Text

[The landlord]218-the landlord , [the lady]219-the lady , and [Mr. Charles Wogan]109-wogan were all three , it seemed , in luck 's way that September morning of the year 1719 . [Wogan]109-wogan was not surprised , [his]109-wogan luck for the moment was altogether in , so that even when [his]109-wogan horse stumbled and went lame at a desolate part of [the road from [Florence]0-florence to [Bologna]1-bologna]220-the road from florence to bologna , [he]109-wogan had no doubt but that somehow fortune would serve [him]109-wogan . [His]109-wogan horse stepped gingerly on for a few yards , stopped , and looked round at [[his]109-wogan master]221-his master . [Wogan]109-wogan and [his]109-wogan horse were on the best of terms . " Is it so bad as that ? "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , and dismounting [he]109-wogan gently felt the strained leg . Then [he]109-wogan took the bridle in [his]109-wogan hand and walked forward , whistling as [he]109-wogan walked . Yet [the place]222-the place and the hour were most unlikely to give [him]109-wogan succour . It was early morning , and [he]109-wogan walked across [an empty basin of [the hills]224-the hills]223-an empty basin of the hills . The sun was not visible , though the upper air was golden and [the green peaks of [the hills]224-the hills]225-the green peaks of the hills rosy . [The basin]227-the basin [itself]227-the basin was filled with a broad uncoloured light , and lay naked to it and extraordinarily still . There were as yet no shadows ; [the road]228-the road rose and dipped across low ridges of turf , a ribbon of dead and unillumined white ; and the grass at any distance from [the road]228-the road had the darkness of peat . [He]109-wogan led [his]109-wogan horse forward for perhaps a mile , and then turning a corner by a knot of trees came unexpectedly upon [a wayside inn]230-a wayside inn . In front of [the inn]231-the inn stood [a travelling carriage]232-a travelling carriage with [its]232-a travelling carriage team of horses . The backs of the horses smoked , and the candles of the lamps were still burning in the broad daylight . [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan quickened [his]109-wogan pace . [He]109-wogan would beg a seat on the box to the next posting stage . [Fortune]110-fortune had served [him]109-wogan . As [he]109-wogan came near [he]109-wogan heard from the interior of [the inn]231-the inn [a woman]234-a woman 's voice , not unmusical so much as shrill with impatience , which perpetually ordered and protested . As [he]109-wogan came nearer [he]109-wogan heard [a man]235-a man 's voice obsequiously answering the protests , and as the sound of [his]109-wogan footsteps rang in front of [the inn]231-the inn both voices immediately stopped . The door was flung hastily open , and [the landlord]218-the landlord and [the lady]219-the lady ran out onto [the road]228-the road . " [Sir]3070-sir , "[240-the lady in italian] said [the lady in Italian]240-the lady in italian , " [I]240-the lady in italian need a postillion . "[240-the lady in italian] To [Wogan]109-wogan 's thinking [she]240-the lady in italian needed much more than a postillion . [She]240-the lady in italian needed certainly [a retinue of [servants]242-servants]241-a retinue of servants . [He]109-wogan was not quite sure that [she]240-the lady in italian did not need [a nurse]243-a nurse , for [she]240-the lady in italian was [a creature of an exquisite fragility , with the pouting face of a child]244-a creature of an exquisite fragility , with the pouting face of a child , and the childishness was exaggerated by a great muslin bow [she]240-the lady in italian wore at [her]240-the lady in italian throat . [Her]240-the lady in italian pale hair , where it showed beneath [her]240-the lady in italian hood , was fine as silk and as glossy ; [her]240-the lady in italian eyes had the colour of an Italian sky at noon , and [her]240-the lady in italian cheeks the delicate tinge of a carnation . The many laces and ribbons , knotted about [her]240-the lady in italian dress in a manner most mysterious to [Wogan]109-wogan , added to [her]240-the lady in italian gossamer appearance ; and , in a word , [she]240-the lady in italian seemed to [him]109-wogan something too flowerlike for [the world]245-the world 's rough usage . " [I]240-the lady in italian must have a postillion , "[240-the lady in italian] [she]240-the lady in italian continued . " Presently , [madam]3071-madam , "[218-the landlord] said [the landlord]218-the landlord , smiling with all [a Tuscan peasant]247-a tuscan peasant 's desire to please . " In a minute . In less than a minute . "[218-the landlord] [He]218-the landlord looked complacently about [him]218-the landlord as though at any moment now a crop of postillions might be expected to flower by [the roadside]248-the roadside . [The lady]219-the lady turned from [him]218-the landlord with a stamp of the foot and saw that [Wogan]109-wogan was curiously regarding [[her]219-the lady carriage]250-her carriage . [A boy]251-a boy stood at the horses ' heads , but [his]251-a boy dress and sleepy face showed that [he]251-a boy had not been half an hour out of bed , and there was [no one else]252-no one else . [Wogan]109-wogan was wondering how in [the world]245-the world [she]219-the lady had travelled as far as [this inn]254-this inn . [The lady]219-the lady explained . " [The postillion who drove [me]219-the lady from [Florence]0-florence]3072-the postillion who drove me from florence was drunk — oh , but drunk ! [He]3072-the postillion who drove me from florence rolled off [his]3072-the postillion who drove me from florence horse just here , opposite the door . See , [I]219-the lady beat [him]3072-the postillion who drove me from florence , "[219-the lady] and [she]219-the lady raised the beribboned handle of a toy - like cane . " But it was no use . [I]219-the lady broke [my]219-the lady cane over [his]3072-the postillion who drove me from florence back , but [he]3072-the postillion who drove me from florence would not get up . [He]3072-the postillion who drove me from florence crawled into the passage where [he]3072-the postillion who drove me from florence lies . "[219-the lady] [Wogan]109-wogan had some ado not to smile . Neither the cane nor the hand which wielded it would be likely to interfere even with [a sober man]256-a sober man 's slumbers . " And [I]219-the lady must reach [Bologna]1-bologna to - day , "[219-the lady] [she]219-the lady cried in an extreme agitation . " It is of the last importance . "[219-the lady] " Fortune is kind to [us]3073-us both , [madam]3071-madam , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , with a bow . " [My]109-wogan horse is lamed , as [you]3071-madam see . [I]109-wogan will be [[your]3071-madam charioteer]3075-your charioteer , for [I]109-wogan too am in a desperate hurry to reach [Bologna]1-bologna . "[109-wogan] Immediately [the lady]219-the lady drew back . " Oh ! "[219-the lady] [she]219-the lady said with a start , looking at [Wogan]109-wogan . [Wogan]109-wogan looked at [her]219-the lady . " Ah ! "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , thoughtfully . [They]258-they eyed [each other]259-each other for a moment , each silently speculating what [the other]260-the other was doing alone at this hour and in such a haste to reach [Bologna]1-bologna . " [You]109-wogan are English ? "[219-the lady] [she]219-the lady said with a great deal of unconcern , and [she]219-the lady asked in English . That [she]219-the lady was English , [Wogan]109-wogan already knew from [her]219-the lady accent . [His]109-wogan Italian , however , was more than passable , and [he]109-wogan was [a wary man]261-a wary man by nature as well as by some ten years ' training in a service where wariness was the first need , though it was seldom acquired . [He]109-wogan could have answered " No "[219-the lady] quite truthfully , being Irish . [He]109-wogan preferred to answer [her]219-the lady in Italian as though [he]109-wogan had not understood . " [I]109-wogan beg [your]219-the lady pardon . Yes , [I]109-wogan will drive [you]219-the lady to [Bologna]1-bologna if [the landlord]218-the landlord will swear to look after [my]109-wogan horse . "[109-wogan] And [he]109-wogan was very precise in [his]109-wogan directions . [The landlord]218-the landlord swore very readily . [His]109-wogan anxiety to be rid of [[his]109-wogan vociferous guest]263-his vociferous guest and to get back to bed was extreme . [Wogan]109-wogan climbed into [the postillion]264-the postillion 's saddle , describing the while such remedies as [he]109-wogan desired to be applied to the sprained leg . " The horse is a favourite ? "[219-the lady] asked [the lady]219-the lady . " [Madam]3071-madam , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , with a laugh , " [I]109-wogan would not lose that horse for [all the world]3078-all the world , for [the woman [I]109-wogan shall marry]3079-the woman i shall marry will ride on it into [[my]109-wogan city of dreams]3080-my city of dreams . "[109-wogan] [The lady]219-the lady stared , as [she]219-the lady well might . [She]219-the lady hesitated with [her]219-the lady foot upon the step . " Is [he]3081-he sober ? "[219-the lady] [she]219-the lady asked of [the landlord]218-the landlord . " [Madam]3071-madam , "[218-the landlord] said [the landlord]218-the landlord , unabashed , " in [this district]3083-this district [he]3081-he is nicknamed [the water drinker]3084-the water drinker . "[218-the landlord] " [You]219-the lady know [him]3081-he , then ? [He]3081-he is Italian ? "[218-the landlord] " [He]3081-he is more . [He]3081-he is of [Tuscany]2-tuscany . "[218-the landlord] [The landlord]218-the landlord had never seen [Wogan]109-wogan in [his]109-wogan life before , but [the lady]219-the lady seemed to wish some assurance on the point , so [he]218-the landlord gave it . [He]218-the landlord shut the carriage door , and [Wogan]109-wogan cracked [his]109-wogan whip . [The postillion]264-the postillion 's desires were of a piece with [the lady]219-the lady 's . [They]273-they raced across [the valley]274-the valley , and as [they]273-they climbed [the slope beyond]275-the slope beyond , the sun came over [the crests]276-the crests . One moment the dew upon the grass was like raindrops , the next it shone like polished jewels . [The postillion]264-the postillion shouted a welcome to the sun , and [the lady]219-the lady proceeded to breakfast in [[her]219-the lady carriage]250-her carriage . [Wogan]109-wogan had to snatch a meal as best [he]109-wogan could while the horses were changed at the posting stage . [The lady]219-the lady would not wait , and [Wogan]109-wogan for [his]109-wogan part was used to a light fare . [He]109-wogan drove into [Bologna]1-bologna that afternoon . [The lady]219-the lady put [her]219-the lady head from the window and called out the name of [a street]282-a street . [[Her]219-the lady postillion]283-her postillion , however , paid no heed : [he]283-her postillion seemed suddenly to have grown deaf ; [he]283-her postillion whipped up [his]283-her postillion horses , shouted encouragements to [them]284-them and warnings to [the pedestrians on [the roads]286-the roads]285-the pedestrians on the roads . [The carriage]287-the carriage rocked round corners and bounced over the uneven stones . [Wogan]109-wogan had clean forgotten the fragility of [the traveller within]288-the traveller within . [He]109-wogan saw [men]289-men going busily about , talking in groups and standing alone , and all with consternation upon [their]289-men faces . [The quiet streets]290-the quiet streets were alive with [them]289-men . Something had happened that day in [Bologna,—some]3-bologna,—some catastrophe . Or news had come that day,—bad news . [Wogan]109-wogan did not stop to inquire . [He]109-wogan drove at a gallop straight to [a long white house which fronted [the street]292-the street]291-a long white house which fronted the street . The green latticed shutters were closed against the sun , but there were [servants]242-servants about the doorway , and in [their]242-servants aspect , too , there was something of disorder . [Wogan]109-wogan called to one of [them]242-servants , jumped down from [his]109-wogan saddle , and ran through the open doorway into [a great hall with frescoed walls all ruined by neglect]294-a great hall with frescoed walls all ruined by neglect . At the back of [the hall]295-the hall a marble staircase , guarded by a pair of marble lions , ran up to [a landing]296-a landing and divided . [Wogan]109-wogan set foot on the staircase and heard an exclamation of surprise . [He]109-wogan looked up . [A burly , good - humoured man in the gay embroideries of [a courtier]298-a courtier]297-a burly , good - humoured man in the gay embroideries of a courtier was descending towards [him]109-wogan . " [You]109-wogan ? "[299-the courtier] cried [the courtier]299-the courtier . " Already ? "[299-the courtier] and then laughed . [He]297-a burly , good - humoured man in the gay embroideries of a courtier was [the only man whom [Wogan]109-wogan had seen laugh since [he]109-wogan drove into [Bologna]1-bologna]300-the only man whom wogan had seen laugh since he drove into bologna , and [he]109-wogan drew a great breath of hope . " Then nothing has happened , [Whittington]111-whittington ? There is no bad news ? "[109-wogan] " There is news so bad , [[my]111-whittington friend]3085-my friend , that [you]109-wogan might have jogged [here]3086-here on [a mule]3087-a mule and still have lost no time . [Your]109-wogan hurry is clean wasted , "[111-whittington] answered [Whittington]111-whittington . [Wogan]109-wogan ran past [him]111-whittington up the stairs , and so left [the hall]295-the hall and the open doorway clear . [Whittington]111-whittington looked now straight through the doorway , and saw [the carriage]287-the carriage and [the lady on the point of stepping down onto the kerb]303-the lady on the point of stepping down onto the kerb . [His]111-whittington face assumed a look of extreme surprise . Then [he]111-whittington glanced up the staircase after [Wogan]109-wogan and laughed as though the conjunction of [the lady]219-the lady and [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan was a rare piece of amusement . [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan did not hear the laugh , but [the lady]219-the lady did . [She]219-the lady raised [her]219-the lady head , and at the same moment [the courtier]299-the courtier came across [the hall]295-the hall to meet [her]219-the lady . As soon as [he]299-the courtier had come close , " [Harry]111-whittington , "[219-the lady] said [she]219-the lady , and gave [him]109-wogan [her]219-the lady hand . [He]109-wogan bent over it and kissed it , and there was more than courtesy in the warmth of the kiss . " But [I]109-wogan 'm glad [you]219-the lady 've come . [I]109-wogan did not look for [you]219-the lady for another week , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said in a low voice . [He]109-wogan did not , however , offer to help [her]219-the lady to alight . " This is [[your]109-wogan lodging]3088-your lodging ? "[219-the lady] [she]219-the lady asked . " No , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " [the King]3089-the king 's ; "[109-wogan] and [the woman]308-the woman shrank suddenly back amongst [her]308-the woman cushions . In a moment , however , [her]308-the woman face was again at the door . " Then who was [he,—my postillion]3090-he,—my postillion ? "[308-the woman] " [Your]109-wogan postillion ? "[111-whittington] asked [Whittington]111-whittington , glancing at [the servant who held the horses]309-the servant who held the horses . " Yes , [the tall man who looked as if [he]3091-the tall man who looked as if he should have been a scholar and had twisted himself all awry into a soldier should have been [a scholar]3092-a scholar and had twisted [himself]3091-the tall man who looked as if he should have been a scholar and had twisted himself all awry into a soldier all awry into [a soldier]3093-a soldier]3091-the tall man who looked as if he should have been a scholar and had twisted himself all awry into a soldier . [You]109-wogan must have passed [him]3091-the tall man who looked as if he should have been a scholar and had twisted himself all awry into a soldier in [the hall]295-the hall . "[111-whittington] [Whittington]111-whittington stared at [her]308-the woman . Then [he]111-whittington burst again into a laugh . " [Your]109-wogan postillion , was [he]3091-the tall man who looked as if he should have been a scholar and had twisted himself all awry into a soldier ? That 's the oddest thing , "[111-whittington] and [he]111-whittington lowered [his]111-whittington voice . " [Your]109-wogan postillion was [Mr. Charles Wogan]109-wogan , who comes from [Rome]4-rome post - haste with [the Pope]3095-the pope 's procuration for the marriage . [You]109-wogan have helped [him]109-wogan on [his]109-wogan way , it seems . Here 's a good beginning , to be sure . "[111-whittington] [The lady]219-the lady uttered a little cry of anger , and [her]219-the lady face hardened out of all its softness . [She]219-the lady clenched [her]219-the lady fists viciously , and [her]219-the lady blue eyes grew cold and dangerous as steel . At this moment [she]219-the lady hardly looked the delicate flower [she]219-the lady had appeared to [Wogan]109-wogan 's fancy . " But [you]219-the lady need not blame [yourself]219-the lady , "[111-whittington] said [Whittington]111-whittington , and [he]111-whittington lowered [his]111-whittington head to a level with [hers]219-the lady . " [All the procurations in [Christendom]5-christendom]3096-all the procurations in christendom will not marry [James Stuart]112-james stuart to [Clementina Sobieski]113-clementina sobieski . "[111-whittington] " [She]113-clementina sobieski has not come , then ? "[111-whittington] " No , nor will [she]113-clementina sobieski come . There is news to - day . Lean back from the window , and [I]219-the lady will tell [you]219-the lady . [She]113-clementina sobieski has been arrested at [Innspruck]17-innspruck . "[219-the lady] [The lady]219-the lady could not repress a crow of delight . " Hush , "[111-whittington] said [Whittington]111-whittington . Then [he]111-whittington withdrew [his]111-whittington head and resumed in [his]111-whittington ordinary voice , " [I]111-whittington have hired [a house for [[your]219-the lady Ladyship]3098-your ladyship , which [I]111-whittington trust will be found convenient . [[My]111-whittington servant]3099-my servant]3097-a house for your ladyship , which i trust will be found convenient . my servant will drive [you]219-the lady thither . "[111-whittington] [He]111-whittington summoned [[his]111-whittington servant]312-his servant from the group of footmen about the entrance , gave [him]312-his servant [his]111-whittington orders , bowed to the ground , and twisting [his]111-whittington cane sauntered idly down [the street]292-the street . [Wogan]109-wogan mounted the stairs , not daring to speculate upon the nature of the bad news . But [his]111-whittington face was pale beneath its sunburn , and [his]111-whittington hand trembled on the balustrade ; for [he]111-whittington knew — in [his]111-whittington heart [he]111-whittington knew . There could be only one piece of news which would make [his]111-whittington haste or tardiness matters of no account . [Both branches of the stairs]314-both branches of the stairs ran up to [a common landing]315-a common landing , and in the wall facing [him]111-whittington , midway between the two stairheads , was a great door of tulip wood . [An usher]316-an usher stood by the door , and at [Wogan]109-wogan 's approach opened it . [Wogan]109-wogan , however , signed to [him]316-an usher to be silent . [He]109-wogan wished to hear , not to speak , and so [he]109-wogan slipped into [the room]317-the room unannounced . The door was closed silently behind [him]109-wogan , and at once [he]109-wogan was surprised by the remarkable silence , almost a cessation of life it seemed , in [a room which was quite full]318-a room which was quite full . Wherever the broad bars of sunshine fell , as they slanted dusty with motes through the open lattices of the shutters , [they]319-they striped [a woman]234-a woman 's dress or [a man]235-a man 's velvet coat . Yet if [anyone]322-anyone shuffled a foot or allowed a petticoat to rustle , [that person]323-that person glanced on each side guiltily . [A group of people]324-a group of people were gathered in front of the doorway . [Their]324-a group of people backs were towards [Wogan]109-wogan , and [they]324-a group of people were looking towards the centre of [the room]317-the room . [Wogan]109-wogan raised [himself]109-wogan on [his]109-wogan toes and looked that way too . Having looked [he]109-wogan sank down again , aware at once that [he]109-wogan had travelled of late a long way in a little time , and that [he]109-wogan was intolerably tired . For that one glance was enough to deprive [him]109-wogan of [his]109-wogan last possibility of doubt . [He]109-wogan had seen [the Chevalier de St. George]114-the chevalier , [[his]109-wogan King]326-his king , sitting apart in [a little open space]327-a little open space , and over against [him]109-wogan [a short squarish man , dusty as [Wogan]109-wogan [himself]109-wogan , who stood and sullenly waited]109-wogan . It was [Sir John Hay]115-hay , [the man who had been sent to fetch [the Princess Clementina]116-clementina privately to [Bologna]1-bologna]328-the man who had been sent to fetch the princess clementina privately to bologna , and here [he]115-hay now was back at [Bologna]1-bologna and alone . [Wogan]109-wogan had counted much upon this marriage , more indeed than [any of [[his]109-wogan comrades]330-his comrades]329-any of his comrades . It was to be the first step of the pedestal in the building up of a throne . It was to establish in [Europe]7-europe [a party for [James Stuart]112-james stuart as strong as [the party of [Hanover]8-hanover]332-the party of hanover]331-a party for james stuart as strong as the party of hanover . But so much was known to [[everyone]333-everyone in [that room]335-that room]334-everyone in that room ; to [Wogan]109-wogan the marriage meant more . For even while [he]109-wogan found [himself]109-wogan muttering over and over with dry lips , as white and exhausted [he]109-wogan leaned against the door , [[Clementina]116-clementina 's qualifications,—"Daughter of [the King of [Poland]9-poland]3101-the king of poland , cousin to [the Emperor]3102-the emperor and to [the King of [Portugal]10-portugal]3103-the king of portugal]3100-clementina 's qualifications,—"daughter of the king of poland , cousin to the emperor and to the king of portugal , [niece to [the Electors of [Treves]11-treves]3105-the electors of treves , [Bavaria]117-bavaria , and [Palatine,"—the]118-palatine,"—the[3100-clementina 's qualifications,—"daughter of the king of poland , cousin to the emperor and to the king of portugal] image of [the girl]336-the girl [herself]336-the girl]3104-niece to the electors of treves , bavaria , and palatine,"—the image of the girl herself rose up before [his]109-wogan eyes and struck [her]336-the girl titles from [his]109-wogan thoughts . [She]336-the girl was [the chosen woman]337-the chosen woman , chosen by [him]109-wogan out of all [Europe]7-europe — and lost by [John Hay]115-hay ! [He]109-wogan remembered very clearly at that moment [his]109-wogan first meeting with [her]336-the girl . [He]109-wogan had travelled from [court]338-court to [court]338-court in search of [the fitting wife]340-the fitting wife , and had come at last to [the palace at [Ohlau]12-ohlau in [Silesia]13-silesia]341-the palace at ohlau in silesia . It was in the dusk of the evening , and as [he]109-wogan was ushered into [the great stone hall]342-the great stone hall , hung about and carpeted with barbaric skins , [he]109-wogan had seen standing by the blazing wood fire in the huge chimney [a girl in a riding dress]343-a girl in a riding dress . [She]343-a girl in a riding dress raised [her]343-a girl in a riding dress head , and the firelight struck upwards on [her]343-a girl in a riding dress face , adding a warmth to its bright colours and a dancing light to the depths of [her]343-a girl in a riding dress dark eyes . [Her]343-a girl in a riding dress hair was drawn backwards from [her]343-a girl in a riding dress forehead , and the frank , sweet face revealed to [him]109-wogan from the broad forehead to the rounded chin told [him]109-wogan that here was one who joined to a royal dignity the simple nature of [a peasant girl who works in [the fields]345-the fields and knows more of animals than of [mankind]346-mankind]344-a peasant girl who works in the fields and knows more of animals than of mankind . [Wogan]109-wogan was back again in [that stone hall]347-that stone hall when the voice of [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier with its strong French accent broke in upon [his]109-wogan vision . " Well , [we]3106-we will hear the story . "[109-wogan] There was more anger and less despondency than was often heard in [his]109-wogan voice . ' "[354-her] [Wogan]109-wogan in those words heard [her]354-her voice as clearly as [he]109-wogan saw [her]354-her face and the dry lips between which the voice passed . " [Marnier]120-marnier , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan called out in a low voice , and [[his]109-wogan servant]312-his servant came from [the adjoining room]395-the adjoining room , " take this to [Mr. Edgar]121-edgar , [[the King]3089-the king 's secretary]3148-the king 's secretary , as soon as it grows dusk . "[109-wogan] With that [Wogan]109-wogan remembered that [he]109-wogan had not slept for forty - eight hours . [Wogan]109-wogan waked up in the dark and was seized with a fear that [he]109-wogan had slept too long . "[114-the chevalier] [The Chevalier]114-the chevalier drew [his]114-the chevalier hand across [his]114-the chevalier eyes and stared afresh at [Wogan]109-wogan . The audacity of the exploit and the imperturbable manner of its proposal caught [his]109-wogan breath away . [He]109-wogan rose from [his]109-wogan chair and took a turn or two across [the room]317-the room . [Wogan]109-wogan watched [his]109-wogan every gesture . It would be difficult [he]109-wogan knew to wring the permission [he]109-wogan needed from [[his]109-wogan dejected master]425-his dejected master , and [his]109-wogan unruffled demeanour was a calculated means of persuasion . An air of confidence was the first requisite . In reality , however , [Wogan]109-wogan was not troubled at this moment by any thought of failure . It was not that [he]109-wogan had any plan in [his]109-wogan head ; but [he]109-wogan was fired with a conviction that somehow [this chosen woman]426-this chosen woman was not to be wasted , that some day , released by some means in spite of all the pressure [English Ministers]427-english ministers could bring upon [the Emperor]3102-the emperor , [she]426-this chosen woman would come riding into [Bologna]1-bologna . [The Chevalier]348-the chevalier paused in [his]348-the chevalier walk and looked towards [the Cardinal]430-the cardinal . " What does [[your]430-the cardinal Eminence]3161-your eminence say ? "[348-the chevalier] " That to the old the impulsiveness of youth is eternally charming , "[430-the cardinal] said [the Cardinal]430-the cardinal , with a foppish delicacy of speaking in an odd contrast to [[his]430-the cardinal person]432-his person . [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan understood that [he]109-wogan had [a second antagonist]433-a second antagonist . " [I]109-wogan am not [a youth]3162-a youth , [[your]430-the cardinal Eminence]3161-your eminence , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan exclaimed with all the indignation of twenty - seven years . " [I]109-wogan am [a man]235-a man . "[109-wogan] " But [an Irishman]3165-an irishman , and that spells youth . [You]109-wogan write poetry too , [I]109-wogan believe , [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan . It is a heady practice . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan made no answer , though the words stung . An argument with [the Cardinal]430-the cardinal would be sure to ruin [his]109-wogan chance of obtaining [the Chevalier]114-the chevalier 's consent . [He]109-wogan merely bowed to [the Cardinal]430-the cardinal and waited for [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier to speak . " Look [you]109-wogan , [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan ; while [the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's at war with [Spain]18-spain , while [England]19-england 's fleet could strip [him]3102-the emperor of [Sicily]20-sicily , [he]3102-the emperor 's [[England]19-england 's henchman]3167-england 's henchman . [He]3102-the emperor dare not let [the Princess]3107-the princess go . [We]3169-we know it . [General Heister]123-general heister , [the Governor of [Innspruck]17-innspruck]3170-the governor of innspruck , is under pain of death to hold [her]3107-the princess safe . "[109-wogan] " But , [sir]3070-sir , would [the world]245-the world stop if [General Heister]123-general heister died ? "[430-the cardinal] " [A German scaffold]3173-a german scaffold if [you]3070-sir fail . "[430-the cardinal] " In the matter of scaffolds [I]430-the cardinal have no leaning towards [any one nationality]3174-any one nationality . "[430-the cardinal] [The Cardinal]430-the cardinal smiled . [He]430-the cardinal liked [a man of spirit]438-a man of spirit , though [he]430-the cardinal might think [him]438-a man of spirit absurd . [The Chevalier]348-the chevalier resumed [his]348-the chevalier restless pacing to and fro . " It is impossible . "[348-the chevalier] But [he]348-the chevalier seemed to utter the phrase with less decision this second time . [Wogan]109-wogan pressed [his]109-wogan advantage at the expense of [his]109-wogan modesty . " [Sir]3070-sir , will [you]3070-sir allow [me]109-wogan to tell [you]3070-sir a story,—a story of an impossible escape from [Newgate]21-newgate in [the heart of [London]22-london]3176-the heart of london by [a man in fetters]3177-a man in fetters ? There were nine grenadiers with loaded muskets standing over [him]3177-a man in fetters . There were [two courtyards to cross]3178-two courtyards to cross , two walls to climb , and beyond the walls [the unfriendly streets]3179-the unfriendly streets . [The man]365-the man hoodwinked [[his]365-the man sentries]3181-his sentries , climbed [his]365-the man two walls , crossed [the unfriendly streets]3179-the unfriendly streets , and took refuge in [a cellar]3183-a cellar , where [he]365-the man was discovered . From [the cellar]3184-the cellar in broad daylight [he]365-the man fought [his]365-the man way to the roofs , and on the roofs [he]365-the man played such a game of hide - and - seek among the chimney - tops — "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan broke off from [his]109-wogan story with a clear thrill of laughter ; it was a laugh of enjoyment at a pleasing recollection . Then [he]109-wogan suddenly flung [himself]109-wogan down on [his]109-wogan knee at the feet of [[his]109-wogan sovereign]440-his sovereign . " Give [me]109-wogan leave , [[your]440-his sovereign Majesty]3160-your majesty , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried passionately . " Let [me]109-wogan go upon this errand . If [I]109-wogan fail , if [the scaffold]3186-the scaffold 's dressed for [me]109-wogan , why where 's the harm ? [[Your]440-his sovereign Majesty]3160-your majesty loses [one servant out of [his]3160-your majesty many]3188-one servant out of his many . Whereas , if [I]109-wogan win — "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan drew a long breath . " Aye , and [I]109-wogan shall win ! There 's [the Princess]3107-the princess , too , [a prisoner]3190-a prisoner . [Sir]3070-sir , [she]3107-the princess has ventured much . [I]109-wogan beg [you]3070-sir give [me]109-wogan leave . "[109-wogan] [The Chevalier]348-the chevalier laid [his]348-the chevalier hand gently upon [Wogan]109-wogan 's shoulder , but [he]348-the chevalier did not assent . [He]109-wogan looked again doubtfully to [the Cardinal]430-the cardinal , who said with [his]430-the cardinal pleasant smile , " [I]430-the cardinal will wager [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan a box at [the Opera]3192-the opera on the first night that [he]109-wogan returns , that [he]109-wogan will return empty - handed . "[430-the cardinal] [Wogan]109-wogan rose to [his]109-wogan feet and replied good - humouredly , " It 's a wager [I]109-wogan take the more readily in that [your]430-the cardinal Eminence can not win , though [you]430-the cardinal may lose . For if [I]109-wogan return empty - handed , upon [my]109-wogan honour [I]109-wogan 'll not return at all . "[109-wogan] [The Cardinal]430-the cardinal condescended to laugh . [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan laughed too . [He]109-wogan had good reason , for here was [[his]109-wogan Eminence]444-his eminence in a kindly temper and [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier warming out of [his]348-the chevalier melancholy . But [I]348-the chevalier can not compass it , "[348-the chevalier] and [he]348-the chevalier turned away . " Sure , [sir]3070-sir , [you]3070-sir 'll put [us]3194-us all to shame when [I]348-the chevalier bring [her]3195-her Royal Highness out of [Innspruck]17-innspruck . "[348-the chevalier] " Oh , that ! "[348-the chevalier] said [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier , as though for the moment [he]348-the chevalier had forgotten . " It is impossible , "[348-the chevalier] and the phrase was spoken now in an accent of hesitation . " [The house]3196-the house stands in [the faubourgs of [Innspruck]17-innspruck]3197-the faubourgs of innspruck . " [Sir]3070-sir , "[348-the chevalier] said [he]348-the chevalier , eagerly , " [I]348-the chevalier have never told [you]3070-sir , but [the Princess Clementina]116-clementina when [a child]3225-a child amongst [[her]116-clementina playmates]3226-her playmates had a favourite game . "[348-the chevalier] [The Chevalier]348-the chevalier started . " Is that so ? " In very truth it is , "[348-the chevalier] and [the two men]462-the two men stood looking each at [the other]260-the other and quite silent . [Wogan]109-wogan crept back to [[his]109-wogan lodging]373-his lodging as cautiously as [he]109-wogan had left [it]373-his lodging . There was no light in any window but in [his]109-wogan own , where [[his]109-wogan servant]312-his servant , [Marnier]120-marnier , awaited [him]109-wogan . [Wogan]109-wogan opened the door softly and found [the porter]472-the porter asleep in [his]109-wogan chair . [He]109-wogan stole [upstairs]473-upstairs and made [his]109-wogan preparations . These , however , were of the simplest kind , and consisted of half - a - dozen orders to [Marnier]120-marnier and the getting into bed . In the morning [he]109-wogan woke before daybreak and found [Marnier]120-marnier already up . [They]474-they went silently out of [the house]3196-the house as the dawn was breaking . [Marnier]120-marnier had the key to [the stables]476-the stables , and [they]474-they saddled the two horses and rode through [the blind and silent streets]477-the blind and silent streets with [their]474-they faces muffled in [their]474-they cloaks . [They]474-they met [no one]356-no one , however , until [they]474-they were come to [the outskirts of [the town]3115-the town]479-the outskirts of the town . But then as [they]474-they passed [the mouth of [an alley]482-an alley]481-the mouth of an alley [a man]235-a man came suddenly out and as suddenly drew back . The morning was chill , and [the man]365-the man was closely wrapped . [Wogan]109-wogan could not distinguish [his]109-wogan face or [person]485-person , and looking down [the alley]486-the alley [he]109-wogan saw at the end of [it]486-the alley only a garden wall , and over the top of the wall a thicket of trees and the chimney - tops of [a low house]487-a low house embosomed amongst [them]488-them . [He]109-wogan rode on , secure in the secrecy of [his]109-wogan desperate adventure . But that same morning [Mr. Whittington]111-whittington paid a visit to [[Wogan]109-wogan 's lodging]489-wogan 's lodging and asked to be admitted . [He]111-whittington was told that [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan had not yet returned to [Bologna]1-bologna . " So , indeed , [I]111-whittington thought , "[111-whittington] said [he]111-whittington ; and [he]111-whittington sauntered carelessly along , not to [[his]111-whittington own house]490-his own house , but to one smaller , situated at the bottom of [a cul - de - sac]491-a cul - de - sac and secluded amongst trees . At the door [he]111-whittington asked whether [[her]492-her Ladyship]493-her ladyship was yet visible , and was at once shown into [a room with long windows which stood open to [the garden]413-the garden]494-a room with long windows which stood open to the garden . [[Her]492-her Ladyship]493-her ladyship lay upon a sofa sipping [her]492-her coffee and teasing a spaniel with the toe of [her]492-her slipper . " [You]111-whittington are early , "[492-her] [she]492-her said with some surprise . " And yet no earlier than [[your]111-whittington Ladyship]3098-your ladyship , "[111-whittington] said [Whittington]111-whittington . When [he]111-whittington turned back into [the room]317-the room [[her]492-her Ladyship]493-her ladyship had kicked the spaniel from the sofa and was sitting bolt upright with all [her]493-her ladyship languor gone . " Well ? "[492-her] [she]492-her asked quickly . [Whittington]111-whittington took a seat on the sofa by [her]492-her side . " [Charles Wogan]109-wogan left [Bologna]1-bologna at daybreak . Moreover , [I]111-whittington have had a message from [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier bidding [me]111-whittington not to mention that [I]111-whittington saw [him]109-wogan in [Bologna]1-bologna yesterday . [One]3129-one could hazard a guess at the goal of so secret a journey . "[111-whittington] " Ohlau ! "[219-the lady] exclaimed [the lady]219-the lady , in a whisper . Then [she]219-the lady nestled back upon the sofa and bit the fragment of lace [she]219-the lady called [her]219-the lady handkerchief . " So there 's an end of [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan , "[492-her] [she]492-her said pleasantly . [Whittington]111-whittington made no answer . " For there 's no chance that [he]109-wogan 'll succeed , "[492-her] [she]492-her continued with a touch of anxiety in [her]492-her voice . [Whittington]111-whittington neither agreed nor contradicted . [He]111-whittington asked a question instead . " What is the sharpest spur [a man]235-a man can know ? What is it that gives [a man]235-a man audacity to attempt and wit to accomplish the impossible ? "[111-whittington] [The lady]219-the lady smiled . " [The poets]3240-the poets tell [us]3241-us love , "[492-her] said [she]492-her , demurely . [Whittington]111-whittington nodded [his]111-whittington head . " [Wogan]109-wogan speaks very warmly of [the Princess Clementina]116-clementina . "[111-whittington] [[Her]219-the lady Ladyship]493-her ladyship 's red lips lost their curve . [Her]219-the lady eyes became thoughtful , apprehensive . " [I]219-the lady wonder , "[219-the lady] [she]219-the lady said slowly . " Yes , [I]111-whittington too wonder , "[111-whittington] said [Whittington]111-whittington . Outside the branches of the trees rustled in the wind and flung shadows , swift as ripples , across the sunlit grass . But within [the little room]503-the little room there was a long silence . [M. Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux , [the chamberlain]504-the chamberlain , was [a little portly person with a round , red face like a cherub 's]505-a little portly person with a round , red face like a cherub 's . [He]125-chateaudoux was [a creature of [the house]3196-the house]506-a creature of the house , [one that walked with delicate steps]508-one that walked with delicate steps , [a conductor of ceremonies]509-a conductor of ceremonies , [an expert in the subtleties of etiquette]510-an expert in the subtleties of etiquette ; and once [he]125-chateaudoux held [his]125-chateaudoux wand of office in [his]125-chateaudoux hand , there was nowhere to be found a being so precise and consequential . But out of doors [he]125-chateaudoux had the timidity of a cat . [He]125-chateaudoux lived , however , by rule and rote , and since it had always been [his]125-chateaudoux habit to take the air between three and four of the afternoon , [he]125-chateaudoux was to be seen between those hours at [Innspruck]17-innspruck on any fine day mincing along the avenue of trees before [the villa in which [[his]125-chateaudoux mistress]512-his mistress was held prisoner]511-the villa in which his mistress was held prisoner . On one afternoon during the month of October [he]125-chateaudoux passed [a hawker]513-a hawker , who , tired with [his]513-a hawker day 's tramp , was resting on a bench in [the avenue]3199-the avenue , and who carried upon [his]513-a hawker arm a half - empty basket of cheap wares . [The man]365-the man was ragged ; [his]365-the man toes were thrusting through [his]365-the man shoes ; it was evident that [he]365-the man wore no linen , and a week 's growth of beard dirtily stubbled [his]365-the man chin,—in a word , [he]365-the man was [a man from whom [M. Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux 's prim soul]516-a man from whom m. chateaudoux 's prim soul positively shrank . [M. Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux went quickly by , fearing to be pestered for alms . [The hawker]517-the hawker , however , remained seated upon the bench , drawing idle patterns upon the gravel with a hazel stick stolen from a hedgerow . The next afternoon [the hawker]517-the hawker was in [the avenue]3199-the avenue again , only this time on a bench at the opposite end ; and again [he]517-the hawker paid no heed to [M. Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux , but sat moodily scraping the gravel with [his]517-the hawker stick . On the third afternoon [M. Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux found [the hawker]517-the hawker seated in the middle of [the avenue]3199-the avenue and over against the door of [the guarded villa]522-the guarded villa . [M. Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux , when [his]125-chateaudoux timidity slept , was capable of good nature . There was [a soldier with a loaded musket in full view]523-a soldier with a loaded musket in full view . [The hawker]517-the hawker , besides , had not pestered [him]523-a soldier with a loaded musket in full view . [He]125-chateaudoux determined to buy some small thing,—a mirror , perhaps , which was always useful,—and [he]125-chateaudoux approached [the hawker]517-the hawker , who for [his]125-chateaudoux part wearily flicked the gravel with [his]125-chateaudoux stick and drew a curve here and a line there until , as [M. Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux stopped before the bench , there lay sketched at [his]125-chateaudoux feet the rude semblance of a crown . The stick swept over it the next instant and left the gravel smooth . But [M. Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux had seen , and [his]125-chateaudoux heart fluttered and sank . For here were plots , possibly dangers , most certainly trepidations . [He]125-chateaudoux turned [his]125-chateaudoux back as though [he]125-chateaudoux had seen nothing , and constraining [himself]125-chateaudoux to a slow pace walked towards the door of [the villa]526-the villa . But [the hawker]517-the hawker was now at [his]125-chateaudoux side , whining in execrable German and a strong French accent the remarkable value of [his]517-the hawker wares . There were [samplers most exquisitely worked]528-samplers most exquisitely worked , jewels for [[the most noble gentleman]529-the most noble gentleman 's honoured sweetheart]530-the most noble gentleman 's honoured sweetheart , and purses which [emperors]531-emperors would give a deal to buy . [Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux was urged to take notice that [emperors]531-emperors would give sums to lay a hand on [the hawker]517-the hawker 's purses . [M. Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux pretended not to hear . " [I]125-chateaudoux want nothing , "[125-chateaudoux] [he]125-chateaudoux said , " nothing in [the world]245-the world ; "[125-chateaudoux] and [he]125-chateaudoux repeated the statement in order to drown [the other]260-the other 's voice . " A purse , [good gentleman]3243-good gentleman , "[517-the hawker] persisted [the hawker]517-the hawker , and [he]517-the hawker dangled one before [Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux 's eyes . Not for anything would [Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux take that purse . " Go away , "[125-chateaudoux] [he]125-chateaudoux cried ; " [I]125-chateaudoux have a sufficiency of purses , and [I]125-chateaudoux will not be plagued by [you]125-chateaudoux . "[125-chateaudoux] [They]536-they were now at the steps of [the villa]526-the villa , and [the sentry]538-the sentry , lifting the butt of [his]538-the sentry musket , roughly thrust [the hawker]517-the hawker back . " What have [you]517-the hawker there ? Bring [your]517-the hawker basket here , "[538-the sentry] said [he]538-the sentry ; and to [Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux 's consternation [the hawker]517-the hawker immediately offered the purse to [the sentinel]541-the sentinel . " It is only [the poor who have kind hearts]3244-the poor who have kind hearts , "[538-the sentry] [he]538-the sentry said ; " here 's the proper purse for [a soldier]3093-a soldier . It is so hard to get the money out that [a man]235-a man is saved an ocean of drink . "[538-the sentry] [The hawker]517-the hawker 's readiness destroyed any suspicions [the sentinel]541-the sentinel may have felt . " Go away , "[538-the sentry] [he]538-the sentry said , " quick ! "[538-the sentry] " [You]125-chateaudoux will buy the purse ? "[541-the sentinel] [The sentinel]541-the sentinel raised [his]541-the sentinel musket again . [He]109-wogan picked [himself]109-wogan up and limped off . Now the next day a remarkable thing happened . [M. Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux swerved from the regularity of [his]125-chateaudoux habits . [He]125-chateaudoux walked along [the avenue]3199-the avenue , it is true ; but at the end of it [he]125-chateaudoux tripped down [a street]282-a street and turned out of that into another which brought [him]125-chateaudoux to [the arcades]555-the arcades . The handkerchief flipped out a letter which fell onto the ground . In the gloom it was barely visible ; and [M. " [I]127-friederika am heart - broken , "[127-friederika] wrote [Friederika]127-friederika , " but [my]127-friederika fidelity to [[my]127-friederika Chateaudoux]3248-my chateaudoux has not faltered , nor will not , whatever [I]127-friederika may be called upon to endure . For the mission [he]348-the chevalier was set upon filled [his]348-the chevalier thoughts and ran like a fever in [his]348-the chevalier blood . [He]348-the chevalier lay awake at nights inventing schemes of evasion , and each morning showed a flaw , and the schemes crumbled . Not that [his]348-the chevalier faith faltered . At some one moment [he]348-the chevalier felt sure the perfect plan , swift and secret , would be revealed to [him]348-the chevalier , and [he]348-the chevalier lived to seize the moment . This evening was but one of many during that Christmastide . [Wogan]109-wogan must wear an easy countenance , though [his]109-wogan heart grew heavy as lead . [The Countess of [Berg]25-berg]598-the countess of berg was [the Prince [Constantine]138-constantine 's favourite]625-the prince constantine 's favourite ; and [Wogan]109-wogan was not slow to discover that [her]598-the countess of berg smiling face and quiet eyes hid [the most masterful woman at [that court]627-that court]626-the most masterful woman at that court . [He]109-wogan made [himself]109-wogan [[her]598-the countess of berg assiduous servant]628-her assiduous servant , whether in hunting amid the snow or in the entertainments at [the palace]629-the palace , but a quizzical deliberate word would now and again show [him]109-wogan that [she]598-the countess of berg was still [[his]109-wogan enemy]630-his enemy . With [the Princess Casimira]137-princess casimira [he]109-wogan was a profound critic of observances : [he]109-wogan invented a new cravat and was most careful that there should never be a wrinkle in [his]109-wogan stockings ; with [the Princess Charlotte]136-charlotte [he]109-wogan laughed till [his]109-wogan head sang . [He]109-wogan played all manner of parts ; [the palace]629-the palace might have been the stage of a pantomime and [himself]109-wogan the harlequin . But for all [his]109-wogan efforts it did not seem that [he]109-wogan advanced [his]109-wogan cause ; and if [he]109-wogan made headway one evening with [the Prince]588-the prince , the next morning [he]109-wogan had lost it , and so [Christmas]139-christmas came and passed . But two days after Christmas [a courier]633-a courier brought a letter to [the castle]634-the castle . [He]633-a courier came in the evening , and the letter was carried to [Wogan]109-wogan while [he]109-wogan was at table . [He]109-wogan noticed at once that it was in [[his]109-wogan King]326-his king 's hand , and [he]109-wogan slipped it quickly into [his]109-wogan pocket . It may have been something precipitate in [his]109-wogan manner , or it may have been merely that all were on the alert to mark [his]109-wogan actions , but at once curiosity was aroused . No plain words were said ; but here and there [heads]636-heads nodded together and whispered , and while some eyed [Wogan]109-wogan suspiciously , [a few women whose hearts were tuned to a sympathy with [the Princess]3107-the princess in [her]3107-the princess imprisonment , or touched with the notion of a romantic attachment]637-a few women whose hearts were tuned to a sympathy with the princess in her imprisonment , or touched with the notion of a romantic attachment , smiled upon [him]109-wogan [their]637-a few women whose hearts were tuned to a sympathy with the princess in her imprisonment , or touched with the notion of a romantic attachment encouragement . [The Countess of [Berg]25-berg]598-the countess of berg for once was unobservant , however . [Wogan]109-wogan made [his]109-wogan escape from [the company]640-the company as soon as [he]109-wogan could , and going up to [[his]109-wogan apartments]641-his apartments read the letter . The moon was at its full , and what with the clear , frosty air , and the snow stretched over [the world]245-the world like a white counterpane , [he]109-wogan was able to read the letter by the window without the light of a candle . It was written in [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier 's own cipher and hand ; it asked anxiously for news and gave some . [Wogan]109-wogan had had occasion before to learn that cipher by heart . [He]109-wogan stood by the window and spelled the meaning . Then [he]109-wogan turned to go down ; but at the door [his]109-wogan foot slipped upon the polished boards , and [he]109-wogan stumbled onto [his]109-wogan knee . [He]109-wogan picked [himself]109-wogan up , and thinking no more of the matter rejoined [the company]640-the company in [a room where [the Countess of [Berg]25-berg]598-the countess of berg]645-a room where the countess of berg was playing upon a harp . " [The King]3089-the king , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , drawing [the Prince]588-the prince apart , " leaves [Bologna]1-bologna for [Rome]4-rome . "[109-wogan] " So the letter came from [him]3089-the king ? "[588-the prince] asked [the Prince]588-the prince , with an eagerness which could not but seem hopeful to [[his]588-the prince companion]649-his companion . " And in [his]588-the prince own hand , "[109-wogan] replied [Wogan]109-wogan . [The Prince]588-the prince shuffled and hesitated as though [he]588-the prince was curious to hear particulars . [Wogan]109-wogan thought it wise to provoke [his]109-wogan curiosity by disregarding it . It seemed that there was wisdom in [his]109-wogan reticence , for a little later [the Prince]588-the prince took [him]109-wogan aside while [the Countess of Berg]141-the countess of berg was still playing upon [her]652-her harp , and said , — " Single - handed [you]109-wogan could do nothing . [You]109-wogan would need [friends]3289-friends . "[652-her] [Wogan]109-wogan took a slip of paper from [his]109-wogan pocket and gave it to [the Prince]588-the prince . " On that slip , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " [I]109-wogan wrote down the names of [all the friends whom [I]109-wogan could trust , and by the side of the names the places where [I]109-wogan could lay [my]109-wogan hands upon them]3290-all the friends whom i could trust , and by the side of the names the places where i could lay my hands upon them . One after the other [I]109-wogan erased the names until only three remained . "[109-wogan] [The Prince]588-the prince nodded and read out the names . " [Gaydon]142-gaydon , [Misset]143-misset , O'Toole . [They]3291-they are [good men]3292-good men ? "[588-the prince] " [The flower of [Ireland]30-ireland]3293-the flower of ireland .
