[You]3085-my friend have lived too close with this fine scheme of [yours]3085-my friend . [You]3085-my friend need [[your]3085-my friend friends]3373-your friends . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan began to be conscious of an unfamiliar sense of loneliness . It grew upon [him]109-wogan that evening while [he]109-wogan sat at the table ; it accompanied [him]109-wogan up the stairs to bed . [Other men of [his]109-wogan age]833-other men of his age were now seated comfortably by [their]833-other men of his age own hearths , while [he]109-wogan was hurrying about [Europe]7-europe , [a vagabond adventurer]834-a vagabond adventurer , risking [his]109-wogan life for — and at once the reason why [he]109-wogan was risking [his]109-wogan life rose up to convict [him]109-wogan a grumbler . [The landlord]218-the landlord led [him]109-wogan into [a room in the front of [the house]3196-the house which held a great canopied bed and little other furniture]836-a room in the front of the house which held a great canopied bed and little other furniture . There was not even a curtain to the window . [Wogan]109-wogan raised [his]109-wogan candle and surveyed the dingy walls . " [You]218-the landlord have not spent much of [your]218-the landlord new paint on [[your]218-the landlord guest - room]3374-your guest - room , [[my]109-wogan friend]3085-my friend . "[109-wogan] " [Sir]3070-sir , [you]109-wogan have not marked the door , "[838-his host] said [[his]218-the landlord host]838-his host , reproachfully . " True , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , with a yawn ; " the door is admirably white . "[109-wogan] " The frame of the door does not suffer in a comparison . "[218-the landlord] [The landlord]218-the landlord raised and lowered [his]218-the landlord candle that [Wogan]109-wogan might see . " [I]109-wogan do not wish to be unjust to the frame of the door , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , and [he]109-wogan drew off [his]109-wogan boots . [The landlord]218-the landlord bade [[his]218-the landlord guest]841-his guest good - night and descended [the stairs]366-the stairs . [Wogan]109-wogan , being [a campaigner]843-a campaigner , was methodical even though lost in reflection . [He]109-wogan was reflecting now why in [the world]245-the world [he]109-wogan should lately have become sensible of loneliness ; but at the same time [he]109-wogan put [the Prince]588-the prince 's letter beneath [his]109-wogan pillow and a sheathed hunting - knife beside the letter . [He]109-wogan had always been lonely , and the fact had never troubled [him]109-wogan ; [he]109-wogan placed a chair on the left of the bed and [his]109-wogan candle on the chair . Besides , [he]109-wogan was not really lonely , having [a host of friends whom [he]109-wogan had merely to seek out]846-a host of friends whom he had merely to seek out ; [he]109-wogan took the charges from [his]109-wogan pistol lest they should be damp , and renewed them and placed the pistols by the candle . [He]109-wogan had even begun to pity [himself]109-wogan for [his]109-wogan loneliness , and pity of that sort , [he]109-wogan recognised , was a discreditable quality ; the matter was altogether very disquieting . [He]109-wogan propped [his]109-wogan sword against the chair and undressed . [Wogan]109-wogan cast back in [his]109-wogan memories for the first sensations of loneliness . They were recent , since [he]109-wogan had left [Ohlau]12-ohlau , indeed . [He]109-wogan opened the window ; the rain splashed in on the sill , pattered in the street puddles below , and fell across [the country]847-the country with a continuous roar as though [the level plain]848-the level plain was a stretched drum . No ; [he]109-wogan had only felt lonely since [he]109-wogan had come near to [Schlestadt]31-schlestadt , since , in a word , [he]109-wogan had deemed [himself]109-wogan to have outstripped pursuit . [He]109-wogan got into [his]109-wogan bed and blew out the candle . For a moment [the room]317-the room was black as pitch , then on [his]109-wogan left side the darkness thinned at one point and a barred square of grey became visible ; the square of grey was the window . [Wogan]109-wogan understood that [his]109-wogan loneliness came upon [him]109-wogan with the respite from [his]109-wogan difficulties , and concluded that , after all , it was as well that [he]109-wogan had not a comfortable fireside whereby to sun [himself]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan turned over on [his]109-wogan right side and saw the white door and [its]850-its white frame . The rain made a dreary sound outside the window , but in three days [he]109-wogan would be at [Schlestadt]31-schlestadt . Besides [he]109-wogan fell asleep . And in a little [he]109-wogan dreamed . [He]109-wogan dreamed that [he]109-wogan was swinging on a gibbet before [the whole populace of [Innspruck]17-innspruck]851-the whole populace of innspruck , that [he]109-wogan died to [his]109-wogan bewilderment without any pain whatever , but that pain came to [him]109-wogan after [he]109-wogan was quite dead,—not bodily pain at all , but an anguish of mind because the chains by which [he]109-wogan was hanged would groan and creak , and [the populace , mistaking that groaning]852-the populace , mistaking that groaning for [his]109-wogan cries , scoffed at [him]109-wogan and ridiculed [[his]109-wogan King]326-his king for sending to rescue [the Princess Clementina]116-clementina a marrowless thing that could not die like [a man]235-a man . [Wogan]109-wogan stirred in [his]109-wogan sleep and waked up . The rain had ceased , and a light wind blew across [the country]847-the country . Outside the sign - board creaked and groaned upon its stanchion . Once [he]109-wogan became aware of that sound [he]109-wogan could no longer sleep for listening to it ; and at last [he]109-wogan sprang out of bed , and leaning out of the window lifted the sign - board off the stanchion and into [[his]109-wogan bedroom]782-his bedroom . It was a plain white board without any device on it . " True , "[109-wogan] thought [Wogan]109-wogan , " [the man]365-the man wants a new name for [[his]365-the man inn]3378-his inn . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan propped the board against the left side of [his]109-wogan bed , since that was nearest to the window , got between the sheets , and began to think over names . [He]109-wogan turned on [his]109-wogan right side and fell asleep again . [He]109-wogan was not to sleep restfully that night . [He]109-wogan waked again , but very slowly , and without any movement of [his]109-wogan body . [He]109-wogan lay with [his]109-wogan face towards the door , dreamily considering that [the landlord]218-the landlord , for all [his]218-the landlord pride in [his]218-the landlord new paint , had employed [a bad workman who had left a black strip of the door unpainted,—a fairly wide strip]858-a bad workman who had left a black strip of the door unpainted,—a fairly wide strip , too , which [[his]109-wogan host]838-his host should never have overlooked . [Wogan]109-wogan was lazily determining to speak to [the landlord]218-the landlord about it when [his]109-wogan half - awakened mind was diverted by a curious phenomenon , a delusion of the eyes such as [he]109-wogan had known to have befallen [him]109-wogan before when [he]109-wogan had stared for a long while on any particular object : the strip of black widened and widened . [Wogan]109-wogan waited for it to contract , as it would be sure to do . But it did not contract , and — so [Wogan]109-wogan waked up completely . [He]109-wogan waked up with a shock of the heart , with all [his]109-wogan senses startled and strained . But [he]109-wogan had been gradually waking before , and so by neither movement nor cry did [he]109-wogan betray that [he]109-wogan was awake . [He]109-wogan had not locked the door of [[his]109-wogan room]563-his room ; that widening strip of black ran vertically down from the lintel to the ground and between the white door and the white door frame . The door was being cautiously pushed open ; the strip of black was the darkness of the passage coming through . [Wogan]109-wogan slid [his]109-wogan hand beneath [his]109-wogan pillow , and drew the knife from its sheath as silently as the door opened . The strip of black ceased to widen , there was a slight scuffling sound upon the floor which [Wogan]109-wogan was at no loss to understand . It was the sound of [a man]235-a man crawling into [the room]317-the room upon [his]235-a man hands and knees . [Wogan]109-wogan lay on [his]109-wogan side and felt grateful to [his]109-wogan host,—an admirable man,—for [he]109-wogan had painted [his]109-wogan door white , and now [he]109-wogan crawled through it on [his]109-wogan hands and knees . No doubt [he]109-wogan would crawl to the side of the bed ; [he]109-wogan did . To feel , no doubt , for [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan 's coat and breeches and any little letter which might be hiding in the pockets . But here [Wogan]109-wogan was wrong . For [he]109-wogan saw a dark thing suddenly on the counterpane at the edge of the bed . The dark thing travelled upwards very softly ; it had four fingers and a thumb . It was , no doubt , travelling towards the pillow , and as soon as it got there — but [Wogan]109-wogan watching that hand beneath [his]109-wogan dosed eyelids had again to admit that [he]109-wogan was wrong . It did not travel towards the pillow ; to [his]109-wogan astonishment it stole across towards [him]109-wogan , it touched [his]109-wogan chest very gently , and then [he]109-wogan understood . The hand was creeping upwards towards [his]109-wogan throat . Meanwhile [Wogan]109-wogan had seen no face , though the face must be just below the level of the bed . [He]109-wogan only saw the hand and the arm behind [it]864-it . [He]109-wogan moved as if in [his]109-wogan sleep , and the hand disappeared . As if in [his]109-wogan sleep , [he]109-wogan flung out [his]109-wogan left arm and felt for the sign - board standing beside [his]109-wogan bed . The bed was soft . [Wogan]109-wogan wanted something hard , and it had occurred to [him]109-wogan that the sign - board would very well serve [his]109-wogan turn . An idea , too , which seemed to [him]109-wogan diverting , had presented itself to [his]109-wogan mind . With a loud sigh and a noisy movement such as [a man halfway between wakefulness and sleep]865-a man halfway between wakefulness and sleep may make [he]109-wogan flung [himself]109-wogan over onto [his]109-wogan left side . At the same moment [he]109-wogan lifted the white sign - board onto the bed . It seemed that [he]109-wogan could not rest on [his]109-wogan left side , for [he]109-wogan flung over again to [his]109-wogan right and pulled the bedclothes over as [he]109-wogan turned . The sign - board now lay flat upon the bed , but on the right side between [himself]109-wogan and [the man upon the floor]866-the man upon the floor . [His]109-wogan mouth uttered a little murmur of contentment , [he]109-wogan drew down the hand beneath the pillow , and in a second was breathing regularly and peacefully . The hand crept onto the bed again and upwards , and suddenly lay spread out upon the board and quite still . Just for a second [the owner of that hand]867-the owner of that hand had been surprised and paralysed by the unexpected . It was only that second which [Wogan]109-wogan needed . [He]109-wogan sat up , and with [his]109-wogan right arm [he]109-wogan drove [his]109-wogan hunting knife down into the back of the hand and pinned it fast to the board ; with [his]109-wogan left [he]109-wogan felt for , found , and gripped a mouth already open to cry out . [He]109-wogan dropped [his]109-wogan hunting knife , caught [the intruder]868-the intruder round the waist , lifted [him]868-the intruder onto the bed , and setting a knee upon [his]868-the intruder chest gagged [him]868-the intruder with an end of the sheet . [The man]365-the man fought wildly with [his]365-the man free hand , beating the air . [Wogan]109-wogan knelt upon that arm with [his]109-wogan other knee . [Wogan]109-wogan needed a rope , but since [he]109-wogan had none [he]109-wogan used the sheets and bound [[his]109-wogan prisoner]870-his prisoner to the bed . Then [he]109-wogan got up and went to the door . [The house]3196-the house was quite silent , quite dark . [Wogan]109-wogan shut the door gently — there was no key in the lock — and bending over the bed looked into the face of [[his]109-wogan assailant]872-his assailant . The face was twisted with pain , the whites of the eyes glared horribly , but [Wogan]109-wogan could see that [the man]365-the man was [[his]109-wogan landlord]874-his landlord . [He]109-wogan stood up and thought . There was [another man who had met [him]109-wogan in [the village]789-the village and had guided [him]109-wogan to [the inn]231-the inn]875-another man who had met him in the village and had guided him to the inn ; there was still [a third who had gone out of [the kitchen]879-the kitchen as [Wogan]109-wogan had entered [it]879-the kitchen]878-a third who had gone out of the kitchen as wogan had entered it ; there was [the wife]3306-the wife , too , who might be awake . [Wogan]109-wogan crossed to the window and looked out . The window was perhaps twenty feet from the ground , but the stanchion was three feet below the window . [He]109-wogan quickly put on [his]109-wogan clothes , slipped the letter from under [his]109-wogan pillow into a pocket , strapped [his]109-wogan saddle - bag and lowered it from the window by a blanket . [He]109-wogan had already one leg on the sill when a convulsive movement of [the man on the bed]881-the man on the bed made [him]109-wogan stop . [He]109-wogan climbed back into [the room]317-the room , drew the knife out of the board and out of the hand pinned to the board , and making a bandage wrapped the wound up . " [You]881-the man on the bed must lie there till morning , [[my]109-wogan friend]3085-my friend , "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan whispered in [his]881-the man on the bed ear , " but here 's a thing to console [you]881-the man on the bed . [I]109-wogan have found a name for [[your]881-the man on the bed inn]3380-your inn ; [I]109-wogan have painted the device upon [your]881-the man on the bed sign - board . [The ' Inn of the Five Red Fingers]3381-the ' inn of the five red fingers . ' There 's never [a passer - by]3382-a passer - by but will stop to inquire the reason of so conspicuous a sign ; "[109-wogan] and [Wogan]109-wogan climbed out of the window , lowered [himself]109-wogan till [he]109-wogan hung at the full length of [his]109-wogan arms from the stanchion , and dropped on the ground . [He]109-wogan picked up [his]109-wogan saddle - bag and crept round [the house]3196-the house to [the stable]3339-the stable . The door needed only a push to open it . In [the hay - loft]885-the hay - loft above [he]109-wogan heard [a man]235-a man snoring . [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan did not think it worth while to disturb [him]235-a man . [He]109-wogan saddled [his]109-wogan horse , walked it out into [the yard]887-the yard , mounted , and rode quietly away . [He]109-wogan had escaped , but without much credit to [himself]109-wogan . " There was no key in the door , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan thought . " [I]109-wogan should have noticed it . [Misset]143-misset , [the man of resources]3383-the man of resources , would have tilted a chair backwards against that door with its top bar wedged beneath the door handle . "[109-wogan] Certainly [Wogan]109-wogan needed [Misset]143-misset if [he]109-wogan was to succeed in [his]109-wogan endeavour . [He]109-wogan was sunk in humiliation ; [his]109-wogan very promise to rescue [the Princess]3107-the princess shrank from its grandeur and became a mere piece of impertinence . But [he]109-wogan still had [his]109-wogan letter in [his]109-wogan pocket , and in time that served to enhearten [him]109-wogan . Only two more days , [he]109-wogan thought . On the third night [he]109-wogan would sleep in [Schlestadt]31-schlestadt . The next afternoon [Wogan]109-wogan came to [the town of Ulm]889-the town of ulm . " [Gaydon]142-gaydon , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said to [himself]109-wogan as [he]109-wogan watched [its]889-the town of ulm towers and the smoke curling upwards from [its]889-the town of ulm chimneys , " would go no further to - day with this letter in [his]142-gaydon pocket . [Gaydon]142-gaydon — the cautious [Gaydon]142-gaydon — would sleep in [this town]3384-this town and in [[its]889-the town of ulm most populous quarter]3385-its most populous quarter . [Gaydon]142-gaydon would put up at [the busiest inn]3386-the busiest inn . [Charles Wogan]109-wogan will follow [Gaydon]142-gaydon 's example . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan rode slowly through [the narrow streets of [gabled houses]891-gabled houses]890-the narrow streets of gabled houses until [he]109-wogan came to [the market square]892-the market square . [The square]893-the square was frequented ; [its]893-the square great fountain was playing ; [citizens]894-citizens were taking the air with [[their]894-citizens wives]895-their wives and [children]896-children ; [the chief highway of [the town]3115-the town]897-the chief highway of the town ran through [it]893-the square ; on one side stood [the frescoed Rathhaus]38-the frescoed rathhaus , and opposite to [it]38-the frescoed rathhaus there was [a spacious inn]899-a spacious inn . [Wogan]109-wogan drew up at the doorway and saw that [the hall]295-the hall was encumbered with baggage . " [Gaydon]142-gaydon would stop here , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , and [he]109-wogan dismounted . [The porter]472-the porter came forward and took [his]472-the porter horse . " [I]109-wogan need [a room]3387-a room , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , and [he]109-wogan entered [the house]3196-the house . There were [people]903-people going up and down the stairs . While [he]109-wogan was unstrapping [his]109-wogan valise in [[his]109-wogan bedroom]782-his bedroom , [a servant with an apron about [his]905-a servant with an apron about his waist waist]905-a servant with an apron about his waist knocked at the door and inquired whether [he]109-wogan could help [him]109-wogan . " No , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan ; and [he]109-wogan thought with more confidence than ever , " here , to be sure , is where [Gaydon]142-gaydon would sleep . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan supped at the ordinary in the company of [linen merchants]906-linen merchants and [travellers]3362-travellers , and quite recovered [his]109-wogan spirits . [He]109-wogan smoked a pipe of tobacco on a bench under [the trees of [the square]893-the square]908-the trees of the square , and giving an order that [he]109-wogan should be called at five went up to [[his]109-wogan bedroom]782-his bedroom . There was a key in the lock of the door , which [Wogan]109-wogan turned ; [he]109-wogan also tilted a chair and wedged the handle . [He]109-wogan opened the window and looked out . [[His]109-wogan room]563-his room was on the first floor and not very high from the ground . [A man]235-a man might possibly climb through the window . [Gaydon]142-gaydon would assuredly close the shutters and the window , so that [no one]356-no one could force an entrance without noise . [Wogan]109-wogan accordingly did what [Gaydon]142-gaydon would assuredly have done , and when [he]109-wogan blew out [his]109-wogan candle found [himself]109-wogan in consequence in utter darkness . No glimmer of light was anywhere visible . [He]109-wogan had [his]109-wogan habits like another , and one of them was to sleep without blinds or curtains drawn . [His]109-wogan present deflection from this habit made [him]109-wogan restless ; [he]109-wogan was tired , [he]109-wogan wished above all things to sleep , but sleep would not come . [He]109-wogan turned from one side to the other , [he]109-wogan punched [his]109-wogan pillows , [he]109-wogan tried to sleep with [his]109-wogan head low , and when that failed with [his]109-wogan head high . [He]109-wogan resigned [himself]109-wogan in the end to a sleepless night , and lying in [his]109-wogan bed drew some comfort from the sound of voices and the tread of feet in [the passages]914-the passages and [the rooms about [him]109-wogan]915-the rooms about him . These , at all events , were companionable , and they assured [him]109-wogan of safety . But in a while they ceased , and [he]109-wogan was left in a silence as absolute as the darkness . [He]109-wogan endured this silence for perhaps half an hour , and then all manner of infinitesimal sounds began to stir about [him]109-wogan . The lightest of footsteps moved about [his]109-wogan bed , faint sighs breathed from very close at hand , even [his]109-wogan name was softly whispered . [He]109-wogan sat suddenly up in [his]109-wogan bed , and at once all these sounds became explained to [him]109-wogan . They came from [the street]292-the street and [the square]893-the square outside the window . So long as [he]109-wogan sat up they were remote , but the moment [he]109-wogan lay down again [they]918-they peopled [the room]317-the room . " Sure , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , " here is a lesson for [architects]3388-architects . Build no shutters to [a house]3268-a house when [the man]365-the man that has to live in [it]3268-a house has a spark of imagination , else will [he]365-the man go stark raving mad before the mortar 's dry . Window shutters are window shutters , but they are the doors of Bedlam as well . Now [Gaydon]142-gaydon should have slept in [this room]351-this room . [Gaydon]142-gaydon 's [a great man]3392-a great man . [Gaydon]142-gaydon has a great deal of observation and common sense , and was never plagued with a flim - flam of fancies . To be sure , [I]109-wogan need [Gaydon]142-gaydon , but since [I]109-wogan have not [Gaydon]142-gaydon , [I]109-wogan 'll light a candle . "[109-wogan] With that [Wogan]109-wogan got out of bed . [He]109-wogan had made [himself]109-wogan so secure with [his]109-wogan key and [his]109-wogan tilted chair and [his]109-wogan shutters that [he]109-wogan had not thought of placing [his]109-wogan candle by [his]109-wogan bedside . It stood by [his]109-wogan looking - glass on the table . Now [the room]317-the room was so pitch dark that [Wogan]109-wogan could do no more than guess at the position even of the window . The table , [he]109-wogan remembered , was not far from the door , and the door was at some distance from [his]109-wogan bed , and in the wall on [his]109-wogan right . [He]109-wogan moved forward in the darkness with [his]109-wogan hands in front of [him]109-wogan , groping for the table . [The room]317-the room was large ; in a little [his]109-wogan hands touched something , and that something was a pillar of the bed . [He]109-wogan had missed [his]109-wogan way in [[his]109-wogan bedroom]782-his bedroom . [Wogan]109-wogan laughed to [himself]109-wogan and started off again ; and the next thing which [his]109-wogan outstretched hands touched was a doorknob . The table should now be a little way to [his]109-wogan left . [He]109-wogan was just turning away in that direction , when it occurred to [him]109-wogan that [he]109-wogan ought to have felt the rim of the top bar of [his]109-wogan tilted chair underneath the door - handle . [He]109-wogan stooped down and felt for the chair ; there was no chair , and [he]109-wogan stood very still . The fears bred of imagination had now left [him]109-wogan ; [he]109-wogan was restored by the shock of an actual danger . [He]109-wogan leaned forward quietly and felt if the key was still in the lock . But there was no lock to this door . [Wogan]109-wogan felt the surface of the door ; it was of paper . It was plainly the door of a cupboard in the wall , papered after the same pattern as the wall , which by the flickering light of [his]109-wogan single candle [he]109-wogan had overlooked . [He]109-wogan opened the door and stretched out [his]109-wogan arms into the cupboard . [He]109-wogan touched something that moved beneath [his]109-wogan hand , a stiff , short crop of hair , the hair of [a man]235-a man 's head . [He]109-wogan drew [his]109-wogan arm away as though an adder had stung it ; [he]109-wogan did not utter a cry or make a movement . [He]109-wogan stood for a moment paralysed , and during that moment a strong hand caught [him]109-wogan by the throat . [Wogan]109-wogan was borne backwards , [[his]109-wogan assailant]872-his assailant sprang at [him]109-wogan from the cupboard , [he]109-wogan staggered under the unexpected vigour of the attack , [he]109-wogan clutched [[his]109-wogan enemy]630-his enemy , and [the two men]462-the two men came to the ground with a crash . Even as [he]109-wogan fell [Wogan]109-wogan thought , " [Gaydon]142-gaydon would never have overlooked [that cupboard]3393-that cupboard . "[109-wogan] It was the only reflection , however , for which [he]109-wogan could afford time . [He]109-wogan was undermost , and the hand at [his]109-wogan throat had the grip of a steel glove . [He]109-wogan fought with blows from [his]109-wogan fists and [his]109-wogan bent knees ; [he]109-wogan twisted [his]109-wogan legs about the legs of [[his]109-wogan enemy]630-his enemy ; [he]109-wogan writhed [his]109-wogan body if so [he]109-wogan might dislodge [him]630-his enemy ; [he]109-wogan grappled wildly for [his]109-wogan throat . But all the time [his]109-wogan strength grew less ; [he]109-wogan felt that [his]109-wogan temples were swelling , and it seemed to [him]109-wogan that [his]109-wogan eyes must burst . The darkness of [the room]317-the room was spotted with sparks of fire ; the air was filled with a continuous roar like a million chariots in [a street]282-a street . [He]109-wogan saw the face of [[his]109-wogan chosen woman]930-his chosen woman , most reproachful and yet kind , gazing at [him]109-wogan from behind the bars which now would never be broken , and then there came a loud banging at the door . The summons surprised [them]931-they both , so hotly had [they]931-they been engaged , so unaware were [they]931-they of the noise which [their]931-they fall had made . [Wogan]109-wogan felt [[his]109-wogan assailant]872-his assailant 's hand relax and heard [him]872-his assailant say in a low muffled voice , " It is nothing . Go to bed ! [I]872-his assailant fell over a chair in the dark . "[872-his assailant] That momentary relaxation was , [he]109-wogan knew , [his]109-wogan last chance . [He]109-wogan gathered [his]109-wogan strength in a supreme effort , lurched over onto [his]109-wogan left side , and getting [his]109-wogan right arm free swung it with all [his]109-wogan strength in the direction of the voice . [His]109-wogan clenched fist caught [[his]109-wogan opponent]933-his opponent full under the point of the chin , and the hand at [Wogan]109-wogan 's throat clutched once and fell away limp as an empty glove . [Wogan]109-wogan sat up on the floor and drew [his]109-wogan breath . That , after all , was more than [[his]109-wogan antagonist]934-his antagonist was doing . The knocking at the door continued ; [Wogan]109-wogan could not answer it , [he]109-wogan had not the strength . [His]109-wogan limbs were shaking , the sweat clotted [his]109-wogan hair and dripped from [his]109-wogan face . But [[his]109-wogan opponent]933-his opponent was quieter still . At last [he]109-wogan managed to gather [his]109-wogan legs beneath [him]109-wogan , to kneel up , to stand shakily upon [his]109-wogan feet . [He]109-wogan could no longer mistake the position of the door ; [he]109-wogan tottered across to it , removed the chair , and opened it . [The landlord]218-the landlord with [a couple of [servants]242-servants]937-a couple of servants stepped back as [Wogan]109-wogan showed [himself]109-wogan to the light of [their]937-a couple of servants candles . [Wogan]109-wogan heard [their]937-a couple of servants exclamations , though [he]109-wogan did not clearly understand them , for [his]109-wogan ears still buzzed . [He]109-wogan saw [their]937-a couple of servants startled faces , but only dimly , for [he]109-wogan was dazzled by the light . [He]109-wogan came back into [the room]317-the room , and pointing to [[his]109-wogan assailant,—a sturdy , broad man , who now sat up opening and shutting [his]109-wogan eyes in a dazed way,—"Who]3394-his assailant,—a sturdy , broad man , who now sat up opening and shutting his eyes in a dazed way,—"who is that ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan asked , gasping rather than speaking the words . " Who is that ? "[218-the landlord] repeated [the landlord]218-the landlord , staring at [Wogan]109-wogan . " Who is that ? "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , leaning against the bed - post . " Why , [sir]3070-sir , [[your]3070-sir servant]3396-your servant . Who should [he]3396-your servant be ? "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan was silent for a little , considering as well as [his]109-wogan rambling wits allowed this new development . " Ah ! "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , " [he]3396-your servant came here with [me]109-wogan ? "[109-wogan] " Yes , since [he]3396-your servant is [[your]3070-sir servant]3396-your servant . "[218-the landlord] [The landlord]218-the landlord was evidently mystified ; [he]218-the landlord was no less evidently speaking with sincerity . [Wogan]109-wogan reflected that to proffer a charge against [the assailant]942-the assailant would involve [his]109-wogan own detention in [Ulm]39-ulm . " To be sure , "[218-the landlord] said [he]218-the landlord , " [I]218-the landlord know . This is [[my]218-the landlord servant]3099-my servant . That is precisely what [I]218-the landlord mean . "[218-the landlord] [His]109-wogan wits were at work to find a way out of [his]109-wogan difficulty . " This is [[my]109-wogan servant]3099-my servant ? What then ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan asked fiercely . " But [I]218-the landlord do n't understand , "[218-the landlord] said [the landlord]218-the landlord . " [You]218-the landlord do n't understand ! "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan . " Was there ever [such a landlord]3400-such a landlord ? [He]3400-such a landlord does not understand . This is [[my]109-wogan servant]3099-my servant , [I]109-wogan tell [you]218-the landlord . "[109-wogan] " Yes , [sir]3070-sir , but — but — "[218-the landlord] " Well ? "[218-the landlord] " [We]3403-we were roused — there was a noise — a noise of [men]289-men fighting . "[109-wogan] " There would have been no noise , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , triumphantly , " if [you]218-the landlord had prepared a bed for [[my]109-wogan servant]3099-my servant . [He]3099-my servant would not have crept into [[my]109-wogan cupboard]3406-my cupboard to sleep off [his]3099-my servant drunkenness . "[109-wogan] " But , [sir]3070-sir , there was a bed . "[109-wogan] " [You]3070-sir should have seen that [he]3099-my servant was carried to it . As it is , here have [I]109-wogan been driven to beat [him]3099-my servant and to lose [my]109-wogan night 's rest in consequence . It is not fitting . [I]109-wogan do not think that [[your]218-the landlord inn]3380-your inn is well managed . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan expressed [his]109-wogan indignation with so majestic an air that [the landlord]218-the landlord was soon apologising for having disturbed [a gentleman]945-a gentleman in the proper exercise of belabouring [[his]218-the landlord valet]946-his valet . " [We]3409-we will carry [the fellow]3410-the fellow away , "[218-the landlord] said [he]218-the landlord . " [You]218-the landlord will do nothing of the kind , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . " [He]3410-the fellow shall get back into [[his]3410-the fellow cupboard]3411-his cupboard and there [he]3410-the fellow shall remain till daybreak . Come , get up ! "[109-wogan] [[Wogan]109-wogan 's self - appointed valet]947-wogan 's self - appointed valet got to [his]947-wogan 's self - appointed valet feet . There was no possibility of an escape for [him]947-wogan 's self - appointed valet since there were [three men]948-three men between [him]947-wogan 's self - appointed valet and the door . On the other hand , obedience to [Wogan]109-wogan might save [him]947-wogan 's self - appointed valet from a charge of attempted theft . " In with [you]365-the man , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , and [the man]365-the man obeyed . [His]365-the man head no doubt was still spinning from the blow , and [he]365-the man had the stupid look of one dazed . " There is no lock to the door , "[218-the landlord] said [the landlord]218-the landlord . " There is no need of a lock , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , " so long as [one]3129-one has a chair . [The fellow]3410-the fellow will do very well till the morning . But [I]109-wogan will take [your]365-the man three candles , for it is not likely that [I]109-wogan shall sleep . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan smoked [his]109-wogan pipe all the rest of the night , reclining on a couple of chairs in front of the cupboard . In the morning [he]109-wogan made [[his]109-wogan valet]946-his valet walk three miles by [his]109-wogan horse 's side . [The man]365-the man dared not disobey , and when [Wogan]109-wogan finally let [him]365-the man go [he]365-the man was so far from [the town]3115-the town that , had [he]365-the man confederates [there]3363-there , [he]365-the man could do no harm . [Wogan]109-wogan continued [his]109-wogan journey . [Towns]777-towns , it was proved , were no safer to [him]109-wogan than [villages]956-villages . [He]109-wogan began to wonder how it was that no traps had been laid for [him]109-wogan on the earlier stages of [his]109-wogan journey , and [he]109-wogan suddenly hit upon the explanation . " It was that night , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan to [himself]109-wogan , " when [the Prince]588-the prince sat by [the Countess]599-the countess with the list of [[my]109-wogan friends]3416-my friends in [his]588-the prince hands . The names were all erased but three , and against those three was that other name of [Schlestadt]31-schlestadt . No doubt [the Countess]599-the countess while [she]599-the countess bent over [her]599-the countess harp - strings took a look at that list . [I]109-wogan must run the gauntlet into [Schlestadt]31-schlestadt . "[109-wogan] Towards evening [he]109-wogan came to [Stuttgart]40-stuttgart and rode through [the Schloss Platz]957-the schloss platz and along [the Königstrasse]958-the königstrasse . [Wogan]109-wogan would not sleep [there]3363-there , since there [the Duke of Würtemberg]151-the duke of würtemberg held [his]151-the duke of würtemberg court , and in that court [the Countess of [Berg]25-berg]598-the countess of berg was very likely to have [friends]3289-friends . [He]109-wogan rode onwards through [the valley]274-the valley along [the banks of [the Nesen brook]41-the nesen brook]963-the banks of the nesen brook until [he]109-wogan came to [its]41-the nesen brook junction with [the Neckar]42-the neckar . A mile farther [a wooden mill]964-a wooden mill stood upon [the river - bank]965-the river - bank , beyond [the mill]966-the mill was [a tavern]967-a tavern , and beyond [the tavern]968-the tavern stood [a few cottages]969-a few cottages . At some distance from [the cottages along [the road]228-the road]970-the cottages along the road , [Wogan]109-wogan could see a high brick wall , and over the top the chimneys and the slate roof of [a large house]972-a large house . [Wogan]109-wogan stopped at [the tavern]968-the tavern . [It]968-the tavern promised no particular comfort , [it]968-the tavern was [a small dilapidated house]974-a small dilapidated house ; but [it]968-the tavern had the advantage that [it]968-the tavern was free from new paint . It seemed to [Wogan]109-wogan , however , wellnigh useless to take precautions in the choice of [a lodging]975-a lodging ; danger leaped at [him]109-wogan from every quarter . For this last night [he]109-wogan must trust to [his]109-wogan luck ; and besides there was the splash of the water falling over [the mill - dam]976-the mill - dam . It was always something to [Wogan]109-wogan to fall asleep with that sound in [his]109-wogan ears . [He]109-wogan dismounted accordingly , and having ordered [his]109-wogan supper asked for [a room]3387-a room . " [You]109-wogan will sleep [here]3086-here ? "[838-his host] exclaimed [[his]109-wogan host]838-his host . " [I]838-his host will at all events lie in bed , "[838-his host] returned [Wogan]109-wogan . [The innkeeper]979-the innkeeper took a lamp and led the way up a narrow winding stair . " Have a care , [sir]3070-sir , "[979-the innkeeper] said [he]979-the innkeeper ; " the stairs are steep . "[979-the innkeeper] " [I]979-the innkeeper prefer them steep . "[979-the innkeeper] " [I]979-the innkeeper am afraid that [I]979-the innkeeper keep the light from [you]3070-sir , but there is no room for two to walk abreast . "[979-the innkeeper] " It is an advantage . [I]218-the landlord do not like to be jostled on the stairs . "[218-the landlord] [The landlord]218-the landlord threw open a door at the top of the stairs . " [The room]317-the room is a garret , "[218-the landlord] [he]218-the landlord said in apology . " So long as [it]317-the room has no cupboards it will serve [my]218-the landlord turn . "[218-the landlord] " Ah ! [you]218-the landlord do not like cupboards . "[979-the innkeeper] " [They]317-the room fill [a poor man]3421-a poor man with envy of [those who have clothes to hang in them]3422-those who have clothes to hang in them . "[218-the landlord] [Wogan]109-wogan ascertained that there were no cupboards . There was a key , too , in the lock , and a chest of drawers which could be moved very suitably in front of the door . " It is a good garret , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , laying down [his]109-wogan bag upon a chair . " The window is small , "[218-the landlord] continued [the landlord]218-the landlord . " [One]3129-one will be less likely to fall out , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . [One]3129-one would also , [he]109-wogan thought , be less likely to climb in . [He]109-wogan looked out of the window . It was a good height from the ground ; there was no stanchion or projection in the wall , and it seemed impossible that [a man]235-a man could get [his]235-a man shoulders through the opening . [Wogan]109-wogan opened the window to try it , and the sound of [someone]690-someone running came to [his]109-wogan ears . " Oho ! "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , but [he]109-wogan said it to [himself]109-wogan , " here 's [a man in a mighty hurry]3424-a man in a mighty hurry . "[109-wogan] A mist was rising from the ground ; the evening , too , was dark . [Wogan]109-wogan could see [no one]356-no one in [the road below]986-the road below , but [he]109-wogan heard the footsteps diminishing into a faint patter . Then they ceased altogether . [The man who ran]987-the man who ran was running in the direction of [Stuttgart]40-stuttgart . " Yes , [your]365-the man garret will do , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , in quite a different voice . [He]109-wogan had begun to think that this night [he]109-wogan would sleep , and [he]109-wogan realised now that [he]109-wogan must not . [The man]365-the man might be running on [his]365-the man own business , but this was the last night before [Wogan]109-wogan would reach [[his]109-wogan friends]989-his friends . [Stuttgart]40-stuttgart was only three miles away . [He]109-wogan could take no risks , and so [he]109-wogan must stay awake with [his]109-wogan sword upon [his]109-wogan knees . Had [his]109-wogan horse been able to carry [him]109-wogan farther , [he]109-wogan would have ridden on , but the horse was even more weary than [its master]990-its master . Besides , the narrow staircase made [[his]109-wogan room]563-his room an excellent place to defend . " Get [my]109-wogan supper , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " for [I]109-wogan am very tired . "[109-wogan] " Will [[your]218-the landlord Excellency]3425-your excellency sup [here]3086-here ? "[218-the landlord] asked [the landlord]218-the landlord . " By no manner of means , "[218-the landlord] returned [Wogan]109-wogan , who had it in [his]109-wogan mind to spy out [the land]993-the land . " [I]109-wogan detest nothing so much as [my]109-wogan own company . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan went [downstairs]994-downstairs into [the common room]995-the common room and supped off a smoked ham and a bottle of execrable wine . While [he]109-wogan ate [a man]235-a man came in and sat [him]109-wogan down by the fire . [The man]365-the man had a hot , flushed face , and when [he]365-the man saluted [Wogan]109-wogan [he]365-the man could hardly speak . " [You]365-the man have been running , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , politely . " [Sir]3070-sir , running is [a poor man]3421-a poor man 's overcoat for a chilly evening ; besides it helps [me]3410-the fellow to pay with patience the price of wine for vinegar ; "[3410-the fellow] and [the fellow]3410-the fellow called [the landlord]218-the landlord . Presently [two other men]1000-two other men entered , and taking a seat by the fire chatted together as though much absorbed in [their]1000-two other men private business . [These two men]1001-these two men wore swords . " [You]218-the landlord have a good trade , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan to [the landlord]218-the landlord . " [The mill]966-the mill brings [me]109-wogan custom . "[109-wogan] The door opened as [the landlord]218-the landlord spoke , and [a big loud - voiced man]1004-a big loud - voiced man cheerily wished [the company]640-the company good evening . [The two companions at the fire]1006-the two companions at the fire paid no heed to the civility ; the third , who had now quite recovered [his]1007-his breath , replied to it . [Wogan]109-wogan pushed [his]109-wogan plate away and called for a pipe . [He]109-wogan thought it might perhaps prove well worth [his]109-wogan while to study [[his]109-wogan landlord]874-his landlord 's clients before [he]109-wogan retired up [those narrow stairs]1009-those narrow stairs . [The four men]1010-the four men gave no sign of any common agreement , nor were [they]1010-the four men at all curious as to [Wogan]109-wogan . If [they]1010-the four men spoke at all , [they]1010-the four men spoke as [strangers speak]1011-strangers speak . But while [Wogan]109-wogan was smoking [his]109-wogan first pipe [a fifth man]1012-a fifth man entered , and [he]1012-a fifth man just gave one quick glance at [Wogan]109-wogan . [Wogan]109-wogan behind a cloud of tobacco - smoke saw the movement of the head and detected the look . It might signify nothing but curiosity , of course , but [Wogan]109-wogan felt glad that the stairs were narrow . [He]109-wogan finished [his]109-wogan pipe and was knocking out the ashes when it occurred to [him]109-wogan that [he]109-wogan had seen [that fifth man]1013-that fifth man before ; and [Wogan]109-wogan looked at [him]1013-that fifth man more carefully , and though [the fellow]3410-the fellow was disguised by the growth of a beard [he]109-wogan recognised [him]1013-that fifth man . It was [the servant whom [Wogan]109-wogan had seen one day in [the Countess of [Berg]141-the countess of berg 's livery of green and red galloping along [the road]228-the road to [Prague]34-prague]1016-the countess of berg 's livery of green and red galloping along the road to prague]1015-the servant whom wogan had seen one day in the countess of berg 's livery of green and red galloping along the road to prague . " [I]109-wogan know enough now , "[109-wogan] thought [Wogan]109-wogan . " [I]109-wogan can go to bed . [The staircase]673-the staircase is a pretty place with which [we]3431-we shall all be more familiar in an hour or two . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan laughed quietly to [himself]109-wogan with a little thrill of enjoyment . [His]109-wogan fatigue had vanished . [He]109-wogan was on the point of getting up from the table when [the two men by the fire]1018-the two men by the fire looked round towards [the last comer]1019-the last comer and made room for [him]109-wogan upon [their]1018-the two men by the fire settle . But [he]109-wogan said , " [I]109-wogan find [the room]317-the room hot , and will stay by the door . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan changed [his]109-wogan mind at the words ; [he]109-wogan did not get up . On the contrary , [he]109-wogan filled [his]109-wogan pipe a second time very thoughtfully . [He]109-wogan had stayed too long in [the room]317-the room , it seemed ; [the little staircase]1021-the little staircase was , after all , likely to prove of no service . [He]109-wogan did not betray [himself]109-wogan by any start or exclamation , [he]109-wogan did not even look up , but bending [his]109-wogan head over [his]109-wogan pipe [he]109-wogan thought over the disposition of [the room]317-the room . [The fireplace]1023-the fireplace was on [his]109-wogan right ; the door was opposite to [him]109-wogan ; the window in the wall at [his]109-wogan left . The window was high from the ground and at some distance . On the other hand , [he]109-wogan had certain advantages . [He]109-wogan was in a corner , [he]109-wogan had [the five men in front of [him]109-wogan]1024-the five men in front of him , and between [them]1024-the five men in front of him and [himself]109-wogan stood a solid table . A loaded pistol was in [his]109-wogan belt , [his]109-wogan sword hung at [his]109-wogan side , and [his]109-wogan hunting knife at [his]109-wogan waist . Still the aspect of affairs was changed . " [Five men]3433-five men , "[109-wogan] thought [he]109-wogan , " upon [a narrow staircase]3434-a narrow staircase are merely [one man who has to be killed five times , but [five men in [a room]3387-a room]3436-five men in a room]3435-one man who has to be killed five times , but five men in a room are [five simultaneous assailants]3438-five simultaneous assailants . [I]109-wogan need O'Toole here , [I]109-wogan need O'Toole 's six feet four and the length of [his]109-wogan arm and the weight of [him]109-wogan — these things [I]109-wogan need — but are there five or only four ? "[109-wogan] And [he]109-wogan was at once aware that [the two men at the fire]1025-the two men at the fire had ceased to talk of [their]1025-the two men at the fire business . [No one]356-no one , indeed , was speaking at all , and [no one]356-no one so much as shuffled a foot . [Wogan]109-wogan raised [his]109-wogan head and proceeded to light [his]109-wogan pipe ; and [he]109-wogan saw that [all the five men]1028-all the five men were silently watching [him]109-wogan , and it seemed to [him]109-wogan that those five pairs of eyes were unnaturally bright . However , [he]109-wogan appeared to be entirely concerned with [his]109-wogan pipe , which , however hard [he]109-wogan puffed at it , would not draw . No doubt the tobacco was packed too tight in the bowl . [He]109-wogan loosened it , and when [he]109-wogan had loosened it the pipe had gone out . [He]109-wogan fumbled in [his]109-wogan pocket and discovered in the breast of [his]109-wogan coat a letter . This letter [he]109-wogan glanced through to make sure that it was of no importance , and having informed [himself]109-wogan upon the point [he]109-wogan folded it into a long spill and walked over to the hearth . The five pairs of eyes followed [his]109-wogan movements . [He]109-wogan , however , had no attention to spare . [He]109-wogan bent down , lit [his]109-wogan spill in the flame , and deliberately lighted [his]109-wogan pipe . The tobacco rose above the rim of the bowl like a head of ale in a tankard . [Wogan]109-wogan , still holding the burning spill in [his]109-wogan right hand , pressed down the tobacco with the little finger of [his]109-wogan left , and lighted the pipe again . By this time [his]109-wogan spill had burned down to [his]109-wogan fingers . [He]109-wogan dropped the end into the fire and walked back to [his]109-wogan seat . The five pairs of eyes again turned as [he]109-wogan turned . [He]109-wogan stumbled at a crack in the floor , fell against the table with a clatter of [his]109-wogan sword , and rolled noisily into [his]109-wogan seat . When [he]109-wogan sat down [a careful observer]1029-a careful observer might have noticed that [his]109-wogan pistol was now at full cock . [He]109-wogan had barely seated [himself]109-wogan when [the polite man]1030-the polite man , who had come first hot and short of breath into [the room]317-the room , crossed the floor and leaning over the table said with a smile and the gentlest voice , " [I]1030-the polite man think , [sir]3070-sir , [you]3070-sir ought to know that [we]3440-we are [all very poor men]3441-all very poor men . "[1030-the polite man] " [I]109-wogan , too , "[109-wogan] replied [Wogan]109-wogan , " am [an Irishman]3165-an irishman . "[109-wogan] [The polite man]1030-the polite man leaned farther across the table ; [his]1030-the polite man voice became wheedling in its suavity . " [I]1030-the polite man think [you]3070-sir ought to know that [we]3440-we are [all very poor men]3441-all very poor men . "[1030-the polite man] " The repetition of the remark , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , " argues certainly a poverty of ideas . "[109-wogan] " [We]3440-we wish to become less poor . "[1030-the polite man] " It is an aspiration which has pushed [many men]3444-many men to creditable feats . "[1030-the polite man] " [You]109-wogan can help [us]3440-we . "[1030-the polite man] " [My]109-wogan prayers are at [your]109-wogan disposal , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . " By more than [your]3070-sir prayers ; "[1030-the polite man] and [he]1030-the polite man added in a tone of apology , " there are [five of [us]3440-we]3445-five of us . "[1030-the polite man] " Then [I]109-wogan have a guinea apiece for [you]109-wogan , "[109-wogan] and [Wogan]109-wogan thrust the table a little away from [him]1030-the polite man to search [his]1030-the polite man pockets . It also gave [him]1030-the polite man more play . " [We]3440-we do not want [your]109-wogan money . [You]109-wogan have a letter which [we]3440-we can coin . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan smiled . " There , [sir]3070-sir , [you]3070-sir are wrong . "[109-wogan] [The polite man]1030-the polite man waved the statement aside . " A letter from [Prince Sobieski]128-prince sobieski , "[1030-the polite man] said [he]1030-the polite man . " [I]1030-the polite man had such a letter a minute ago , but [I]1030-the polite man lit [my]1030-the polite man pipe with it under [your]109-wogan nose . "[1030-the polite man] [The polite man]1030-the polite man stepped back ; [[his]1030-the polite man four companions]1035-his four companions started to [their]1035-his four companions feet . [The servant from [Ohlau]12-ohlau]1036-the servant from ohlau cried out with an oath , " It 's a lie . "[1036-the servant from ohlau] [Wogan]109-wogan shrugged [his]109-wogan shoulders and crossed [his]109-wogan legs . " Here 's [a fine world]3447-a fine world , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [A damned rag of [a lackey]3449-a lackey]3448-a damned rag of a lackey gives [a gentleman]945-a gentleman the lie . "[109-wogan] " [You]109-wogan will give [me]1030-the polite man the letter , "[1030-the polite man] said [the polite man]1030-the polite man , coming round the table . [He]109-wogan held [his]109-wogan right hand behind [his]109-wogan back . " [You]109-wogan can sweep up the ashes from the hearth , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , [who made no movement of any kind]1038-who made no movement of any kind . [The polite man]1030-the polite man came close to [his]109-wogan side ; [Wogan]109-wogan let [him]1030-the polite man come . [The polite man]1030-the polite man stretched out [his]1030-the polite man left hand towards [Wogan]109-wogan 's pocket . [Wogan]109-wogan knocked the hand away , and [the man]365-the man 's right arm swung upwards from behind [his]365-the man back with a gleaming pistol in the hand . [Wogan]109-wogan was prepared for [him]365-the man ; [he]109-wogan had crossed [his]109-wogan legs to be prepared , and as the arm came round [he]109-wogan kicked upwards from the knee . The toe of [his]109-wogan heavy boot caught [the man]365-the man upon the point of the elbow . [His]365-the man arm was flung up ; the pistol exploded and then dropped onto the floor . [That assailant]1043-that assailant was for the time out of action , but at the same moment [the lackey]1044-the lackey came running across the floor , [his]1044-the lackey shoulders thrust forward , a knife in [his]1044-the lackey hand . [Wogan]109-wogan had just time to notice that [the lackey]1044-the lackey 's coat was open at [his]1044-the lackey breast . [He]109-wogan stood up , leaned over the table , caught the lapels one in each hand as [the fellow]3410-the fellow rushed at [him]109-wogan , and lifting the coat up off [his]1044-the lackey shoulders violently jammed it backwards down [his]1044-the lackey arms as though [he]109-wogan would strip [him]1044-the lackey of it . [The lackey]1044-the lackey stood with [his]1044-the lackey arms pinioned at [his]1044-the lackey elbows for a second . During that second [Wogan]109-wogan drew [his]109-wogan hunting knife from [his]109-wogan belt and drove it with a terrible strength into [the man]365-the man 's chest . " There 's a New Year 's gift for [[your]365-the man mistress]3451-your mistress , [the Countess of [Berg]25-berg]141-the countess of berg , "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan ; and [the lackey]1044-the lackey swung round with the force of the blow and then hopped twice in a horrible fashion with [his]1044-the lackey feet together across [the room]317-the room as though returning to [his]1044-the lackey place , and fell upon the floor , where [he]1044-the lackey lay twisting . [The polite man]1030-the polite man was nursing [his]1030-the polite man elbow in a corner ; there were [three others left,—the man with the cheery voice , who had no weapon but a knobbed stick]1052-three others left,—the man with the cheery voice , who had no weapon but a knobbed stick , and [the companions on the settle]1053-the companions on the settle . [These two]1054-these two had swords and had drawn them . [They]1054-these two leaped over [the lackey]1044-the lackey 's body and rushed at [Wogan]109-wogan one a little in advance of the other . [Wogan]109-wogan tilted the heavy table and flung it over to make a barricade in front of [him]109-wogan . It fell with a crash , and the lower rim struck upon the instep of [the leader]1056-the leader and pinned [his]109-wogan foot . [[His]109-wogan companion]649-his companion drew back ; [he]649-his companion [himself]649-his companion uttered a cry and wrenched at [his]649-his companion foot . [Wogan]109-wogan with [his]109-wogan left hand drew [his]109-wogan sword from the scabbard , and with the same movement passed it through [[his]109-wogan opponent]933-his opponent 's body . [The man]365-the man stood swaying , pinned there by [his]365-the man foot and held erect . Then [he]365-the man made one desperate lunge , fell forward across the barricade , and hung there . [Wogan]109-wogan parried the lunge ; the sword fell from [the man]365-the man 's hand and clattered onto the floor within the barricade . [Wogan]109-wogan stamped upon it with [his]109-wogan heel and snapped the blade . [He]109-wogan had still [two opponents]1061-two opponents ; and as [they]1061-two opponents advanced again [he]109-wogan suddenly sprung onto the edge of the table , gave one sweeping cut in a circle with [his]109-wogan sword , and darted across [the room]317-the room . [The two men]462-the two men gave ground ; [Wogan]109-wogan passed between [them]462-the two men . Before [they]1061-two opponents could strike at [his]109-wogan back [he]109-wogan was facing [them]1061-two opponents again . [He]109-wogan had no longer [[his]109-wogan barricade]1064-his barricade , but on the other hand [his]109-wogan shoulders were against the door . [The swordsman]1065-the swordsman crossed blades with [him]109-wogan , and at the first pass [Wogan]109-wogan realised with dismay that [[his]109-wogan enemy]630-his enemy was [a swordsman in knowledge as well as in the possession of the weapon]1067-a swordsman in knowledge as well as in the possession of the weapon . [He]630-his enemy had [a fencer]1068-a fencer 's suppleness of wrist and balance of body ; [he]630-his enemy pressed [Wogan]109-wogan hard and without flurry . The blade of [his]630-his enemy sword made glittering rings about [Wogan]109-wogan 's , and the point struck at [his]630-his enemy breast like an adder . [Wogan]109-wogan was engaged with [his]109-wogan equal if not with [his]109-wogan better . [He]109-wogan was fighting for [his]109-wogan life with [one man]3159-one man , and [he]109-wogan would have to fight for it with two , nay , with three . For over [[his]109-wogan opponent]933-his opponent 's shoulder [he]109-wogan saw [his]109-wogan first polite antagonist cross to the table and pick up from the ground the broken sword . One small consolation [Wogan]109-wogan had ; [the fellow]3410-the fellow picked it up with [his]3410-the fellow left hand , [his]3410-the fellow right elbow was still useless . But even that consolation lasted [him]109-wogan for no long time , for out of the tail of [his]109-wogan eye [he]109-wogan could see [the big fellow]1072-the big fellow creeping up with [his]1072-the big fellow stick raised along the wall at [his]1072-the big fellow right . [Wogan]109-wogan suddenly pressed upon [[his]109-wogan opponent]933-his opponent , delivering thrust upon thrust , and forced [him]933-his opponent to give ground . As [the swordsman]1065-the swordsman drew back , [Wogan]109-wogan swept [his]109-wogan weapon round and slashed at [the man upon [his]109-wogan right]1075-the man upon his right . But the stroke was wide of its mark , and [the big man]1076-the big man struck at the sword with [his]1072-the big fellow stick , struck with all [his]1072-the big fellow might , so that [Wogan]109-wogan 's arm tingled from the wrist to the shoulder . That , however , was the least part of the damage the stick did . It broke [Wogan]109-wogan 's sword short off at the hilt . [Both men]1077-both men gave a cry of delight . [Wogan]109-wogan dropped the hilt . " [I]109-wogan have a loaded pistol , [[my]109-wogan friends]3416-my friends ; [you]3416-my friends have forgotten that , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried , and plucked the pistol from [his]109-wogan belt . At the same moment [he]109-wogan felt behind [him]109-wogan with [his]109-wogan left hand for the knob of the door . [He]109-wogan fired at [the swordsman]1065-the swordsman and [his]109-wogan pistol missed , [he]109-wogan flung it at [the man with the stick]1079-the man with the stick , and as [he]109-wogan flung it [he]109-wogan sprang to the right , threw open the door , darted into [the passage]497-the passage , and slammed the door to . It was the work of a second . [The men]1081-the men sprang at [him]109-wogan as [he]109-wogan opened the door ; as [he]109-wogan slammed it close a sword - point pierced the thin panel and bit like a searing iron into [his]109-wogan shoulder . [Wogan]109-wogan uttered a cry ; [he]109-wogan heard an answering shout in [the room]317-the room , [he]109-wogan clung to the handle , setting [his]109-wogan foot against the wall , and was then stabbed in the back . For [[his]109-wogan host]838-his host was waiting for [him]109-wogan in [the passage]497-the passage . [Wogan]109-wogan dropped the door - handle and turned . That last blow had thrown [him]109-wogan into a violent rage . Possessed by rage , [he]109-wogan was no longer conscious of wounds or danger ; [he]109-wogan was conscious only of superhuman strength . The knife was already lifted to strike again . [Wogan]109-wogan seized the wrist which held the knife , grappled with [the innkeeper]979-the innkeeper , and caught [him]979-the innkeeper about the body . The door of [the room]317-the room , now behind [him]109-wogan , was flung violently open . [Wogan]109-wogan , who was wrought to a frenzy , lifted up [the man [he]109-wogan wrestled with]1087-the man he wrestled with , and swinging round hurled [him]1087-the man he wrestled with headlong through the doorway . [The three men]1088-the three men were already on the threshold . The new missile bounded against [them]1088-the three men , tumbled [them]1088-the three men one against the other , and knocked [them]1088-the three men sprawling and struggling on the floor . [Wogan]109-wogan burst into a laugh of exultation ; [he]109-wogan saw [[his]109-wogan most dangerous enemy]1089-his most dangerous enemy striving to disentangle [himself]109-wogan and [his]109-wogan sword . " Aha , [[my]109-wogan friend]3085-my friend , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried , " [you]3085-my friend handle a sword very prettily , but [I]109-wogan am [the better man]3454-the better man at cock - shies . "[109-wogan] And shutting the door to be ran down [the passage]497-the passage into [the road]228-the road . [He]109-wogan had seen [a house]3268-a house that afternoon with a high garden wall about [it]3268-a house a quarter of a mile away . [Wogan]109-wogan ran towards [it]3268-a house . The mist was still thick , but [he]109-wogan now began to feel [his]109-wogan strength failing . [He]109-wogan was wounded in the shoulder , [he]109-wogan was stabbed in the back , and from both wounds the blood was flowing warm . Moreover , [he]109-wogan looked backwards once over [his]109-wogan shoulder and saw a lantern dancing in [the road]228-the road . [He]109-wogan kept doggedly running , though [his]109-wogan pace slackened ; [he]109-wogan heard a shout and an answering shout behind [him]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan stumbled onto [his]109-wogan knees , picked [himself]109-wogan up , and staggered on , labouring [his]109-wogan breath , dizzy . [He]109-wogan stumbled again and fell , but as [he]109-wogan fell [he]109-wogan struck against the sharp corner of the wall . If [he]109-wogan could find an entrance into [the garden beyond that wall]1094-the garden beyond that wall ! [He]109-wogan turned off [the road]228-the road to the left and ran across [a field]1096-a field , keeping close along the side of the wall . [He]109-wogan came to another corner and turned to the right . As [he]109-wogan turned [he]109-wogan heard voices in [the road]228-the road . [The pursuers]1098-the pursuers had stopped and were searching with the lantern for traces of [his]109-wogan passage . [He]109-wogan ran along the back of the wall , feeling for a projection , a tree , anything which would enable [him]109-wogan to climb it . The wall was smooth , and though the branches of trees swung and creaked above [his]109-wogan head , their stems grew in the garden upon the other side . [He]109-wogan was pouring with sweat , [his]109-wogan breath whistled , in [his]109-wogan ears [he]109-wogan had the sound of innumerable armies marching across [the earth]3142-the earth , but [he]109-wogan stumbled on . And at last , though [his]109-wogan right side brushed against the wall , [he]109-wogan none the less struck against it also with [his]109-wogan chest . [He]109-wogan was too dazed for the moment to understand what had happened ; all the breath [he]109-wogan had left was knocked clean out of [his]109-wogan body ; [he]109-wogan dropped in a huddle on the ground . In a little [he]109-wogan recovered [his]109-wogan breath ; [he]109-wogan listened and could no longer hear any sound of voices ; [he]109-wogan began to consider . [He]109-wogan reached a hand out in front of [him]109-wogan and touched the wall ; [he]109-wogan reached out a hand to the right of [him]109-wogan and touched the wall again . The wall projected then abruptly and made a right angle . Now [Wogan]109-wogan had spent [his]109-wogan boyhood at [Rathcoffey]43-rathcoffey among [cliffs and rocks]1100-cliffs and rocks . This wall , [he]109-wogan reflected , could not be more than twelve feet high . Would [his]109-wogan strength last out ? [He]109-wogan came to the conclusion that it must . [He]109-wogan took off [his]109-wogan heavy boots and flung them one by one over the wall . Then [he]109-wogan pulled off [his]109-wogan coat at the cost of some pain and an added weakness , for the coat was stuck to [his]109-wogan wounds and had roughly staunched them . [He]109-wogan could feel the blood again soaking [his]109-wogan shirt . There was all the more need , then , for hurry . [He]109-wogan stood up , jammed [his]109-wogan back into the angle of the wall , stretched out [his]109-wogan arms on each side , pressing with [his]109-wogan elbows and hands , and then bending [his]109-wogan knees crossed [his]109-wogan legs tailor fashion , and set the soles of [his]109-wogan stockinged feet firmly against the bricks on each side . [He]109-wogan was thus seated as it were upon nothing , but retaining [his]109-wogan position by the pressure of [his]109-wogan arms and feet and [his]109-wogan whole body . Still retaining this position , very slowly , very laboriously , [he]109-wogan worked [himself]109-wogan up the angle , stopping now and then to regain [his]109-wogan breath , now and then slipping back an inch . But [he]109-wogan mounted towards the top , and after a while the back of [his]109-wogan head no longer touched the bricks . [His]109-wogan head was above the coping of the wall . It was at this moment that [he]109-wogan saw the lantern again , just at the corner where [he]109-wogan had turned . The lantern advanced slowly ; it was now held aloft , now close to the ground . [Wogan]109-wogan was very glad [he]109-wogan had thrown [his]109-wogan boots and coat into [the garden]413-the garden . [He]109-wogan made a few last desperate struggles ; [he]109-wogan could now place the palms of [his]109-wogan hands behind [him]109-wogan upon the coping , and [he]109-wogan hoisted [himself]109-wogan up and sat on the wall . The lantern was nearer to [him]109-wogan ; [he]109-wogan lay flat upon [his]109-wogan face on the coping , and then lowering [himself]109-wogan upon [the garden]413-the garden side to the full length of [his]109-wogan arms , [he]109-wogan let go . [He]109-wogan fell into a litter of dead leaves , very soft and comfortable . [He]109-wogan would not have exchanged them at that moment for [[the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's own bed]1104-the emperor 's own bed . [He]109-wogan lay upon [his]109-wogan back and saw the dark branches above [his]109-wogan head grow bright and green . [[His]109-wogan pursuers]1105-his pursuers were flashing [their]1105-his pursuers lantern on the other side ; there was only the thickness of the wall between [him]109-wogan and [them]1105-his pursuers . [He]109-wogan could even hear [them]1105-his pursuers whispering and the brushing of [their]1105-his pursuers feet . [He]109-wogan lay still as a mouse ; and then the earth heaved up and fell away altogether beneath [him]109-wogan . [Wogan]109-wogan had fainted . It was still night when [Wogan]109-wogan opened [his]109-wogan eyes , but the night was now clear of mist . There was no moon , however , to give [him]109-wogan a guess at the hour . [He]109-wogan lay upon [his]109-wogan back among the dead leaves , and looking upwards at the stars , caught as it seemed in a lattice - work of branches , floated back into consciousness . [He]109-wogan moved , and the movement turned [him]109-wogan sick with pain . The knowledge of [his]109-wogan wounds came to [him]109-wogan and brought with it a clear recollection of the last three nights . The ever - widening black strip in the door on the first night , the clutch at [his]109-wogan throat and the leap from the cupboard on the second , the silent watching of those five pairs of eyes on the third , and the lackey with the knife in [his]109-wogan breast hopping with both feet horribly across the floor,—the horror of these recollections swept in upon [him]109-wogan and changed [him]109-wogan from [a man]235-a man into [a timorous child]1107-a timorous child . [He]109-wogan lay and shuddered until in every creak of the branches [he]109-wogan heard the whisper of [an enemy]1108-an enemy , in every flutter of leaves across [the lawn]1109-the lawn a stealthy footstep , and behind every tree - stem [he]109-wogan caught the flap of a cloak . Stiff and sore , [he]109-wogan raised [himself]109-wogan from the ground , [he]109-wogan groped for [his]109-wogan boots and coat , and putting them on moved cautiously through the trees , supporting [himself]109-wogan from stem to stem . [He]109-wogan came to the borders of [a wide , smooth lawn]1110-a wide , smooth lawn , and on the farther side stood [the house,—a long , two - storeyed house with [level tiers of windows stretching to the right and the left]1112-level tiers of windows stretching to the right and the left , and a bowed tower in the middle]1111-the house,—a long , two - storeyed house with level tiers of windows stretching to the right and the left , and a bowed tower in the middle . Through one of the windows in the ground - floor [Wogan]109-wogan saw the spark of a lamp , and about that window a fan of yellow light was spread upon [the lawn]1109-the lawn . [Wogan]109-wogan at this moment felt in great need of companionship . [He]109-wogan stole across [the lawn]1109-the lawn and looked into [the room]317-the room . [An old gentleman with a delicate face , who wore [his]1116-an old gentleman with a delicate face , who wore his own white hair , was bending over a book at a desk own white hair , was bending over a book at a desk]1116-an old gentleman with a delicate face , who wore his own white hair , was bending over a book at a desk . [The room]317-the room was warmly furnished , the door of the stove stood open , and [Wogan]109-wogan could see the logs blazing merrily . A chill wind swept across [the lawn]1109-the lawn , very drear and ghostly . [Wogan]109-wogan crept closer to the window . A great boar - hound rose at [the old man]737-the old man 's feet and growled ; then [the old man]737-the old man rose , and crossing to the window pressed [his]737-the old man face against the panes with [his]737-the old man hands curved about [his]737-the old man eyes . [Wogan]109-wogan stepped forward and stood within the fan of light , spreading out [his]109-wogan arms to show that [he]109-wogan came as a supplicant and with no ill intent . [The old man]737-the old man , with a word to [his]737-the old man hound , opened the window . " Who is it ? "[737-the old man] [he]737-the old man asked , and with a thrill not of fear but of expectation in [his]737-the old man voice . " [A man wounded and in sore straits]3455-a man wounded and in sore straits for [his]109-wogan life , who would gladly sit for a few minutes by [your]737-the old man fire before [he]109-wogan goes upon [his]109-wogan way . "[737-the old man] [The old man]737-the old man stood aside , and [Wogan]109-wogan entered [the room]317-the room . [He]109-wogan was spattered from head to foot with mud , [his]109-wogan clothes were torn , [his]109-wogan eyes sunken , [his]109-wogan face was of a ghastly pallor and marked with blood . " [I]109-wogan am [the Chevalier Warner]129-chevalier , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , " [a gentleman of [Ireland]30-ireland]3456-a gentleman of ireland . [You]737-the old man will pardon [me]109-wogan . But [I]109-wogan have gone through so much these last three nights that [I]109-wogan can barely stand ; "[109-wogan] and dropping into a chair [he]109-wogan dragged [it]1124-it up to the door of the stove , and crouched there shivering . [The old man]737-the old man closed the window . " [I]737-the old man am [Count Otto von Ahlen]153-count otto , and in [[my]737-the old man house]3457-my house [you]109-wogan are safe as [you]109-wogan are welcome . "[737-the old man] [He]737-the old man went to a sideboard , and filling a glass carried it to [Wogan]109-wogan . The liquor was brandy . [Wogan]109-wogan drank it as though it had been so much water . [He]109-wogan was in that condition of fatigue when the most extraordinary events seem altogether commonplace and natural . But as [he]109-wogan felt the spirit warming [his]109-wogan blood , [he]109-wogan became aware of the great difference between [his]109-wogan battered appearance and that of [the old gentleman with the rich dress and the white linen who stooped so hospitably above [him]109-wogan]1126-the old gentleman with the rich dress and the white linen who stooped so hospitably above him , and [he]109-wogan began to wonder at the readiness of the hospitality . [Wogan]109-wogan might have been [a thief]376-a thief , [a murderer]1128-a murderer , for all [Count Otto]153-count otto knew . Yet [the Count]1129-the count , with no other protection than [his]1129-the count dog , had opened [his]1129-the count window , and at that late hour of the night had welcomed [him]109-wogan without a word of a question . " [Sir]3070-sir , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , " [my]109-wogan visit is the most unceremonious thing in [the world]245-the world . [I]109-wogan plump in upon [you]3070-sir in the dark of the morning , as [I]109-wogan take it to be , and disturb [you]3070-sir at [your]3070-sir books without so much as knocking at the door . "[109-wogan] " It is as well [you]109-wogan did not knock at the door , "[1129-the count] returned [the Count]1129-the count , " for [[my]1129-the count servants]3460-my servants are long since in bed , and [your]109-wogan knock would very likely have reached neither [their]3460-my servants ears nor [mine]1129-the count . "[1129-the count] And [he]1129-the count drew up a chair and sat down opposite to [Wogan]109-wogan , bending forward with [his]1129-the count hands upon [his]1129-the count knees . The firelight played upon [his]1129-the count pale , indoor face , and it seemed to [Wogan]109-wogan that [he]109-wogan regarded [[his]109-wogan guest]841-his guest with a certain wistfulness . [Wogan]109-wogan spoke [his]109-wogan thought aloud , — " Yet [I]109-wogan might be [any hedgerow rascal]3461-any hedgerow rascal with a taste for [your]1129-the count plate , and no particular scruples as to a life or two lying in the way of its gratification . "[109-wogan] [The Count]1129-the count smiled . " [Your]109-wogan visit is not so unexampled as [you]109-wogan are inclined to think . Nearly thirty years ago [a young man]3462-a young man as [you]109-wogan are came in just such a plight as [you]109-wogan and stood outside this window at two o'clock of a dark morning . Even so early in [my]1129-the count life [I]1129-the count was at [my]1129-the count books , "[1129-the count] and [he]1129-the count smiled rather sadly . " [I]1129-the count let [him]3462-a young man in and [he]3462-a young man talked to [me]1129-the count for an hour of matters strange and dreamlike , and enviable to [me]1129-the count . [I]1129-the count shall be glad , therefore , to hear [your]109-wogan story if [you]109-wogan have a mind to tell it [me]1129-the count . [The young man who came upon that other night]3465-the young man who came upon that other night was [Count Philip Christopher von Königsmarck]154-königsmarck . "[1129-the count] [Wogan]109-wogan started at the mention of this name . "[109-wogan] [The old man]737-the old man nodded , and taking a lamp from a table by the door went out of [the room]317-the room . [Wogan]109-wogan remained alone ; the dog nuzzled at [his]109-wogan hand ; but it seemed to [Wogan]109-wogan that there was another in [the room]317-the room besides [himself]109-wogan and the dog . The sleeplessness and tension of the last few days , the fatigue of [his]109-wogan arduous journey , the fever of [his]109-wogan wounds , no doubt , had their effect upon [him]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan felt that [Königsmarck]154-königsmarck was at [his]109-wogan side ; [his]109-wogan eyes could almost discern [a shadowy and beautiful figure]1140-a shadowy and beautiful figure ; [his]109-wogan ears could almost hear a musical vibrating voice . And the voice warned him,—in some strange unaccountable way the voice warned and menaced [him]109-wogan . " [I]109-wogan fought , [I]109-wogan climbed that wall , [I]109-wogan crossed [the lawn]1109-the lawn , [I]109-wogan took refuge here for love of [a queen]3473-a queen . For love of [a queen]3473-a queen all [my]109-wogan short life [I]109-wogan lived . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan had once seen [the lonely castle of [Ahlden]44-ahlden where [that queen]1142-that queen was imprisoned]1141-the lonely castle of ahlden where that queen was imprisoned ; [he]109-wogan had once caught a glimpse of [her]1142-that queen driving in the dusk across [the heath]1143-the heath surrounded by [[her]1142-that queen guards]1144-her guards with [their]1144-her guards flashing swords . [He]109-wogan sat chilled with apprehensions and forebodings . They crowded in upon [his]109-wogan mind all the more terrible because [he]109-wogan could not translate them into definite perils which beyond this and that corner of [his]109-wogan life might await [him]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan was the victim of illusions , [he]109-wogan assured [himself]109-wogan , at which to - morrow safe in [Schlestadt]31-schlestadt [he]109-wogan would laugh . But to - night the illusions were real . [Königsmarck]154-königsmarck was with [him]109-wogan . [Königsmarck]154-königsmarck was by some mysterious alchemy becoming incorporate with [him]109-wogan . The voice which spoke and warned and menaced was as much [his]109-wogan as [Königsmarck]154-königsmarck 's . [The old Count]1145-the old count opened the door and heard [Wogan]109-wogan muttering to [himself]109-wogan as [he]109-wogan crouched over the fire . [The Count]1129-the count carried a basin of water in [his]1129-the count hand and a sponge and some linen . [He]1129-the count insisted upon washing [Wogan]109-wogan 's wounds and dressing them in a simple way . " They are not deep , "[1129-the count] [he]1129-the count said ; " a few days ' rest and [a clever surgeon]3477-a clever surgeon will restore [you]109-wogan . "[1129-the count] [He]1129-the count went from [the room]317-the room again and brought back a tray , on which were the remains of a pie , a loaf of bread , and some fruit . "[1129-the count] [Wogan]109-wogan could have heard no words more distressing to [him]109-wogan at this moment . " Oh , stop , [sir]3070-sir . [I]109-wogan pray [you]3070-sir stop ! "[109-wogan] And as [he]109-wogan ate [he]109-wogan told [his]109-wogan story , omitting the precise object of [his]109-wogan journey , the nature of the letter which [he]109-wogan had burned , and any name which might give a clue to the secret of [his]109-wogan enterprise . [The Count Otto]153-count otto listened with [his]153-count otto eyes as well as [his]153-count otto ears ; [he]153-count otto hung upon the words , shuddering at each danger that sprang upon [Wogan]109-wogan , exclaiming in wonder at the shift by which [he]109-wogan escaped from it , and at times [he]109-wogan looked over towards [his]109-wogan books with a glance of veritable dislike . " To feel the blood run hot in one 's veins , to be [bedfellows with peril]3484-bedfellows with peril , to go gallantly forward hand in hand with endeavour , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan mused and broke off . " See , [I]109-wogan own a sword , being [a gentleman]945-a gentleman .
