[The Prince]588-the prince grumbled for a little , since the evening was growing stormy and wild , but there was no remedy . [He]588-the prince could not dispute the matter , for [he]588-the prince was shown [the Countess]599-the countess 's berlin waiting ready for [her]599-the countess return . [A servant of [the Count]1129-the count 's household]1527-a servant of the count 's household also had been left behind at [Nazareth]57-nazareth to retain [the room]317-the room , and [this man]1530-this man , while using all proper civilities , refused to give up possession . [The Prince]588-the prince had no acquaintance with [the officers of [[Dillon]144-dillon 's Irish regiment]3297-dillon 's irish regiment]1532-the officers of dillon 's irish regiment , so that [he]588-the prince had no single suspicion that [Captain Misset]177-captain misset was [the servant]753-the servant . [He]588-the prince drove on for another stage , where [he]588-the prince found [a lodging]975-a lodging . Meanwhile [the hired carriage]1536-the hired carriage rolled into [Innspruck]17-innspruck , and a storm of extraordinary violence burst over [the country]847-the country . In fact , just about the time when [the Prince]588-the prince 's horses were being unharnessed from [his]588-the prince carriage on [the heights of [Mount Brenner]58-mount brenner]1539-the heights of mount brenner , [the hired carriage]1536-the hired carriage stopped before [a little inn under the town wall of [Innspruck]17-innspruck]1541-a little inn under the town wall of innspruck hard by [the bridge]1542-the bridge . And half an hour later , when [the Prince]588-the prince was sitting down to [his]588-the prince supper before a blazing fire and thanking [his]588-the prince stars that on so gusty and wild a night [he]588-the prince had a stout roof above [his]588-the prince head , [a man]235-a man and [a woman]234-a woman came out from [the little tavern under the town wall]1546-the little tavern under the town wall and disappeared into the darkness . [They]1547-they had [the streets]399-the streets to [themselves]1547-they , for that night [the city]1549-the city was a whirlpool of the winds . [Each separate chasm in [the encircling hills]1551-the encircling hills]1550-each separate chasm in the encircling hills was a mouth to discharge a separate blast . The winds swept down into [the hollow]1552-the hollow and charged in a riotous combat about [the squares and lanes]1553-the squares and lanes ; at each corner was [an ambuscade]1554-an ambuscade , and everywhere [they]1547-they clashed with artilleries of hail and sleet . [The man]365-the man and [woman]3693-woman staggered hand in hand and floundered in the deep snow . [They]1547-they were soaked to the skin , frozen by the cold , and whipped by the stinging hail . Though [they]1547-they bent [their]1547-they heads and bodies , though [they]1547-they clung hand in hand , though [they]1547-they struggled with all [their]1547-they strength , there were times when [they]1547-they could not advance a foot and must needs wait for a lull in the shelter of [a porch]1557-a porch . At such times [the man]365-the man would perhaps quote a line of Virgil about the cave of the winds , and [the woman]308-the woman curse like [a grenadier]1560-a grenadier . [They]1547-they , however , were not [the only people who were distressed by the storm]1561-the only people who were distressed by the storm . Outside [the villa in which [the Princess]3107-the princess was imprisoned]1562-the villa in which the princess was imprisoned stood [the two sentinels]1564-the two sentinels , one beneath the window , the other before the door . There were icicles upon [their]1564-the two sentinels beards ; [they]1564-the two sentinels were so shrouded in white they had the look of [snow men built by [schoolboys]1566-schoolboys]1565-snow men built by schoolboys . [Their]1564-the two sentinels coats of frieze could not keep out the searching sleet , nor [their]1564-the two sentinels caps protect [their]1564-the two sentinels ears from the intolerable cold . [Their]1564-the two sentinels hands were so numbed [they]1564-the two sentinels could not feel the muskets [they]1564-the two sentinels held . [The sentinel before the door]1567-the sentinel before the door suffered the most , for whereas [[his]365-the man companion]649-his companion beneath the window had nothing but the house wall before [his]365-the man eyes , [he]365-the man , on [his]365-the man part , could see on the other side of [the alley of trees]1569-the alley of trees the red blinds of " [The White Chamois]59-the white chamois , "[114-the chevalier] [that inn which [the Chevalier de St. George]114-the chevalier had mentioned to [Charles Wogan]126-wogan]1570-that inn which the chevalier de st. george had mentioned to charles wogan . The red blinds shone very cheery and comfortable upon that stormy night . [The sentinel]541-the sentinel envied [the men]1081-the men gathered in the warmth and light behind [them]1564-the two sentinels , and cursed [his]541-the sentinel own miserable lot as heartily as [the woman in [the porch]1574-the porch]1573-the woman in the porch did [hers]1573-the woman in the porch . The red blinds made it unendurable . [He]365-the man left [his]365-the man post and joined [[his]365-the man companion]649-his companion . " [Rudolf]178-rudolf , "[365-the man] [he]365-the man said , bawling into [his]365-the man ear , " come with [me]365-the man ! [Our]1576-the two sentries birds will not fly away to - night . "[365-the man] [The two sentries]1576-the two sentries came to the front of [the house]3196-the house and stared at the red - litten blinds . " What a night ! "[178-rudolf] cried [Rudolf]178-rudolf . " [Not a citizen]3835-not a citizen would thrust [his]3835-not a citizen nose out of doors . "[178-rudolf] " Not [even [the little Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux 's sweetheart]3836-even the little chateaudoux 's sweetheart , "[260-the other] replied [the other]260-the other , with a grin . [They]1576-the two sentries stared again at the red blinds , and in a lull of the wind a clock struck nine . " There is an hour before [the magistrate]3207-the magistrate comes , "[178-rudolf] said [Rudolf]178-rudolf . " [You]178-rudolf take that hour , "[649-his companion] said [[his]365-the man companion]649-his companion ; " [I]649-his companion will have the hour after [the magistrate]3207-the magistrate has gone . "[649-his companion] [Rudolf]178-rudolf ran across to [the inn]231-the inn . [The sentinel at the door]1581-the sentinel at the door remained behind . [Both men]1077-both men were pleased,—Rudolf because [he]365-the man had [his]365-the man hour immediately , [[his]365-the man fellow - soldier]1583-his fellow - soldier because once [the magistrate]3207-the magistrate had come and gone , [he]365-the man would take as long as [he]365-the man pleased . Meanwhile [the man]365-the man and [woman hand in hand]1586-woman hand in hand drew nearer to [the villa]526-the villa , but very slowly . For , apart from the weather 's hindrances , [the woman]308-the woman 's anger had grown . [She]308-the woman stopped , [she]308-the woman fell down when there was no need to fall , [she]308-the woman wept , [she]308-the woman struggled to free [her]308-the woman hand , and finally , when [they]1077-both men had taken shelter beneath [a portico]1589-a portico , [she]308-the woman sank down on the stone steps , and with many oaths and many tears refused to budge a foot . Strangely enough , it was not so much the inclemency of the night or the danger of the enterprise which provoked this obstinacy , as some outrage and dishonour to [her]308-the woman figure . " [You]365-the man may talk all night , "[308-the woman] [she]308-the woman cried between [her]308-the woman sobs , " about [O'Toole]158-o'toole and [[his]158-o'toole beautiful German]3839-his beautiful german . [They]1077-both men can go hang for [me]308-the woman ! [I]308-the woman am only [a servant]1509-a servant , [I]308-the woman know . [I]308-the woman am poor , [I]308-the woman admit it . But poverty is n't a crime . It gives [no one]356-no one the right to make [a dwarf of [me]308-the woman]3842-a dwarf of me . No , no!"—this[308-the woman] as [Wogan]126-wogan bent down to lift [her]308-the woman from the ground—"plague on [you]3843-you all ! [I]126-wogan will sit here and die ; and when [I]126-wogan am found frozen and dead perhaps [you]3843-you will be sorry for [your]3843-you cruelty to [a poor girl who wanted nothing better than to serve [you]3843-you]3844-a poor girl who wanted nothing better than to serve you . "[126-wogan] Here [Jenny]161-jenny was so moved by the piteousness of [her]161-jenny fate that [her]161-jenny tears broke out again . [She]161-jenny wept loudly . [Wogan]126-wogan was in an extremity of alarm lest [someone]690-someone should pass , or [the people of [the house]3196-the house]1591-the people of the house be aroused . [He]126-wogan tried most tenderly to comfort [her]161-jenny . [She]161-jenny would have none of the consolations . [He]126-wogan took [her]161-jenny in [his]126-wogan arms and raised [her]161-jenny to [her]161-jenny feet . [She]161-jenny swore more loudly than [she]161-jenny had wept , [she]161-jenny kicked at [his]126-wogan legs , [she]161-jenny struck at [his]126-wogan head with [her]161-jenny fist . In another moment [she]161-jenny would surely have cried murder . [Wogan]126-wogan had to let [her]161-jenny sink back upon the steps , where [she]161-jenny fell to whimpering . " [I]126-wogan am not beautiful , [I]126-wogan know ; [I]126-wogan never boasted that [I]126-wogan was ; but [I]126-wogan have a figure and limbs that [a painter]3845-a painter would die to paint . And what do [you]3846-you make of [me]126-wogan ? A maggot , a thing all body like a nasty bear . Oh , curse the day that [I]126-wogan set out with [such tyrants]3847-such tyrants ! A pretty figure of fun [I]126-wogan should make before [[your]3846-you beautiful German]3848-your beautiful german , covered with mud to the knees . No , [you]3846-you shall hang [me]126-wogan first ! Why could n't [O'Toole]158-o'toole do [his]158-o'toole own work , [the ninny]3849-the ninny , [I]126-wogan hate [him]158-o'toole ! [He]158-o'toole 's tall enough , the great donkey ; but no , [I]126-wogan must do it , who am shorter , and even then not short enough for [him]158-o'toole and [you]3846-you , but [you]3846-you must drag [me]126-wogan through the dirt without heels ! "[126-wogan] [Wogan]126-wogan let [her]1593-her run on ; [he]126-wogan was at [his]126-wogan wits ' end what to do . All this turmoil , these tears , these oaths and blows , came from nothing more serious than this , that [Jenny]161-jenny , to make [her]161-jenny height less remarkable , must wear no heels . It was ludicrous , it was absurd , but none the less the whole expedition , carried to the very point of completion , must fail , utterly and irretrievably fail , because [Jenny]161-jenny would not for one day go without [her]161-jenny heels . [The Princess]3107-the princess must remain in [[her]3107-the princess prison at [Innspruck]17-innspruck]1595-her prison at innspruck ; [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier must lose [[his]348-the chevalier wife]589-his wife ; the exertions of [Wogan]126-wogan and [[his]126-wogan friends]989-his friends , [their]1599-their risks , [their]1599-their ingenuity , must bear no fruit because [Jenny]161-jenny would not show [herself]161-jenny three inches short of [her]161-jenny ordinary height . [O'Toole]158-o'toole had warned [him]126-wogan there would be a difficulty ; but that the difficulty should become an absolute hindrance , should spoil a scheme of so much consequence , that was inconceivable . Yet there was [Jenny]161-jenny sobbing [her]161-jenny heart out on the steps not half a mile from [the villa]526-the villa ; the minutes were passing ; the inconceivable thing was true . [Wogan]126-wogan could have torn [his]126-wogan hair in the rage of [his]126-wogan despair . [He]126-wogan could have laughed out loudly and passionately until even on that stormy night [he]126-wogan brought [the guard]1601-the guard . [He]126-wogan thought of the perils [he]126-wogan had run , the difficulties [he]126-wogan had surmounted . [He]126-wogan had outwitted [the Countess de Berg]141-the countess of berg and [Lady Featherstone]134-lady featherstone , [he]126-wogan had persuaded [the reluctant Prince Sobieski]128-prince sobieski , [he]126-wogan had foiled [[his]126-wogan enemies]699-his enemies on [the road to [Schlestadt]31-schlestadt]1603-the road to schlestadt , [he]126-wogan had made [his]126-wogan plans , [he]126-wogan had gathered [[his]126-wogan friends]989-his friends , [he]126-wogan had crept out with [them]989-his friends from [Strasbourg]32-strasbourg , yet in the end [they]989-his friends had come to [Innspruck]17-innspruck to be foiled because [Jenny]161-jenny would not go without [her]161-jenny heels . [Wogan]126-wogan could have wept like [Jenny]161-jenny . But [he]126-wogan did not . On the contrary , [he]126-wogan sat down by [her]161-jenny side on the steps and took [her]161-jenny hand , gentle as a sheep . " [You]161-jenny are in the right of it , [Jenny]161-jenny , "[126-wogan] said [he]126-wogan , in a most remorseful voice . [Jenny]161-jenny looked up . " Yes , "[126-wogan] [he]126-wogan continued . " [I]126-wogan was in the wrong . [O'Toole]158-o'toole is [the most selfish man in [the whole world]3851-the whole world]3850-the most selfish man in the whole world . Cowardly , too ! But there never was [a selfish man who was not at heart a bit of a coward]3852-a selfish man who was not at heart a bit of a coward . Sure enough , sooner or later the cowardice comes out . It is a preposterous thing that [O'Toole]158-o'toole should think that [you]161-jenny and [I]126-wogan are going to rescue [[his]158-o'toole heiress]3853-his heiress for [him]158-o'toole while [he]158-o'toole sits at [his]158-o'toole ease by the inn fire . No ; let [us]3854-us go back to [him]158-o'toole and tell [him]158-o'toole to [his]158-o'toole face [the selfish cowardly man [he]158-o'toole is]3855-the selfish cowardly man he is . "[126-wogan] It seemed , however , that [Jenny]161-jenny was not entirely pleased to hear [her]161-jenny own sentiments so frankly uttered by [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan . Besides , [he]109-wogan seemed to exaggerate them , for [she]161-jenny said with a little reluctance , " [I]161-jenny would not say that [he]158-o'toole was [a coward]3856-a coward . "[161-jenny] " But [I]109-wogan would , "[109-wogan] exclaimed [Wogan]109-wogan , hotly . " [Moreover]159-moreover , [I]109-wogan do . With all [my]109-wogan heart [I]109-wogan say it . [A great lubberly monster of a coward]3857-a great lubberly monster of a coward . [He]158-o'toole is envious , too , [Jenny]161-jenny . "[109-wogan] [Jenny]161-jenny had by this time stopped weeping . " Why envious ? "[161-jenny] [she]161-jenny asked with an accent of rebellion which was very much to [Wogan]109-wogan 's taste . " It 's as plain as the palm of [my]161-jenny hand . Why should [he]158-o'toole make [a dwarf of [you]161-jenny]3858-a dwarf of you , [Jenny?—for]179-jenny?—for it 's the truth [he]158-o'toole has done that ; [he]158-o'toole has made [a little dwarf out of [the finest girl in [the land]993-the land]3860-the finest girl in the land by robbing [her]3860-the finest girl in the land of [her]3860-the finest girl in the land heels]3859-a little dwarf out of the finest girl in the land by robbing her of her heels . "[161-jenny] [Jenny]161-jenny was on the point of interrupting with some indignation , but [Wogan]109-wogan would not listen to [her]161-jenny . " [A dwarf]3862-a dwarf , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan continued , " it was [your]161-jenny own word , [Jenny]161-jenny . [I]109-wogan could say nothing to comfort [you]161-jenny when [you]161-jenny spoke it , for it was so true and suitable an epithet . [A little dwarf [he]158-o'toole has made of [you]161-jenny]3863-a little dwarf he has made of you , all body and no legs like a bear , [a dwarf - bear]3864-a dwarf - bear , of course ; and why , if it is not that [he]158-o'toole envies [you]161-jenny [your]161-jenny figure and is jealous of it in a mean and discreditable way ? "[109-wogan] " But that would not have served , "[161-jenny] cried [Jenny]161-jenny . It was [her]161-jenny turn now to speak triumphantly . "[161-jenny] " [I]109-wogan had forgotten that , to be sure , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , meekly . [Jenny]161-jenny laughed derisively . "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , with a sneer . " A hundred guineas and a damask gown ! Three hundred guineas and a gown all lace and gold tags would not be enough . [The poor captain]3884-the poor captain shall have [one person in [the world]245-the world]3885-one person in the world , though [she]3885-one person in the world 's only [a servant]1509-a servant , to help [him]158-o'toole when [he]158-o'toole wants . "[161-jenny] [Thus Wogan]109-wogan won the victory . But [he]1605-he was most careful to conceal it . [He]1605-he walked by [her]161-jenny side humble as a whipped dog . If [he]1605-he had to point out the way , [he]1605-he did it with the most penitent air ; when [he]1605-he offered [his]1605-he hand to help [her]161-jenny over a snow - heap and [she]161-jenny struck it aside , [he]1605-he merely bowed [his]1605-he head as though [her]161-jenny contempt was well deserved . [He]1605-he even whispered in [her]161-jenny ear in a trembling voice , " [Jenny]161-jenny , [you]161-jenny will not say a word to [O'Toole]158-o'toole about the remarks [I]1605-he made of [him]109-wogan ? [He]109-wogan is [a strong , hasty man]3888-a strong , hasty man . [I]1605-he know not what might come of it . "[1605-he] [Jenny]161-jenny sneered and shrugged [her]161-jenny shoulders . [She]161-jenny would not speak to [Wogan]109-wogan any more , and so [they]1606-they came silently into [the avenue of trees between " [The White Chamois]59-the white chamois "[1605-he] and [the villa]526-the villa]1607-the avenue of trees between " the white chamois " and the villa . The windows in the front of [the villa]526-the villa were dark , and through the blinding snow - storm [Wogan]109-wogan could not have distinguished the position of [the house]3196-the house at all but for the red blinds of [the tavern]968-the tavern opposite which shone out upon the night and gave the snow falling before [them]1606-they a tinge of pink . [Wogan]109-wogan crept nearer to [the house]3196-the house and heard [the sentinel stamping in the snow]1613-the sentinel stamping in the snow . [He]109-wogan came back to [Jenny]161-jenny and pointed the sentinel out to [her]161-jenny . " Give [me]109-wogan a quarter of an hour so far as [you]161-jenny can judge . [The sentinel]541-the sentinel is prepared for [your]161-jenny coming , and if [he]541-the sentinel stops [you]161-jenny , [you]161-jenny must say ' [Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux ' in a whisper , and [he]541-the sentinel will understand . [You]161-jenny will find the door of [the house]3196-the house open and [a man]235-a man waiting for [you]161-jenny . "[109-wogan] [Jenny]161-jenny made no answer , but [Wogan]109-wogan was sure of [her]161-jenny now . [He]109-wogan left [her]161-jenny standing beneath the dripping trees and crept towards the side of [the house]3196-the house . [A sentry]1615-a sentry was posted beneath [her]161-jenny Highness 's windows , and through those windows [he]1615-a sentry had to climb . [He]109-wogan needed that quarter of an hour to wait for a suitable moment when [the sentry]538-the sentry would be at the far end of [[his]109-wogan beat]1617-his beat . But [that sentry]1618-that sentry was fuddling [himself]1618-that sentry with a vile spirit distilled from the gentian flower in the kitchen of " The White Chamois . "[1618-that sentry] [Wogan]109-wogan , creeping stealthily through the snow - storm , found the side of [the house]3196-the house unguarded . The windows on [the ground floor]1620-the ground floor were dark ; those on the first floor which lighted [[[her]161-jenny Highness]3138-her highness 's apartments]3618-her highness 's apartments were ablaze . [He]109-wogan noticed with a pang of dismay that one of those lighted windows was wide open to the storm . [He]109-wogan wondered whether it meant that [the Princess]3107-the princess had been removed to [another lodging]1624-another lodging . [He]109-wogan climbed on the sill of the lower window ; by the side of that window a stone pillar ran up the side of [the house]3196-the house to the windows on [the first floor]1626-the first floor . [Wogan]109-wogan had taken note of that pillar months back when [he]109-wogan was hawking chattels in [Innspruck]17-innspruck . [He]109-wogan set [his]109-wogan hands about it and got a grip with [his]109-wogan foot against the sash of the lower window . [He]109-wogan was just raising [himself]109-wogan when [he]109-wogan heard a noise above [him]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan dropped back to the ground and stood in the fixed attitude of [a sentinel]1627-a sentinel . A head appeared at the window , [a woman]234-a woman 's head . The light was behind , within [the room]317-the room , so that [Wogan]109-wogan could not see the face . But the shape of the head , its gracious poise upon the young shoulders , the curve of the neck , the bright hair drawn backwards from the brows,—here were marks [Wogan]109-wogan could not mistake . [They]1630-they had been present before [his]109-wogan eyes these many months . The head at the open window was the head of [the Princess]3107-the princess . [Wogan]109-wogan felt a thrill run through [his]109-wogan blood . To [a lover]1632-a lover the sight of [[his]109-wogan mistress]512-his mistress is always unexpected , though [he]109-wogan foreknows the very moment of [her]512-his mistress coming . To [Wogan]109-wogan the sight of [[his]109-wogan Queen]1634-his queen had the like effect . [He]109-wogan had not seen [her]1634-his queen since [he]109-wogan had left [Ohlau]12-ohlau two years before with [her]1634-his queen promise to marry [the Chevalier]114-the chevalier . It seemed to [him]109-wogan , though for this [he]109-wogan had lived and worked up early and down late for so long , a miraculous thing that [he]109-wogan should see [her]1634-his queen now . [She]1634-his queen leaned forward and peered downwards into [the lane]1635-the lane . The light streamed out , bathing [her]1634-his queen head and shoulders . [Wogan]109-wogan could see the snow fall upon [her]1634-his queen dark hair and whiten it ; it fell , too , upon [her]1634-his queen neck , but that it could not whiten . [She]1634-his queen leaned out into the darkness , and [Wogan]109-wogan set foot again upon the lower window - sill . At the same moment another head appeared beside [Clementina]116-clementina 's , and a sharp cry rang out , a cry of terror . Then both heads disappeared , and a heavy curtain swung across the window , shutting the light in . [Wogan]109-wogan remained motionless , [his]109-wogan heart sinking with alarm . Had that cry been heard ? Had the wind carried it to [the sentry at the door]1472-the sentry at the door ? [He]109-wogan waited , but no sound of running footsteps came to [his]109-wogan ears ; the cry had been lost in the storm . [He]109-wogan was now so near to success that dangers which a month ago would have seemed of small account showed most menacing and fatal . " It was [the Princess - mother who cried out]3894-the princess - mother who cried out , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan thought , and was reminded that the need of persuasions was not ended for the night with the conquest of [Jenny]161-jenny . [He]109-wogan had to convince [the Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother of [his]109-wogan authority without a line of [Prince Sobieski]128-prince sobieski 's writing to support [him]109-wogan ; [he]109-wogan had to overcome [her]1634-his queen timidity . But [he]109-wogan was prepared for the encounter ; [he]109-wogan had foreseen it , and had an argument ready for [the Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother , though [he]109-wogan would have preferred to wring [the old lady]1639-the old lady 's neck . [Her]1637-the princess - mother cry might spoil everything . However , it had not been heard , and since it had not been heard , [Wogan]109-wogan was disposed to forgive it . For the window was still open , and now that the curtain was drawn no ray of light escaped from [the room]317-the room to betray [the man who climbed into [it]317-the room]1641-the man who climbed into it . Meanwhile within [the room]317-the room [the Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother clung to [Clementina]116-clementina . The terror which [her]1637-the princess - mother sharp cry had expressed was visible in [her]1637-the princess - mother strained and startled face . [Her]1637-the princess - mother eyes , bright with terror , stared at the drawn curtain ; [she]1637-the princess - mother could not avert them ; [she]1637-the princess - mother still must gaze , fascinated by [her]1637-the princess - mother fears ; and [her]1637-the princess - mother dry , whispering lips were tremulous . " [Heaven]181-heaven have mercy ! "[1637-the princess - mother] [she]1637-the princess - mother whispered ; " shut the window ! Shut it fast ! "[1637-the princess - mother] and as [Clementina]116-clementina moved in surprise , [she]116-clementina clung the closer to [[her]116-clementina daughter]3589-her daughter . " No , do not leave [me]116-clementina ! Come away ! [Jesu]182-jesu ! here are [[we]3895-we alone,—two women]3896-we alone,—two women ! "[116-clementina] " No cause for fear ! [I]116-clementina saw [him]109-wogan — [the sentry]538-the sentry — [he]109-wogan is climbing up . Ah ! "[116-clementina] and again [her]116-clementina voice rose to a cry as [Wogan]109-wogan 's foot grated on the window - ledge . " Hush , [mother]3780-mother ! A cry will ruin [us]3900-us . "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina asked . " Can [you]1649-a man behind the curtain not guess ? "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina , incredulously . " It is so evident . "[116-clementina] [She]1637-the princess - mother heard [a man behind the curtain]1649-a man behind the curtain spring lightly from the window to the floor . " [[Your]1649-a man behind the curtain sentinel]3902-your sentinel is [the one man who has the right to rescue [me]1637-the princess - mother]3903-the one man who has the right to rescue me . " No , [[your]1637-the princess - mother Highness]3263-your highness , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " but [[the King]3089-the king 's servant]3908-the king 's servant . "[109-wogan] [The Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother dropped into a chair and looked at [[her]1637-the princess - mother visitor]1651-her visitor with despair . It was not [the sentinel]541-the sentinel , to be sure , but , on the other hand , it was [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan , whom [she]1637-the princess - mother knew for [a very insistent man with a great liking for [his]109-wogan own way]1653-a very insistent man with a great liking for his own way . [She]1637-the princess - mother drew little comfort from [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan 's coming . It seemed , too , that [he]109-wogan was not very welcome to [Clementina]116-clementina ; for [she]1637-the princess - mother drew back a step and in a voice which dropped and had a tremble of disappointment , " [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan , "[1637-the princess - mother] [she]1637-the princess - mother said , " [the King]3089-the king is well served ; "[1637-the princess - mother] and [she]1637-the princess - mother stood there without so much as offering [him]109-wogan [her]1637-the princess - mother hand . [Wogan]109-wogan had not counted on so cold a greeting , but [he]109-wogan understood the reason , and was not sure but what [he]109-wogan approved of it . After all , [she]1637-the princess - mother had encountered perils on [the King]3089-the king 's account ; [she]1637-the princess - mother had some sort of a justification to believe [the King]3089-the king would do the like for [her]1637-the princess - mother . It had not occurred to [him]109-wogan or indeed to [anyone]322-anyone before ; but now that [he]109-wogan saw [the chosen woman]337-the chosen woman so plainly wounded , [he]109-wogan felt a trifle hot against [[his]109-wogan King]326-his king for having disappointed [her]1637-the princess - mother . [He]109-wogan set [his]109-wogan wits to work to dispel the disappointment . " [[Your]1637-the princess - mother Highness]3263-your highness , the truth is there are great matters brewing in [Spain]18-spain . [[His]3089-the king Majesty]3911-his majesty was needed [there]3363-there most urgently . [He]3089-the king had to decide between [Innspruck]17-innspruck and [Cadiz]95-cadiz , and it seemed that [he]3089-the king would honour [your]1637-the princess - mother great confidence in [him]3089-the king and at the same time serve [you]1637-the princess - mother best — "[109-wogan] [Clementina]116-clementina would not allow [him]109-wogan to complete the sentence . [Her]116-clementina cheek flushed , and [she]116-clementina said quickly , — " [You]109-wogan are right , [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan . [The King]3089-the king is right . [Mine]3914-mine was [a girl]3881-a girl 's thought . [I]116-clementina am ashamed of it ; "[116-clementina] and [she]116-clementina frankly gave [him]109-wogan [her]116-clementina hand . [Wogan]109-wogan was fairly well pleased with [his]109-wogan apology for [[his]109-wogan King]326-his king . It was not quite the truth , no doubt , but it had spared [Clementina]116-clementina a trifle of humiliation , and had re - established [the King]3089-the king in [her]116-clementina thoughts . [He]109-wogan bent over [her]116-clementina hand and would have kissed it , but [she]116-clementina stopped [him]109-wogan . " No , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina , " an honest handclasp , if [you]109-wogan please ; for [no woman]3630-no woman can have ever lived who had [a truer friend]3917-a truer friend , "[116-clementina] and [Wogan]109-wogan , looking into [her]116-clementina frank eyes , was not , after all , nearly so well pleased with the untruth [he]109-wogan had told [her]116-clementina . [She]116-clementina was [an uncomfortable woman to go about with shifts and contrivances]1661-an uncomfortable woman to go about with shifts and contrivances . [Her]116-clementina open face , with its broad forehead and the clear , steady eyes of darkest blue , claimed truth as a prerogative . [I]116-clementina was attacked on [my]116-clementina way from [Ohlau]12-ohlau . [The room]317-the room was small ; [I]116-clementina could not run away ; neither had [I]116-clementina much space wherein to resist [five men]3433-five men . "[1637-the princess - mother] As [Wogan]109-wogan ended , [the mother]569-the mother rose from [her]569-the mother chair . At all events [she]569-the mother flung the curtain aside ; the snow drifted through the open window onto the floor ; outside the open window it was falling like a cascade , and the air was icy . " [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan , "[569-the mother] [she]569-the mother said , stubbornly working [herself]569-the mother into a heat to make more sure of [her]569-the mother resolution , " [[my]569-the mother daughter]3254-my daughter can not go to - night . " [I]1637-the princess - mother do forbid it . "[1637-the princess - mother] [Wogan]109-wogan had [his]109-wogan one argument . This one argument was [his]109-wogan last resource . [He]109-wogan had chosen it carefully with an eye to [the woman whom it was to persuade]1681-the woman whom it was to persuade . Such arguments would only have confirmed [her]1681-the woman whom it was to persuade in [her]1681-the woman whom it was to persuade stubbornness . [He]109-wogan made accordingly an appeal to sentiment . " [[Your]1637-the princess - mother Highness 's daughter]3945-your highness 's daughter , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " spoke a minute since of the hazards [[my]109-wogan friends]3416-my friends and [I]109-wogan have run to compass [her]3945-your highness 's daughter escape . Such hazards are [our]3993-four of us portion ; they are seldom lightened by so high an aim . But the fifth ! ' "[569-the mother] [The mother]569-the mother was still silent , but [Wogan]109-wogan could see that the tears overbrimmed [her]569-the mother eyes and rolled down [her]569-the mother cheeks . " [I]116-clementina shall not wear it long , "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina , advancing from the embrasure of the window . [Jenny]161-jenny was never the woman to mince [her]161-jenny language , and to - night [she]161-jenny was in [her]161-jenny surliest mood . So [she]161-jenny swore simply and heartily , to [the mother]569-the mother 's utter astonishment and indignation . " Damn !
