"[116-clementina] [The Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother screamed ; [Wogan]109-wogan hastened to interfere . " [Jenny]161-jenny , there 's [the bedroom]4016-the bedroom ; to bed with [you]161-jenny ! "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan took out [his]109-wogan watch . At once [he]109-wogan uttered an exclamation of affright . [Wogan]109-wogan had miscalculated the time which [he]109-wogan would require . It had taken longer than [he]109-wogan had anticipated to reach [the villa]526-the villa against the storm ; [his]109-wogan conflict with [Jenny]161-jenny in [the portico]1692-the portico had consumed valuable minutes ; [he]109-wogan had been at some pains to over - persuade [the Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother ; [Jenny]161-jenny [herself]161-jenny amongst the trees in the darkness had waited more than the quarter of an hour demanded of [her]161-jenny ; [Wogan]109-wogan [himself]109-wogan , absorbed each moment in that moment 's particular business,—now bending all [his]109-wogan wits to vanquish [Jenny]161-jenny , now to vanquish [the Princess]3107-the princess - mother,—even [Wogan]109-wogan had neglected how the time sped . [He]109-wogan looked at [his]109-wogan watch . It was twenty - five minutes to ten , and at ten [the magistrate]3207-the magistrate would be knocking at the door . " [I]116-clementina am ready , "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina , drawing the wet cloak about [her]116-clementina shoulders and its hood over [her]116-clementina head . [She]116-clementina barely shivered under its wet heaviness . " There 's one more thing to be done before [you]161-jenny go , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan ; but before [he]109-wogan could say what that one thing was , [Jenny]161-jenny , who had now recovered [her]161-jenny shoe , ran across [the room]317-the room and took [the beautiful heiress]4015-the beautiful heiress by both hands . [Jenny]161-jenny was impulsive by nature . [The Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother 's distress and [Clementina]116-clementina 's fearlessness made [her]161-jenny suddenly ashamed that [she]161-jenny had spoken so sourly . " There , there , [old lady]4013-old lady , "[161-jenny] [she]161-jenny said soothingly ; " do n't [you]4013-old lady fret . [They]4018-they are [very good friends [[your]4013-old lady niece]4020-your niece is going with]4019-very good friends your niece is going with . "[161-jenny] Then [she]161-jenny drew [Clementina]116-clementina close to [her]161-jenny . " [I]161-jenny do n't wonder [they]4018-they are all mad about [you]116-clementina , for [I]161-jenny ca n't but say [you]116-clementina are very handsome and richly worth the pains [you]116-clementina have occasioned [us]4021-us . "[161-jenny] [She]161-jenny kissed [Clementina]116-clementina plump upon the cheek and whispered in [her]116-clementina ear , " O'Toole wo n't mind the wet cloak , [[my]161-jenny dear]4022-my dear , when [he]4023-he sees [you]116-clementina . "[161-jenny] [Clementina]116-clementina laughed happily and returned [her]161-jenny kiss with no less sincerity , if with less noise . " Quick , [Jenny]161-jenny , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , " to bed with [you]161-jenny ! "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan pointed to the door which led to [[the Princess]3107-the princess 's bedroom]1700-the princess 's bedroom . " Now [you]161-jenny must write a letter , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan added to [Clementina]116-clementina , in a low voice , as soon as the door was shut upon [Jenny]161-jenny . " A letter to [[your]161-jenny mother]3808-your mother , relieving [her]3808-your mother of all complicity in [your]161-jenny escape . [[Her]3808-your mother Highness]3138-her highness will find it to - morrow night slipped under the cover of [her]3808-your mother toilette . "[109-wogan] [Clementina]116-clementina ran to a table , and taking up a pen , " [You]109-wogan think of everything , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina said . " Perhaps [you]109-wogan have written the letter . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan pulled a sheet of paper from [his]109-wogan fob . " [I]109-wogan scribbled down a few dutiful sentiments , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " as [we]4026-we drove down from [Nazareth]57-nazareth , thinking it might save time . "[109-wogan] " [Mother]3780-mother , "[116-clementina] exclaimed [Clementina]116-clementina , " not content with contriving [my]116-clementina escape , [he]109-wogan will write [my]116-clementina letters to [you]109-wogan . Well , [sir]3070-sir , let [us]4026-we hear what [you]109-wogan have made of it . "[116-clementina] [Wogan]109-wogan dictated a most beautiful letter , in which [a mother]1701-a mother 's claims for obedience were strongly set out — as a justification , one must suppose , for [a daughter]1702-a daughter 's disobedience . But [Clementina]116-clementina was betrothed to [[his]109-wogan Majesty]3911-his majesty [King James]185-king james , and that engagement must be ever the highest consideration with [her]116-clementina , on pain of forfeiting [her]116-clementina honour . It was altogether a noble and stately letter , written in formal , irreproachable phrases which [no daughter in [the world]245-the world]1704-no daughter in the world would ever have written to [a mother]1701-a mother . [Clementina]116-clementina laughed over it , but said that it would serve . [Wogan]109-wogan looked at [his]109-wogan watch again . It was then a quarter to ten . " Quick ! "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [[Your]569-the mother Highness]3263-your highness will wait for [me]109-wogan under the fourth tree of [the avenue]3199-the avenue , counting from the end . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan left [the mother]569-the mother and [daughter]590-daughter alone , that [his]109-wogan presence might not check the tenderness of [their]1709-their farewell , and went down [the stairs]366-the stairs into [the dark hall]1711-the dark hall . [M. Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux was waiting there , with [his]125-chateaudoux teeth chattering in the extremity of [his]125-chateaudoux alarm . [Wogan]109-wogan unlatched the door very carefully and saw through the chink [the sentry standing by the steps]1712-the sentry standing by the steps . The snow still fell ; [he]109-wogan was glad to note the only light was a white glimmering from the waste of snow upon the ground . " [You]125-chateaudoux must go out with [her]590-daughter , "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan whispered to [Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux , " and speak a word to [the sentry]538-the sentry . "[109-wogan] " At any moment [the magistrate]3207-the magistrate may come , "[125-chateaudoux] said [Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux , though [he]125-chateaudoux trembled so that [he]125-chateaudoux could hardly speak . " All the more reason for [the sentinel]541-the sentinel to let [[your]541-the sentinel sweetheart]4034-your sweetheart run [home]1187-home at [her]4034-your sweetheart quickest step , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , and above [him]109-wogan [he]109-wogan heard [Clementina]116-clementina come out upon [the landing]360-the landing . [He]109-wogan crept up the stairs to [her]116-clementina . " Here is [my]109-wogan hand , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , in a low voice . [She]116-clementina laid [her]116-clementina own in [his]109-wogan , and bending towards [him]109-wogan in the darkness [she]116-clementina whispered , — " Promise [me]116-clementina it shall always be at [my]116-clementina service . [I]116-clementina shall need [friends]3289-friends . [I]116-clementina am young , and [I]116-clementina have no knowledge . Promise [me]116-clementina ! "[116-clementina] [She]116-clementina was young indeed . The freshness of [her]116-clementina voice , its little tremble of modesty , the earnestness of its appeal , carried [her]116-clementina youth quite [home]1187-home to [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan 's heart . [She]116-clementina was sweet with youth . [Wogan]109-wogan felt it more clearly as [they]1715-they stood together in the darkness than when [he]109-wogan had seen [her]116-clementina plainly in [the lighted room]1716-the lighted room , with [youth]3678-youth mantling [her]116-clementina cheeks and visible in the buoyancy of [her]116-clementina walk . Then [she]116-clementina had been always [the chosen woman]337-the chosen woman . [Wogan]109-wogan could just see [her]116-clementina eyes , steady and mysteriously dark , shining at [him]109-wogan out of the gloom , and a pang of remorse suddenly struck through [him]109-wogan . That one step [she]116-clementina was to take was across the threshold of [a prison]1719-a prison , it was true , but [a prison familiar and warm]1720-a prison familiar and warm , and into a night of storm and darkness and ice . [The road]228-the road lay before [her]116-clementina into [Italy]29-italy , but it was [a road of unknown perils]1722-a road of unknown perils , through [mountains deep in snow]1723-mountains deep in snow . And this escape of to - night from [the villa]526-the villa , this thunderous flight , with [its]526-the villa hardships and its dangers , which followed the escape , was only the symbol of [her]116-clementina life . [She]116-clementina stepped from the shelter of [[her]116-clementina girlhood]1725-her girlhood , as [she]116-clementina stepped across the threshold of [the villa]526-the villa , into [a womanhood dark with many trials , storm - swept and wandering]1727-a womanhood dark with many trials , storm - swept and wandering . [She]116-clementina might reach [the queendom which was [her]116-clementina due]1728-the queendom which was her due , as the berlin in which [she]116-clementina was to travel might — nay , surely would — rush one day from [the gorges]1729-the gorges into [the plains]1730-the plains and [the sunlight of [Italy]29-italy]1731-the sunlight of italy ; but had [Wogan]109-wogan travelled to [Rome]4-rome in [[Gaydon]142-gaydon 's place]1732-gaydon 's place and talked with [Whittington]111-whittington outside [the Caprara Palace]1341-the caprara palace , it is very likely that [she]116-clementina would never have been allowed by [him]109-wogan to start . Up till now [he]109-wogan had thought only of [her]116-clementina splendid courage , of the humiliation of [her]116-clementina capture , of [her]116-clementina wounded pride ; [she]116-clementina was [the chosen woman]337-the chosen woman . Now [he]109-wogan thought of [the girl]336-the girl , and wondered of [her]116-clementina destiny , and was stricken with remorse . " Promise [me]116-clementina , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina repeated , and [her]116-clementina hand tightened upon [his]109-wogan and clung to it . [Wogan]109-wogan had no fine sentiments wherewith to answer [her]116-clementina ; but [his]109-wogan voice took a depth of sincerity and tenderness quite strange to [her]116-clementina . [Her]116-clementina fingers ceased to tremble . [They]1736-they went down into [the hall]295-the hall . [Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux , who had been waiting in an agony of impatience , opened the door and slipped out ; [Clementina]116-clementina followed [him]125-chateaudoux . The door was left ajar behind [them]1736-they , and [Wogan]109-wogan in [the hall]295-the hall saw [Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux speak with [the sentinel]541-the sentinel , saw [the sentinel]541-the sentinel run hurriedly to [Clementina]116-clementina , saw [Clementina]116-clementina disappear into the snow . [Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux ran back into [the hall]295-the hall . " And [you]116-clementina ! "[125-chateaudoux] [he]125-chateaudoux asked , as [he]125-chateaudoux barred and locked the door . " [The magistrate]3207-the magistrate is coming . [I]125-chateaudoux saw the lights of the guard across [the avenue]3199-the avenue . "[125-chateaudoux] [Clementina]116-clementina was outside in the storm ; [Wogan]109-wogan was within [the house]3196-the house , and the lights of [the guard]1601-the guard were already near . " [I]109-wogan go by the way [I]109-wogan came , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan ; " [I]109-wogan have time ; "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan ran quickly up [the stairs]366-the stairs . In [the room]317-the room [he]109-wogan found [the Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother weeping silently , and again , as [he]109-wogan saw [this weak elderly woman]1747-this weak elderly woman left alone to [her]1747-this weak elderly woman fears and forebodings , remorse took hold on [him]109-wogan . " Courage , [madam]3071-madam , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , as [he]109-wogan crossed [the room]317-the room ; " [she]1747-this weak elderly woman goes to [we]4040-we d [a king]4041-a king . "[109-wogan] " [Sir]3070-sir , [I]3107-the princess am [[her]1747-this weak elderly woman mother]3108-her mother , "[3107-the princess] replied [the Princess]3107-the princess , gaining at this moment a suitable dignity from [her]3107-the princess tears . " [I]109-wogan was wondering not of [the King]3089-the king , but of [the man [the King]3089-the king]4045-the man the king conceals . "[109-wogan] " [You]221-his master need not , [madam]3071-madam , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , who had no time for eulogies upon [[his]109-wogan master]221-his master . " Take [[his]221-his master servant]312-his servant 's loyalty as the measure of [his]221-his master merits . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan looked out of the window and suddenly drew back . [He]109-wogan stood for a moment with a look of great fear upon [his]109-wogan face . For [the sentinel]541-the sentinel was back at [his]541-the sentinel post ; [Wogan]109-wogan dared not at this moment risk a struggle , and perhaps an outcry . [Clementina]116-clementina was waiting under [the avenue of trees]1752-the avenue of trees ; [Wogan]109-wogan was within [the house]3196-the house , and the lights of [the guard]1601-the guard were already flaring in [the roadway]546-the roadway . Even as [Wogan]109-wogan stood in the embrasure of the window , [he]109-wogan heard a heavy knocking on the door . [Wogan]109-wogan closed the window cautiously . The snow had drifted through and lay melting in a heap beneath the sill . [He]109-wogan drew the curtain across the embrasure , and then [he]109-wogan crossed to [the bedroom]4016-the bedroom door . " [Jenny]161-jenny , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan whispered , " are [you]161-jenny in bed ? "[109-wogan] " Yes . "[109-wogan] " Lie close ! Do not show [your]161-jenny face nor speak . Only groan , and groan most delicately , or [we]4049-we are lost . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan closed the door upon [Jenny]161-jenny , and turning about came face to face with [the Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother . [She]1637-the princess - mother stood confronting [him]109-wogan , a finger on [her]1637-the princess - mother lips , and terror in [her]1637-the princess - mother eyes ; and [he]109-wogan heard the street - door open and clang to below . " [The magistrate]3207-the magistrate ! "[1637-the princess - mother] [she]1637-the princess - mother whispered . " Courage , [[your]109-wogan Highness]3263-your highness . Keep [them]4052-them from the bed ! Say that [her]1637-the princess - mother eyes are weak and can not bear the light . "[1637-the princess - mother] [He]109-wogan slipped behind the curtain into the embrasure , picturing to [himself]109-wogan the disposition of [the room]317-the room , lest [he]109-wogan should have left behind a trifle to betray [him]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan had in a supreme degree that gift of recollection which takes the form of a mental vision . [He]109-wogan did not have to count over the details of [the room]317-the room ; [he]109-wogan summoned a picture of it to [his]109-wogan mind , and saw it and its contents from corner to corner . And thus while the footsteps yet sounded on the stair , [he]109-wogan saw [Clementina]116-clementina 's bundle lying forgotten on a couch . [He]109-wogan darted from [his]109-wogan hiding - place , seized it , and ran back . [He]109-wogan had just sufficient and not a second more time , for the curtain had not ceased to swing when [the magistrate]3207-the magistrate knocked , and without waiting for an answer entered . [He]109-wogan was followed by [two soldiers]1761-two soldiers , and these [he]109-wogan ordered to wait without the door . " [[Your]134-lady featherstone Highness]3263-your highness , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said in a polite voice , and stopped abruptly . It seemed to [Wogan]109-wogan behind the curtain that [his]109-wogan heart stopped at the same moment and with no less abruptness . There was no evidence of [Clementina]116-clementina 's flight to justify that sudden silence . Then [he]109-wogan grew faint , as it occurred to [him]109-wogan that [he]109-wogan had made [Lady Featherstone]134-lady featherstone 's mistake,—that [his]109-wogan boot protruded into [the room]317-the room . [He]109-wogan clenched [his]109-wogan teeth , expecting a swift step and the curtain to be torn aside . The window was shut ; [he]109-wogan would never have time to open it and leap out and take [his]109-wogan chance with [the sentry underneath]1763-the sentry underneath . [He]109-wogan was caught in a trap , and [Clementina]116-clementina waited for [him]109-wogan in [the avenue]3199-the avenue , under the fourth tree . All was lost , it seemed , and by [his]109-wogan own folly , [his]109-wogan own confidence . Had [he]109-wogan only told [her]116-clementina of [the tavern under the city wall , where [the carriage]287-the carriage stood with [its]287-the carriage horses harnessed in the shafts]1765-the tavern under the city wall , where the carriage stood with its horses harnessed in the shafts , [she]116-clementina might still have escaped , though [he]109-wogan was trapped . The sweat passed down [his]109-wogan face . Yet no swift step was taken , nor was the curtain torn aside . For within [the room]317-the room [the magistrate]3207-the magistrate , [a kindly citizen of [Innspruck]17-innspruck who had no liking for this addition to [his]3207-the magistrate duties]1769-a kindly citizen of innspruck who had no liking for this addition to his duties , stood gazing at [the Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother with a respectful pity . It was the sight of [her]1637-the princess - mother tear - stained face which had checked [his]109-wogan words . For two days [Clementina]116-clementina had kept [her]116-clementina bed , and [the mother]569-the mother 's tears alarmed [him]109-wogan . " [[Her]569-the mother Highness]3138-her highness , [[your]3207-the magistrate daughter]3988-your daughter , suffers so much ? "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [Sir]3070-sir , it is little to be wondered at . "[109-wogan] [The magistrate]3207-the magistrate bowed . That question was not one with which [he]109-wogan had a mind to meddle . " [She]569-the mother still lies in bed ? "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , and [he]109-wogan crossed to the door . [The mother]569-the mother flung [herself]569-the mother in the way . " [She]569-the mother lies in pain , and [you]3070-sir would disturb [her]569-the mother ; [you]3070-sir would flash [your]3070-sir lanterns in [her]569-the mother eyes , that if perchance [she]569-the mother sleeps , [she]569-the mother may wake into a world of pain . [Sir]3070-sir , [you]3070-sir will not . "[569-the mother] " [[Your]3070-sir Highness]3263-your highness — "[569-the mother] " It is [the mother who beseeches [you]3070-sir]4059-the mother who beseeches you . [Sir]3070-sir , would [you]3070-sir have [me]569-the mother on [my]569-the mother knees ? "[569-the mother] [Wogan]109-wogan , but this moment recovered from [his]109-wogan alarm , became again uneasy . [[Her]1774-her Highness]3138-her highness protested too much ; [she]3138-her highness played [her]3138-her highness part in the comedy too strenuously . [He]109-wogan judged by the ear ; [the magistrate]3207-the magistrate had the quivering , terror - stricken face before [his]3207-the magistrate eyes , and [his]3207-the magistrate pity deepened . " [[Your]1637-the princess - mother Highness]3263-your highness , "[3207-the magistrate] [he]3207-the magistrate said , " [I]3207-the magistrate must pray [you]3263-your highness to let [me]3207-the magistrate pass . [I]3207-the magistrate have [General Heister]123-general heister 's orders to obey . "[3207-the magistrate] [The Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother now gave [Wogan]109-wogan reason to applaud [her]1637-the princess - mother . [She]1637-the princess - mother saw that [the magistrate]3207-the magistrate , for all [his]3207-the magistrate politeness , was quite inflexible . " Go , then , "[1637-the princess - mother] [she]1637-the princess - mother said with a quiet dignity which once before [she]1637-the princess - mother had shown that evening . " Since there is no humiliation to be spared [us]4062-us , take a candle , [sir]3070-sir , and count the marks of suffering in [[my]1637-the princess - mother daughter]3254-my daughter 's face ; "[1637-the princess - mother] and with [her]1637-the princess - mother own hand [she]1637-the princess - mother opened the [bedroom]1779-bedroom door and stood aside . " [Madam]3071-madam , [I]3207-the magistrate would not press [my]3207-the magistrate duty an inch beyond its limits , "[3207-the magistrate] said [the magistrate]3207-the magistrate . " [I]3207-the magistrate will stand in the doorway , and do [you]3070-sir bid [[your]3070-sir daughter]3988-your daughter speak . "[3207-the magistrate] [The Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother did not move from [her]1637-the princess - mother position . " [[My]1637-the princess - mother child]3804-my child , "[1637-the princess - mother] [she]1637-the princess - mother said . [Jenny]161-jenny in [the bedroom]4016-the bedroom groaned and turned from one side to the other . " [You]161-jenny are in pain ? "[161-jenny] [Jenny]161-jenny groaned again . [The magistrate]3207-the magistrate [himself]3207-the magistrate closed the door . " Believe [me]3207-the magistrate , "[3207-the magistrate] said [he]3207-the magistrate , " [no one]356-no one could more regret than [I]3207-the magistrate the incivilities to which [I]3207-the magistrate am compelled . "[3207-the magistrate] [He]3207-the magistrate crossed [the room]317-the room . [Wogan]109-wogan heard [him]3207-the magistrate and [[his]109-wogan men]1785-his men descending [the stairs]366-the stairs . [He]109-wogan heard the door open and shut ; [he]109-wogan heard [Chateaudoux]125-chateaudoux draw the bolts . Then [he]109-wogan stepped out from the curtain . " [[Your]1787-your Highness]3263-your highness , that was bravely done , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , and kneeling [he]109-wogan kissed [her]1787-your hand . [He]109-wogan went back into the embrasure , slipped the bundle over [his]109-wogan arm , and opened the window very silently . [He]109-wogan saw the snow was still falling , the wind still moaning about the crannies and roaring along [the streets]399-the streets . [He]109-wogan set [his]109-wogan knee upon the window - ledge , climbed out , and drew the window to behind [him]109-wogan . [The Princess - mother]1637-the princess - mother waited in [the room]317-the room with [her]1637-the princess - mother hand upon [her]1637-the princess - mother heart . [She]1637-the princess - mother waited , it seemed to [her]1637-the princess - mother , for an eternity . Then [she]1637-the princess - mother heard the sound of a heavy fall , and the clang of a musket against the wall of [the villa]526-the villa . But [she]1637-the princess - mother heard no cry . [She]1637-the princess - mother ran to the window and looked out . But strain [her]1637-the princess - mother eyes as [she]1637-the princess - mother might , [she]1637-the princess - mother could distinguish nothing in that blinding storm . [She]1637-the princess - mother could not see [the sentinel]541-the sentinel ; nor was this strange , for [the sentinel]541-the sentinel lay senseless on the snow against the house - wall , and [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan was already running down [the avenue]3199-the avenue . Under the fourth tree [he]109-wogan found [Clementina]116-clementina ; [she]116-clementina took [his]109-wogan arm , and [they]1795-they set off together , wrestling with the wind , wading through the snow . It seemed to [Clementina]116-clementina that [[her]116-clementina companion]1796-her companion was possessed by some new fear . [He]109-wogan said no single word to [her]116-clementina ; [he]109-wogan dragged [her]116-clementina with a fierce grip upon [her]116-clementina wrist ; if [she]116-clementina stumbled , [he]109-wogan jerked [her]116-clementina roughly to [her]116-clementina feet . [She]116-clementina set [her]116-clementina teeth and kept pace with [him]109-wogan . Only once did [she]116-clementina speak . [They]1795-they had come to a depression in [the road]228-the road where the melted snow had made a wide pool . [Wogan]109-wogan leaped across it and said , — " Give [me]109-wogan [your]3107-the princess hand ! There 's a white stone midway where [you]3107-the princess can set [your]3107-the princess foot . "[109-wogan] [The Princess]3107-the princess stepped as [he]109-wogan bade [her]3107-the princess . The stone yielded beneath [her]3107-the princess tread and [she]3107-the princess stood ankle - deep in the water . [Wogan]109-wogan sprang to [her]3107-the princess side and lifted [her]3107-the princess out . [She]3107-the princess had uttered no cry , and now [she]3107-the princess only laughed as [she]3107-the princess stood shivering on the further edge . It was that low musical , good - humoured laugh to which [Wogan]109-wogan had never listened without a thrill of gladness , but it waked no response in [him]109-wogan now . " [You]109-wogan told [me]3107-the princess of a white stone on which [I]3107-the princess might safely set [my]3107-the princess foot , "[3107-the princess] [she]3107-the princess said . " Well , [sir]3070-sir , [your]109-wogan white stone was straw . "[3107-the princess] [They]1799-they were both to remember these words afterwards and to make of them a parable , but it seemed that [Wogan]109-wogan barely heard them now . " Come ! "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said , and taking [her]3107-the princess arm [he]109-wogan set off running again . [Clementina]116-clementina understood that something inopportune , something terrible , had happened since [she]116-clementina had left [the villa]526-the villa . [She]116-clementina asked no questions ; [she]116-clementina trusted [herself]116-clementina without reserve to [these true friends who had striven at such risks for [her]116-clementina]1801-these true friends who had striven at such risks for her , [she]116-clementina desired to prove to [them]1801-these true friends who had striven at such risks for her that [she]116-clementina was what [they]1801-these true friends who had striven at such risks for her would have [her]116-clementina be,—a girl who did not pester [them]1801-these true friends who had striven at such risks for her with inconvenient chatter , but who could keep silence when silence was helpful , and face hardships with a buoyant heart . [They]1799-they crossed [the bridge]1542-the bridge and stopped before a pair of high folding doors . [They]1803-they were the doors of [the tavern]968-the tavern . [Wogan]109-wogan drew a breath of relief , pulled the bobbin , and pushed the doors open . [Clementina]116-clementina slipped through , and in darkness [she]116-clementina took a step forward and bruised [herself]116-clementina against the wheels of [a carriage]576-a carriage . [Wogan]109-wogan closed the door and ran to [her]116-clementina side . " This way , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , and held out [his]109-wogan hand . [He]109-wogan guided [Clementina]116-clementina round [the carriage]287-the carriage to a steep narrow stairway — it was more a ladder than a stair — fixed against the inner wall . At the top of [this stairway]1807-this stairway shone a horizontal line of yellow light . [Wogan]109-wogan led [the Princess]3107-the princess up [the stairs]366-the stairs . The line of light shone out beneath a door . [Wogan]109-wogan opened the door and stood aside . [Clementina]116-clementina passed into [a small bare room lighted by a single candle]1810-a small bare room lighted by a single candle , where [Mrs. Misset]143-misset , [Gaydon]142-gaydon , and [O'Toole]158-o'toole waited for [her]116-clementina coming . Not a word was said ; but [their]1811-their eyes spoke [their]1811-their admiration of [the woman]308-the woman , [their]1811-their knees expressed [their]1811-their homage to [the Queen]3476-the queen . There was a fire blazing on the hearth , [Mrs. Misset]143-misset had a dry change of clothes ready and warm . [Wogan]109-wogan laid [the Princess]3107-the princess 's bundle on a chair , and with [Gaydon]142-gaydon and [O'Toole]158-o'toole went down [the stairs]366-the stairs . " The horses ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan asked . " [I]142-gaydon have ordered [them]4071-them , "[142-gaydon] said [Gaydon]142-gaydon , " at [the post - house]4072-the post - house . [I]142-gaydon will fetch [them]4071-them ; "[142-gaydon] and [he]142-gaydon hurried off upon [his]142-gaydon errand . [Wogan]109-wogan turned to [O'Toole]158-o'toole . " And the bill ? "[109-wogan] " [I]109-wogan have paid it . "[109-wogan] " There is [no one]356-no one awake in [the house]3196-the house ? "[109-wogan] " [No one]356-no one but [the landlady]4076-the landlady . "[109-wogan] " Good ! Can [you]109-wogan keep [her]4076-the landlady engaged until [we]4077-we are ready ? "[109-wogan] " To be sure [I]158-o'toole can . [She]4076-the landlady shall never give a thought to [any man of [you]109-wogan but [myself]158-o'toole]4078-any man of you but myself . "[158-o'toole] [O'Toole]158-o'toole passed through a door at the bottom of the staircase into [the common - room of [the inn]231-the inn]1816-the common - room of the inn . [Wogan]109-wogan gently opened the big doors and dragged [the carriage]287-the carriage out into [the road]228-the road . [Gaydon]142-gaydon with the horses galloped silently up through the snow , and together [the two men]462-the two men feverishly harnessed [them]462-the two men to [the carriage]287-the carriage . There were six for [the carriage]287-the carriage , and a seventh for [O'Toole]158-o'toole to ride . The expedition which [Wogan]109-wogan and [Gaydon]142-gaydon showed was matched by [the Princess]3107-the princess . For while [they]462-the two men were fastening the last buckles , the door at the top of the stairs opened , and again that night [Clementina]116-clementina whispered , — " [I]116-clementina am ready . "[116-clementina] " Come ! "[109-wogan] replied [Wogan]109-wogan . [She]3107-the princess wore a scarlet cloak upon [her]3107-the princess shoulders , and muffling it about [her]3107-the princess head [she]3107-the princess ran down with [Mrs. Misset]143-misset . [Wogan]109-wogan opened the lower door of [the inn]231-the inn and called for [O'Toole]158-o'toole . [O'Toole]158-o'toole came running out before [Wogan]109-wogan had ended [his]109-wogan words , and sprang into [his]109-wogan saddle . [Gaydon]142-gaydon was already on the box with the reins gathered in [his]142-gaydon hand . [Wogan]109-wogan had the carriage door open before [Clementina]116-clementina had reached the foot of [the stairs]366-the stairs ; it was shut upon [her]116-clementina and [[her]116-clementina companion]1796-her companion almost before [they]1827-they were aware [they]1827-they were within [it]1828-it ; [the carriage]287-the carriage started almost before the door was shut . Yet when it did start , [Wogan]109-wogan was beside [Gaydon]142-gaydon upon the box . [Their]1827-they movements , indeed , occurred with so exact a rapidity , that though [the hostess]1830-the hostess at once followed [O'Toole]158-o'toole to bid [[her]1830-the hostess guests]1831-her guests farewell , when [she]1830-the hostess reached the big doors [she]1830-the hostess saw only the back of [the carriage]287-the carriage lurching through the ruts of snow . " Quick ! "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan ; " [we]1827-they have lost too much time . "[109-wogan] " A bare twenty minutes , "[142-gaydon] said [Gaydon]142-gaydon . " A good twelve hours , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . [Gaydon]142-gaydon lashed the horses into a gallop , the horses strained at [their]1833-their collars , [the carriage]287-the carriage raced out of [the town]3115-the town and up [the slopes of [the Brenner]62-the brenner]1836-the slopes of the brenner . [The princess [Clementina]116-clementina]1436-the princess clementina had been rescued from [[her]1436-the princess clementina prison]1424-her prison . " But [we]4079-we must keep [her]1436-the princess clementina free ! "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan , as [he]109-wogan blew through [his]109-wogan gloves upon [his]109-wogan frozen fingers . " Faster ! Faster ! "[109-wogan] The incline was steep , the snow clogged the wheels , the horses sank deep in it . [Gaydon]142-gaydon might ply [his]142-gaydon whip as [he]142-gaydon would , [the carriage]287-the carriage might lurch and leap from side to side ; the pace was all too slow for [Wogan]109-wogan . " [We]4079-we have lost twelve hours , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried . " Oh , would to [God]126-wogan [we]4079-we were come to [Italy]29-italy ! "[109-wogan] And turning backwards [he]109-wogan strained [his]109-wogan eyes down through the darkness and snow to [the hidden roofs of [Innspruck]17-innspruck]1840-the hidden roofs of innspruck , almost fearing to see the windows from [one end of [the town]3115-the town]1841-one end of the town to the other leap to a blaze of light , and to hear a roar of many voices warn [him]109-wogan that the escape was discovered . But the only cry that [he]109-wogan heard came from the lips of [Mrs. Misset]143-misset , who put [her]143-misset head from [the carriage]287-the carriage and bade [him]109-wogan stop . [Gaydon]142-gaydon brought the horses to a standstill three miles out of [Innspruck]17-innspruck . [Wogan]109-wogan jumped down from [his]109-wogan box and ran to the carriage - door . " [[Her]143-misset Highness]3138-her highness is ill ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried in suspense . " Not the least bit in [the world]245-the world , "[116-clementina] returned [Clementina]116-clementina , whose voice for once in a way jarred upon [Wogan]109-wogan 's ears . Nothing short of a positive sickness could justify the delay . " What is it , then ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan asked curtly , almost roughly , of [Mrs. Misset]143-misset . " [You]143-misset carried a packet for [[her]143-misset Highness]3138-her highness . It is left behind at [the tavern]968-the tavern . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan stamped impatiently on the ground . " And for this , for a petticoat or two , [you]143-misset hinder [us]4084-us , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried in a heat . " There 's no petticoat in [the world]245-the world , though it were so stiff with gold that it stood on end of itself , that 's worth a single second of the next forty - eight hours . "[109-wogan] " But it contains [her]143-misset [Highness]186-highness 's jewels . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan 's impatience became an exasperation . Were [all women]1844-all women at heart , then , no better than [Indian squaws]1845-indian squaws ? A string of beads outweighed the sacrifices of [friends]3289-friends and the chance of a crown ! There was a blemish in [his]109-wogan idol , since at all costs [she]1847-her must glitter . [Wogan]109-wogan , however , was [the master]3711-the master here . " [[Her]1847-her Highness]3138-her highness must lose [her]3138-her highness jewels , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said roughly , and was turning away when [[her]1847-her Highness]3138-her highness [herself]3138-her highness spoke . " [You]109-wogan are unjust , [[my]3138-her highness friend]3085-my friend , "[3138-her highness] [she]3138-her highness said . " [I]3138-her highness would lose them very willingly , were there a chance [no one else]252-no one else would discover [them]3138-her highness . But there 's no chance . [The woman of [the tavern]968-the tavern]4089-the woman of the tavern will find the bundle , will open it ; very likely [she]4089-the woman of the tavern has done so already . [We]4091-we shall have [all Innspruck]4092-all innspruck on [our]4091-we heels in half an hour ; "[3138-her highness] and for the first time that night [Wogan]109-wogan heard [her]3138-her highness voice break , and grieved to know that the tears were running down [her]3138-her highness cheeks . [He]109-wogan called to [O'Toole]158-o'toole , — " Ride back to [the tavern]968-the tavern ! Bring the packet without fail ! "[109-wogan] [O'Toole]158-o'toole galloped off , and [Gaydon]142-gaydon drove [the carriage]287-the carriage to the side of [the road]228-the road . There was nothing to do but to wait , and [they]1852-they waited in silence , counting up the chances . There could be no doubt that [the landlady]4076-the landlady , if once [she]4076-the landlady discovered the jewels hidden away in a common packet of clothing , must suspect [the travellers who had left them behind]1854-the travellers who had left them behind . [She]4076-the landlady would be terrified by [their]1855-their value ; [she]4076-the landlady would be afraid to retain [them]1855-their lest harm should come to [her]4076-the landlady ; and all [Innspruck]17-innspruck would be upon [the fugitives]1856-the fugitives ' heels . [They]1852-they waited for half an hour,—thirty minutes of gloom and despair . [Clementina]116-clementina wept over this new danger which [[her]116-clementina comrades]1857-her comrades ran ; [Mrs. Misset]143-misset wept for that [her]143-misset negligence was to blame ; [Gaydon]142-gaydon sat on the box in the falling snow with [his]142-gaydon arms crossed upon [his]142-gaydon breast , and felt [his]142-gaydon head already loose upon [his]142-gaydon shoulders . [The only one of [the party who had any comfort of that half - hour]1859-the party who had any comfort of that half - hour]1858-the only one of the party who had any comfort of that half - hour was [Wogan]109-wogan . For [he]109-wogan had been [wrong,—the chosen woman]1860-wrong,—the chosen woman had no wish to glitter at all costs , though , to be sure , [she]1860-wrong,—the chosen woman could not help [glittering]1861-glittering with the refulgence of [her]1860-wrong,—the chosen woman great merits . [[His]109-wogan idol]1862-his idol had no blemish . [Wogan]109-wogan paced up and down [the road]228-the road , while [he]109-wogan listened for [O'Toole]158-o'toole 's return , and that thought cheated the time for [him]109-wogan . At last [he]109-wogan heard very faintly the sound of galloping hoofs below [him]109-wogan on [the road]228-the road . [He]109-wogan ran back to [Gaydon]142-gaydon . " It might be [a courier]633-a courier to arrest [us]4095-us . If [I]109-wogan shout , drive fast as [you]142-gaydon can to [Nazareth]57-nazareth , and from [Nazareth]57-nazareth to [Italy]29-italy . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan hurried down [the road]228-the road and was hailed by [O'Toole]158-o'toole . " [I]109-wogan have it , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . [Wogan]109-wogan turned and ran by [O'Toole]158-o'toole 's stirrup to [the carriage]287-the carriage . " [The landlady]4076-the landlady has a good conscience and sleeps well , "[158-o'toole] said [O'Toole]158-o'toole . " [I]158-o'toole found [the house]3196-the house dark and the doors shut . They were only secured , however , by a wooden beam dropped into a couple of sockets on the inside . "[158-o'toole] " But how did [you]158-o'toole open them ? "[116-clementina] asked [Clementina]116-clementina . " [[Your]158-o'toole Highness]3263-your highness , [I]158-o'toole have , after all , a pair of arms , "[158-o'toole] said [O'Toole]158-o'toole . " [I]158-o'toole just pressed on the doors till — "[158-o'toole] " Till the sockets gave ? "[116-clementina] " No , till the beam broke , "[158-o'toole] said [he]158-o'toole , and [Clementina]116-clementina laughed . " That 's [my]116-clementina six foot four ! "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina . [O'Toole]158-o'toole did not understand . But [he]158-o'toole smiled with great condescension and dignity , and continued [his]158-o'toole story . " [I]158-o'toole groped [my]158-o'toole way up the stairs into [the room]317-the room and found the bundle untouched in the corner . "[158-o'toole] [He]158-o'toole handed it to [the Princess]3107-the princess ; [Wogan]109-wogan sprang again onto the box , and [Gaydon]142-gaydon whipped up the horses . [They]1868-they reached [the first posting stage]1869-the first posting stage at two , the second at four , the third at six , and at each [they]1868-they wasted no time . All that night [their]1868-they horses strained up [the mountain road]1870-the mountain road amid the whirling sleet . At times the wind roaring down [a gorge]1871-a gorge would set [the carriage]287-the carriage rocking ; at times [they]287-the carriage stuck fast in drifts ; and [Wogan]109-wogan and [Gaydon]142-gaydon must leap from the box and plunging waist - deep in the snow , must drag at the horses and push at the wheels . The pace was too slow ; [Wogan]109-wogan seemed to hear on every gust of wind the sound of [a galloping company]1873-a galloping company . " [We]1868-they have lost twelve hours , more than twelve hours now , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan repeated and repeated to [Gaydon]142-gaydon . All the way to [Ala]63-ala [they]1868-they would still be in [[the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's territory]1875-the emperor 's territory . It needed only [a single courier]1876-a single courier to gallop past [them]1868-they , and at either [Roveredo]64-roveredo or [Trent]52-trent [they]1868-they would infallibly be taken . [Wogan]109-wogan fingered [his]109-wogan pistols , straining [his]109-wogan eyes backwards down [the road]228-the road . At daybreak the snow stopped ; [the carriage]287-the carriage rolled on high among [the mountains]1519-the mountains under a grey sky ; and here and there , at a wind of [the road]228-the road , [Wogan]109-wogan caught a glimpse of [the towers and chimney - tops of [Innspruck]17-innspruck]1881-the towers and chimney - tops of innspruck , or had within [his]109-wogan view [a stretch of [the slope]1883-the slope [they]1868-they had climbed]1882-a stretch of the slope they had climbed . But there was never a black speck visible upon the white of the snow ; as yet [no courier]1884-no courier was overtaking [them]1868-they , as yet [Innspruck]17-innspruck did not know [its captive]1885-its captive had escaped . At eight o'clock in the morning [they]1868-they came to [Nazareth]57-nazareth , and found [[their]1868-they own [berlin]65-berlin]1886-their own berlin ready harnessed at the post - house door , the postillion already in [his]109-wogan saddle , and [Misset]143-misset waiting with an uncovered head . " [[Her]143-misset Highness]3138-her highness will breakfast [here]3086-here , no doubt ? "[142-gaydon] said [Gaydon]142-gaydon . " [Misset]143-misset will have seen to it , "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan , " that [the berlin]4102-the berlin is furnished . [We]1868-they can breakfast as [we]1868-they go . "[109-wogan] [They]1868-they waited no more than ten minutes at [Nazareth]57-nazareth . The order of travelling was now changed . [Wogan]109-wogan and [Gaydon]142-gaydon now travelled in [the berlin]4102-the berlin with [Mrs. Misset]143-misset and [Clementina]116-clementina . [Gaydon]142-gaydon , being the oldest of [the party]1888-the party , figured as [the Count of [Cernes]50-cernes]1307-the count of cernes , [Mrs. Misset]143-misset as [[his]142-gaydon wife]589-his wife , [Clementina]116-clementina as [[his]142-gaydon niece]1891-his niece , and [Wogan]109-wogan as [a friend of [the family]1893-the family]1892-a friend of the family . [O'Toole]158-o'toole and [Misset]143-misset rode beside [the carriage]287-the carriage in the guise of [servants]242-servants . Thus [they]1888-the party started from [Nazareth]57-nazareth , and had journeyed perhaps a mile when without so much as a moan [Clementina]116-clementina swooned and fell forward into [Wogan]109-wogan 's arms . [Mrs. Misset]143-misset uttered a cry ; [Wogan]109-wogan clasped [the Princess]3107-the princess to [his]109-wogan breast . [Her]3107-the princess head fell back across [his]109-wogan arm , pale as death ; [her]3107-the princess eyes were closed ; [her]3107-the princess bosom , strained against [his]109-wogan , neither rose nor fell . " [She]3107-the princess has fasted all [Lent]187-lent , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said in a broken voice . " [She]3107-the princess has eaten nothing since [we]4103-we left [Innspruck]17-innspruck . "[109-wogan] [Mrs. Misset]143-misset burst into tears ; [she]143-misset caught [Clementina]116-clementina 's hand and clasped it ; [she]143-misset had no eyes but for [her]116-clementina . With [Gaydon]142-gaydon it was different . [Wogan]109-wogan was holding [the Princess]3107-the princess in a clasp too loverlike , though , to be sure , it was none of [his]109-wogan business . " [We]4103-we must stop [the carriage]287-the carriage , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said . " No , "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan , desperately ; " that [we]4103-we must not do ; "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan caught [her]3107-the princess still closer to [him]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan had a fear that [she]3107-the princess was dying . Even so , [she]3107-the princess should not be recaptured . Though [she]3107-the princess were dead , [he]109-wogan would still carry [her]3107-the princess dead body into [Bologna]1-bologna and lay it white and still before [[his]109-wogan King]326-his king . [Europe]7-europe from [London]22-london to [the Bosphorus]66-the bosphorus should know the truth of [her]3107-the princess and ring with the wonder of [her]3107-the princess , though [she]3107-the princess were dead . O'Toole , attracted by the noise of [Mrs. Misset]143-misset 's lamentations , bent down over [his]109-wogan horse 's neck and looked into [the carriage]287-the carriage . " [[Her]143-misset Highness]3138-her highness is dead ! "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried . " Drive on , "[109-wogan] replied [Wogan]109-wogan , through [his]109-wogan clenched teeth . Upon the other side of [the carriage]287-the carriage , [Misset]143-misset shouted through the window , " There is a spring by [the roadside]248-the roadside . "[143-misset] " Drive on , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . [Gaydon]142-gaydon touched [him]109-wogan on the arm . " [You]109-wogan will stifle [her]3138-her highness , [man]3319-man . "[142-gaydon] [Wogan]109-wogan woke to a comprehension of [his]109-wogan attitude , and placed [Clementina]116-clementina back on [her]116-clementina seat . [Mrs. Misset]143-misset by good fortune had a small bottle of Carmelite water in [her]143-misset pocket ; [she]143-misset held it to [the Princess]3107-the princess 's nostrils , who in a little opened [her]143-misset eyes and saw [[her]143-misset companions]1902-her companions in tears about [her]143-misset , imploring [her]143-misset to wake . " It is nothing , "[143-misset] [she]143-misset said . " Take courage , [my]143-misset poor marmosets ; "[143-misset] and with a smile [she]143-misset added , " There 's [my]143-misset six feet four with the tears in [his]4108-his eyes . Did ever [a woman]234-a woman have [such friends]4110-such friends ? "[143-misset] The sun came out in the sky as [she]143-misset spoke . [They]1903-they had topped [the pass]1904-the pass and were now driving down towards [Italy]29-italy . There was snow about [them]1903-they still on [the mountain - sides]1905-the mountain - sides and deep in drifts upon [the roads]286-the roads . The air was musical with the sound of innumerable freshets : they could be seen leaping and sparkling in the sunlight ; [the valleys below]1907-the valleys below were green with the young green of spring , and the winds were tempered with the warmth of [Italy]29-italy . A like change came upon [the fugitives]1856-the fugitives . [They]1903-they laughed , where before [they]1903-they had wept ; from under the seat [they]1903-they pulled out chickens which [Misset]143-misset had cooked with [his]1909-his own hands at [Nazareth]57-nazareth , bottles of the wine of [St. Laurent]188-st. laurent , and bread ; and [Wogan]109-wogan allowed a halt long enough to get water from a spring by the roadside . " There is no salt , "[142-gaydon] said [Gaydon]142-gaydon . " Indeed there is , "[143-misset] replied [Misset]143-misset , indignant at the aspersion on [his]1909-his catering . " [I]1909-his have it in [my]1909-his tobacco - box . "[1909-his] [He]1909-his took [his]1909-his tobacco - box from [his]1909-his pocket and passed it into [the carriage]287-the carriage . [Clementina]116-clementina made sandwiches and passed them out to [the horsemen]1911-the horsemen . The chickens turned out to be old cocks , impervious to the soundest tooth . [No one]356-no one minded except [Misset]143-misset , who had brought [them]1913-them . The jolts of [the carriage]287-the carriage became matter for a jest . [They]1915-they picnicked with the merriment of [children]896-children , and finally [O'Toole]158-o'toole , to show [his]158-o'toole contempt for [the Emperor]3102-the emperor , fired off both [his]158-o'toole loaded pistols in the air . At that [Wogan]109-wogan 's anxiety returned . [He]109-wogan blazed up into anger . [He]109-wogan thrust [his]109-wogan head from the window . " Is this [your]109-wogan respect for [[her]4111-her Highness]3138-her highness ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried . " Is this [your]109-wogan consideration ? "[109-wogan] " Nay , "[116-clementina] interposed [Clementina]116-clementina , " [you]109-wogan shall not chide [my]116-clementina six feet four . "[116-clementina] " But [he]158-o'toole is mad , [[your]109-wogan Highness]3263-your highness . [I]109-wogan do n't say but what a trifle of madness is salt to [a man]235-a man ; but [O'Toole]158-o'toole 's clean daft to be firing [his]158-o'toole pistols off to let [the whole world]3851-the whole world know who [we]4116-we are . Here are [we]4116-we not six stages from [Innspruck]17-innspruck , and already [we]4116-we have lost twelve hours . "[109-wogan] " When ? "[116-clementina] " Last night , before [we]4116-we left [Innspruck]17-innspruck , between the time when [you]109-wogan escaped from [the villa]526-the villa and when [I]1918-i joined [you]109-wogan in [the avenue]3199-the avenue . [I]1918-i climbed out of the window to descend as [I]1918-i had entered , but [the sentinel]541-the sentinel had returned . [I]1918-i waited on the window - ledge crouched against the wall until [he]158-o'toole should show [me]1918-i [his]158-o'toole back . After five minutes or so [he]158-o'toole did . [He]158-o'toole stamped on the snow and marched up [the lane]1635-the lane . [I]1918-i let [myself]1918-i down and hung by [my]1918-i hands , but [he]158-o'toole turned on [his]158-o'toole beat before [I]1918-i could drop . [He]158-o'toole marched back ; [I]1918-i clung to the ledge , thinking that in the darkness [he]158-o'toole would pass on beneath [me]1918-i and never notice . [He]158-o'toole did not notice ; but [my]1918-i fingers were frozen and numbed with the cold . [I]1918-i felt them slipping ; [I]1918-i could cling no longer , and [I]1918-i fell . Luckily [I]1918-i fell just as [he]158-o'toole passed beneath [me]1918-i ; [I]1918-i dropped feet foremost upon [his]158-o'toole shoulders , and [he]158-o'toole went down without a cry . [I]1918-i left [him]158-o'toole lying stunned there on the snow ; but [he]158-o'toole will be found , or [he]158-o'toole will recover . Either way [our]4121-our escape will be discovered , and no later than this morning . Nay , it must already have been discovered . Already [Innspruck]17-innspruck 's bells are ringing the alarm ; already the pursuit is begun — "[1918-i] and [he]1918-i leaned [his]1918-i head from the window and cried , " Faster ! faster ! "[1918-i] [O'Toole]158-o'toole , for [his]158-o'toole part , shouted , " Trinkgeldt ! "[158-o'toole] It was the only word of German which [he]158-o'toole knew . " But , "[1918-i] said [he]1918-i , " there was [a Saracen lady [I]1918-i learned about at school who travelled over [Europe]7-europe]4122-a saracen lady i learned about at school who travelled over europe and found [[her]4122-a saracen lady i learned about at school who travelled over europe lover]4123-her lover in [an alehouse in [London]22-london]4124-an alehouse in london , with no word but [his]4123-her lover name to help [her]4122-a saracen lady i learned about at school who travelled over europe over [the road]228-the road . Sure , it would be a strange thing if [I]1918-i could n't travel all over [Germany]68-germany with the help of ' [Trinkgeldt]69-trinkgeldt . ' "[1918-i] The word certainly had its efficacy with [the postillion]264-the postillion . " [Trinkgeldt]69-trinkgeldt ! "[158-o'toole] cried [O'Toole]158-o'toole , and the berlin rocked and lurched and leaped down [the pass]1904-the pass . The snow was now less deep , the drifts fewer . [The road]228-the road wound along [a mountain - side]1922-a mountain - side : at one window rose [the rock]1923-the rock ; from the other [the travellers]1924-the travellers looked down hundreds of feet to [the bed of [the valley]274-the valley]1925-the bed of the valley and the boiling torrent of [the Adige]70-the adige . It was a mere narrow ribbon of [a road made by [the Romans]1928-the romans]1927-a road made by the romans , without a thought for the convenience of [travellers]3362-travellers in a later day ; and as [the carriage]287-the carriage turned a corner , [O'Toole]158-o'toole , mounted on [his]158-o'toole horse , saw ahead [a heavy cart]1931-a heavy cart crawling up towards [them]1932-them . [The carter]1933-the carter saw the berlin thundering down towards [him]1933-the carter behind [its four maddened horses]1934-its four maddened horses , and [he]1933-the carter drew [[his]1933-the carter cart]1935-his cart to the inside of [the road]228-the road against [the rock]1923-the rock . [The postillion]264-the postillion tugged at [his]158-o'toole reins ; [he]158-o'toole had not sufficient interval of space to check [[his]158-o'toole team]1939-his team ; [he]158-o'toole threw a despairing glance at [O'Toole]158-o'toole . It seemed impossible [the berlin]4102-the berlin could pass . There was no use to cry out ; [O'Toole]158-o'toole fell behind [the carriage]287-the carriage with [his]158-o'toole mind made up . [He]158-o'toole looked down the precipice ; [he]158-o'toole saw in [his]158-o'toole imagination [the huge carriage]1942-the huge carriage with its tangled , struggling horses falling sheer into the foam of [the river]1943-the river . [He]158-o'toole could not ride back to [Bologna]1-bologna with that story to tell ; [he]158-o'toole and [his]158-o'toole horse must take [the same quick , steep road]1944-the same quick , steep road . [The postillion]264-the postillion drove so close to [the cart]1946-the cart that [he]264-the postillion touched [it]1946-the cart as [he]264-the postillion passed . " [We]4126-we are lost ! "[264-the postillion] [he]264-the postillion shouted in an agony ; and [O'Toole]158-o'toole saw the hind wheel of the berlin slip off [the road]228-the road and revolve for the fraction of a second in the air . [He]158-o'toole was already putting [his]158-o'toole horse at [the precipice]1948-the precipice as though it was a ditch to be jumped , when the berlin made , to [his]158-o'toole astonished eyes , an effort to recover its balance like a live thing . It seemed to spring sideways from the brink of [the precipice]1948-the precipice . It not only seemed , it did spring ; and [O'Toole]158-o'toole , drawing rein , in the great revulsion of [his]158-o'toole feelings , saw , as [he]158-o'toole rocked unsteadily in [his]158-o'toole saddle , [the carriage]287-the carriage tearing safe and unhurt down the very centre of [the road]228-the road . [O'Toole]158-o'toole set [his]158-o'toole spurs to [his]158-o'toole horse and galloped after it . [The postillion]264-the postillion looked back and laughed . " Trinkgeldt ! "[264-the postillion] [he]264-the postillion cried . [O'Toole]158-o'toole swore loudly , and getting level beat [him]264-the postillion with [his]158-o'toole whip . [Wogan]109-wogan 's head popped out of the window . " Silence ! "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan in a rage . " [Mademoiselle]165-mademoiselle de caprara is asleep ; "[109-wogan] and then seeing [O'Toole]158-o'toole 's white and disordered face [he]109-wogan asked , " What is it ? "[109-wogan] [No one in [the coach]1954-the coach]1953-no one in the coach had had a suspicion of [their]1955-they danger . But [O'Toole]158-o'toole still saw before [his]158-o'toole eyes that wheel slip over the precipice and revolve in air , [he]158-o'toole still felt [his]158-o'toole horse beneath [him]158-o'toole quiver and refuse this leap into air . In broken tones [he]158-o'toole gasped out [his]158-o'toole story to [Wogan]109-wogan , and as [he]158-o'toole spoke [the Princess]3107-the princess stirred . " Hush ! "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan ; " [she]3107-the princess need not know . Ride behind , [O'Toole]158-o'toole ! [Your]158-o'toole blue eyes are green with terror . [Your]158-o'toole face will tell the story , if once [she]3107-the princess sees it . "[109-wogan] [O'Toole]158-o'toole fell back again behind [the carriage]287-the carriage , and at four that afternoon [they]1955-they stopped before [the post - house at [Brixen]71-brixen]1958-the post - house at brixen . [They]1955-they had crossed [the Brenner]62-the brenner in a storm of snow and howling winds ; [they]1955-they had travelled ten leagues from [Innspruck]17-innspruck . [Wogan]109-wogan called a halt of half an hour . [The Princess]3107-the princess had eaten barely a mouthful since [her]3107-the princess supper of the night before . [Wogan]109-wogan forced [her]3107-the princess to alight , forced [her]3107-the princess to eat a couple of eggs , and to drink a glass of wine . Before the half - hour had passed , [she]3107-the princess was anxious to start again . From [Brixen]71-brixen [the road]228-the road was easier ; and either from the smoothness of the travelling or through some partial relief from [his]109-wogan anxieties , [Wogan]109-wogan , who had kept awake so long , suddenly fell fast asleep , and when [he]109-wogan woke up again the night was come . [He]109-wogan woke up without a start or even a movement , as was [his]109-wogan habit , and sat silently and bitterly reproaching [himself]109-wogan for that [he]109-wogan had yielded to fatigue . It was pitch - dark within [the carriage]287-the carriage ; [he]109-wogan stared through the window and saw dimly [the moving mountain - side]1962-the moving mountain - side , and here and there a clump of trees rush past . The steady breathing of [Gaydon]142-gaydon , on [his]109-wogan left , and of [Mrs. Misset]143-misset in the corner opposite to [Gaydon]142-gaydon , showed that [those two guardians]1963-those two guardians slept as well . [His]109-wogan reproaches became more bitter and then suddenly ceased , for over against [him]109-wogan in the darkness a young , fresh voice was singing very sweetly and very low . It was [the Princess [Clementina]116-clementina]1436-the princess clementina , and [she]116-clementina sang to [herself]116-clementina , thinking [all three of [[her]116-clementina companions]1902-her companions]1965-all three of her companions were asleep . [Wogan]109-wogan had not caught the sound at first above the clatter of the wheels , and even now that [he]109-wogan listened it came intermittently to [his]109-wogan ears . [He]109-wogan heard enough , however , to know and to rejoice that there was no melancholy in the music . The song had the clear bright thrill of the blackbird 's note in June . [Wogan]109-wogan listened , entranced . [He]109-wogan would have given worlds to have written the song with which [Clementina]116-clementina solaced [herself]116-clementina in the darkness , to have composed the melody on which [her]116-clementina voice rose and sank . [The carriage]287-the carriage drew up at [an inn]3349-an inn ; the horses were changed ; the flight was resumed . [Wogan]109-wogan had not moved during this delay , neither had [Misset]143-misset nor [O'Toole]158-o'toole come to the door . But [an ostler]1969-an ostler had flashed a lantern into [the berlin]4102-the berlin , and for a second the light had fallen upon [Wogan]109-wogan 's face and open eyes . [Clementina]116-clementina , however , did not cease ; [she]116-clementina sang on until the lights had been left behind and the darkness was about them . Then [she]116-clementina stopped and said , — " How long is it since [you]109-wogan woke ? "[116-clementina] [Wogan]109-wogan was taken by surprise . " [I]109-wogan should never have slept at all , "[109-wogan] stammered [he]109-wogan . " [I]109-wogan promised [myself]109-wogan that . Not a wink of sleep betwixt [Innspruck]17-innspruck and [Italy]29-italy ; and here was [I]109-wogan fast as a log [this side of [Trent]52-trent]4127-this side of trent . [I]109-wogan think [our]4128-we postillion sleeps too ; "[109-wogan] and letting down the window [he]109-wogan quietly called [Misset]143-misset . " [We]4128-we have fresh relays , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " and [we]4128-we travel at a snail's - pace . "[109-wogan] " The relays are only fresh to [us]4128-we , "[143-misset] returned [Misset]143-misset . " [We]4128-we can go no faster . There is [someone ahead with three stages]4129-someone ahead with three stages ' start of [us,—someone of importance]4130-us,—someone of importance , it would seem , and who travels with [a retinue]4131-a retinue , for [he]4131-a retinue takes all the horses at each stage . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan thrust [his]109-wogan head out of the window . There was no doubt of it ; the horses lagged . In this hurried flight the most trifling hindrance was a monumental danger , and this was no trifling hindrance . For the hue and cry was most certainly raised behind [them]1971-they ; the pursuit from [Innspruck]17-innspruck had begun twelve hours since , on the most favourable reckoning . At any moment [they]1971-they might hear the jingle of a horse 's harness on [the road]228-the road behind . "[1973-a man with a great retinue blocking their way in front] [Misset]143-misset did not know . "[109-wogan] [The Princess]3107-the princess was silent . [Wogan]109-wogan hoped that [he]109-wogan had reassured [her]3107-the princess . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan stopped , to make sure that [Gaydon]142-gaydon and [Mrs. Misset]143-misset were still asleep . There are [dark lanes there from [Avignon]72-avignon between [great frowning houses]4175-great frowning houses , [narrow climbing streets]4176-narrow climbing streets from [Meran]73-meran]4174-dark lanes there from avignon between great frowning houses , narrow climbing streets from meran , [arcades from [Verona]74-verona]4177-arcades from verona , and [a park of many thickets and tall poplar - trees]4178-a park of many thickets and tall poplar - trees with a long silver stretch of water . [It]4179-that park has a wall too , [my]109-wogan city,—a round wall enclosing [it]4179-that park within a perfect circle ; and from [whatever quarter of [the plain]795-the plain [you]4171-you come towards [it]4179-that park]4180-whatever quarter of the plain you come towards it , [you]4171-you only see this wall , there 's not so much as a chimney visible above it . Once [you]4171-you have crowded with [the caravans]4182-the caravans and [traders]4183-traders through the gates,—for [[my]109-wogan town]4159-my town is busy,—you are at once in [the ringing streets]4185-the ringing streets . [I]109-wogan think [[my]109-wogan architect]4186-my architect in that took [Aigues Mortes]190-aigues mortes for [his]4186-my architect model .
