Well , [I]109-wogan have a notion — "[109-wogan] and then [he]1985-you broke off abruptly . " There 's a black horse [I]1985-you own , [my]1985-you favourite horse . "[1985-you] " [You]1985-you rode it the first time [you]1985-you came to [Ohlau]12-ohlau , "[3107-the princess] said [the Princess]3107-the princess . " Do [you]1985-you indeed remember that ? "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan , with so much pleasure that [Gaydon]142-gaydon stirred in [his]142-gaydon corner , and [Clementina]116-clementina said , " Hush ! "[116-clementina] [Wogan]109-wogan waited in a suspense lest [Gaydon]142-gaydon should wake up , which , to be sure , would be the most inconsiderate thing in [the world]245-the world . [Gaydon]142-gaydon , however , settled [himself]142-gaydon more comfortably , and in a little [his]142-gaydon regular breathing might be heard again . " Well , "[109-wogan] resumed [Wogan]109-wogan , " [I]109-wogan have a notion that [the lady [I]109-wogan shall marry]4197-the lady i shall marry will come riding some sunrise on [my]109-wogan black horse across [the plain]795-the plain and into [[my]109-wogan city of dreams]3080-my city of dreams . And [she]4197-the lady i shall marry has not . "[109-wogan] " Ah , "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina , " here 's a subterfuge , [[my]116-clementina friend]3085-my friend . [The lady [you]3085-my friend shall marry]4201-the lady you shall marry , [you]3085-my friend say . But tell [me]116-clementina this ! Has [the lady [you]3085-my friend love]4202-the lady you love ridden on [your]3085-my friend black horse into [[your]3085-my friend city of dreams]3282-your city of dreams ? "[116-clementina] " No , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan ; " for there is [no lady whom [I]109-wogan love]4204-no lady whom i love . "[109-wogan] There [Wogan]109-wogan should have ended , but [he]109-wogan added rather sadly , " Nor is there like to be . "[109-wogan] " Then [I]116-clementina am sure , "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina . " Sure that [I]116-clementina speak truth ? "[116-clementina] " No , sure that [you]3085-my friend mislead [me]109-wogan . It is not kind ; for here perhaps [I]109-wogan might give [you]3085-my friend some small token of [my]109-wogan gratitude , would [you]3085-my friend but let [me]109-wogan . Oh , it is no matter . [I]109-wogan shall find out who [the lady]219-the lady is . [You]3085-my friend need not doubt it . [I]109-wogan shall set [my]109-wogan wits and eyes to work . There shall be marriages when [I]109-wogan am [Queen]4206-queen . [I]109-wogan will find out ! "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan 's face was not visible in the darkness ; but [he]109-wogan spoke quickly and in a startled voice , — " That [you]3085-my friend must never do . Promise that [you]3085-my friend never will ! Promise [me]109-wogan that [you]3085-my friend will never try ; "[109-wogan] and again [Gaydon]142-gaydon stirred in [his]109-wogan corner . [Clementina]116-clementina made no answer to the passionate words . [She]116-clementina did not promise , but [she]116-clementina drew a breath , and then from head to foot [she]116-clementina shivered . [Wogan]109-wogan dared not repeat [his]109-wogan plea for a promise , but [he]109-wogan felt that though [she]116-clementina had not given it , none the less [she]116-clementina would keep it . [They]1988-they sat for awhile silent . Then [Clementina]116-clementina came back to [her]116-clementina first question . " Tell [me]116-clementina of [the King]3089-the king , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina said very softly . And as [the carriage]287-the carriage rolled down [the mountain valley]1990-the mountain valley through the night and [its]287-the carriage wheels struck flashes of fire from the stones , [Wogan]109-wogan drew a picture for [her]116-clementina of [the man [she]116-clementina was to marry]1991-the man she was to marry . It was a relief to [him]109-wogan to escape from the dangerous talk of the last hour , and [he]109-wogan spoke fervently . [The poet in [him]109-wogan]1992-the poet in him had always been sensitive to the glamour of [that wandering Prince]1993-that wandering prince ; [he]109-wogan had [[his]109-wogan countrymen]1994-his countrymen 's instinctive devotion for a failing cause . This was no suitable moment for dwelling upon the defects and weaknesses . [Wogan]109-wogan told [her]116-clementina the story of the campaign in [Scotland]76-scotland , of [the year 's residence in [Avignon]72-avignon]1995-the year 's residence in avignon . [He]109-wogan spoke most burningly . [A girl]3881-a girl would no doubt like to hear of [her]3881-a girl love 's achievements ; and if [James Stuart]112-james stuart had not so many to [his]112-james stuart name as [a man]235-a man could wish , that was merely because chance had served [him]112-james stuart ill . So a fair tale was told , not to be found in any history book , of a night attack in [Scotland]76-scotland and how [the Chevalier de St. George]114-the chevalier , surprised and already to all purposes [a prisoner]3190-a prisoner , forced a way alone through nine grenadiers with loaded muskets and escaped over the roof - tops . It was a good breathless story as [he]109-wogan told it , and [he]109-wogan had just come to an end of it when [the carriage]287-the carriage drove through [the village of Wellishmile]2000-the village of wellishmile and stopped at [the posting - house]2001-the posting - house . [Wogan]109-wogan opened the door and shook [Gaydon]142-gaydon by the shoulder . " Let [us]4208-us try if [we]4208-us can get [stronger horses]4209-stronger horses [here]3086-here , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , and [he]109-wogan got out . [Gaydon]142-gaydon woke up with surprising alacrity . " [I]109-wogan must have fallen asleep , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [I]109-wogan beseech [[your]142-gaydon Highness]3263-your highness 's forgiveness ; [I]109-wogan have slept this long while . "[109-wogan] It was no business of [his]109-wogan if [Wogan]109-wogan chose to attribute [his]109-wogan own escape from [Newgate]21-newgate as an exploit of [the King]3089-the king 's . The story was a familiar one at [Bologna]1-bologna , whither [they]2003-we were hurrying ; it was sufficiently known that [Charles Wogan]109-wogan was [its hero]2004-its hero . All this was [Wogan]109-wogan 's business , not [Gaydon]142-gaydon 's . Nor had [Gaydon]142-gaydon anything to do with [any city of dreams]2005-any city of dreams or with [any lady that might ride into [it]2005-any city of dreams , or with any black horse that chanced to carry [her]2007-her]2006-any lady that might ride into it , or with any black horse that chanced to carry her . [Poets]191-poets no doubt talked that way . It was [their]2003-we business . [Gaydon]142-gaydon was not sorry that [he]142-gaydon had slept so heartily through those last stages . [He]142-gaydon got down from [the carriage]287-the carriage and met [Wogan]109-wogan coming from [the inn]231-the inn with a face of dismay . " [We]2003-we are stopped here . There is no help for it . [We]2003-we have gained on [the Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden , who is no more than two stages ahead . The relays which carried [him]1434-the prince of baden from [here]3086-here to the next stage have only this instant come back . [They]2003-we are too tired to move . So [we]2003-we must stay until [they]2003-we are refreshed . And [we]2003-we are still three posts [this side of [Trent]52-trent]4127-this side of trent ! "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried . " [I]109-wogan would not mind were [Trent]52-trent behind [us]2003-we . But there 's no help for it . [I]109-wogan have hired [a room where [the Countess]599-the countess and [[her]599-the countess niece]1524-her niece can sleep until such time as [we]2003-we can start]4215-a room where the countess and her niece can sleep until such time as we can start . "[109-wogan] [Clementina]116-clementina and [Mrs. Misset]143-misset descended and supped in company with [Gaydon]142-gaydon and [Wogan]109-wogan , while [Misset]143-misset and [O'Toole]158-o'toole waited upon [them]2010-them as [servants]242-servants . It was a silent sort of supper , very different from the meal [they]2010-them had made that morning . For though the fare was better , it lacked the exhilaration . This delay weighed heavily upon [them]2010-them all . For [the country]847-the country was now for a sure thing raised behind [them]2010-them , and if [they]2010-them had gained on [the Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden , [[their]2010-them pursuers]2014-their pursuers had no less certainly gained on [them]2010-them . " Would [we]2010-them were [t'other side of [Trent]52-trent]4218-t'other side of trent ! "[109-wogan] exclaimed [Wogan]109-wogan ; and looking up [he]109-wogan saw that [Clementina]116-clementina was watching [him]109-wogan with a strange intentness . [Her]116-clementina eyes were on [him]109-wogan again while [they]2010-them sat at supper ; and when [he]109-wogan led [her]116-clementina to the door of [[her]116-clementina room]2015-her room and [she]116-clementina gave [him]109-wogan [her]116-clementina hand , [she]116-clementina stood for a little while looking deep into [his]109-wogan eyes . And though [she]116-clementina had much need of sleep , when [she]116-clementina had got into [the room]317-the room and the door was closed behind [her]116-clementina , [she]116-clementina remained staring at the logs of the fire . For [she]116-clementina knew [his]109-wogan secret , and to [her]116-clementina eyes [he]109-wogan was now [another man]3607-another man . Before , [Wogan]109-wogan was [the untiring servant]2018-the untiring servant , [the unflinching friend]2019-the unflinching friend ; now [he]109-wogan was [the man who loved [her]116-clementina]2020-the man who loved her . The risks [he]109-wogan had run , [his]109-wogan journeyings , [his]109-wogan unswerving confidence in the result , [his]109-wogan laborious days and nights of preparation , and the swift execution,—love as well as service claimed a share in these . [He]109-wogan was changed for ever to [her]116-clementina eyes ; [she]116-clementina knew [his]109-wogan secret . There was the cloud no bigger than [a man]235-a man 's hand . For [she]116-clementina must needs think over all that [he]109-wogan had said and done by the new light [the secret shed]2022-the secret shed . When did [he]109-wogan first begin to care ? Why ? [She]116-clementina recalled [his]109-wogan first visit long ago to [Ohlau]12-ohlau , when [he]109-wogan rode across [the park]2023-the park on [his]109-wogan black horse charged with [his]109-wogan momentous errand . [She]116-clementina had been standing , [she]116-clementina remembered , before the blazing log - fire in [the great stone hall]342-the great stone hall , much as [she]116-clementina was standing now . Great changes had come since then . [She]116-clementina was [[James Stuart]112-james stuart 's chosen wife]2025-james stuart 's chosen wife — and [this man]1530-this man loved [her]116-clementina . [He]1530-this man had no hope of any reward ; [he]1530-this man desired even that [she]116-clementina should not know . [She]116-clementina should no doubt have been properly sorry and compassionate , but [she]116-clementina was [a girl simple and frank]2027-a girl simple and frank . To be loved by [a man who could so endure and strive and ask no guerdon,—that]2028-a man who could so endure and strive and ask no guerdon,—that lifted [her]116-clementina . [She]116-clementina thought the more worthily of [herself]116-clementina because [he]1530-this man loved [her]116-clementina . [She]116-clementina was raised thereby . [She]116-clementina could not be sorry ; [her]116-clementina blood pulsed , [her]116-clementina heart sang , the starry eyes shone with a brighter light . [He]1530-this man loved [her]116-clementina . [She]116-clementina knew [his]1530-this man secret . A little clock chimed the hour upon the mantel - shelf , and lifting [her]116-clementina eyes [she]116-clementina saw that just twenty - four hours had passed since [she]116-clementina had driven out of [Innspruck]17-innspruck up [the Brenner]62-the brenner . As [she]116-clementina got into bed a horse galloped up to [the inn]231-the inn and stopped . [She]116-clementina remembered that [she]116-clementina had not ridden on [his]1530-this man black horse out of the sunrise across [the plain]795-the plain . [He]1530-this man loved [her]116-clementina , and since [he]1530-this man loved [her]116-clementina , surely — [She]116-clementina fell asleep puzzled and wondering why . [She]116-clementina was waked up some two hours afterwards by a rapping on the door , and [she]116-clementina grew hot and [she]116-clementina recognised [Wogan]109-wogan 's voice cautiously whispering to [her]116-clementina to rise with all speed . For in [her]116-clementina dreams from which [she]116-clementina had wakened , [she]116-clementina had ridden across [the flat green plain]2031-the flat green plain into [the round city of dreams]2032-the round city of dreams . When the horse galloped up to the door , [the Princess]3107-the princess turned on [her]3107-the princess side and went to sleep . [In [the common - room]2035-the common - room below [Gaydon]142-gaydon and [Wogan]109-wogan]2034-in the common - room below gaydon and wogan were smoking a pipe of tobacco over the fire . [Both men]1077-both men rose on the instant ; [Wogan]109-wogan stealthily opened the door an inch or so and looked down [the passage]497-the passage . [Gaydon]142-gaydon raised a corner of the blind and peered through the window . [The two remaining members of the party]2038-the two remaining members of the party , [Misset]143-misset and [O'Toole]158-o'toole , who as [lackeys]2039-lackeys had served the supper of [the Princess]3107-the princess , were now eating [their]2038-the two remaining members of the party own . When [the Princess]3107-the princess turned over on [her]3107-the princess side , and [Wogan]109-wogan stepped on tiptoe to the door and [Gaydon]142-gaydon peeped through the window , [Misset]143-misset laid down [his]109-wogan knife and fork , and drawing a flask from [his]109-wogan pocket emptied its contents into an earthenware water - jug which stood upon the table . [O'Toole]158-o'toole , for [his]158-o'toole part , simply continued to eat . " [He]142-gaydon is getting off [his]142-gaydon horse , "[142-gaydon] said [Gaydon]142-gaydon . " Has [he]142-gaydon ridden hard , do [you]142-gaydon think ? "[143-misset] asked [Misset]143-misset . " [He]142-gaydon looks in a mighty ill - humour . "[158-o'toole] [O'Toole]158-o'toole looked up from [his]158-o'toole plate , and became gradually aware that something was occurring . Before [he]158-o'toole could speak , however , [Gaydon]142-gaydon dropped the blind . " [He]142-gaydon is coming in . It will never do for [him]142-gaydon to find [the four of [us]4219-the four of us]4219-the four of us together . [He]142-gaydon may not be [the courier from [Innspruck]17-innspruck]4220-the courier from innspruck ; on the other hand , [he]142-gaydon may , and seeing the four of [us]4219-the four of us [he]142-gaydon will ask questions of [the landlord]218-the landlord . Seeing no more than two , [he]142-gaydon will very likely ask none . "[142-gaydon] [O'Toole]158-o'toole began to understand . [He]158-o'toole understood , at all events , that for [him]158-o'toole there was to be no more supper . If two were to make [themselves]2042-themselves scarce , [he]158-o'toole knew that [he]158-o'toole would be [one of [the two]2044-the two]2043-one of the two . " Very well , "[158-o'toole] said [he]158-o'toole , heaving a sigh which made the glasses on the table dance , and laying [his]158-o'toole napkin down [he]158-o'toole got up . " [Jack]193-jack will find out [the fellow]3410-the fellow 's business . "[109-wogan] [Misset]143-misset nodded [his]158-o'toole head , took up [his]158-o'toole knife and fork again . [He]158-o'toole leaned across the table to [O'Toole]158-o'toole as [the others]2045-the others stepped out of [the room]317-the room . " [You]365-the man speak only French , [Lucius]158-o'toole . [You]365-the man come from [Savoy]77-savoy . "[158-o'toole] [He]158-o'toole had no time to say more , for [the new - comer]2047-the new - comer stamped blustering down [the passage]497-the passage and flung into [the room]317-the room . [The man]365-the man , as [Gaydon]142-gaydon had remarked , was in a mighty ill - humour ; [his]365-the man clothes and [his]365-the man face were splashed with mud , and [he]365-the man seemed , moreover , in the last stage of exhaustion . For though [he]365-the man bawled for [the landlord]218-the landlord it was in a weak , hoarse voice , which did not reach beyond the door . [Misset]143-misset looked at [him]365-the man with sympathy . " [You]365-the man have no doubt come far , "[158-o'toole] said [he]158-o'toole ; " and [the landlord]218-the landlord 's [a laggard]4224-a laggard . Here 's something that may comfort [you]365-the man till [he]218-the landlord comes ; "[158-o'toole] and [he]158-o'toole filled a glass half full with red Tyrol wine from the bottle at [his]158-o'toole elbow . [The man]365-the man thanked [him]158-o'toole and advanced to the table . " It is a raw hot wine , "[143-misset] continued [Misset]143-misset , " and goes better with water ; "[158-o'toole] and [he]158-o'toole filled up the glass from the water - jug . [The courier]3130-the courier reached out [his]3130-the courier hand for it . " [I]3130-the courier am [the thirstiest man in all [Germany]68-germany]4225-the thirstiest man in all germany , "[3130-the courier] said [he]3130-the courier , and [he]3130-the courier took a gulp of the wine and immediately fell to spluttering . " Save [us]4226-us , "[3130-the courier] said [he]3130-the courier , " but this wine is devilishly strong . "[3130-the courier] " Try some more water , "[143-misset] said [Misset]143-misset , and again [he]158-o'toole filled up the glass . [The courier]3130-the courier drank it all in a single draught , and stood winking [his]3130-the courier eyes and shaking [his]3130-the courier head . " That warms [a man]235-a man , "[3130-the courier] said [he]3130-the courier . " It does one good ; "[3130-the courier] and again [he]3130-the courier called for [the landlord]218-the landlord , and this time in a strange voice . [The landlord]218-the landlord still lagged , however , and [Misset]143-misset did not doubt that [Wogan]109-wogan had found a means to detain [him]218-the landlord . [He]158-o'toole filled up [the courier]3130-the courier 's glass again , half wine , half water . [The courier]3130-the courier sat heavily down in a chair . " [I]3130-the courier take the liberty , [gentlemen]3122-gentlemen , "[3130-the courier] said [he]3130-the courier . " [I]3130-the courier am no better than a dung - heap to sit beside [gentlemen]3122-gentlemen . But indeed [I]3130-the courier can stand no longer . Never have [I]3130-the courier stridden across such vile slaughter - house cattle as [they]3122-gentlemen keep for [travellers]3362-travellers on [the Brenner road]4231-the brenner road . [I]3130-the courier have sprained [my]3130-the courier legs with spurring 'em . Seven times , "[3130-the courier] [he]3130-the courier cried with an oath,—"seven times has a horse dropped under [me]3130-the courier to - day . There 's not an inch of [me]3130-the courier unbruised , curse [me]3130-the courier if there is ! [I]3130-the courier 'm a cake of mud . "[3130-the courier] [Misset]143-misset knew very well why [the courier]3130-the courier had suffered these falls . The horses [he]3130-the courier had ridden had first been tired by [the Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden , and then had the last spark of fire flogged out of [them]2061-them by [the Princess]3107-the princess 's postillions . [He]3130-the courier merely shrugged [his]3130-the courier shoulders , however , and said , " That looks ill for [us]4232-us . "[3130-the courier] [The courier]3130-the courier gazed suddenly at [Misset]143-misset , then at [O'Toole]158-o'toole , with a dull sort of suspicion in [his]3130-the courier eyes . " And which way might [you]4232-us [gentlemen]3122-gentlemen be travelling ? "[3130-the courier] " To [Innspruck]17-innspruck ; [we]4232-us 're from [Trent]52-trent , "[143-misset] said [Misset]143-misset , boldly . "[158-o'toole] [The courier]3130-the courier gazed with blank , heavy eyes at [O'Toole]158-o'toole . [He]158-o'toole had the appearance of [a man fuddled with drink]2067-a man fuddled with drink . " That 's very strange , "[158-o'toole] said [he]158-o'toole , solemnly , wagging [his]158-o'toole head . " [I]158-o'toole do not dispute its truth , but it is most strange . [I]158-o'toole will tell [[my]158-o'toole wife]3598-my wife of it . "[158-o'toole] [He]158-o'toole turned in [his]158-o'toole chair , and a twinge from [his]158-o'toole bruises made [him]158-o'toole cry out . " [I]158-o'toole shall be as stiff as a mummy in the morning , "[158-o'toole] [he]158-o'toole exclaimed , and swore loudly at " [the bandits "[158-o'toole] who had caused [him]158-o'toole this deplorable journey]4239-the bandits " who had caused him this deplorable journey . " Did [you]143-misset pass [a travelling carriage]232-a travelling carriage on [the road]228-the road ? "[3130-the courier] " Yes , "[143-misset] said [Misset]143-misset ; " [the Prince of [Baden]55-baden with a large following]4242-the prince of baden with a large following drove into [Trent]52-trent as [we]4243-we came out . "[143-misset] " Yes , yes , "[3130-the courier] said [the courier]3130-the courier . " But [no second party]4244-no second party behind [the Prince]588-the prince ? "[3130-the courier] [Misset]143-misset shook [his]3130-the courier head ; [he]3130-the courier made a pretence of consulting [O'Toole]158-o'toole in French , and [O'Toole]158-o'toole shook [his]158-o'toole head . " Then [I]3130-the courier shall have [the robbers]4246-the robbers , "[3130-the courier] cried [the courier]3130-the courier . " [They]4246-the robbers are to be flayed alive , and [they]4246-the robbers deserve it , "[3130-the courier] [he]3130-the courier shouted fiercely to [Misset]143-misset . " Gallows - birds ! "[3130-the courier] [He]3130-the courier dropped [his]3130-the courier head upon [his]3130-the courier arms and muttered " gallows - birds "[3130-the courier] again . It seemed that [he]3130-the courier was falling asleep , but [he]3130-the courier suddenly sat up and beat on the table with [his]3130-the courier fist . " [I]3130-the courier have eaten nothing since the morning . Ah — gallows- birds — flayed alive , and hanged — no , hanged and flayed alive — no , that 's impossible . "[3130-the courier] [He]3130-the courier drank off the wine which [Misset]143-misset had poured out for [him]3130-the courier , and rose from [his]3130-the courier chair . " Where 's [the landlord]218-the landlord ? [I]3130-the courier want supper . [I]3130-the courier want besides to speak to [him]218-the landlord ; "[3130-the courier] and [he]3130-the courier staggered towards the door . " As for supper , "[143-misset] said [Misset]143-misset , " [we]4248-we shall be glad if [you]3130-the courier will share [ours]4248-we . [Travellers]3362-travellers should be friendly . "[143-misset] [O'Toole]158-o'toole caught [the courier]3130-the courier by the arm and with a polite speech in French drew [him]3130-the courier again down into [his]3130-the courier chair . [The courier]3130-the courier stared at [O'Toole]158-o'toole and forgot all about [the landlord]218-the landlord . [He]3130-the courier had eaten nothing all day , and the wine and the water - jug had gone to [his]3130-the courier head . [He]3130-the courier put a long forefinger on [O'Toole]158-o'toole 's knee . " Say that again , "[3130-the courier] said [he]3130-the courier , and [O'Toole]158-o'toole obeyed . A slow , fat smile spread all over [the courier]3130-the courier 's face . " [I]3130-the courier 'll tell [[my]3130-the courier wife]3598-my wife about it , "[3130-the courier] said [he]3130-the courier . [He]3130-the courier tried to clap [O'Toole]158-o'toole on the back , and missing [him]158-o'toole fell forward with [his]158-o'toole face on the table . The next minute [he]3130-the courier was snoring . [Misset]143-misset walked round the table and deftly picked [his]3130-the courier pockets . There was a package in one of [them]2076-them superscribed to " [Prince Taxis]195-prince taxis , [the Governor of [Trent]52-trent]4251-the governor of trent . "[143-misset] [Misset]143-misset deliberately broke the seal and read the contents . [He]3130-the courier handed the package to [O'Toole]158-o'toole , who read it , and then flinging it upon the ground danced upon it . [Misset]143-misset went out of [the room]317-the room and found [Wogan]109-wogan and [Gaydon]142-gaydon keeping watch by [Clementina]116-clementina 's door . To [them]2078-them [he]3130-the courier spoke in a whisper . " [The fellow]3410-the fellow brings letters from [General Heister]123-general heister to [the Governor of [Trent]52-trent]4251-the governor of trent to stop [us]1088-the three men at all costs . But [his]3410-the fellow letters are destroyed , and [he]3410-the fellow 's lying dead - drunk on the table . "[3130-the courier] [The three men]1088-the three men quickly concerted a plan . [The Princess]3107-the princess must be roused ; a start must be made at once ; and [O'Toole]158-o'toole must be left behind to keep a watch upon [the courier]3130-the courier , [Wogan]109-wogan rapped at the door and waked [Clementina]116-clementina ; [he]109-wogan sent [Gaydon]142-gaydon to [the stables]476-the stables to bribe [the ostlers]2083-the ostlers , and with [Misset]143-misset went down to inform [O'Toole]158-o'toole . [O'Toole]158-o'toole , however , was sitting with [his]158-o'toole eyes closed and [his]158-o'toole head nodding , surrounded by scraps of the letter which [he]158-o'toole had danced to pieces . [Wogan]109-wogan shook [him]158-o'toole by the shoulder , and [he]158-o'toole opened [his]158-o'toole eyes and smiled fatuously . " [He]158-o'toole means to tell [[his]158-o'toole wife]589-his wife , "[158-o'toole] [he]158-o'toole said with a foolish gurgle of laughter . " [He]158-o'toole must be [an ass]4255-an ass . [I]143-misset do n't think if [I]143-misset had [a wife]3121-a wife [I]143-misset should tell [her]3121-a wife . Would [you]109-wogan , [Wogan]109-wogan , tell [[your]109-wogan wife]3716-your wife if [you]109-wogan had one ? [Misset]143-misset would n't tell [[his]158-o'toole wife]589-his wife . "[143-misset] [Misset]143-misset interrupted [him]158-o'toole . " What have [you]109-wogan drank since [I]158-o'toole went out of [the room]317-the room ? "[158-o'toole] [he]158-o'toole asked roughly . [He]158-o'toole took up the water - jug and turned it topsy - turvy . It was quite empty . " Only water , "[158-o'toole] said [O'Toole]158-o'toole , dreamily , and [he]158-o'toole laughed again . " Now [I]158-o'toole would n't mind telling [[my]158-o'toole wife]3598-my wife that , "[158-o'toole] said [he]158-o'toole . [Misset]143-misset let [him]158-o'toole go and turned with a gesture of despair to [Wogan]109-wogan . " [I]143-misset poured [my]143-misset flask out into the water - bottle . It was full of burnt Strasbourg brandy , of double strength . It is as potent as opium . [Neither of [them]4262-them]4261-neither of them will have [his]109-wogan wits before to - morrow . It will not help [us]4263-we to leave [O'Toole]158-o'toole to guard [the courier]3130-the courier . "[143-misset] " And [we]4263-we can not take [him]109-wogan , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . " There is [the Princess to be thought of]4265-the princess to be thought of . [We]4263-we must leave [him]109-wogan , and [we]4263-we can not leave [him]109-wogan alone , for [his]109-wogan neck 's in danger,—more than in danger if [the courier]3130-the courier wakes before [him]109-wogan . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan picked up carefully the scraps of the letter and placed them in the middle of the fire . They were hardly burnt before [Gaydon]142-gaydon came into [the room]317-the room with word that horses were already being harnessed to [the berlin]4102-the berlin . [Wogan]109-wogan explained [their]2086-their predicament . " [We]4263-we must choose which of [us]4263-we three shall stay behind , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " Which of [us]4263-we two , "[143-misset] [Misset]143-misset corrected , pointing to [Gaydon]142-gaydon and [himself]109-wogan . " When [the Princess]3107-the princess drives into [Bologna]1-bologna , [Charles Wogan]109-wogan , who first had the high heart to dare this exploit , the brain to plot , the hand to execute [it,—Charles Wogan]109-wogan must ride at [her]3107-the princess side , not [Misset]143-misset , not [Gaydon]142-gaydon . [I]109-wogan take [no man]1254-no man 's honours . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan shook [Wogan]109-wogan by the hand as [he]109-wogan spoke , and [he]109-wogan had spoken with an extraordinary warmth of admiration . [Gaydon]142-gaydon could do no less than follow [[his]142-gaydon companion]649-his companion 's example , though there was a shade of embarrassment in [his]142-gaydon manner of assenting . It was not that [he]142-gaydon had any envy of [Wogan]109-wogan , or any desire to rob [him]109-wogan of a single tittle of [his]109-wogan due credit . There was nothing mean in [Gaydon]142-gaydon 's nature , but here was a halving of [[Clementina]116-clementina 's protectors]2088-clementina 's protectors , and [he]142-gaydon could not stifle a suspicion that [the best man of the four to leave behind]2089-the best man of the four to leave behind was really [Charles Wogan]109-wogan [himself]109-wogan . Not a word , however , of this could [he]142-gaydon say , and so [he]142-gaydon nodded [his]142-gaydon assent to [Misset]143-misset 's proposal . " It is [I]142-gaydon , then , who stay behind with O'Toole and [the courier]3130-the courier , "[142-gaydon] [he]142-gaydon said . " [Misset]143-misset has [a wife]3121-a wife ; the lot evidently falls to [me]142-gaydon . [We]4271-we will make a shift somehow or another to keep [the fellow]3410-the fellow quiet till sundown to - morrow , which time should see [you]142-gaydon out of danger . "[142-gaydon] [He]142-gaydon unbuckled the sword from [his]142-gaydon waist and laid it on the table , and that simple action somehow touched [Wogan]109-wogan to the heart . [He]142-gaydon slipped [his]142-gaydon arm into [Gaydon]142-gaydon 's and said remorsefully , — " [Dick]169-dick , [I]142-gaydon do hate to leave [you]142-gaydon , [you]142-gaydon and [Lucius]158-o'toole . [I]142-gaydon swept [you]142-gaydon into the peril , [you]142-gaydon two , [[my]142-gaydon friends]3416-my friends , and now [I]142-gaydon leave [you]142-gaydon in the thick of it to find a way out for [yourselves]142-gaydon . But there is no remedy , is there ? [I]142-gaydon shall not rest until [I]142-gaydon see [you]142-gaydon both again . Goodbye , [Lucius]158-o'toole . "[142-gaydon] [He]142-gaydon looked at [O'Toole]158-o'toole sprawling with outstretched legs upon [his]158-o'toole groaning chair . " [My]142-gaydon six feet four , "[142-gaydon] said [he]142-gaydon , turning to [Gaydon]142-gaydon ; " [you]142-gaydon must give [me]142-gaydon the passport . Have a good care of [him]158-o'toole , [Dick]169-dick ; "[142-gaydon] and [he]142-gaydon gripped [O'Toole]158-o'toole affectionately by the arms for a second , and then taking the passport hurried from [the room]317-the room . [Gaydon]142-gaydon had seldom seen [Wogan]109-wogan so moved . [The berlin]4102-the berlin was brought round to the door ; [the Princess , rosy with sleep]2092-the princess , rosy with sleep , stepped into [it]4102-the berlin ; [Wogan]109-wogan had brought with [him]109-wogan a muff , and [he]109-wogan slipped it over [Clementina]116-clementina 's feet to keep [her]116-clementina warm during the night ; [Misset]143-misset took [Gaydon]142-gaydon 's place , and [the postillion]264-the postillion cracked [his]264-the postillion whip and set off towards [Trent]52-trent . [Gaydon]142-gaydon , sitting before the fire in [the parlour]2094-the parlour , heard the wheels grate upon [the road]228-the road ; [he]142-gaydon had a vision of the berlin thundering through the night with a trail of sparks from the wheels ; and [he]142-gaydon wondered whether [Misset]143-misset was asleep or merely leaning back with [his]264-the postillion eyes shut , and thus visiting incognito [Woman]196-woman 's fairy - land of dreams . However , [Gaydon]142-gaydon consoled [himself]142-gaydon with the reflection that it was none of [his]142-gaydon business . But [Gaydon]142-gaydon was out of [his]142-gaydon reckoning . There were no fairy tales told for [Misset]143-misset to overhear , and [the Princess]3107-the princess [Clementina]116-clementina slept in [[her]116-clementina corner of [the carriage]287-the carriage]2097-her corner of the carriage . If a jolt upon a stone wakened [her]116-clementina , a movement opposite told [her]116-clementina that [her]116-clementina sentinel was watchful and alert . Three times [the berlin]4102-the berlin stopped for a change of horses ; and on each occasion [Wogan]109-wogan was out of the door and hurrying [the ostlers]2083-the ostlers before the wheels had ceased to revolve . " [You]109-wogan should sleep , [[my]116-clementina friend]3085-my friend , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina . " Not till [we]4275-we reach [Italy]29-italy , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan replied ; and with the confidence of [a child]3225-a child [she]116-clementina nestled warmly in [her]116-clementina cloak again and closed [her]116-clementina eyes . This feeling of security was a new luxury to [her]116-clementina after the months of anxiety and prison . The grey light of the morning stole into [the berlin]4102-the berlin and revealed to [her]116-clementina the erect and tireless figure of [[her]116-clementina saviour]2103-her saviour . The sun leaped down [the mountain - peaks]2104-the mountain - peaks , and the grey of the light was now a sparkling gold . [Wogan]109-wogan bade [her]116-clementina Highness look from the carriage window , and [she]116-clementina could not restrain a cry of delight . On [her]116-clementina left , [mountain - ridge]2105-mountain - ridge rose behind [mountain - ridge]2105-mountain - ridge , away to [the towering limestone cliffs of [Monte Scanupia]79-monte scanupia]2107-the towering limestone cliffs of monte scanupia ; on [her]116-clementina right , [the white peaks of [the Orto d'Abram]2109-the orto d'abram]2108-the white peaks of the orto d'abram flashed to the sun ; and between [the hills]224-the hills [the broad valley of [the Adige]70-the adige]2111-the broad valley of the adige rolled [southwards,—a summer country of [villages and vines]2113-villages and vines]2112-southwards,—a summer country of villages and vines , of mulberry - trees and [fields of maize]2114-fields of maize , in the midst of which rose [the belfries of [an Italian town]2116-an italian town]2115-the belfries of an italian town . " This is [Italy]29-italy , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina cried . " But [[the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's [Italy]29-italy]4277-the emperor 's italy , "[109-wogan] answered [Wogan]109-wogan ; and at half - past nine that morning [the carriage]287-the carriage stopped in [the public square of [Trent]52-trent]2118-the public square of trent . As [Wogan]109-wogan stepped onto the ground , [he]109-wogan saw a cloud of dust at the opposite side of [the square]893-the square , and wrapped in that cloud [men on horseback]2120-men on horseback like [soldiers in the smoke of battle]2121-soldiers in the smoke of battle ; [he]109-wogan heard , too , the sound of wheels . [The Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden had that instant driven away , and [he]1434-the prince of baden had taken every procurable horse in [the town]3115-the town . [Wogan]109-wogan 's own horses could go no further . [He]109-wogan came back to the door of [the carriage]287-the carriage . " [I]109-wogan must search through [Trent]52-trent , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " on the mere chance of finding what will serve [us]4278-us . [[Your]116-clementina Highness]3263-your highness must wait in [the inn]231-the inn ; "[109-wogan] and [Clementina]116-clementina , muffling [her]116-clementina face , said to [him]109-wogan , — " [I]116-clementina dare not . [My]116-clementina face is known in [Trent]52-trent , though this is the first time ever [I]116-clementina saw it . "[116-clementina] [Wogan]109-wogan left [Misset]143-misset to stand sentinel , and hurried off upon [[his]109-wogan business]2125-his business . [He]109-wogan ran from [stable]2126-stable to [stable]2126-stable , from [inn]2128-inn to [inn]2128-inn . [The Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden had hired [thirty - six horses]2131-thirty - six horses ; six more were nowhere to be found . [Wogan]109-wogan would be content with four ; [he]109-wogan ended in a prayer for two . At [each house]2132-each house the door was shut in [his]109-wogan face . [Wogan]109-wogan was in despair ; nowhere could delay be so dangerous as at [Trent]52-trent , where there were [soldiers]1199-soldiers , and [a Governor who would not hesitate to act without orders if [he]2134-a governor who would not hesitate to act without orders if he suspected the princess clementina suspected [the Princess Clementina]1436-the princess clementina]2134-a governor who would not hesitate to act without orders if he suspected the princess clementina was escaping through [[his]2134-a governor who would not hesitate to act without orders if he suspected the princess clementina town]2136-his town . Two hours had passed in [Wogan]109-wogan 's vain search,—two hours of daylight , during which [Clementina]116-clementina had sat in [an unharnessed carriage]2137-an unharnessed carriage in [the market square]892-the market square . [Wogan]109-wogan ran back to [the square]893-the square , half expecting to find that [she]116-clementina had been recognised and arrested . As [he]109-wogan reached [the square]893-the square , [he]109-wogan saw that [curious people]2141-curious people were loitering about [the carriage]287-the carriage ; as [he]109-wogan pushed through [them]2141-curious people , [he]109-wogan heard [them]2141-curious people questioning why [travellers]3362-travellers should on so hot a morning of spring sit muffled up in [a close , dark carriage]2144-a close , dark carriage when [they]3362-travellers could take [their]3362-travellers ease beneath trees in [the inn - garden]2145-the inn - garden . [One man]3159-one man laughed out at [the Princess]3107-the princess and the comical figure [she]3107-the princess made with [her]3107-the princess scarlet cloak drawn tight about [her]3107-the princess face . [Wogan]109-wogan [himself]109-wogan had bought that cloak in [Strasbourg]32-strasbourg to guard [[his]109-wogan Princess]2148-his princess from the cold of [the Brenner]62-the brenner , and guessed what discomfort its ermine lining must now be costing [her]3107-the princess . And [this lout]2149-this lout dared to laugh and make [her]3107-the princess , [this incomparable woman]2150-this incomparable woman , a butt for [his]109-wogan ridicule ! [Wogan]109-wogan took a step towards [the fellow]3410-the fellow with [his]109-wogan fists clenched , but thought the better of [his]109-wogan impulse , and turning away ran to [the palace of [Prince Taxis]195-prince taxis]2152-the palace of prince taxis . This desperate course alone remained to [him]109-wogan ; [he]109-wogan must have speech with [the Prince - bishop]2153-the prince - bishop [himself]109-wogan . At [the palace]629-the palace , however , [he]109-wogan was informed that [the Prince]588-the prince was in bed with [the gout]2156-the gout . [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan , however , insisted . " [You]4284-you will present [my]109-wogan duties to [the Prince]588-the prince ; [you]4284-you will show [him]588-the prince [my]109-wogan passport ; [you]4284-you will say that [the Count of Cernes]1307-the count of cernes has business of the last importance in [Italy]29-italy , and begs permission , since [the Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden has hired every post - horse in [the town]3115-the town , to requisition half a dozen farm - horses from [the fields]345-the fields . "[109-wogan] [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan kicked [his]109-wogan heels in [the courtyard]2157-the courtyard while the message was taken . At any moment some rumour of the curious spectacle in [the square]893-the square might be brought to [the palace]629-the palace and excite inquiry . There might be [another courier in pursuit]2160-another courier in pursuit besides [the man whom [Gaydon]142-gaydon kept [a prisoner]3190-a prisoner]2161-the man whom gaydon kept a prisoner . [Wogan]109-wogan was devoured with a fever of impatience . It seemed to [him]109-wogan hours before [[the Prince]588-the prince 's secretary]2164-the prince 's secretary returned to [him]109-wogan . [The secretary]412-the secretary handed [him]109-wogan back [his]109-wogan passport , and on the part of [the Prince]588-the prince made a speech full of civilities . " Here 's a great deal of jam , [sir]3070-sir , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . " [I]109-wogan misdoubt [me]109-wogan but what there 's a most unpalatable pill hidden away in it . "[109-wogan] " Indeed , "[412-the secretary] said [the secretary]412-the secretary , " [the Prince]588-the prince begs [you]109-wogan to be content and to wait for the post - horses to return . "[412-the secretary] " Ah , ah ! "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan , " but that 's the one thing [I]109-wogan can not do . [I]109-wogan must speak plainly , it appears . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan drew [the secretary]412-the secretary out of ear - shot , and resumed : " [My]109-wogan particular business is to catch up [the Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden . [He]588-the prince is summoned back to [Innspruck]17-innspruck . Do [you]412-the secretary understand ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan asked significantly . " [Sir]3070-sir , [we]4294-we are well informed in [Trent]52-trent as to [the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's wishes , "[412-the secretary] said [the secretary]412-the secretary , with a great deal of dignity . " No , no , [[my]109-wogan friend]3085-my friend , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . "[109-wogan] [The secretary]412-the secretary stepped back in surprise . " By [[her]1434-the prince of baden Highness [the Princess]3107-the princess]4299-her highness the princess ? "[412-the secretary] [he]412-the secretary exclaimed . " [She]4299-her highness the princess changes [her]4299-her highness the princess mind ; [she]4299-her highness the princess is willing where before [she]4299-her highness the princess was obdurate . To tell [you]412-the secretary the truth , [the Prince]588-the prince plied [her]4299-her highness the princess too hard , and [she]4299-her highness the princess would have none of [him]588-the prince . Now that [he]588-the prince turns [his]588-the prince back and puts the miles as fast as [he]588-the prince can between [himself]588-the prince and [her]4299-her highness the princess , [she]4299-her highness the princess can not sleep for want of [him]588-the prince . "[412-the secretary] [The secretary]412-the secretary nodded [his]412-the secretary head sagaciously . " [[Her]4299-her highness the princess Highness]3138-her highness is [a woman]234-a woman , "[412-the secretary] said [he]412-the secretary , " and that explains all . But it will do [her]3138-her highness no harm to suffer a little longer for [her]3138-her highness obstinacy , and , to tell [you]412-the secretary the truth , [the Prince Taxis]4304-the prince taxis is so tormented with the gout that — "[412-the secretary] " That [you]412-the secretary are unwilling to approach [him]4304-the prince taxis a second time , "[109-wogan] interrupted [Wogan]109-wogan . " [I]412-the secretary have no doubt of it . [I]412-the secretary have [myself]412-the secretary seen [prelates]4305-prelates in a most unprelatical mood . But here is a case where needs must .
