" [A mad Irishman who has vowed to free [[her]3138-her highness Highness]3138-her highness]4308-a mad irishman who has vowed to free her highness . "[412-the secretary] " [He]4304-the prince taxis has set out from [Strasbourg]32-strasbourg with that aim . "[412-the secretary] " [He]4304-the prince taxis will hang for it , then , but [he]4304-the prince taxis will never rescue [her]3138-her highness ; "[412-the secretary] and [the secretary]412-the secretary began to laugh . " [I]412-the secretary can not upon [my]412-the secretary honour vex [the Prince]588-the prince again because a gallows - bird has prated in [his]4304-the prince taxis cups . "[412-the secretary] " No , no , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan ; " [you]412-the secretary do not follow [me]109-wogan . [Charles Wogan]109-wogan will come to the gallows over this adventure . For [my]109-wogan part , [I]109-wogan would have [him]109-wogan broken on the wheel and tortured in many uncomfortable ways . These Irishmen all [the world]245-the world over are [pestilent fellows]4312-pestilent fellows . But the trouble is this : If [[her]3138-her highness Highness]3138-her highness hears of [his]109-wogan attempt , [she]3138-her highness is , as [you]412-the secretary sagely discovered , [a woman]234-a woman , a trivial , trifling thing . [She]3138-her highness will be absurd enough to imagine [her]3138-her highness rescue possible ; [she]3138-her highness will again change [her]3138-her highness mind , and it is precisely that which [General Heister]123-general heister fears . [He]123-general heister would have [her]3138-her highness formally betrothed to [the Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden before [Charles Wogan]109-wogan is caught and hanged sky - high . Therefore , since [I]109-wogan was pressing into [Italy]29-italy , [he]123-general heister charged [me]109-wogan with this message to [the Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden . Now observe this , if [you]412-the secretary please . Suppose that [I]109-wogan do not overtake [the Prince]588-the prince ; suppose that [[her]3138-her highness Highness]3138-her highness hears of [Wogan]109-wogan 's coming and again changes [her]3138-her highness mind,—who will be to blame ? Not [I]109-wogan , for [I]109-wogan have done [my]109-wogan best , not [Prince Taxis]195-prince taxis , for [he]195-prince taxis is not informed , but [[Prince Taxis]195-prince taxis 's secretary]4319-prince taxis 's secretary . "[109-wogan] [The secretary]412-the secretary yielded to [Wogan]109-wogan 's argument . [He]109-wogan might be in a great fear of [Prince Taxis]195-prince taxis , but [he]109-wogan was in a greater of [the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's wrath . [He]109-wogan left [Wogan]109-wogan again , and in a little while came back with the written permission which [Wogan]109-wogan desired . [Wogan]109-wogan wasted no time in unnecessary civilities ; the morning had already been wasted . The clocks were striking one as [he]109-wogan hurried away from [the palace]629-the palace , and before two [the Princess Clementina]116-clementina was able to throw back [her]116-clementina cloak from about [her]116-clementina face and take the air ; for [the berlin]4102-the berlin was on [the road from [Trent]52-trent to [Roveredo]64-roveredo]2178-the road from trent to roveredo . " Those were the four worst hours since [we]4320-we left [Innspruck]17-innspruck , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina said . " [I]116-clementina thought [I]116-clementina should suffocate . "[116-clementina] The revulsion from despair , the knowledge that each beat of the hoofs brought [them]2179-them nearer to safety , the glow of the sun upon [a country which was [Italy]29-italy in all but name]2180-a country which was italy in all but name , raised [them]2179-them all to the top of [their]2179-them spirits . [Clementina]116-clementina was in [her]116-clementina gayest mood ; [she]116-clementina lavished caresses upon [[her]116-clementina " little woman]4321-her " little woman , "[116-clementina] as [she]116-clementina called [Mrs. Misset]143-misset ; [she]116-clementina would have [Wogan]109-wogan give [her]116-clementina an account of [his]109-wogan interview with [[Prince Taxis]195-prince taxis 's secretary]4319-prince taxis 's secretary ; [she]116-clementina laughed with the merriest enjoyment over [his]109-wogan abuse of [Charles Wogan]109-wogan . " But it was not [myself]109-wogan alone whom [I]109-wogan slandered , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [[Your]116-clementina Highness]3263-your highness had a share of [our]4323-our abuse . [Our]4323-our heads wagged gravely over [woman]3693-woman 's inconstancies . It was not in nature but [you]116-clementina must change [your]116-clementina mind . Indeed , [[your]116-clementina Highness]3263-your highness would have laughed . "[109-wogan] But at all events [[her]116-clementina Highness]3138-her highness did not laugh now . On the contrary , [her]3138-her highness eyes lost all their merriment , and [her]3138-her highness blood rushed hotly into [her]3138-her highness cheeks . [She]3138-her highness became for that afternoon [a creature of moods]2183-a creature of moods , now talking quickly and perhaps a trifle wildly , now relapsing into long silences . [Wogan]109-wogan was troubled by a thought that the strain of [her]3138-her highness journey was telling its tale even upon [her]3138-her highness vigorous youth . It may be that [she]3138-her highness noted [his]109-wogan look of anxiety , but [she]3138-her highness said to [him]109-wogan abruptly and with a sort of rebellion , — " [You]109-wogan would despise [any woman who had the temerity to change]4326-any woman who had the temerity to change [her]4326-any woman who had the temerity to change mind . "[3138-her highness] " Nay ; [I]3138-her highness do not say that . "[3138-her highness] " But it is merely politeness that restrains [you]109-wogan . [You]109-wogan would despise [her]4326-any woman who had the temerity to change , judging [her]4326-any woman who had the temerity to change by [men]289-men . When [a man]235-a man changes [his]235-a man mind , why , it is so , [he]235-a man changes [his]235-a man mind . But when [a girl]3881-a girl does , it may well be that for the first time [she]3881-a girl is seriously exercising [her]3881-a girl judgment . For [her]3881-a girl upbringing renders it natural that [she]3881-a girl should allow [others]460-others to make up [her]3881-a girl mind for [her]3881-a girl at the first . "[3138-her highness] " That [I]109-wogan think is very true , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . [Clementina]116-clementina , however , was not satisfied with [his]109-wogan assent . [She]116-clementina attacked [him]109-wogan again and almost vindictively . " [You]109-wogan of course would never change [your]109-wogan mind for any reason , once it was fixed . [You]109-wogan are resolute . [You]109-wogan are quite , quite perfect . "[116-clementina] [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan could not imagine what [he]109-wogan had done thus to provoke [her]116-clementina irony . " [Madam]3071-madam , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan pleaded , " [I]109-wogan am not in truth so obstinate a fellow as [you]116-clementina make [me]109-wogan out . [I]109-wogan have often changed [my]109-wogan mind . [I]109-wogan take some pride in it on occasion . "[109-wogan] [Her]116-clementina Highness inclined to a greater graciousness . " [I]109-wogan am glad to know it . [You]116-clementina shall give [me]109-wogan examples . [One]3129-one may have a stiff neck and yet no cause for pride . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan looked so woe - begone under this reproof that [Clementina]116-clementina suddenly broke out into a laugh , and so showed [herself]116-clementina in a fresh and more familiar mood . The good - humour continued ; [she]116-clementina sat opposite to [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan ; if [she]116-clementina moved , [her]116-clementina hand , [her]116-clementina knee , [her]116-clementina foot , must needs touch [his]109-wogan ; [she]116-clementina made [him]109-wogan tell [her]116-clementina stories of [his]109-wogan campaigns ; and so the evening came upon [them,—an]2184-them,—an evening of stars and mysterious quiet and a clear , dark sky . [They]2185-they passed [Roveredo]64-roveredo ; [they]2185-they drew near to [Ala]63-ala , [the last village in [the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's territories]2186-the last village in the emperor 's territories . [Five miles beyond [Ala]63-ala]2188-five miles beyond ala [they]2185-they would be on [Venetian]81-venetian soil , and already [they]2185-they saw the lights of [the village]789-the village twinkling like so many golden candles . But the berlin , which had drawn [them]2185-they so stoutly over [these rugged mountain - roads]2190-these rugged mountain - roads , failed [them]2185-they at the last . One of the hind wheels jolted violently upon a great stone , there was a sudden cracking of wood , and [the carriage]287-the carriage lurched over , throwing its occupants one against the other . [Wogan]109-wogan disentangled [himself]109-wogan , opened the door , and sprang out . [He]109-wogan sprang out into a pool of water . One glance at [the carriage]287-the carriage , dark though the night was , told [him]109-wogan surely what had happened . The axle - tree was broken . [He]109-wogan saw that [Clementina]116-clementina was about to follow [him]109-wogan . " There is water , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " It is ankle - deep . "[109-wogan] " And no white stone , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina answered with a laugh , " whereon [I]116-clementina can safely set [my]116-clementina foot ? "[116-clementina] " No , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " but [you]116-clementina can trust without fear to [my]109-wogan arms ; "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan reached them out to [her]116-clementina . " Can [I]116-clementina ? "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina , in a curious voice ; and when [he]109-wogan had lifted [her]116-clementina from [the carriage]287-the carriage , [she]116-clementina was aware that [she]116-clementina could not . [He]109-wogan lifted [her]116-clementina daintily , like a piece of porcelain ; but to lift [her]116-clementina was not enough , [he]109-wogan must carry [her]116-clementina . [His]109-wogan arms tightened about [her]116-clementina waist , [hers]116-clementina in spite of [herself]116-clementina about [his]109-wogan shoulders . [He]109-wogan took a step or two from [the carriage]287-the carriage , with the water washing over [his]109-wogan boots , and the respectful support of [a servant]1509-a servant became the warm grip of [a man]235-a man . [He]109-wogan no longer held [her]116-clementina daintily ; [he]109-wogan clipped [her]116-clementina close to [him]109-wogan , straining [her]116-clementina breasts against [his]109-wogan chest ; [he]109-wogan was on fire with [her]116-clementina . [She]116-clementina could not but know it ; [his]109-wogan arms shook , [his]109-wogan bosom heaved ; [she]116-clementina felt the quick hammering of [his]109-wogan heart ; and a murmur , an inarticulate murmur , of infinite longing trembled from [his]109-wogan throat . And something of [his]109-wogan madness passed into [her]116-clementina and made a sweet tumult in [her]116-clementina blood . [He]109-wogan stopped still holding [her]116-clementina ; [he]109-wogan felt [her]116-clementina fingers clasp tighter ; [he]109-wogan looked downwards into [her]116-clementina face upturned to [his]109-wogan . [They]2197-they were alone for a moment , [these two]1054-these two , alone in [an uninhabited world]2199-an uninhabited world . [The broken carriage]2200-the broken carriage , the busy fingers about it , the smoking horses , the lights of [Ala]63-ala twinkling in [the valley]274-the valley , had not even the substance of shadows . [They]2197-they simply were not , and [they]2197-they never had been . There were just [two people alive between the Poles,—not princess and [servant]2203-servant , but [man]3319-man and woman in the primitive relationship of [rescuer and rescued]2205-rescuer and rescued]2202-two people alive between the poles,—not princess and servant , but man and woman in the primitive relationship of rescuer and rescued ; and [they]2197-they stood in the dark of a translucent night of spring , with the stars throbbing above [them]2197-they to the time of [their]2197-they passionate hearts , and the earth stretching about [them]2197-they rich as black velvet . [He]109-wogan looked down into [her]116-clementina eyes as once in the night - time [he]109-wogan had done before ; and again [he]109-wogan marvelled at their steadiness and their mysterious depths . [Her]116-clementina eyes were fixed on [his]109-wogan and did not flinch ; [her]116-clementina arms were close about [his]109-wogan neck ; [he]109-wogan bent [his]109-wogan head towards [her]116-clementina , and [she]116-clementina said in a queer , toneless voice , low but as steady as [her]116-clementina eyes , — " [I]116-clementina know . Ah , but well [I]116-clementina know . Last night [I]116-clementina dreamed ; [I]116-clementina rode on [your]109-wogan black horse into [[your]109-wogan city of dreams]3282-your city of dreams ; "[116-clementina] and the moment of passion ended in farce . For [Wogan]109-wogan , startled by the words , set [her]116-clementina down there and then into [the pool]2206-the pool . [She]116-clementina stood over [her]116-clementina ankles in water . [She]116-clementina uttered a little cry and shivered . Then [she]116-clementina laughed and sprang lightly onto dry soil , making much of [[her]116-clementina companion]1796-her companion 's awkwardness . [Wogan]109-wogan joined in the laughter , finding therein as [she]116-clementina did a cover and a cloak . " [We]4334-we must walk to [Ala]63-ala , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " It is as well , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina . " There was a time when [cavaliers]4335-cavaliers laid [their]4335-cavaliers cloaks in the mud to save [a lady]3124-a lady 's shoe - sole . "[116-clementina] " [Madam]3071-madam , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , " the chivalry of to - day has the same intention . "[109-wogan] " But in its effect , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina , " it is more rheumatical . "[116-clementina] [Wogan]109-wogan searched in [the carriage]287-the carriage and drew out a coil of rope which [he]109-wogan slung across [his]109-wogan shoulders like a bandolier . [Clementina]116-clementina laughed at [him]109-wogan for [his]109-wogan precautions , but [Wogan]109-wogan was very serious . " [I]109-wogan would not part with it , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [I]109-wogan never travelled for four days without being put to it for a piece of rope . "[109-wogan] [They]2209-they left [the postillion]264-the postillion to make what [he]109-wogan could of [the berlin]4102-the berlin and walked forward in the clear night to [Ala.]88-ala. The shock of the tumble had alarmed [Mrs. Misset]143-misset ; the fatigue of the journey had strained [her]143-misset endurance to the utmost . [She]143-misset made no complaint , but [she]143-misset could walk but slowly and with many rests by the way . It took a long while for [them]2209-they to reach [the village]789-the village . [They]2209-they saw the lights diminish in [the houses]2213-the houses ; the stars grew pale ; there came a hint of morning in the air . The laughter at [Wogan]109-wogan 's awkwardness had long since died away , and [they]2209-they walked in silence . Forty - eight hours had passed since [the berlin]4102-the berlin left [Innspruck]17-innspruck . Twenty - four hours ago [Clementina]116-clementina knew [Wogan]109-wogan 's secret . Now [he]109-wogan was aware that [she]116-clementina knew it . [They]2209-they could not look into [each other]259-each other 's faces , but [their]2209-they eyes conversed of it . If [they]2209-they turned [their]2209-they heads sharply away , that aversion of [their]2209-they gaze spoke no less clearly . There was a link between [them]2209-they now , and a secret link , the sweeter on that account , perhaps,—certainly the more dangerous . The cloud had grown much bigger than [a man]235-a man 's hand . Moreover , [she]116-clementina had never seen [James Stuart]112-james stuart ; [she]116-clementina had [his]112-james stuart picture , it is true , but the picture could not recall . It must create , not revivify [his]112-james stuart image to [her]116-clementina thoughts , and that it could not do ; so that [he]112-james stuart remained a shadowy figure to [her]116-clementina , a mere number of features , almost an abstraction . On the other hand [[the King]3089-the king 's emissary]2218-the king 's emissary walked by [her]116-clementina side , sat sleepless before [her]116-clementina , had held [her]116-clementina in [his]2218-the king 's emissary arms , had talked with [her]116-clementina , had risked [his]2218-the king 's emissary life for [her]116-clementina ; [she]116-clementina knew [him]2218-the king 's emissary . What [she]116-clementina knew of [James Stuart]112-james stuart , [she]116-clementina knew chiefly from the lips of [this emissary]2219-this emissary . On this walk to [Ala]63-ala [he]2218-the king 's emissary spoke of [[his]2218-the king 's emissary master]221-his master , and remorsefully in the highest praise . But [she]116-clementina knew [his]2218-the king 's emissary secret , [she]116-clementina knew that [he]2218-the king 's emissary loved [her]116-clementina , and therefore every remorseful , loyal word [he]2218-the king 's emissary spoke praised [him]2218-the king 's emissary more than it praised [[his]2218-the king 's emissary master]221-his master . And it happened that just as [they]2222-they came to [the outskirts of [the village]789-the village]2223-the outskirts of the village , [she]116-clementina dropped a handkerchief which hung loosely about [her]116-clementina neck . For a moment [she]116-clementina did not remark [her]116-clementina loss ; when [she]116-clementina did and turned , [she]116-clementina saw that [[her]116-clementina companion]1796-her companion was rising from the ground on which no handkerchief longer lay , and that [he]1796-her companion had [his]1796-her companion right hand in [his]1796-her companion breast . [She]116-clementina turned again without a word , and walked forward . But [she]116-clementina knew that kerchief was against [his]1796-her companion heart , and the cloud still grew . [They]2222-they reached [Ala]63-ala towards two o'clock of the morning . [The town]3115-the town had some reputation in those days for [its]3115-the town velvets and silks , and [Wogan]109-wogan made no doubt that somewhere [he]109-wogan would procure [a carriage]576-a carriage to convey [them]2222-they the necessary five miles into [Venetian]81-venetian territory . [The Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden was still ahead of [them]2222-they , however . [The inn of " The Golden Lion]4338-the inn of " the golden lion "[109-wogan] had not a single horse fit for [their]2222-they use in [[its]2229-its stables]2230-its stables . [Wogan]109-wogan , however , obtained there a few likely addresses and set out alone upon [his]109-wogan search . [He]109-wogan returned in a couple of hours with [a little two - wheeled cart drawn by a pony]2231-a little two - wheeled cart drawn by a pony , and sent word within that [he]109-wogan was ready . [Clementina]116-clementina [herself]116-clementina with [her]116-clementina hood thrown back from [her]116-clementina face came out to [him]109-wogan at the door . An oil lamp swung in [the passage]497-the passage and lit up [her]116-clementina face . [Wogan]109-wogan could see that the face was grave and anxious . " [[Your]116-clementina Highness]3263-your highness and [Mrs. Misset]143-misset can ride in [the cart]1946-the cart . It has no springs , to be sure , and may shake to pieces like plaster . But if it carries [you]116-clementina five miles , it will serve . [Misset]143-misset and [I]109-wogan can run by the side . "[109-wogan] " But [Lucy Misset]170-lucy must not go , "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina . " [She]170-lucy is ill , and no wonder . [She]170-lucy must not take one step more to - night . There would be great danger , and indeed [she]170-lucy has endured enough for [me]116-clementina . "[116-clementina] The gravity of [the girl]336-the girl 's face , as much as [her]116-clementina words , convinced [Wogan]109-wogan that here was no occasion for encouragement or resistance . [He]109-wogan said with some embarrassment , — " Yet [we]4341-we can not leave [her]170-lucy [here]3086-here alone ; and of [[us]4341-we [two men]415-two men]4343-us two men , [[her]170-lucy husband]4003-her husband must stay with [her]170-lucy . "[109-wogan] " Dare [we]4341-we wait till the morning ? "[116-clementina] asked [Clementina]116-clementina . " [Lucy]170-lucy may be recovered then . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan shook [his]109-wogan head . " [The courier [we]4341-we stopped at [Wellishmile]82-wellishmile]4346-the courier we stopped at wellishmile was not [the only man sent after [us]4341-we]4347-the only man sent after us . Of that [we]4341-we may be very sure . Here are [we]4341-we five miles from safety , and while those five miles are still unbridged — Listen ! "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan leaned [his]109-wogan head forward and held up [his]109-wogan hand for silence . In the still night [they]2234-they could hear far away the galloping of a horse . The sound grew more distinct as [they]2234-they listened . " [The rider]4348-the rider comes from [Italy]29-italy , "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina . " But [he]4348-the rider might have come from [Trent]52-trent , "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan . " [We]4341-we left [Trent]52-trent behind twelve hours ago , and more . For twelve hours [we]4341-we crept and crawled along [the road]228-the road ; these last miles [we]4341-we have walked . Any moment [[the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's troopers]4351-the emperor 's troopers might come riding after [us]4341-we . Ah , but [we]4341-we are not safe ! [I]109-wogan am afraid ! "[109-wogan] [Clementina]116-clementina turned sharply towards [him]109-wogan as [he]109-wogan spoke this unwonted confession . " [You]109-wogan ! "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina exclaimed with a wondering laugh . Yet [he]109-wogan had spoken the truth . [His]109-wogan face was twitching ; [his]109-wogan eyes had the look of [a man]235-a man scared out of [his]235-a man wits . " Yes , [I]109-wogan am afraid , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said in a low , uneasy voice . " When [I]109-wogan have all but won through the danger , then comes [my]109-wogan moment of fear . In the thick of it , perils tread too close upon the heels of peril for [a man]235-a man to count them up . Each minute claims [your]4353-you hands and eyes and brain,—claims [you]4353-you and inspires [you]4353-you . But when the danger 's less , and though less still threatens ; when [you]4353-you 're just this side of safety 's frontier and not safe,—indeed , indeed , [one]3129-one should be afraid . A vain spirit of confidence , and the tired head nods , and the blow falls on it from nowhere . Oh , but [I]109-wogan have seen examples times out of mind . [I]109-wogan beg [you]4353-you , no delay ! "[109-wogan] The hoofs of the approaching horse sounded ever louder while [Wogan]109-wogan spoke ; and as [he]109-wogan ended , [a man]235-a man rode out from [the street]292-the street into the open space before [the inn]231-the inn . The gallop became a trot . " [He]235-a man is riding to the door , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . " The light falls on [your]4353-you face ; "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan drew [Clementina]116-clementina into the shadow of the wall . But at the same moment [the rider]4348-the rider changed [his]4348-the rider mind . [He]4348-the rider swerved ; it seemed too that [he]4348-the rider used [his]4348-the rider spurs , for [his]4348-the rider horse bounded beneath [him]4348-the rider and galloped past [the inn]231-the inn . [He]4348-the rider disappeared into the darkness , and the sound of the horse diminished . [Wogan]109-wogan listened until they had died away . " [He]235-a man rides into [Austria]83-austria ! "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [He]235-a man rides to [Trent]52-trent , to [Brixen]71-brixen , to [Innspruck]17-innspruck ! And in haste . Let [us]4355-us go ! [I]109-wogan had even a fancy that [I]109-wogan knew [his]235-a man voice . "[109-wogan] " From a single oath uttered in anger ! Nay , [you]4356-you are all fears . For [my]143-misset part , [I]143-misset was afraid that [he]235-a man had it in [his]235-a man mind to stay here at [this inn where [[my]143-misset little woman]4358-my little woman lies]4357-this inn where my little woman lies . What if suspicion fall on [her]4358-my little woman ? What if [those troopers of [the Emperor]3102-the emperor]4359-those troopers of the emperor find [her]4358-my little woman and guess the part [she]4358-my little woman played ! "[143-misset] " [You]4356-you make [her]4358-my little woman safe by seeking safety , "[109-wogan] returned [Wogan]109-wogan . " [You]4356-you are the prey [the Emperor]3102-the emperor flies at . Once [you]4356-you are out of reach , [his]3102-the emperor mere dignity must hold [him]3102-the emperor in from wreaking vengeance on [[your]4356-you friends]3373-your friends . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan went into [the inn]231-the inn , and calling [Misset]143-misset told [him]109-wogan of [his]109-wogan purpose . [He]109-wogan would drive [her]143-misset [Highness]186-highness to [Peri]84-peri , [a little village]2242-a little village ten miles from [Ala]63-ala , but in [Italy]29-italy . At [Peri]84-peri , [Mrs. Misset]143-misset and [[her]143-misset husband]4003-her husband were to rejoin [them]2244-them in the morning , and from [Peri]84-peri [they]2244-them could travel by slow stages to [Bologna]1-bologna . The tears flowed from [Clementina]116-clementina 's eyes when [she]116-clementina took [her]116-clementina farewell of [[her]116-clementina little woman]2245-her little woman . Though [her]116-clementina reason bowed to [Wogan]109-wogan 's argument , [she]116-clementina had a sense of cowardice in deserting so faithful [a friend]447-a friend . [Mrs. Misset]143-misset , however , joined in [Wogan]109-wogan 's prayer ; and [she]143-misset mounted into the trap and at [Wogan]109-wogan 's side drove out of [the town]3115-the town by [that street along which [the horseman]3286-the horseman had ridden]2248-that street along which the horseman had ridden . [Clementina]116-clementina was silent ; [[her]116-clementina driver]2250-her driver was no more talkative . [They]2251-they were alone and together on [the road to [Italy]29-italy]2252-the road to italy . That embarrassment from which [Wogan]109-wogan 's confession of fear had procured [them]2251-they some respite held [them]2251-they in a stiff constraint . [They]2251-they were conscious of it as of a tide engulfing [them]2251-they . [Neither]2253-neither dared to speak , dreading what might come of speech . The most careless question , the most indifferent comment , might , as it seemed to both , be the spark to fire a mine . [Neither]2253-neither had any confidence to say , once [they]2251-they had begun to talk , whither the talk would lead ; but [they]2251-they were very much afraid , and [they]2251-they sat very still lest a movement of the one should provoke a question in the other . [She]116-clementina knew [his]109-wogan secret , and [he]109-wogan was aware that [she]116-clementina knew it . [She]116-clementina could not have found it even then in [her]116-clementina heart to part willingly with [her]116-clementina knowledge . [She]116-clementina had thought over - much upon it during the last day . [She]116-clementina had withdrawn [herself]116-clementina into it from the company of [[her]116-clementina fellow - travellers]2255-her fellow - travellers , as into [a private chamber]2256-a private chamber ; it was familiar and near . Nor would [Wogan]109-wogan have desired , now that [she]116-clementina had the knowledge , to deprive [her]116-clementina of it , but [he]109-wogan knew it instinctively for a dangerous thing . [He]109-wogan drove on in silence while the stars paled in the heavens and a grey , pure light crept mistily up from the under edges of [the world]245-the world , and the morning broke hard and empty and cheerless . [Wogan]109-wogan suddenly drew in the reins and stopped [the cart]1946-the cart . " There is a high wall behind [us]2259-us . [It]4363-it stretches across [the fields]345-the fields from either side , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [It]4363-it makes [a gateway of [the road]228-the road]4365-a gateway of the road . "[109-wogan] [Clementina]116-clementina turned . The wall was perhaps ten yards behind [them]2259-us . " A gateway , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina , " through which [we]2259-us have passed . "[116-clementina] " [The gateway of [Italy]29-italy]4367-the gateway of italy , "[109-wogan] answered [Wogan]109-wogan ; and [he]109-wogan drew the lash once or twice across the pony 's back and so was silent . [Clementina]116-clementina looked at [his]109-wogan set and cheerless face , cheerless as that chill morning , and [she]116-clementina too was silent . [She]116-clementina looked back along the road which [she]116-clementina had traversed through snow and sunshine and clear nights of stars ; [she]116-clementina saw it winding out from the gates of [Innspruck]17-innspruck over [the mountains]1519-the mountains , above [the foaming river]2261-the foaming river , and after a while [she]116-clementina said very wistfully , — " There are worse lives than a gipsy 's . "[116-clementina] " Are there any better ? "[109-wogan] answered [Wogan]109-wogan . So this was what [[Mr. Wogan]109-wogan 's fine project]2262-mr. wogan 's fine project had come to . [He]109-wogan remembered another morning when the light had welled over [the hills]224-the hills , sunless and clear and cold , on [the road to [Bologna,—the]85-bologna,—the]2264-the road to bologna,—the morning of the day when [he]109-wogan had first conceived the rescue of [Clementina]116-clementina . And the rescue had been effected , and here was [Clementina]116-clementina safe out of [Austria]83-austria , and [Wogan]109-wogan sure of a deathless renown , of the accomplishment of an endeavour held absurd and preposterous ; and these two short sentences were [their]2265-their summary and comment , — " There are worse lives than [a gipsy]4368-a gipsy 's . "[2265-their] " Are there any better ? "[2266-both] [Both]2266-both had at this supreme crisis of [their]2266-both fortunes but the one thought,—that the only days through which [they]2266-both had really lived were those last two days of flight , of hurry , of hope alternating with despair , of light - hearted companionship , days never to be forgotten , when each snatched meal was a picnic seasoned with laughter , days of unharnessed freedom lived in the open air . [Clementina]116-clementina was the first to perceive that [her]116-clementina behaviour fell below the occasion . [She]116-clementina was safe in [Italy]29-italy , journeying henceforward safely to [[her]116-clementina betrothed]2267-her betrothed . [She]116-clementina spurred [herself]116-clementina to understand it , [she]116-clementina forced [her]116-clementina lips to sing aloud the Te Deum . [Wogan]109-wogan looked at [her]116-clementina in surprise as the first notes were sung , and the woful appeal in [her]116-clementina eyes compelled [him]109-wogan to as brave a show as [he]109-wogan could make of joining in the hymn . But the words faltered , the tune wavered , joyless and hollow in that empty morning . " Drive on , "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina , suddenly ; and [she]116-clementina had a sense that [she]116-clementina was being driven into [bondage,—she who had just been freed]2268-bondage,—she who had just been freed . [Wogan]109-wogan drove on towards [Peri]84-peri . It was the morning of Sunday , the 30th of April ; and as [the little cart]2269-the little cart drew near to [this hamlet of [thirty cottages]2271-thirty cottages]2270-this hamlet of thirty cottages , [the travellers]1924-the travellers could hear the single bell in [the church belfry]2273-the church belfry calling [the villagers]2274-the villagers to Mass. [Wogan]109-wogan spoke but once to [Clementina]116-clementina , and then only to point out [a wooden hut which stood picturesquely on [a wooded bluff of [Monte Lessini]86-monte lessini]2276-a wooded bluff of monte lessini]2275-a wooden hut which stood picturesquely on a wooded bluff of monte lessini , high up upon the left . [A narrow gorge down which a torrent foamed led upwards]2277-a narrow gorge down which a torrent foamed led upwards to [the bluff]2278-the bluff , and [the hut of which the windows were shuttered]2279-the hut of which the windows were shuttered , and which seemed at that distance to have been built with an unusual elegance , was to [Wogan]109-wogan 's thinking a hunting - box . [Clementina]116-clementina looked up at [the bluff]2278-the bluff indifferently and made no answer . [She]116-clementina only spoke as [Wogan]109-wogan drove past [the church]2281-the church - door , and the sound of [the priest]2282-the priest 's voice came droning out to [them]2283-them . " Will [you]109-wogan wait for [me]116-clementina ? "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina asked . " [I]109-wogan will not be long . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan stopped the pony . " [You]116-clementina would give thanks ? "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [I]109-wogan understand . "[109-wogan] " [I]116-clementina would pray for an honest heart wherewith to give honest thanks , "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina , in a low voice ; and [she]116-clementina added hastily , " There is a life of ceremonies , there is a life of [cities]4369-cities before [me]116-clementina . [I]116-clementina have lived under the skies these last two days . "[116-clementina] [She]116-clementina went into [the church]2281-the church , shrouding [her]116-clementina face in [her]116-clementina hood , and kneeled down before a rush chair close to the door . A sense of gratitude , however , was not that morning to be got by any prayers , however earnest . It was merely a distaste for ceremonies and observances , [she]116-clementina strenuously assured [herself]116-clementina , that had grown upon [her]116-clementina during these ten days . [She]116-clementina sought to get rid of that distaste , as [she]116-clementina kneeled , by picturing in [her]116-clementina thoughts [the Prince to whom [she]116-clementina was betrothed]2285-the prince to whom she was betrothed . [She]116-clementina recalled the exploits , the virtues , which [Wogan]109-wogan had ascribed to [him]109-wogan ; [she]116-clementina stamped them upon the picture . " It is [the King]3089-the king , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina said to [herself]116-clementina ; and the picture answered [her]116-clementina , " It is [[the King]3089-the king 's servant]3908-the king 's servant . "[116-clementina] And , lo ! the face of the picture was the face of [Charles Wogan]109-wogan . [She]116-clementina covered [her]116-clementina cheeks with [her]116-clementina hands in a burning rush of shame ; [she]116-clementina struck in [her]116-clementina thoughts at the face of that image with [her]116-clementina clenched fists , to bruise , to annihilate it . " It is [the King]3089-the king ! It is [the King]3089-the king ! It is [the King]3089-the king ! "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina cried in [her]116-clementina remorse , but the image persisted . It still wore the likeness of [Charles Wogan]109-wogan ; it still repeated , " No , it is [[the King]3089-the king 's servant]3908-the king 's servant . "[109-wogan] There was more of [the primitive woman in [this girl]2287-this girl bred in [the rugged country - side of [Silesia]13-silesia]2288-the rugged country - side of silesia than even [Wogan]109-wogan was aware of]2286-the primitive woman in this girl bred in the rugged country - side of silesia than even wogan was aware of , and during the halts in [their]2289-their journey [she]116-clementina had learned from [Mrs. Misset]143-misset details which [Wogan]109-wogan had been at pains to conceal . It was [Wogan]109-wogan who had conceived the idea of [her]116-clementina rescue — in [[the King]185-king james 's place]2290-the king 's place . In [[the King]3089-the king 's place]2290-the king 's place , [Wogan]109-wogan had come to [Innspruck]17-innspruck and effected it . In [[the King]3089-the king 's place]2290-the king 's place , [he]109-wogan had taken [her]116-clementina by the hand and cleft a way for [her]116-clementina through [[her]116-clementina enemies]2295-her enemies . [He]109-wogan was [the man]365-the man , [the rescuer]2297-the rescuer ; [she]116-clementina was [the woman]308-the woman , [the rescued]2299-the rescued . [She]116-clementina became conscious of the futility of [her]116-clementina attitude of prayer . [She]116-clementina raised [her]116-clementina head and saw that [a man kneeling close to the altar]2300-a man kneeling close to the altar had turned and was staring fixedly towards [her]116-clementina . [The man]365-the man was [the Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden . Had [he]365-the man recognised [her]116-clementina ? [She]116-clementina peered between [her]116-clementina fingers ; [she]116-clementina remarked that [his]365-the man gaze was puzzled ; [he]365-the man was not then sure , though [he]365-the man suspected . [She]116-clementina waited until [he]365-the man turned [his]365-the man head again , and then [she]116-clementina silently rose to [her]116-clementina feet and slipped out of [the church]2281-the church . [She]116-clementina found [Wogan]109-wogan waiting for [her]116-clementina in some anxiety . " Did [he]365-the man recognise [you]116-clementina ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan asked . " [He]365-the man was not sure , "[116-clementina] answered [Clementina]116-clementina . " How did [you]109-wogan know [he]365-the man was at [Mass]87-mass ? "[116-clementina] " [A native [I]116-clementina spoke with]4378-a native i spoke with told [me]116-clementina . "[116-clementina] [Clementina]116-clementina climbed up into [the cart]1946-the cart . " [The Prince]588-the prince is not [a generous man]4380-a generous man , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina said hesitatingly . [Wogan]109-wogan understood [her]116-clementina . [The Prince of [Baden]55-baden]1434-the prince of baden must not know that [she]116-clementina had come to [Peri]84-peri escorted by [a single cavalier]2306-a single cavalier . [He]109-wogan would talk bitterly , [he]109-wogan would make much of [his]109-wogan good fortune in that [he]109-wogan had not married [the Princess Clementina]116-clementina , [he]109-wogan would pity the [Chevalier de St. George,—there]198-chevalier de st. george,—there was a fine tale there . [Wogan]109-wogan could trace it across the tea - tables of [Europe]7-europe , and hear the malicious inextinguishable laughter which winged it on its way . [He]109-wogan drove off quickly from [the church]2281-the church door . " [He]109-wogan leaves [Peri]84-peri at nine , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . " [He]109-wogan will have no time to make inquiries . [We]4381-we have but to avoid [the inn]231-the inn [he]109-wogan stays at . "[109-wogan] To [this second inn]2308-this second inn [Wogan]109-wogan drove , and was welcomed by [a shrewish woman whose sour face was warmed for once in a way into something like enthusiasm]2309-a shrewish woman whose sour face was warmed for once in a way into something like enthusiasm . " [A lodging indeed [you]109-wogan shall have]4385-a lodging indeed you shall have , "[2309-a shrewish woman whose sour face was warmed for once in a way into something like enthusiasm] cried [she]2309-a shrewish woman whose sour face was warmed for once in a way into something like enthusiasm , " and [a better lodging than [the Prince of Baden]1434-the prince of baden]4386-a better lodging than the prince of baden can look back upon , though [he]109-wogan pay never so dearly for it . [Poor man]4388-poor man , [he]109-wogan will have slept wakefully this night ! Here , [sir]3070-sir , [you]109-wogan will find honest board and an honest bed for [yourself]109-wogan and [[your]109-wogan sweet lady]4390-your sweet lady , and an honest bill to set [you]109-wogan off in a sweet humour in the morning . "[2309-a shrewish woman whose sour face was warmed for once in a way into something like enthusiasm] " Nay , [[my]109-wogan good woman]4391-my good woman , "[109-wogan] interrupted [Wogan]109-wogan , hastily . " This is [no sweet lady of mine]4392-no sweet lady of mine , nor are [we]4393-we like to stay until the morrow . [[The young lady]3768-the young lady 's uncle]4397-the young lady 's uncle and [aunt]4398-aunt are following [us]4393-we , and [we]4393-we wait only for [their]4399-their arrival . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan examined [the inn]231-the inn and thought the disposition of [it]231-the inn very convenient . [It]231-the inn made three sides of [a courtyard]2311-a courtyard open to [the road]228-the road . On the right and the bottom were [farm - buildings]2313-farm - buildings and [a stable]3526-a stable ; [the inn]231-the inn was [the wing]2316-the wing upon the left hand . [The guest rooms , of which there were four]2317-the guest rooms , of which there were four , were all situated upon [the first floor]1626-the first floor and looked out upon a little thicket of fir - trees at the back of [the wing]2316-the wing . [They]2317-the guest rooms , of which there were four were approached by a staircase , which ran up with a couple of turns from [the courtyard itself]2320-the courtyard itself and on the outside of [the house]3196-the house - wall . [Wogan]109-wogan was very pleased with [that staircase]2322-that staircase ; it was narrow . [He]109-wogan was pleased , too , because there were [no other travellers]2323-no other travellers in [the inn]231-the inn . [He]109-wogan went back to [the landlady]4076-the landlady . " It is very likely , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " that [[my]109-wogan friends]3416-my friends when [they]3416-my friends come will , after all , choose to stay [here]3086-here for the night . [I]109-wogan will hire all [the rooms upon the first floor]4402-the rooms upon the first floor . "[109-wogan] [The landlady]4076-the landlady was no less pleased than [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan . [She]4076-the landlady had a thought that [they]2317-the guest rooms , of which there were four were [a runaway couple]2327-a runaway couple and served [them]2317-the guest rooms , of which there were four breakfast in [a little parlour up the stairs]2328-a little parlour up the stairs with many sly and confusing allusions . [She]4076-the landlady became confused , however , when after breakfast [Clementina]116-clementina withdrew to bed , and [Wogan]109-wogan sauntered out into [the high - road]2329-the high - road , where [he]109-wogan sat [himself]109-wogan down on a bank to watch for [Captain Misset]177-captain misset . All day [he]109-wogan sat resolutely with [his]109-wogan back towards [the inn]231-the inn . [The landlady]4076-the landlady inferred that here were [lovers]4191-lovers quarrelling , and [she]4076-the landlady was yet more convinced of it when [she]4076-the landlady entered [the parlour]2094-the parlour in the afternoon to lay the table for dinner and saw [Clementina]116-clementina standing wistfully at the window with [her]116-clementina eyes upon that unmoving back . [Wogan]109-wogan meanwhile for all [his]109-wogan vigilance watched [the road]228-the road but ill . [Merchants]1198-merchants , [pedlars]2336-pedlars , [friars]2337-friars , and gentlemen travelling for [their]2338-their pleasure passed down [the road]228-the road into [Italy]29-italy . [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan saw [them]2340-them not , or saw [them]2340-them with unseeing eyes . [His]109-wogan eyes were turned inwards , and [he]109-wogan gazed at a picture that [his]109-wogan heart held of [a room in [that inn]2342-that inn behind [him]109-wogan , where after all [her]116-clementina dangers and fatigues [a woman]234-a woman]2341-a room in that inn behind him , where after all her dangers and fatigues a woman slept in peace . Towards evening [fewer travellers]2344-fewer travellers passed by , but there came [one party of six well - mounted men whose leader suddenly bowed [his]109-wogan head down upon [his]109-wogan horse 's neck as [he]109-wogan rode past]2345-one party of six well - mounted men whose leader suddenly bowed his head down upon his horse 's neck as he rode past . [Wogan]109-wogan had preached a sermon on the carelessness which comes with danger 's diminutions , but [he]109-wogan was very tired . The head was nodding ; the blow might fall from nowhere , and [he]109-wogan not know . At nightfall [he]109-wogan returned and mounted to [the parlour]2094-the parlour , where [Clementina]116-clementina awaited [him]109-wogan . " There is no sign of [Captain Misset]177-captain misset , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . [Wogan]109-wogan was puzzled by the way in which [Clementina]116-clementina received the news . For a moment [he]109-wogan thought that [her]116-clementina eyes lightened , and that [she]116-clementina was glad ; then it seemed to [him]109-wogan that [her]116-clementina eyes clouded and suddenly as if with pain . Nor was [her]116-clementina voice a guide to [him]109-wogan , for [she]116-clementina spoke [her]116-clementina simple question without significance , — " Must [we]2347-they wait , then , till the morning ? "[116-clementina] " There is a chance that [they]2347-they may come before the morning . [I]116-clementina will watch on the top stair , and if [they]2347-they come [I]116-clementina will make bold to wake [[your]116-clementina Highness]3263-your highness . "[116-clementina] [[Their]2347-they hostess]2348-their hostess upon this brought [their]2347-they supper into [the room]317-the room , and [Wogan]109-wogan became at once aware of a change in [her]116-clementina demeanour . [She]116-clementina no longer embarrassed [them]2347-they with [her]116-clementina patronage , nor did [she]116-clementina continue [her]116-clementina sly allusions to the escapades of [lovers]4191-lovers . On the contrary , [she]116-clementina was of an extreme deference . Under the deference , too , [Wogan]109-wogan seemed to remark a certain excitement . " Have [you]116-clementina [other lodgers]4404-other lodgers to - night ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan asked carelessly . " No , [sir]3070-sir , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina . " [Travellers]3362-travellers are taken by [a big house]4407-a big house and a bustle of [servants]242-servants . "[116-clementina] As soon as [she]116-clementina had left [the room]317-the room [Wogan]109-wogan asked of [Clementina]116-clementina , — " When did [her]116-clementina manner change ? "[109-wogan] " [I]116-clementina had not remarked the change till now , "[116-clementina] replied [Clementina]116-clementina . [Wogan]109-wogan became uneasy . [He]109-wogan went down into [the courtyard]2157-the courtyard , and found [it]2157-the courtyard empty . There was a light in [the kitchen]879-the kitchen , and [he]109-wogan entered [the room]317-the room . [The landlady]4076-the landlady was having [her]4076-the landlady supper in company with [[her]4076-the landlady few servants]2356-her few servants , and there were [one or two peasants from [the village]789-the village]2357-one or two peasants from the village . [Wogan]109-wogan chatted with [them]2357-one or two peasants from the village for a few minutes and came out again much relieved of [his]109-wogan fears . [He]109-wogan thought , however , it might be as well to see that [his]109-wogan pony was ready for an emergency . [He]109-wogan crossed silently to [the stable]3339-the stable , which [he]109-wogan found dark as [the courtyard]2157-the courtyard . The door was latched , but not locked . [He]109-wogan opened it and went in . [The building]1165-the building was long , with many stalls ranged side by side . [Wogan]109-wogan 's pony stood in the end stall opposite to the door . [Wogan]109-wogan took down the harness from the pegs and began to fix it ready on the pony . [He]109-wogan had just put the collar over its head when [he]109-wogan heard a horse stamping in one of [the stalls at the other end of [the stables]476-the stables]2362-the stalls at the other end of the stables . Now [he]109-wogan had noticed in the morning that there were only two horses in [the building]1165-the building , and those two were tied up in [the stalls next to that which [his]109-wogan pony occupied]2365-the stalls next to that which his pony occupied . [He]109-wogan walked along [the range of stalls]2366-the range of stalls . The two horses were there , then came a gap of [empty stalls]2367-empty stalls , and beyond the gap [he]109-wogan counted six other horses . [Wogan]109-wogan became at once curious about those six other horses . [They]2368-their might of course be farm - horses , but [he]109-wogan wished to know . It was quite dark within [the building]1165-the building ; [he]109-wogan had only counted the horses by the noise of [their]2368-their movements in [[their]2368-their stalls]2370-their stalls , the rattle of [their]2368-their head - ropes , and the pawing of [their]2368-their feet . [He]109-wogan dared not light a lamp , but [horses as a rule]2371-horses as a rule knew [him]109-wogan for [a friend]447-a friend . [He]109-wogan went into the stall of the first , petted it for a moment and ran [his]109-wogan hand down [its]2373-its legs . [He]109-wogan repeated the process with the second , and with so much investigation [he]109-wogan was content . [No farm - horse that ever [Wogan]109-wogan had seen]2374-no farm - horse that ever wogan had seen had such a smooth sleek skin or such fine legs as had those two over which [he]109-wogan had passed [his]109-wogan hands . " Now where are [the masters of those horses]4410-the masters of those horses ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan asked [himself]109-wogan . " Why do [they]4410-the masters of those horses leave [their]4410-the masters of those horses cattle at [this inn]254-this inn and not show [themselves]4410-the masters of those horses in [the kitchen]879-the kitchen or [the courtyard]2157-the courtyard ? Why do [they]4410-the masters of those horses not ask for a couple of [[my]109-wogan rooms]4414-my rooms ? "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan stood in the dark and reflected . Then [he]109-wogan stepped out of the door with even more caution than [he]109-wogan had used when entering by [it]2375-it . [He]109-wogan stole silently along to [the shed where [his]109-wogan trap was housed]2376-the shed where his trap was housed , and felt beneath the seat . From beneath the seat [he]109-wogan drew out a coil of rope , and a lamp . The rope [he]109-wogan wound about [him]109-wogan under [his]109-wogan coat . Then [he]109-wogan went back to [[his]109-wogan staircase]2377-his staircase and [the parlour]2094-the parlour . [Clementina]116-clementina could read in [his]109-wogan face that something was amiss , but [she]116-clementina had a great gift of silence . [She]116-clementina waited for [him]109-wogan to speak . [Wogan]109-wogan unwound the coil of rope from [his]109-wogan body . " [[Your]116-clementina Highness]3263-your highness laughed at [me]109-wogan for that [I]109-wogan would not part with [my]109-wogan rope . [I]109-wogan have a fear this night will prove [my]109-wogan wisdom . "[109-wogan] And with that [he]109-wogan began deliberately to break up the chairs in [the room]317-the room . [Clementina]116-clementina asked no questions ; [she]116-clementina watched [him]109-wogan take the rungs and bars of the chairs and test [their]2380-their strength . Then [he]109-wogan cut the coil of rope in half and tied loops at intervals ; into the loops [he]109-wogan fitted the wooden rungs . [Wogan]109-wogan worked expeditiously for an hour without opening [his]109-wogan mouth . In an hour [he]109-wogan had fashioned a rope - ladder . [He]109-wogan went to the window which looked out on the back of [the wing]2316-the wing , upon the little thicket of fir - trees . [He]109-wogan opened the window cautiously and dropped the ladder down the wall . " [[Your]116-clementina Highness]3263-your highness has courage , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " The ladder does not touch the ground , but it will not be far to drop , should there be need . "[109-wogan] The window of [[Clementina]116-clementina 's bedroom]2382-clementina 's bedroom was next to that of [the parlour]2094-the parlour and looked out in the same direction . [Wogan]109-wogan fixed the rope - ladder securely to the foot of the bed and drew the bed close to the window . [He]109-wogan left the lamp upon a chair and went back to [the parlour]2094-the parlour and explained . " [[Your]116-clementina Highness]3263-your highness , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan added , " there may be no cause for any alarm . On the other hand , [the Governor of [Trent]52-trent]4251-the governor of trent may have taken a leaf from [my]109-wogan own book . [He]4251-the governor of trent may have it in mind to snatch [[your]116-clementina Highness]3263-your highness out of [Italy]29-italy even as [I]109-wogan did out of [Austria]83-austria ; and of a truth it would be the easier undertaking . Here are [we]4420-we five miles from [the border]4421-the border and in [a small tavern set apart from [a small village]4423-a small village , instead of in the thick of [an armed town]4424-an armed town]4422-a small tavern set apart from a small village , instead of in the thick of an armed town . "[109-wogan] " But [we]4420-we might start now , "[2385-she] [she]2385-she said . " [We]4420-we might leave a message behind for [Mrs. Misset]143-misset and wait for [her]143-misset in [Verona]74-verona . "[109-wogan] " [I]109-wogan had thought of that . But if [my]109-wogan mere suspicion is the truth , [the six men]4425-the six men will not be so far from [their]4425-the six men six horses that [we]4420-we could drive away unnoticed by [any one of [them]4425-the six men]4426-any one of them . Nor could [we]4420-we hope to outpace [them]4425-the six men and [six men]4427-six men upon [an open road]4428-an open road ; indeed , [I]109-wogan would sooner face [them]4425-the six men at the head of [my]109-wogan staircase here . And while [I]109-wogan hold [them]4425-the six men back [[your]2386-you Highness]3263-your highness can creep down that ladder . "[109-wogan] " And hide in the thicket , "[2386-you] [she]2386-you interrupted . " Yet — yet — that leaves [you]109-wogan alone . [I]2386-you could give [you]109-wogan some help ; "[2386-you] and [her]2386-you face coloured . " [You]109-wogan were so kind as to tell [me]2386-you [I]2386-you had courage . [I]2386-you could at the least load [your]109-wogan pistols . "[2386-you] " [You]109-wogan would do that ? "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan . " Aye , but [you]109-wogan would , [you]109-wogan would ! "[109-wogan] For the first time that day [he]109-wogan forgot to address [her]2386-you with the ceremony of [her]2386-you title . All that day [he]109-wogan had schooled [his]109-wogan tongue to the use of it . [They]2387-they were not [man]3319-man and [woman]3693-woman , though [his]109-wogan heart would have it so ; [they]2387-they were [princess]2390-princess and [servant]2203-servant , and every minute [he]109-wogan must remember it . But [he]109-wogan forgot it now . Delicate [she]2386-you was to look upon as [any princess who had ever adorned [a court , delicate and fresh , rich - voiced and young]2393-a court , delicate and fresh , rich - voiced and young]2392-any princess who had ever adorned a court , delicate and fresh , rich - voiced and young , but here was [the rare woman]2394-the rare woman flashing out like a light over stormy seas , the spirit of [her]2386-you and [her]2386-you courage ! " [You]2386-you would load [my]109-wogan pistols ! "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan repeated , [his]109-wogan whole face alight . " To be sure , [you]2386-you would do that . But [I]109-wogan ask [you]2386-you , [I]109-wogan think , for a higher courage . [I]109-wogan ask [you]2386-you to climb down that ladder , to run alone , taking shelter when there 's need , back to [that narrow gorge [we]4431-we saw where the path leads upwards to [the bluff]2278-the bluff]4430-that narrow gorge we saw where the path leads upwards to the bluff . There was [a hut]4433-a hut ; two hours would take [you]2386-you to [it]4433-a hut , and there [you]2386-you should be safe . [I]109-wogan will keep [the enemy]4434-the enemy back till [you]2386-you are gone . If [I]109-wogan can , when all is over here [I]109-wogan 'll follow [you]2386-you . If [I]109-wogan do not come , why , [you]2386-you must — "[109-wogan] " Ah , but [you]2386-you will come , "[2395-she] said [she]2395-she , with a smile . " [I]2395-she have no fears but that [you]2386-you will come ; "[2395-she] and [she]2395-she added , " Else would [you]2386-you never persuade [me]2395-she to go . "[2395-she] " Well , then , [I]109-wogan will come . At all events , [Captain Misset]177-captain misset and [[his]177-captain misset wife]589-his wife will surely come down [the road]228-the road to - morrow . If [I]109-wogan rap twice upon [your]2386-you door , [you]2386-you will take that for [my]109-wogan signal . But it is very likely [I]109-wogan shall not rap at all . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan shivered as [he]109-wogan spoke . It was not for the first time during that conversation , and a little later , as [they]2396-they stood together in [the passage by the stair - head]2397-the passage by the stair - head , [Clementina]116-clementina twice remarked that [he]109-wogan shivered again . There was an oil lamp burning against [the passage wall]2398-the passage wall , and by its light [she]116-clementina could see that on that warm night of spring [his]109-wogan face was pinched with cold . [He]109-wogan was in truth chilled to the bone through lack of sleep ; [his]109-wogan eyes had the strained look of [a man strung to the breaking point]2399-a man strung to the breaking point , and at the sight of [him]109-wogan [the mother in [her]116-clementina]2400-the mother in her was touched . " What if [I]116-clementina watched to - night ? "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina said . " What if [you]109-wogan slept ? "[116-clementina] [Wogan]109-wogan laughed the suggestion aside . " [I]109-wogan shall sleep very well , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " upon [that top stair]4437-that top stair . [I]109-wogan can count upon waking , though only the lowest step tremble beneath a foot . "[109-wogan] This [he]109-wogan said , meaning not to sleep at all , as [Clementina]116-clementina very well understood . [She]116-clementina leaned over the balustrade by [Wogan]109-wogan 's side and looked upwards to the sky . The night was about [them]2401-we like a perfume of flowers . A stream bubbled and sang over stones behind [the inn]231-the inn . [The courtyard below]2403-the courtyard below was very silent . [She]116-clementina laid a hand upon [his]109-wogan sleeve and said again in a pleading voice , — " Let [me]116-clementina watch to - night . There is no danger . [You]109-wogan are racked by sleeplessness , and [phantoms born of it]4438-phantoms born of it wear the face of truth to [you]109-wogan . [We]2401-we are safe ; [we]2401-we are in [Italy]29-italy . The stars tell [me]116-clementina so . Let [me]116-clementina watch to - night . "[116-clementina] And at once [she]116-clementina was startled . [He]109-wogan withdrew [his]109-wogan arm so roughly that it seemed [he]109-wogan flung off [his]109-wogan hand ; [he]109-wogan spoke in a voice so hoarse and rough [she]116-clementina did not know it for [his]109-wogan . And indeed it was [a different man who now confronted [her,—a]116-clementina man different from [the dutiful servant who had rescued [her]116-clementina]2405-the dutiful servant who had rescued her , different even from [the man who had held [her]116-clementina so tenderly in [his]109-wogan arms on [the road]228-the road to [Ala.]88-ala.]2406-the man who had held her so tenderly in his arms on the road to ala.]2404-a different man who now confronted her,—a man different from the dutiful servant who had rescued her , different even from the man who had held her so tenderly in his arms on the road to ala. " Go to [[your]116-clementina room]4439-your room , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [You]116-clementina must not stay [here]3086-here . "[109-wogan] [She]116-clementina stepped back in [her]116-clementina surprise and faced [him]109-wogan . " Every minute , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried in a sort of exasperation , " [I]109-wogan bid [myself]109-wogan remember the great gulf between [you]116-clementina and [me]109-wogan ; every minute [you]116-clementina forget it . [I]109-wogan make a curtain of [your]116-clementina rank , [your]116-clementina title , and — let [us]4441-us be frank — [your]116-clementina destiny ; [I]109-wogan hang the curtain up between [us]4441-us , and with a gentle hand [you]116-clementina tear it down . At the end of it all [I]109-wogan am flesh and blood . Why did [I]109-wogan sit the whole long dreary day out on [the bank]4442-the bank by the roadside there ? To watch ? [I]109-wogan could not describe to [you]116-clementina [one traveller out of [them]4444-them all who passed]4443-one traveller out of them all who passed . Why , then ? Ask [yourself]116-clementina ! It was not that [I]109-wogan might stand by [your]116-clementina side afterwards in the glamour of an Italian night with the stars pulsing overhead like a smile upon [your]116-clementina lips , and all [the world]245-the world whispering ! [You]116-clementina must not stay [here]3086-here ! "[109-wogan] [His]2408-he eyes burnt upon [her]2409-her ; [his]2408-he hands shook ; from head to foot [he]2408-he was hot and fierce with passion , and in spite of [herself]2409-her [she]2409-her kindled to it . That [he]2408-he loved [she]2409-her knew before , but [his]2408-he description of [[his]2408-he city of dreams]2410-his city of dreams had given to [him]2408-he in [her]2409-her thoughts a touch of fancifulness , had led [her]2409-her to conceive of [his]2408-he love as something dreamlike , had somehow spiritualised [him]2408-he to the hindrance of [her]2409-her grasp of [him]2408-he as flesh and blood . Thus , [she]2409-her understood , [she]2409-her might well have seemed to be trifling with [him]2408-he , though nothing was further from [her]2409-her thoughts . But now [he]2408-he was dangerous ; love had made [him]2408-he dangerous , and to [her]2409-her . [She]2409-her knew it , and in spite of [herself]2409-her [she]2409-her gloried in the knowledge . [Her]2409-her heart leaped into [her]2409-her eyes and shone there responsive , unafraid . The next moment [she]2409-her lowered [her]2409-her head . But [he]2408-he had seen the unmistakable look in [her]2409-her eyes . Even as [she]2409-her stood with [her]2409-her bowed head , [he]2408-he could not but feel that every fibre in [her]2409-her body thrilled ; [he]2408-he could not but know the transfigured expression of [her]2409-her face . " [I]2409-her had no thought to hurt [you]109-wogan , "[2409-her] [she]2409-her said , and [her]2409-her voice trembled , and it was not with fear or any pain . [Wogan]109-wogan took a step towards [her]2409-her and checked [himself]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan spoke sharply between clenched teeth . " Lock [your]2409-her door , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . The curtain between [them]2411-them was down . [Wogan]109-wogan had patched and patched it before ; but it was torn down now , and [they]2411-them had seen [each other]259-each other without so much as that patched semblance of a screen to veil [their]2411-them eyes . [Clementina]116-clementina did not answer [him]109-wogan or raise [her]116-clementina head . [She]116-clementina went quietly into [[her]116-clementina room]2015-her room . [Wogan]109-wogan did not move until [she]2409-her had locked the door . Then [he]109-wogan disposed [himself]109-wogan for the night . [He]109-wogan sat down across the top step of [the stairs]366-the stairs with [his]109-wogan back propped against the passage wall . Facing [him]109-wogan was the door of [[Clementina]116-clementina 's room]2415-clementina 's room , on [his]109-wogan left hand [the passage]497-the passage with the oil lamp burning on a bracket , stretched to the house - wall ; on [his]109-wogan right [the stairs]366-the stairs descended straight for some steps , then turned to the left and ran down still within view to a point where again [they]366-the stairs turned outwards into [the courtyard]2157-the courtyard . [Wogan]109-wogan saw to the priming of [his]109-wogan pistols and laid them beside [him]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan looked out to [his]109-wogan right over [the low - roofed buildings opposite]2419-the low - roofed buildings opposite , and saw [the black mountains]2420-the black mountains with [their]2420-the black mountains glimmering crests , and just above one spur a star which flashed with a particular brightness . [He]109-wogan was very tired and very cold ; [he]109-wogan drew [his]109-wogan cloak about [him]109-wogan ; [he]109-wogan leaned back against the wall and watched that star . So long as [he]109-wogan saw that , [he]109-wogan was awake , and therefore [he]109-wogan watched it . At what time sleep overtook [him]109-wogan [he]109-wogan could never discover . It seemed to [him]109-wogan always that [he]109-wogan did not even for a second lose sight of that star . Only it dilated , it grew brighter , it dropped towards earth , and [he]109-wogan was not in any way surprised . [He]109-wogan was merely pleased with it for behaving in so attractive and natural a way . Then , however , the strange thing happened . When the star was hung in the air between [earth]2421-earth and sky and nearer to [the earth]3142-the earth , it opened like a flower and disclosed in its bright heart the face of [a girl]3881-a girl , which was yet brighter . And [that girl]2424-that girl 's face , with the broad low brows and the dark eyes and the smile which held [all earth]2425-all earth and much of heaven , stooped and stooped out of fire through the cool dark towards [him]109-wogan until [her]2424-that girl lips touched [his]109-wogan . It was then that [he]109-wogan woke , quietly as was [his]109-wogan wo nt , without any start , without opening [his]109-wogan eyes , and at once [he]109-wogan was aware of [someone breathing]2426-someone breathing . [He]109-wogan raised [his]109-wogan eyelids imperceptibly and peered through [his]109-wogan eyelashes . [He]109-wogan saw close beside [him]109-wogan the lower part of [a woman]234-a woman 's frock , and it was the frock which [Clementina]116-clementina wore . One wild question set [his]109-wogan heart leaping within [his]109-wogan breast . " Was there truth in the dream ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan asked [himself]109-wogan ; and while [he]109-wogan was yet formulating the question , [Clementina]116-clementina 's breathing was suddenly arrested . It seemed to [him]109-wogan , too , from the little that [he]109-wogan saw between [his]109-wogan closed eyes , that [she]116-clementina stiffened from head to foot . [She]116-clementina stood in that rigid attitude , very still . Something new had plainly occurred , something that brought with it a shock of surprise . [Wogan]109-wogan , without moving [his]109-wogan head or opening [his]109-wogan eyes a fraction wider , looked down [the staircase]673-the staircase and saw just above the edge of [one of the steep stairs]2429-one of the steep stairs a face watching [them,—a face with bright , birdlike eyes and an indescribable expression of cunning]2430-them,—a face with bright , birdlike eyes and an indescribable expression of cunning . [Wogan]109-wogan had need of all [his]109-wogan self - control . [He]109-wogan felt that [his]109-wogan eyelids were fluttering on [his]109-wogan cheeks , that [his]109-wogan breath had stopped even as [Clementina]116-clementina 's had . For the face which [he]109-wogan saw was one quite familiar to [him]109-wogan , though never familiar with that expression . It was the face of [an easy - going gentleman who made up for the lack of [his]2431-an easy - going gentleman who made up for the lack of his wit by the heartiness of his laugh , and to whom wogan had been drawn because of his simplicity wit by the heartiness of [his]2431-an easy - going gentleman who made up for the lack of his wit by the heartiness of his laugh , and to whom wogan had been drawn because of his simplicity laugh , and to whom [Wogan]109-wogan had been drawn because of [his]109-wogan simplicity]2431-an easy - going gentleman who made up for the lack of his wit by the heartiness of his laugh , and to whom wogan had been drawn because of his simplicity . There was no simplicity in [Henry Whittington]111-whittington 's face now . [It]2432-it remained above the edge of the step staring at [them]2433-them with a look of crafty triumph , a very image of intrigue . Then it disappeared silently . [Wogan]109-wogan remembered the voice of [the man who had spurred past the doorway of [the inn]231-the inn at [Ala.]88-ala.]2434-the man who had spurred past the doorway of the inn at ala. [He]109-wogan knew now why [he]109-wogan had thought to recognise it . The exclamation had been one of anger,—because [he]109-wogan had seen [Clementina]116-clementina and [himself]109-wogan in [Italy]29-italy ? [He]109-wogan had spurred onwards — towards [Trent]52-trent ? There were those six horses in [the stables]476-the stables . [Whittington]111-whittington 's face had disappeared very silently . " [An honest man]4447-an honest man , "[109-wogan] thought [Wogan]109-wogan , " does not take off [his]4447-an honest man boots before [he]4447-an honest man mounts the stairs . "[109-wogan] [Clementina]116-clementina was still standing at [his]109-wogan side . Without changing [his]109-wogan attitude [he]109-wogan rapped with [his]109-wogan knuckles gently twice upon the boards of the stair . [She]116-clementina turned towards [him]109-wogan with a gasp of the breath . [He]109-wogan rapped again twice , fearful lest [she]116-clementina should speak to [him]109-wogan . [She]116-clementina understood that [he]109-wogan had given [her]116-clementina the signal to go . [She]116-clementina turned on [her]116-clementina heel and slipped back into [[her]116-clementina room]2015-her room . [Wogan]109-wogan did not move . In a few minutes [he]109-wogan heard voices whispering in [the courtyard below]2403-the courtyard below . By that time [the Princess]3107-the princess should have escaped into the thicket . The stairs creaked , and again [he]109-wogan saw a face over the edge of a step . It was the flabby face of [a stranger]1151-a stranger , who turned and whispered in German to others behind [him]1151-a stranger . The face rose ; a pair of shoulders , a portly body , and a pair of unbooted legs became visible . [The man]365-the man carried a drawn sword ; between [his]365-the man closed eyelashes [Wogan]109-wogan saw that [four others with the like arms]2442-four others with the like arms followed . There should have been six ; but the sixth was [Harry Whittington]111-whittington , who , to be sure , was not likely to show [himself]111-whittington to [Wogan]109-wogan awake . [The five men]2443-the five men passed the first turn of the stairs without noise . [Wogan]109-wogan was very well pleased with [their]2443-the five men noiselessness . [Men]289-men without boots to [their]289-men feet were at a very great disadvantage when it came to a fight . [He]109-wogan allowed [them]2443-the five men to come up to the second turn , [he]109-wogan allowed [the leader]1056-the leader to ascend the last straight flight until [he]1056-the leader was almost within sword - reach , and then [he]1056-the leader quietly rose to [his]1056-the leader feet . " [Gentlemen]3122-gentlemen , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " [I]109-wogan grieve to disappoint [you]3122-gentlemen ; but [I]109-wogan have hired [this lodging]4449-this lodging for the night . "[109-wogan] [The leader]1056-the leader stopped , discountenanced , and leaned back against [[his]109-wogan followers]2447-his followers . " [You]3122-gentlemen are awake ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan stammered . " It is a habit of [mine]109-wogan . "[109-wogan] [The leader]1056-the leader puffed out [his]1056-the leader cheeks and assumed an appearance of dignity . " Then [we]4450-we are saved some loss of time . For [we]4450-we were coming to awake [you]3122-gentlemen . "[1056-the leader] " It was on that account , no doubt , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , folding [his]109-wogan arms , " that [you]3122-gentlemen have all taken off [your]3122-gentlemen boots . But , pardon [me]109-wogan , [[your]3122-gentlemen four friends]4451-your four friends behind appear in spite of what [I]109-wogan have said to be thrusting [you]3122-gentlemen forward . [I]109-wogan beg [you]3122-gentlemen to remain on the step on which [you]3122-gentlemen stand . For if [you]3122-gentlemen mount one more , [you]3122-gentlemen will put [me]109-wogan to the inconvenience of drawing [my]109-wogan sword . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan leaned back idly against the wall . [The Princess]3107-the princess should now be on [the road]228-the road and past [the inn]231-the inn — unless perhaps [Whittington]111-whittington was at watch beneath the windows . That did not seem likely , however . [Whittington]111-whittington would work in the dark and not risk detection . [The leader of [the four]2453-the four]2452-the leader of the four had stepped back at [Wogan]109-wogan 's words , but [he]2452-the leader of the four said very bravely , — " [I]2452-the leader of the four warn [you]3122-gentlemen to use no violence to [officers]4452-officers in discharge of [their]4452-officers duty . [We]4453-we hold a warrant for [your]3122-gentlemen arrest . "[2452-the leader of the four] " Indeed ? "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , with a great show of surprise . " [I]109-wogan can not bring [myself]109-wogan to believe it . On what counts ? "[109-wogan] " Firstly , in that [you]109-wogan stole away [her]4454-her Highness [the Princess Clementina]116-clementina from [[the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's guardianship]4456-the emperor 's guardianship on the night of the 27th of April at [Innspruck]17-innspruck . "[2452-the leader of the four] " Did [I]109-wogan indeed do that ? "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , carelessly . " Upon [my]109-wogan word , this cloak of [mine]109-wogan is frayed . [I]109-wogan had not noticed it ; "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan picked at the fringe of [his]109-wogan cloak with some annoyance . " In the second place , [you]109-wogan did kill and put to death , at [a wayside inn outside [Stuttgart]40-stuttgart]4457-a wayside inn outside stuttgart , one [Anton Gans]200-anton gans , servant to [the Countess of [Berg]25-berg]598-the countess of berg . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan smiled amicably . " [I]109-wogan should be given a medal for that with a most beautiful ribbon of salmon colour , [I]109-wogan fancy , salmon or aquamarine . Which would look best , do [you]109-wogan think , on a coat of black velvet ? [I]109-wogan wear black velvet , as [[your]109-wogan relations]4459-your relations will too , [[my]109-wogan friend]3085-my friend , if [you]109-wogan forget which step [your]109-wogan foot is on . "[109-wogan] [The leader of the four]2452-the leader of the four , who had set [his]2452-the leader of the four foot on the forbidden step , withdrew it quickly . "[109-wogan] And a voice very different from [[his]109-wogan leader's]2455-his leader's — a voice loud and decisive , which came from [the last of [the four]2453-the four]2456-the last of the four — answered [him]109-wogan , — " [We]4461-we have .
