"[2456-the last of the four] " And how comes it , "[109-wogan] asked [Wogan]109-wogan , " that [the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's warrant runs in [Venice]27-venice ? "[109-wogan] " Because [the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's arm strikes in [Venice]27-venice , "[2458-the hindermost] cried [the hindermost]2458-the hindermost again , and [he]2458-the hindermost pushed past [the man in front of [him]2458-the hindermost]2459-the man in front of him . " That [we]4461-we have yet to see , "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan , and [his]109-wogan sword flashed naked in [his]109-wogan hand . At the same moment [the man who had spoken]2460-the man who had spoken drew a pistol and fired . [He]2460-the man who had spoken fired in a hurry ; the bullet cut a groove in the rail of the stair and flattened itself against the passage wall . " [The Emperor]3102-the emperor 's arm shakes , it seems , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , with a laugh . [The leader of the party]2461-the leader of the party , thrust forward by [those behind [him]2461-the leader of the party]2462-those behind him , was lifted to the forbidden step . " [I]109-wogan warned [you]2461-the leader of the party , "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan , and [his]109-wogan sword darted out . But whether from design or accident , [the man]365-the man uttered a cry and stumbled forward on [his]365-the man face . [Wogan]109-wogan 's sword flashed over [his]109-wogan shoulder , and its point sank into the throat of [the soldier behind [him]109-wogan]2464-the soldier behind him . [That second soldier]2465-that second soldier fell back , with the blood spurting from [his]2465-that second soldier wound , upon [the man with the smoking pistol]2466-the man with the smoking pistol , who thrust [him]2465-that second soldier aside with an oath . " Make room , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried , and lunged over [the fallen leader]2467-the fallen leader . " Here 's [a fellow in the most desperate hurry]4468-a fellow in the most desperate hurry , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , and parrying the thrust [he]109-wogan disengaged , circled , disengaged again , and lunging felt [the soldier]2468-the soldier 's leather coat yield to [his]109-wogan point . " [The Emperor]3102-the emperor 's arm is weak , too , [one]3129-one might believe , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan laughed , and [he]109-wogan drove [his]109-wogan sword home . [The man]365-the man fell upon [the stairs]366-the stairs ; but as [Wogan]109-wogan spoke [the leader]1056-the leader crouched on the step plucked violently at [his]1056-the leader cloak below [his]1056-the leader knees . [Wogan]109-wogan had not recovered from [his]109-wogan lunge ; the jerk at the cloak threw [him]109-wogan off [his]109-wogan balance , [his]109-wogan legs slipped forward under [him]109-wogan , in another moment [he]109-wogan would have come crashing down the stairs upon [his]109-wogan back , and at the bottom of [the flight]2472-the flight there stood [one man absolutely unharmed supporting [[his]1056-the leader comrade who had been wounded in the throat]2474-his comrade who had been wounded in the throat]2473-one man absolutely unharmed supporting his comrade who had been wounded in the throat . [Wogan]109-wogan felt [the jerk]2475-the jerk , understood the danger , and saw its remedy at the same instant . [He]109-wogan did not resist the impetus , [he]109-wogan threw [his]109-wogan body into it , [he]109-wogan sprang from [the stairs]366-the stairs forwards , tearing [his]109-wogan cloak from [the leader]1056-the leader 's hands , [he]109-wogan sprang across [the leader]1056-the leader , across [the soldier who had fired at [him]109-wogan]2479-the soldier who had fired at him , and [he]109-wogan dropped with all [his]109-wogan weight into the arms of [the third man with the pierced throat]2480-the third man with the pierced throat . The blood poured out from the wound over [Wogan]109-wogan 's face and breast in a blinding jet . [The fellow]3410-the fellow uttered one choking cry and reeling back carried [the comrade who supported [him]109-wogan against the balustrade at the turn of [the stairs]366-the stairs]2482-the comrade who supported him against the balustrade at the turn of the stairs . [Wogan]109-wogan did not give [that fourth man]2484-that fourth man time to disengage [himself]2484-that fourth man , but dropping [his]109-wogan sword caught [him]2484-that fourth man by the throat as [the third wounded man]2485-the third wounded man slipped between [them]2486-them to the ground . [Wogan]109-wogan bent [[his]109-wogan new opponent]2487-his new opponent backwards over the balustrade , and felt the muscles of [his]109-wogan back resist and then slacken . [Wogan]109-wogan bent [him]109-wogan further and further over until it seemed [his]109-wogan back must break . But it was the balustrade which broke . [Wogan]109-wogan heard it crack . [He]109-wogan had just time to loose [his]109-wogan hands and step back , and the railing and [the man poised on the rail]2488-the man poised on the rail fell outwards into [the courtyard]2157-the courtyard . [Wogan]109-wogan stepped forward and peered downwards . [The soldier]2468-the soldier had not broken [his]2468-the soldier neck , for [Wogan]109-wogan saw [him]2468-the soldier writhe upon the ground . [He]109-wogan bent [his]109-wogan head to see the better ; [he]109-wogan heard a report behind [him]109-wogan , and a bullet passed through the crown of [his]109-wogan hat . [He]109-wogan swung round and saw [the leader of [the four]2453-the four]2452-the leader of the four with one of [his]2452-the leader of the four own pistols smoking in [his]2452-the leader of the four hand . " [You]2452-the leader of the four ! "[109-wogan] cried [Wogan]109-wogan . " Sure , here 's a rabbit attacking a terrier dog ; "[2468-the soldier] and [he]2468-the soldier sprang up [the stairs]366-the stairs . [The man]365-the man threw away the pistol , fell on [his]365-the man knees , and held up [his]365-the man hands for mercy . " Now what will [I]109-wogan do to [you]365-the man ? "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . " Did [you]365-the man not fire at [my]109-wogan back ? That 's reprehensible cowardice . And with [my]109-wogan own pistol , too , which is sheer impertinence . What will [I]109-wogan do with [you]365-the man ? "[109-wogan] [The man]365-the man 's expression was so pitiable , [his]365-the man heavy cheeks hung in such despairing folds , that [Wogan]109-wogan was stirred to laughter . " Well , [you]365-the man have put [me]109-wogan to a deal of inconvenience , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan ; " but [I]109-wogan will be merciful , being strong , being most extraordinary strong . [I]109-wogan 'll send [you]365-the man back to [[your]365-the man master]4471-your master [the Emperor]3102-the emperor with a message from [me]109-wogan that [four men are no manner of use at all]4473-four men are no manner of use at all . Come in here for a bit . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan took [the unfortunate man]2496-the unfortunate man and led [him]2496-the unfortunate man into [the parlour]2094-the parlour . Then [he]109-wogan lit a lamp , and making [[his]109-wogan captive]2498-his captive sit where [he]109-wogan could see any movement that [he]109-wogan made , [he]109-wogan wrote a very polite note to [[his]109-wogan Most Catholic Majesty [the Emperor]3102-the emperor]2499-his most catholic majesty the emperor wherein [he]109-wogan pointed out that it was a cruel thing to send [four poor men who had never done harm to capture [Charles Wogan]109-wogan]2501-four poor men who had never done harm to capture charles wogan ; that [no King]1255-no king or [Emperor before who had wanted to capture [Charles Wogan]109-wogan , of whom there were already many , and by [God]126-wogan 's grace [he]109-wogan hoped there would be more , had ever despatched less than [a regiment of horse upon so hazardous an expedition]2503-a regiment of horse upon so hazardous an expedition]126-wogan ; and that when [Captain O'Toole]158-o'toole might be expected to be standing side by side with [Wogan]109-wogan , it was usually thought necessary to add [seven batteries of artillery]2504-seven batteries of artillery and [a field marshal]2505-a field marshal . [Wogan]109-wogan thereupon went on to point out that [Peri]84-peri was in [Venetian territory]2506-venetian territory , which [his]109-wogan Most Catholic Majesty had violated , and that [Charles Wogan]109-wogan would accordingly feel it [his]109-wogan bounden duty not to sleep night or day until [he]109-wogan had made [a confederation of [Italian states]2508-italian states]2507-a confederation of italian states to declare war and captivity upon [[his]109-wogan Most Catholic Majesty]2509-his most catholic majesty . [Wogan]109-wogan concluded with the assurances of [his]109-wogan profoundest respects and was much pleased by [his]109-wogan letter , which [he]109-wogan sealed and compelled [[his]109-wogan prisoner]870-his prisoner upon [his]109-wogan knees to promise to deliver into [the Emperor]3102-the emperor 's own hands . " Now where is that pretty warrant ? "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , as soon as this important function was accomplished . " Now , "[109-wogan] continued [Wogan]109-wogan , " here is paper and ink and a chair . "[109-wogan] " [You]109-wogan will not force [me]3410-the fellow to that , "[3410-the fellow] cried [the fellow]3410-the fellow . " By no means . "[3410-the fellow] Then followed a deal of sighing and muttering . But the confession was written and handed to [Wogan]109-wogan , who glanced over it . " But there 's an omission , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [You]109-wogan make mention of [only five men]4481-only five men . "[2468-the soldier] [The soldier]2468-the soldier turned a startled face on [Wogan]109-wogan . " So [you]109-wogan knew ! "[2468-the soldier] [he]2468-the soldier cried . " Oh , [I]109-wogan knew , "[109-wogan] answered [Wogan]109-wogan , suddenly . " Look at [me]109-wogan ! Did [you]109-wogan ever see eyes so heavy with want of sleep , a face so worn by it , a body so jerked upon strings like [a showman]4488-a showman 's puppet ? Write , [I]109-wogan tell [you]109-wogan ! [[We]4489-we who serve [the King]3089-the king]4490-we who serve the king are trained to wakefulness . Write ! [I]109-wogan am in haste ! "[109-wogan] " Yet [[your]109-wogan King]3134-your king does not reign ! "[365-the man] said [the man]365-the man , wonderingly , and [he]365-the man wrote . [He]365-the man wrote the truth about [Harry Whittington]111-whittington ; for [Wogan]109-wogan was looking over [his]109-wogan shoulder . " Did [he]111-whittington pay [you]109-wogan to keep silence as to [his]111-whittington share in the business ? " [I]109-wogan may need it for a particular purpose ; "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan put the letter carefully away in the pocket of [his]109-wogan coat . " For a very particular purpose , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan added . " It will be well for [you]109-wogan to convey [[your]109-wogan party]4493-your party back with all haste to [Trent]52-trent . [You]109-wogan are on [the wrong side of the border]4494-the wrong side of the border . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan went from [the parlour]2094-the parlour and climbed out of [the house]3196-the house by the rope - ladder . [He]109-wogan left it hanging at the window and walked up [the glimmering road]2521-the glimmering road , a ribbon of ghostly white between [dim hills]2522-dim hills . It was then about half - past twelve of the night , and not a feather of cloud stained the perfection of the sky . It curved above [his]109-wogan head spangled like [a fair lady]2523-a fair lady 's fan , and unfathomably blue like [Clementina]116-clementina 's eyes when [her]116-clementina heart stirred in their depths . [He]109-wogan reached the little footway and turned into [the upward cleft of [the hills]224-the hills]2524-the upward cleft of the hills . [He]109-wogan walked now into the thick night of a close - grown clump of dwarf - oaks , which weaved so dense a thatch above [his]109-wogan head that [he]109-wogan knocked against the boles . The trees thinned , [he]109-wogan crossed here and there a dimpled lawn in the pure starshine , [he]109-wogan traversed a sparse grove of larches in the dreamy twilight , [he]109-wogan came out again upon [the grassy lip of a mountain torrent]2526-the grassy lip of a mountain torrent which henceforth kept [him]109-wogan company , and which , speaking with many voices , seemed [a friend]447-a friend trying to catch [his]109-wogan mood . For [here]3086-here [it]2529-it leaped over [an edge of rock]2530-an edge of rock , and here in [a tiny waterfall]2531-a tiny waterfall , and splashed into [a pellucid pool]2532-a pellucid pool , and the reverberating noise filled [the dell]2533-the dell with a majestic din ; there it ran smoothly kissing [its]2529-it banks with a murmur of contentment , embosoming the stars ; beyond , it chafed hoarsely between narrow walls ; and again half a mile higher up [it]2529-it sang on shallows and evaded the stones with a tinkling laugh . But [Wogan]109-wogan was deaf to the voices ; [he]109-wogan mounted higher , the trees ceased , [he]109-wogan came into [a desolate country of boulders]2534-a desolate country of boulders ; and the higher [he]109-wogan ascended , the more heavily [he]109-wogan walked . [He]109-wogan stopped and washed [his]109-wogan face and hands clean of blood - stains in [the stream]2535-the stream . Above [him]109-wogan and not very far away was [the lonely hut]2536-the lonely hut . [He]109-wogan came upon [it]2536-the lonely hut quite suddenly . For [the path]2537-the path climbed steeply at the back , and slipping from the mouth of [a narrow gully]2538-a narrow gully [he]109-wogan stood upon the edge of [a small plateau in the centre of which stood [the cabin]2540-the cabin]2539-a small plateau in the centre of which stood the cabin , [a little house of pinewood built with some decoration and elegance]2541-a little house of pinewood built with some decoration and elegance . One unglazed window was now unshuttered , and the light from a lantern streamed out of it in a yellow fan , marking the segment of a circle upon the rough rocky ground and giving to the dusk of the starshine a sparkle of gold . Through the window [Wogan]109-wogan could see into [the room]317-the room . [It]317-the room was furnished simply , but with an eye to comfort . [He]109-wogan saw too [the girl [he]109-wogan had dared to bear off from the thick of [a hostile town]2544-a hostile town]2543-the girl he had dared to bear off from the thick of a hostile town . [She]2543-the girl he had dared to bear off from the thick of a hostile town was lying upon a couch , [her]2543-the girl he had dared to bear off from the thick of a hostile town head resting upon [her]2543-the girl he had dared to bear off from the thick of a hostile town folded arms . [She]2543-the girl he had dared to bear off from the thick of a hostile town was asleep , and in a place most solitary . Behind [the cabin rose a black forest of pines]2545-the cabin rose a black forest of pines , pricking the sky with their black spires , and in front of [it]2545-the cabin rose a black forest of pines the ground fell sharply to [the valley]274-the valley , in which no light gleamed ; beyond [the valley]274-the valley rose [the dim hills]2548-the dim hills again . Nor was there any sound except the torrent . The air at this height was keen and fresh with a smell of primeval earth . [Wogan]109-wogan hitched [his]109-wogan cloak about [his]109-wogan throat , and [his]109-wogan boots rang upon [the rock]1923-the rock . [The Princess]3107-the princess raised [her]3107-the princess head ; [Wogan]109-wogan walked to the door and stood for a little with [his]109-wogan hand upon the latch . [He]109-wogan lifted it and entered . [Clementina]116-clementina looked at [him]109-wogan for a moment , and curiously . [She]116-clementina had no questions as to how [his]109-wogan struggle with [the Governor of [[Trent]52-trent 's emissaries]2552-trent 's emissaries]2551-the governor of trent 's emissaries had fared . [Wogan]109-wogan could understand by some unspoken sympathy that that matter had no place in [her]116-clementina thoughts . [She]116-clementina stood up in an attitude of expectation . " It grows towards morning ? "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina . " In two hours [we]2553-we shall have the dawn , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan replied ; and there was a silence between [them]2553-we . " [You]116-clementina found [this cabin]4495-this cabin open ? "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . " The door was latched . [I]109-wogan loosed a shutter . The night is very still . "[109-wogan] " [One]3129-one might fancy there were [no others alive]4497-no others alive but [you]109-wogan and [me]116-clementina across [all the width of [the world]245-the world]4498-all the width of the world . "[116-clementina] " [One]3129-one could wish it , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina said beneath [her]116-clementina breath , and crossed to the window where [she]116-clementina stayed , breathing the fresh night . The sigh , however , had reached to [Wogan]109-wogan 's ears . [He]109-wogan took [his]109-wogan pistols from [his]109-wogan belt , and to engage [his]109-wogan thoughts , loaded the one which had been fired at [him]109-wogan . After a little [he]109-wogan looked up and saw that [Clementina]116-clementina 's eyes dwelt upon [him]109-wogan with that dark steady look , which held always so much of mystery and told always one thing plainly , [her]116-clementina lack of fear . And [she]116-clementina said suddenly , — " There was trouble at [Peri]84-peri . [I]116-clementina climbed from the window . [I]116-clementina had almost forgotten . As [I]116-clementina ran down [the road]228-the road past [the open court]4502-the open court , [I]116-clementina saw [a little group of [men gathered about the foot of the staircase]4504-men gathered about the foot of the staircase]4503-a little group of men gathered about the foot of the staircase ! [I]116-clementina was in two minds whether to come back and load [your]116-clementina pistols or to obey [you]116-clementina . [I]116-clementina obeyed , but [I]116-clementina was in much fear for [you]116-clementina . [I]116-clementina had almost forgotten , it seems so long ago . Tell [me]116-clementina ! [You]116-clementina conquered ; it is no new thing . Tell [me]116-clementina how ! "[116-clementina] [She]116-clementina did not move from the window , [she]116-clementina kept [her]116-clementina eyes fixed upon [Wogan]109-wogan while [he]109-wogan told [his]109-wogan story , but it was quite clear to [him]109-wogan that [she]116-clementina did not hear one half of it . And when [he]109-wogan had done [she]116-clementina said , — " How long is it till the morning ? "[116-clementina] [Wogan]109-wogan had spun [his]109-wogan tale out , but half an hour enclosed it , from the beginning to the end . [He]109-wogan became silent again ; but [he]109-wogan was aware at once that silence was more dangerous than speech , for in the silence [he]109-wogan could hear both [their]2554-their hearts speaking . [He]109-wogan began hurriedly to talk of [their]2554-their journey , and there could be no more insidious topic for [him]109-wogan to light upon . For [he]109-wogan spoke of [the Road]228-the road , and [he]109-wogan had already been given a warning that to the romance of [the Road]228-the road [her]116-clementina heart turned like a compass - needle to the north . [They]2554-their were both gipsies , for all that [they]2554-their had no Egyptian blood . [That southward road from [Innspruck]17-innspruck]2557-that southward road from innspruck was much more than a mere highway of travel between [a starting - place]2558-a starting - place and a goal , even to these two to whom [the starting - place]2559-the starting - place meant peril and the goal the first opportunity of sleep . " Even in [our]2554-their short journey , "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina , " how it climbed hillsides angle upon angle , how it swept through [the high solitudes of ice where no trees grow , where silence lives]4505-the high solitudes of ice where no trees grow , where silence lives ; how it dropped down into [green valleys]4506-green valleys and the noise of streams ! And it still sweeps on , through dark and light , a glimmer at night , a glare in the midday , between lines of poplars , hidden amongst vines , through [lighted cities]4507-lighted cities , down to [Venice]27-venice and [the sea]3274-the sea . If [one]3129-one could travel it , never retracing a step , pitching a tent by [the roadside]248-the roadside when one willed ! That were freedom ! "[116-clementina] [She]116-clementina stopped with a remarkable abruptness . [She]116-clementina turned [her]116-clementina eyes out of the window for a little . Then again [she]116-clementina asked , — " How long till morning ? "[116-clementina] " But one more hour . "[116-clementina] [She]116-clementina came back into [the room]317-the room and seated [herself]116-clementina at the table . " [You]2561-he gave [me]116-clementina some hint at [Innspruck]17-innspruck of an adventurous ride from [Ohlau]12-ohlau , "[116-clementina] and [she]116-clementina drew [her]116-clementina breath sharply at the word , as though the name with all its associations struck [her]116-clementina a blow , " into [Strasbourg]32-strasbourg . Tell [me]2561-he [its]32-strasbourg history . So will this hour pass . "[2561-he] [He]2561-he told [her]116-clementina as [he]2561-he walked about [the room]317-the room , though [his]2561-he heart was not in the telling , nor [hers]116-clementina in the hearing , until [he]2561-he came to relate the story of [his]2561-he escape from [the inn]231-the inn a mile or so beyond [Stuttgart]40-stuttgart . [He]2561-he described how [he]2561-he hid in [the garden]413-the garden , how [he]2561-he crossed [the rich level of lawn]2565-the rich level of lawn to the lighted window , how to [his]2561-he surprise [he]2561-he was admitted without a question by [an old bookish gentleman]2566-an old bookish gentleman — and thereupon [he]2561-he ceased so suddenly that [Clementina]116-clementina turned [her]116-clementina head aside and listened . " Did [you]2561-he hear a step ? "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina asked in a low voice . " No . "[116-clementina] And [they]2567-they both listened . No noise came to [their]2567-they ears but the brawling of the torrent . That , however , filled [the room]317-the room , drowning all the natural murmurs of the night . " Indeed , [one]3129-one would not hear a company of [soldiers]1199-soldiers , "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina . [She]116-clementina crossed to the window . " Yet [you]116-clementina heard [my]109-wogan step , and it waked [you]116-clementina , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , as [he]109-wogan followed [her]116-clementina . " [I]116-clementina listened for it in [my]116-clementina sleep , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina . For a second time that night [they]2567-they stood side by side looking upon darkness and the spangled sky . Only there was [no courtyard]2569-no courtyard with [its]2569-no courtyard signs of habitation . [Clementina]116-clementina drew [herself]116-clementina away suddenly from the sill . [Wogan]109-wogan at once copied [her]116-clementina example . " [You]116-clementina saw — ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan began . " [No one]356-no one , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina , bending [her]116-clementina dark eyes full upon [him]109-wogan . " Will [you]109-wogan close the shutter ? "[116-clementina] [Wogan]109-wogan drew back instinctively . [He]109-wogan had a sense that this open window , though there was [no one to spy through it]2570-no one to spy through it , was in some way a security . Suppose that [he]109-wogan closed it ! That mere act of shutting [himself]109-wogan and [her]116-clementina apart , though it gave not one atom more of privacy , still had a semblance of giving it . [He]109-wogan was afraid . [He]109-wogan said , — " There is no need . Who should spy on [us]4514-us ? What would it matter if [we]4514-us were spied upon ? "[109-wogan] " [I]109-wogan ask [you]109-wogan to close that shutter . "[109-wogan] From the quiet , level voice [he]109-wogan could infer nothing of the thought behind the request ; and [her]116-clementina unwavering eyes told [him]109-wogan nothing . " Why ? "[116-clementina] " Because [I]116-clementina am afraid , as [you]109-wogan are , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina , and [she]116-clementina shivered . " [You]109-wogan would not have it shut . [I]116-clementina am afraid while it stays open . There is too much expectation in the night . Those great black pines stand waiting ; the stars are very bright and still , they wait , holding their breath . It seems to [me]116-clementina the whirl of [the earth]3142-the earth has stopped . Never was there a night so hushed in expectation ; "[116-clementina] and these words too [she]116-clementina spoke without a falter or a lifting note , breathing easily like [a child asleep]2571-a child asleep , and not changing [her]116-clementina direct gaze from [Wogan]109-wogan 's face . " [I]116-clementina am afraid , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina continued , " of [you]109-wogan and [me]116-clementina . [I]116-clementina am the more afraid ; "[116-clementina] and [Wogan]109-wogan set the shutter in its place and let the bar fall . [Clementina]116-clementina with a breath of relief came back to [her]116-clementina seat at the table . " How long is it till dawn ? "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina said . " [We]4516-we have half an hour , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . " Well , [that old man]4517-that old man — [Count von Ahlen]153-count otto , [you]116-clementina said — received [you]116-clementina , heaped logs upon [his]4517-that old man fire , stanched [your]116-clementina wounds , and asked no questions . " Why did [he]4517-that old man ask no question , seeing [me]109-wogan disordered , wounded , [a bandit]4518-a bandit , for all [he]4517-that old man knew , with a murder on [my]109-wogan hands ? " [Count Otto von Ahlen]153-count otto , [[my]109-wogan host]4522-my host , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan continued , " had a momentary thought that [I]109-wogan was [Königsmarck]154-königsmarck mysteriously returned as [he]4517-that old man had mysteriously vanished ; and through these thirty years ' retention of [his]4517-that old man youth , [Count Otto]153-count otto could never think of [Königsmarck]154-königsmarck but as [a man young and tossed in a froth of passion]4523-a man young and tossed in a froth of passion . ' "[109-wogan] " And the saying lived in [your]116-clementina thoughts , "[116-clementina] cried [Clementina]116-clementina . " [I]116-clementina do not wonder . "[116-clementina] " Nay , it was an hour 's talk with [Königsmarck]154-königsmarck which set [the old man]737-the old man 's thoughts that way ; and though [Königsmarck]154-königsmarck talked never so well , [I]109-wogan would not likely infer from [his]737-the old man talk an eternal and universal truth . "[116-clementina] " No , "[109-wogan] exclaimed [Wogan]109-wogan ; " [I]109-wogan would to God it were ! " All the way up from [Peri]84-peri , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , suddenly , " [I]109-wogan strove to make real to [myself]109-wogan the ignominy , the odium , the scandal . "[2580-i] " But [I]109-wogan had no thought ever to let [you]116-clementina know . [I]109-wogan was [[the King]3089-the king 's man - at - arms]4542-the king 's man - at - arms , as [I]109-wogan am now ; "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan burst into a harsh laugh . " Here 's madness ! And here 's the poem ! "[109-wogan] and at that a great cry of terror leaped from [Clementina]116-clementina 's lips and held [them]2581-them both aghast . [Wogan]109-wogan had risen from [his]109-wogan seat ; with a violent gesture [he]109-wogan had thrown back [his]109-wogan cloak , and [his]109-wogan coat beneath was stained and dark with blood . [Clementina]116-clementina stood opposite to [him]109-wogan , all [her]116-clementina quiet and [her]116-clementina calmness gone . There was no longer any mystery in [her]116-clementina eyes . Again for love of [me]116-clementina [you]109-wogan are hurt . "[116-clementina] " It is not [my]109-wogan wound , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan answered . " It is blood [I]109-wogan spilt for [you]116-clementina ; "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan took a step towards [her]116-clementina , and in a second [she]116-clementina was between [his]109-wogan arms , sobbing with all the violence of passion which [she]116-clementina had so long restrained . [Wogan]109-wogan was wrung by it . That [she]116-clementina should weep at all was a thought strange to [him]109-wogan ; that [he]109-wogan should cause the tears was a sorrow which tortured [him]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan touched [her]116-clementina hair with [his]109-wogan lips , [he]109-wogan took [her]116-clementina by the arms and would have set [her]116-clementina apart ; but [she]116-clementina clung to [him]109-wogan , hiding [her]116-clementina face , and the sobs shook [her]116-clementina . [Her]116-clementina breast was strained against [him]109-wogan , [he]109-wogan felt the beating of [her]116-clementina heart , a fever ran through all [his]109-wogan blood . And as [he]109-wogan held [her]116-clementina close , a queer inconsequential thought came into [his]109-wogan mind . It shocked [him]109-wogan , and [he]109-wogan suddenly held [her]116-clementina off . " The blood upon [my]109-wogan coat is wet , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried . The odium , the scandal of a flight which would make [her]116-clementina name a byword from [London]22-london to [Budapest]91-budapest , that [he]109-wogan could envisage ; but that this blood upon [his]109-wogan coat should stain the dress [she]116-clementina wore — no ! [He]109-wogan saw indeed that the bodice was smeared a dark red . " See , the blood stains [you]116-clementina ! "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried . " Why , then , [I]116-clementina share it , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina answered with a ringing voice of pride . " [I]116-clementina share it with [you]109-wogan ; "[116-clementina] and [she]116-clementina smiled through [her]116-clementina tears and a glowing blush brightened upon [her]116-clementina face . " That 's [John Sobieski]201-john sobieski speaking , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan exclaimed , and with an emphasis of despair , " [[Poland]146-king john 's King]4549-poland 's king ! But [I]109-wogan was mad ! Indeed , [I]109-wogan blame [myself]109-wogan . "[109-wogan] " Blame ! "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina cried passionately , [her]116-clementina whole nature rising in revolt against the word . " Are [we]4550-we to blame ? [We]4550-we are [man]3319-man and [woman]3693-woman . Who shall cast the stone ? Are [you]116-clementina to blame for that [you]116-clementina love [me]116-clementina ? Who shall blame [you]116-clementina ? Not [I]116-clementina , who thank [you]116-clementina from [my]116-clementina heart . Am [I]116-clementina to blame ? What have [we]4550-we hearts for , then , if not to love ? [I]116-clementina have a thought — it may be very wrong . [I]116-clementina do not know . [I]116-clementina do not trouble to think — that [I]116-clementina should be much more to blame did [I]116-clementina not love [you]116-clementina too . There 's the word spoken at the last , "[116-clementina] and [she]116-clementina lowered [her]116-clementina head . It occurred to [him]109-wogan that [he]109-wogan had never before seen [her]116-clementina drop [her]116-clementina eyes from [his]109-wogan . [Her]116-clementina next words told [him]109-wogan it was [her]116-clementina white flag of surrender . " [I]116-clementina believe the spoken truth is best , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina said simply in a low voice which ever so slightly trembled . " Unspoken and yet known by both of [us]4553-our , [I]116-clementina think it would breed thoughts and humours [we]4553-our are best without . Unspoken [our]4553-our eyes would question , each to other , at every meeting ; there would be no health in [our]4553-our thoughts . But here 's the truth out , and [I]116-clementina am glad — in whichever way [you]109-wogan find its consequence . "[116-clementina] [She]116-clementina stood before [him]109-wogan with [her]116-clementina head bent . " Yes , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina answered . " There is [Bologna]1-bologna . Say that [Bologna]1-bologna is [our]4553-our goal . What will [you]109-wogan do ? "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan drew a long breath . The magnitude of the submission paralysed [him]109-wogan . The picture which [she]116-clementina evoked was one to blind [him]109-wogan as with a glory of sunlight . [He]109-wogan remained silent for a while . Then [he]109-wogan said timidly , — " There is [Ohlau]12-ohlau . "[109-wogan] [The girl]336-the girl shivered . But [she]336-the girl answered only with [her]336-the girl question , — " What will [you]109-wogan do ? "[336-the girl] " [You]336-the girl would lose a throne , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said , and even while [he]109-wogan spoke was aware that such a plea had not with [her]336-the girl now the weight of thistledown . " [You]336-the girl would become the mock of [Europe,—you]92-europe,—you that are its wonder ; "[336-the girl] and [he]109-wogan saw the corner of [her]336-the girl lip curve in a smile of scorn . " What will [you]109-wogan do ? "[336-the girl] [she]336-the girl asked , and [he]109-wogan ceased to argue . It was [he]109-wogan who must decide ; [she]336-the girl willed it so . [He]109-wogan turned towards the door of [the hut]4535-the hut and opened it . As [he]109-wogan passed through , [he]109-wogan heard [her]336-the girl move behind , and looking over [his]109-wogan shoulder , [he]109-wogan saw that [she]336-the girl leaned down upon the table and kissed the pistol which [he]109-wogan had left loaded there . [He]109-wogan stepped out of [the cabin]2540-the cabin and closed the door behind [him]109-wogan . The dark blue of the sky had faded to a pure and pearly colour ; a colourless grey light invaded it ; the pale stars were drowning ; and all about [him]109-wogan the trees shivered to the morning . [Wogan]109-wogan walked up and down [that little plateau]2590-that little plateau , torn by indecision . Inside [the sheltered cabin]2591-the sheltered cabin sat waiting [the girl]336-the girl , whose destiny was in [his]109-wogan hands . [He]109-wogan had a sentence to speak , and by it the flow of all [her]336-the girl years would be irrevocably ordered . [She]336-the girl had given [herself]336-the girl over to [him,—she]109-wogan , with [her]336-the girl pride , [her]336-the girl courage , [her]336-the girl endurance . [Wogan]109-wogan had seen too closely into [her]336-the girl heart to bring any foolish charge of unmaidenliness against [her]336-the girl . No , the very completeness of [her]336-the girl submission raised [her]336-the girl to a higher pinnacle . If [she]336-the girl gave [herself]336-the girl , [she]336-the girl did so without a condition or a reserve , body and bone , heart and soul . [Wogan]109-wogan knew amongst [the women of [his]109-wogan time]2593-the women of his time [many who made [their]2594-many who made their bargain with the world , buying a semblance of esteem with a double payment of lies bargain with [the world]245-the world , buying a semblance of esteem with a double payment of lies]2594-many who made their bargain with the world , buying a semblance of esteem with a double payment of lies . [This girl]2287-this girl stood apart from [them]2593-the women of his time . [She]2287-this girl loved , therefore [she]2287-this girl entrusted [herself]2287-this girl simply to [the man [she]2287-this girl loved]2597-the man she loved , and bade [him]2597-the man she loved dispose of [her]2287-this girl . That very simplicity was another sign of [her]2287-this girl strength . [She]2287-this girl was the more priceless on account of it . [He]109-wogan went back into [the hut]4535-the hut . Through the chinks of the shutter the morning stretched a grey finger ; [the room]317-the room was filled with a vaporous twilight . " [We]4557-we travel to [Bologna]1-bologna , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . " [I]109-wogan will not have [you]2287-this girl wasted . [Other women]4558-other women may slink into [kennels]4559-kennels and stop [their]4558-other women ears — not [you]2287-this girl . [The King]3089-the king is true to [you]2287-this girl . [You]2287-this girl are for [the King]3089-the king . "[109-wogan] As [she]2287-this girl had not argued before , [she]2287-this girl did not argue now . [She]2287-this girl nodded [her]2287-this girl head and fastened [her]2287-this girl cloak about [her]2287-this girl throat . [She]2287-this girl followed [him]109-wogan out of [the hut]4535-the hut and down [the gorge]2601-the gorge . In the northeast the sky already flamed , and the sun was up before [they]2602-they reached [the road]228-the road . [They]2602-they walked silently towards [Peri]84-peri , and [Wogan]109-wogan was wondering whether in [her]2287-this girl heart [she]2287-this girl despised [him]109-wogan when [she]2287-this girl stopped . " [I]2287-this girl am to marry [the King]3089-the king , "[2287-this girl] said [she]2287-this girl . " Yes , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . " But [you]109-wogan ? "[2287-this girl] [she]2287-this girl said with [her]2287-this girl brows in a frown ; " there is no compulsion on [you]109-wogan to marry — [anyone]322-anyone . "[2287-this girl] [Wogan]109-wogan was relieved of [his]109-wogan fears . [He]109-wogan broke into a laugh , to which [she]2287-this girl made no reply . [She]2287-this girl still waited frowning for [his]109-wogan answer . " [No woman]3630-no woman , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said , " will ride on [my]109-wogan black horse into [[my]109-wogan city of dreams]3080-my city of dreams . [You]2287-this girl may be very sure [I]109-wogan will not marry . "[109-wogan] " No . [I]109-wogan would not have [you]2287-this girl married . "[109-wogan] [Wogan]109-wogan laughed again , but [Clementina]116-clementina was very serious . That [she]116-clementina had no right to make any such claim did not occur to [her]116-clementina . [She]116-clementina was merely certain and resolved that [Wogan]109-wogan must not marry . [She]116-clementina did not again refer to the matter , nor could [she]116-clementina so have done had [she]116-clementina wished . For a little later and while [they]2604-they were not yet come to [Peri]84-peri , [they]2604-they were hailed from behind , and turning about [they]2604-they saw [Gaydon]142-gaydon and [O'Toole]158-o'toole riding after [them]2604-they . [O'Toole]158-o'toole had [his]158-o'toole story to tell . [Gaydon]142-gaydon and [he]158-o'toole had put [the courier]3130-the courier to bed and taken [his]158-o'toole clothes and [his]158-o'toole money , and after [the fellow]3410-the fellow had waked up , [they]2604-they had sat for a day in [the bedroom]4016-the bedroom keeping [him]3410-the fellow quiet and telling [the landlord]218-the landlord [he]3410-the fellow was very ill . [O'Toole]158-o'toole finished [his]158-o'toole story as [they]2604-they came to [Peri]84-peri . [They]2604-they went boldly to [the Cervo Inn]2609-the cervo inn , where all traces of the night 's conflict had been removed , and neither [Wogan]109-wogan nor [the landlady]4076-the landlady thought it prudent to make any mention of the matter ; [they]2604-they waited for [Misset]177-captain misset and [[his]177-captain misset wife]589-his wife , who came the next day . And thus reunited [they]2604-they passed one evening into [the streets of [Bologna]1-bologna]3270-the streets of bologna and stopped at [the Pilgrim Inn]93-the pilgrim inn . In [the parlour of [the Pilgrim Inn]2614-the pilgrim inn [the four friends]2615-the four friends]2613-the parlour of the pilgrim inn the four friends took [their]2615-the four friends leave of [the Princess]3107-the princess . [She]3107-the princess could not part from [them]2615-the four friends lightly ; [she]3107-the princess spoke with a faltering voice : — " Five days ago [I]3107-the princess was in prison at [Innspruck]17-innspruck , perpetually harassed and with no hope of release but in [you]109-wogan . Now [I]3107-the princess am in [Bologna]1-bologna , and free . [I]3107-the princess could not believe that [any girl]4566-any girl could find [such friends]4110-such friends except in [fairyland]4568-fairyland . [You]109-wogan make [the world]245-the world very sweet and clean to [me]3107-the princess . [I]3107-the princess should thank [you]109-wogan . See [my]3107-the princess tears fall ! Will [you]109-wogan take them for [my]3107-the princess thanks ? [I]3107-the princess have no words which can tell as much of [my]3107-the princess thoughts towards [you]109-wogan . [[My]3107-the princess little woman]4358-my little woman [I]3107-the princess keep with [me]3107-the princess , but to [you]109-wogan gentlemen [I]3107-the princess would gladly give a token each , so that [you]109-wogan may know [I]3107-the princess will never forget , and so that [you]109-wogan too may keep for [me]3107-the princess [a home within [your]109-wogan memories]4571-a home within your memories . "[3107-the princess] To [Major Gaydon]142-gaydon [she]2617-her gave a ring from off [her]2617-her finger , to [Captain Misset]177-captain misset a chain which [she]2617-her wore about [her]2617-her neck , to O'Toole , " [her]2617-her six feet four , "[2617-her] as [she]2617-her said between laughter and tears , [her]2617-her watch . [Each with a word of homage]2618-each with a word of homage took [his]2618-each with a word of homage leave . [Clementina]116-clementina spoke to [Wogan]109-wogan last of all , and when [the room]317-the room was empty but for [these two]1054-these two . " To [you]109-wogan , [[my]116-clementina friend]3085-my friend , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina , " [I]116-clementina give nothing . There is no need . But [I]116-clementina ask for something . [I]116-clementina would be in debt to [you]109-wogan still deeper than [I]116-clementina am . [I]116-clementina ask for a handkerchief which [I]116-clementina dropped from [my]116-clementina shoulders one evening under the stars upon [the road]228-the road to [Ala.]88-ala. "[116-clementina] [Wogan]109-wogan bowed to [her]116-clementina without a word . [He]109-wogan drew the handkerchief from [his]109-wogan breast slowly . " It is true , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan ; " [I]109-wogan have no right to it ; "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan gave it back . But [his]109-wogan voice showed that [he]109-wogan was hurt . " [You]109-wogan do not understand , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina , with a great gentleness . " [You]109-wogan have every right which the truest loyalty can confer . "[116-clementina] [Wogan]109-wogan could not trust [his]109-wogan voice to answer [her]116-clementina . [He]109-wogan took [her]116-clementina hand to lift it to [his]109-wogan lips . " Here 's a great work ended , "[142-gaydon] said [Gaydon]142-gaydon at last . " [We]2621-his three companions shall be historical , "[158-o'toole] said [O'Toole]158-o'toole . " It is [my]142-gaydon one ambition . [I]142-gaydon want to figure in the history - books and be a great plague and nuisance to [children at school]4574-children at school . [I]142-gaydon would sooner be cursed daily by [schoolboys]1566-schoolboys than have any number of golden statues in [galleries]4576-galleries . It means the more solid reputation ; "[142-gaydon] and then [he]142-gaydon became silent . [Gaydon]142-gaydon had , besides [his]142-gaydon joy at the rescue of [Clementina]116-clementina , a private satisfaction that matters which were none of [his]142-gaydon business had had no uncomfortable issue . [Misset]177-captain misset , too , was thankful for that [[his]142-gaydon wife]589-his wife had come safely to the journey 's end . [O'Toole]158-o'toole alone had a weight upon [his]158-o'toole mind ; and when [Gaydon]142-gaydon said , " Well , [we]4577-we may go to bed and sleep without alarms till sundown to - morrow , "[142-gaydon] [he]142-gaydon remarked , — " There 's [Jenny]161-jenny . [He]109-wogan had thought that [their]2638-their troubles were at an end , but here was a new difficulty at which in truth [he]109-wogan rather feared to guess . [The Chevalier]198-chevalier de st. george,—there 's departure to [Spain]18-spain had been a puzzle to [him]109-wogan before ; [he]109-wogan remembered now that [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier had agreed with reluctance to [his]348-the chevalier enterprise , and had never been more than lukewarm in [its]348-the chevalier support . " [I]109-wogan brought [her]3107-the princess out of [Innspruck]17-innspruck to [Bologna]1-bologna . [The King]3089-the king must marry [the Princess]3107-the princess ; "[109-wogan] and , quite unawares , [he]109-wogan set off running towards [the inn]231-the inn . [Many of [the people]2650-the people]2649-many of the people carried blazing torches , which [they]2649-many of the people waved in the air , dropping the burning resin upon [[their]2649-many of the people companions]2651-their companions ; [others]460-others threw [their]460-others hats skywards ; here were [boys]2653-boys beating drums , and [grown men blowing upon toy trumpets]2654-grown men blowing upon toy trumpets ; and [all]2655-all were shouting and cheering with a deafening enthusiasm . The news of [the Princess]3107-the princess 's arrival had spread like wildfire through [the town]3115-the town . [Wogan]109-wogan 's spirits rose at a bound . Here was a welcome very different from [the Cardinal]430-the cardinal 's . " This is [one tiny square in [a little town]4607-a little town]4606-one tiny square in a little town , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan continued . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan began hurriedly to assure [her]116-clementina that [the King]3089-the king had doubted [his]3089-the king capacity to bring the enterprise to a favourable issue , but that now [he]3089-the king would without doubt return . Just for a second it shone out , angles and lines so clearly revealed that it was as though [the crowd]2648-the crowd had vanished , and that one contorted face glared alone at the windows in a flare of hell - fire . " [The man at [Peri]84-peri]4613-the man at peri , "[116-clementina] said [she]116-clementina , in a whisper . " At [Peri]84-peri , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said in a stumbling voice , " [I]109-wogan waked from a dream and saw [that man , bird - like and cunning]4615-that man , bird - like and cunning , watching over the rim of the stairs . " [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " [[our]4618-our Holy Father [the Pope]3095-the pope]4619-our holy father the pope wishes to testify [his]3095-the pope approbation of [your]109-wogan remarkable enterprise on behalf of [a princess who is [[his]3095-the pope god - daughter]4622-his god - daughter]4621-a princess who is his god - daughter . " [You]109-wogan hardly know what [you]109-wogan refuse , "[444-his eminence] said [[his]109-wogan Eminence]444-his eminence . For [they]989-his friends hold service under [the King of [France]54-france]4627-the king of france]4626-three friends with me who shared every danger . i can not accept an honour which they do not share ; for indeed they risked more than i did . for they hold service under the king of france . "[109-wogan] [The Cardinal]430-the cardinal was pleased to compliment [Wogan]109-wogan upon [his]109-wogan loyalty to [[his]109-wogan friends]989-his friends . " [They]989-his friends shall not be [the losers]4628-the losers , "[430-the cardinal] said [he]430-the cardinal . " [I]430-the cardinal sent [a messenger thither]4631-a messenger thither on the night of [your]109-wogan coming , "[430-the cardinal] said [the Cardinal]430-the cardinal ; " but it is a long journey into [Spain]18-spain . [We]4632-we must wait . "[430-the cardinal] To [Wogan]109-wogan it seemed the waiting would never end . [The Cardinal]430-the cardinal had found [a little house]2690-a little house set apart from [the street]292-the street with [a great garden of lawns and cedar - trees and laurels]2692-a great garden of lawns and cedar - trees and laurels ; and in [that garden]2693-that garden now fresh with spring flowers and made private by high walls , [the Princess]3107-the princess passed [her]3107-the princess days . [Wogan]109-wogan saw [her]3107-the princess but seldom during this time , but each occasion sent [him]109-wogan back to [[his]109-wogan lodging]373-his lodging in a fever of anxiety . [She]3107-the princess had grown silent , and [her]3107-the princess silence alarmed [him]109-wogan . [She]3107-the princess had lost the sparkling buoyancy of [her]3107-the princess spirits . [Mrs. Misset]143-misset , who attended [her]3107-the princess , told [him]109-wogan that [she]3107-the princess would sit for long whiles with a red spot burning in each cheek . [Wogan]109-wogan feared that [her]3107-the princess pride was chafing [her]3107-the princess gentleness , that [she]3107-the princess guessed there was reluctance in [the King]3089-the king 's delay . " But [she]3107-the princess must marry [the King]3089-the king , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan still persevered in declaring . [Her]3107-the princess hardships , [her]3107-the princess imprisonment , [her]3107-the princess perilous escape , the snows of [Innspruck,—these]96-innspruck,—these were known now ; and if at the last the end for which they had been endured — [Wogan]109-wogan broke off from [his]109-wogan reflections to hear [the world]245-the world laughing . [The world]245-the world would not think ; it would laugh . " For [her]3107-the princess own sake [she]3107-the princess must marry , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan cried , as [he]109-wogan paced about [[his]109-wogan rooms]377-his rooms . " For [ours]4634-ours , too , for [a country]4635-a country 's sake ; "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan looked northwards towards [England]19-england . But " for [her]3107-the princess own sake "[109-wogan] was the reason uppermost in [his]109-wogan thoughts . But the days passed . The three promised patents came from [Rome]4-rome , and [Cardinal Origo]122-cardinal origo unlocked the drawer and joined [Wogan]109-wogan 's to [them]2700-them . [He]109-wogan presented all four at the same time . " The patents carry the titles of ' Excellency , ' "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan . [O'Toole]158-o'toole beamed with delight . " Sure , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " [I]109-wogan will have a toga with the arms of [the O'Tooles]202-the o'tooles embroidered on the back , to appear in at [the Capitol]4636-the capitol . It is on June 15 , [your]109-wogan Eminence . Upon [my]109-wogan soul , [I]109-wogan have not much time ; "[109-wogan] and [he]109-wogan grew thoughtful . " A toga will hardly take a month , even with the embroidery , which [I]430-the cardinal do not greatly recommend , "[430-the cardinal] said [the Cardinal]430-the cardinal , drily . " [I]158-o'toole was not at the moment thinking of the toga , "[158-o'toole] said [O'Toole]158-o'toole , gloomily . " And what of [the King in [Spain]18-spain]4630-the king in spain ? "[109-wogan] asked [Wogan]109-wogan . " [We]4638-we must wait , [[my]430-the cardinal friend]3085-my friend , "[430-the cardinal] said [the Cardinal]430-the cardinal . In a week there was brought to [Wogan]109-wogan one morning a letter in [the King]3089-the king 's hand . [He]109-wogan fingered it for a little , not daring to break the seal . When [he]109-wogan did break it , [he]109-wogan read a great many compliments upon [his]109-wogan success , and after the compliments a statement that the marriage should take place at [Montefiascone]97-montefiascone as soon as [the King]3089-the king could depart from [Spain]18-spain , and after that statement , a declaration that since [[her]2705-her Highness]3138-her highness 's position was not meanwhile one that suited either [her]2705-her dignity or the love [the King]3089-the king had for [her]2705-her , a marriage by proxy should take place at [Bologna]1-bologna . [The Chevalier]348-the chevalier added that [he]348-the chevalier had written to [Cardinal Origo]122-cardinal origo to make the necessary arrangements for the ceremony , and [he]348-the chevalier appointed herewith [Mr. Charles Wogan]109-wogan to act as [[his]348-the chevalier proxy]2709-his proxy , in recognition of [his]348-the chevalier great services . [Wogan]109-wogan felt a natural distaste for the part [he]109-wogan was to take in the ceremony . To stand up before [the Cardinal]430-the cardinal and take [Clementina]116-clementina 's hand in [his]348-the chevalier , and speak another 's marriage vows and receive [hers]116-clementina as another 's deputy,—there was a certain mockery in the situation for which [he]109-wogan had no liking . The memory of [the cabin on [the mountain - side]2712-the mountain - side]2711-the cabin on the mountain - side was something too near . But , at all events , [the King]3089-the king was to marry [the Princess]3107-the princess , and [Wogan]109-wogan 's distaste was swallowed up in a great relief . There would be no laughter rippling over [Europe]7-europe like the wind over a field of corn . [He]109-wogan stood by [his]109-wogan window in the spring sunshine with a great contentment of spirit , and then there came a loud rapping on [his]109-wogan door . [He]109-wogan caught [his]109-wogan breath ; [he]109-wogan grew white with a sudden fear ; [you]2715-you would have thought it was [his]109-wogan heart that was knocked upon . For there was another side to the business . [The King]3089-the king would marry [the Princess]3107-the princess ; but how would [the Princess]3107-the princess take this marriage by proxy and [the King]3089-the king 's continued absence ? [She]3107-the princess had [her]3107-the princess pride , as [he]109-wogan knew well . The knocking was repeated . [Wogan]109-wogan in a voice of suspense bade [[his]109-wogan visitor]720-his visitor enter . [The visitor]2721-the visitor was [one of [[her]3107-the princess Highness 's new servants]2723-her highness 's new servants]2722-one of her highness 's new servants . " Without a doubt , "[109-wogan] thought [Wogan]109-wogan , " [she]3107-the princess has received a letter by the same messenger who brought [me]109-wogan [mine]109-wogan . "[109-wogan] [The servant]753-the servant handed [him]109-wogan a note from [the Princess]3107-the princess , begging [him]109-wogan to attend on [her]3107-the princess at once . " [She]3107-the princess must marry [the King]3089-the king , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan to [himself]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan took [his]109-wogan hat and cane , and followed [the servant]753-the servant into [the street]292-the street . [Wogan]109-wogan was guided through [the streets]399-the streets to the mouth of [a blind alley]2729-a blind alley , at the bottom of which rose a high garden wall , and over the wall the smoking chimneys of [a house]3268-a house among the tops of many trees freshly green , which shivered in the breeze and shook the sunlight from their leaves . [This alley]2731-this alley , from the first day when [the Princess]3107-the princess came to lodge in [the house]3196-the house , had worn to [Wogan]109-wogan a familiar air ; and this morning , as [he]109-wogan pondered dismally whether , after all , those laborious months since [he]109-wogan had ridden hopefully out of [Bologna]1-bologna to [Ohlau]12-ohlau were to bear no fruit , [he]109-wogan chanced to remember why . [He]109-wogan had passed [that alley]2734-that alley at the moment of grey dawn , when [he]109-wogan was starting out upon this adventure , and [he]109-wogan had seen [a man]235-a man muffled in a cloak step from its mouth and suddenly draw back as [his]109-wogan horse 's hoofs rang in [the silent street]2736-the silent street , as though to elude recognition . [Wogan]109-wogan wondered for a second who at that time had lived in [the house]3196-the house ; but [he]109-wogan was admitted through a door in the wall and led into [a little room]768-a little room with French windows opening on [a lawn]2739-a lawn . [The garden]413-the garden seen from [here]3086-here was a wealth of white blossoms and yellow , and amongst them [Clementina]116-clementina paced alone , the richest and the whitest blossom of them all . [She]116-clementina was dressed simply in a white gown of muslin and a little three - cornered hat of straw ; but [Wogan]109-wogan knew as [he]109-wogan advanced towards [her]116-clementina that it was not merely the hat which threw the dark shadow on [her]116-clementina face . [She]116-clementina took a step or two towards [him]109-wogan and began at once without any friendly greeting in a cold , formal voice , — " [You]109-wogan have received a letter this morning from [[his]109-wogan Majesty]3911-his majesty ? "[116-clementina] " Yes , [[your]109-wogan Highness]3263-your highness . "[116-clementina] " Why does [the King]3089-the king linger in [Spain]18-spain ? "[116-clementina] " The expedition from [Cadiz]95-cadiz — "[116-clementina] " Which left harbour a week ago . Well , [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina asked in biting tones , " how does that expedition now on [the high seas]1296-the high seas detain [[his]109-wogan Majesty]3911-his majesty in [Spain]18-spain ? "[116-clementina] [Wogan]109-wogan was utterly dumfounded . [He]109-wogan stood and gazed at [her]116-clementina , a great trouble in [his]109-wogan eyes , and [his]109-wogan wits with that expedition all at sea . " Is [[your]116-clementina Highness]3263-your highness sure ? "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan babbled . " Oh , indeed , most sure , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina replied with the hardest laugh which [he]109-wogan had ever heard from [a woman]234-a woman 's lips . " [I]109-wogan did not know , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan said in dejection , and [she]116-clementina took a step nearer to [him]109-wogan , and [her]116-clementina cheeks flamed . " Is that the truth ? "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina asked , [her]116-clementina voice trembling with anger . " [You]109-wogan did not know ? "[116-clementina] And [Wogan]109-wogan understood that the real trouble with [her]116-clementina at this moment was not so much [the King]3089-the king 's delay in [Spain]18-spain as a doubt whether [he]109-wogan [himself]109-wogan had played with [her]116-clementina and spoken [her]116-clementina false . For if [he]109-wogan was proved untrue here , why , [he]109-wogan might have been untrue throughout , on [the stairway at [Innspruck]17-innspruck]2744-the stairway at innspruck , on [the road to [Ala]63-ala]2745-the road to ala , in [the hut on [the bluff of [the hills]224-the hills]2747-the bluff of the hills]2746-the hut on the bluff of the hills . [He]109-wogan could see how harshly the doubt would buffet [her]116-clementina pride , how it would wound [her]116-clementina to the soul . " It is the truth , "[109-wogan] [he]109-wogan answered ; " [you]116-clementina will believe it . [I]109-wogan pledge [my]109-wogan soul upon it . Lay [your]116-clementina hand in mine . [I]109-wogan will repeat it standing so . Could [I]109-wogan speak false with [your]116-clementina hand close in [mine]109-wogan ? "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan held out [his]109-wogan hand ; [she]116-clementina did not move , nor did [her]116-clementina attitude of distrust relent . " Could [you]109-wogan not ? "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina asked icily . [Wogan]109-wogan was baffled ; [he]109-wogan was angered . " Have [I]109-wogan ever told [you]116-clementina lies ? " In [the berlin between [Brixen]71-brixen and [Wellishmile]82-wellishmile]4647-the berlin between brixen and wellishmile . ' Do [you]3070-sir remember that ? The chain linked [your]3070-sir hand - locks , [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan . It was [your]3070-sir own escape of which [you]116-clementina told [me]116-clementina . [I]2751-i would not have thought [I]2751-i could have suffered so much pain ! "[2751-i] That last cry wrung [Wogan]126-wogan 's heart . " Will [you]737-the old man show [me]116-clementina first the portrait of [Mlle . de Caprara]204-mlle ? "[116-clementina] said [Clementina]116-clementina . It was a full - length portrait painted with remarkable skill . [Maria Vittoria de Caprara]164-maria vittoria was represented in a black dress , and the warm Italian colouring of [her]164-maria vittoria face made a sort of glow in the dark picture . [Her]164-maria vittoria eyes watched [you]2770-you from the canvas with so life - like a glance [you]2770-you had a thought when [you]2770-you turned that [they]2771-they turned after [you]2770-you . [Clementina]116-clementina gazed at the picture for a long while , and the blood slowly mounted on [her]116-clementina neck and transfused [her]116-clementina cheeks . " There is a face , [Mr. Wogan,—a]205-mr. wogan,—a passionate , beautiful face,—which might well set a seal upon [a man]235-a man 's heart . [I]116-clementina do not wonder . [I]116-clementina can well believe that though to - day that face gladdens [the streets of [Rome]4-rome]4688-the streets of rome , [a lover in [Spain]18-spain]4689-a lover in spain might see it through [all the thick earth of [the Pyrenees]99-the pyrenees]4690-all the thick earth of the pyrenees . [Wogan]126-wogan followed [her]116-clementina , and pacing with much dignity [they]2775-they walked back to [the little house among the trees]2776-the little house among the trees , and so came again into [the garden of blossoms]2777-the garden of blossoms . The anger had now gone from [her]116-clementina face , but it was replaced by a great weariness . " It is strange , is it not , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina said with a faltering smile , " that on a spring morning , beneath this sky , amongst these flowers , [I]116-clementina should think with envy of [the snows of [Innspruck]17-innspruck]4693-the snows of innspruck and [[my]116-clementina prison there]4694-my prison there ? But [I]116-clementina owe [you]126-wogan a reparation , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina added . " [You]126-wogan said [the King]3089-the king had need of [me]116-clementina . For that saying of [yours]126-wogan [I]116-clementina find an apt simile . Call it a stone on which [you]126-wogan bade [me]116-clementina set [my]116-clementina foot and step . [I]116-clementina stepped , and found that [your]126-wogan stone was straw . "[116-clementina] " No , [madam]3071-madam , "[126-wogan] cried [Wogan]126-wogan . " [I]116-clementina had a thought , "[116-clementina] [she]116-clementina continued , " [you]126-wogan knew the stone was straw when [you]126-wogan commended it to [me]116-clementina as stone . But this morning [I]116-clementina have learned [my]116-clementina error . [I]116-clementina acquit [you]126-wogan , and ask [your]126-wogan pardon . [You]126-wogan did not know that [the King]3089-the king had no need of [me]116-clementina . "[116-clementina] And [she]116-clementina bowed to [him]126-wogan as though the conversation was at an end . [Wogan]126-wogan , however , would not let [her]116-clementina go . [He]126-wogan placed [himself]126-wogan in front of [her]116-clementina , engrossed in [his]126-wogan one thought , " [She]116-clementina must marry [the King]3089-the king . "[126-wogan] [He]126-wogan spoke , however , none the less with sincerity when [he]126-wogan cried , — " Nor do [I]126-wogan know now — no , and [I]126-wogan shall not know . "[126-wogan] " [You]126-wogan have walked with [me]126-wogan to [the Caprara Palace]1341-the caprara palace this morning . Or did [I]126-wogan dream [we]4700-we walked ? "[126-wogan] " What [[your]126-wogan Highness]3263-your highness has shown [me]2779-i to - day [I]2779-i can not gainsay . For this is the first time that ever [I]2779-i heard of [Mlle]204-mlle . de [Caprara]204-mlle . But [I]2779-i am very sure that [you]126-wogan draw [your]126-wogan inference amiss . [You]126-wogan sit in judgment on [the King]3089-the king , not knowing [him]3089-the king . [You]126-wogan push aside the firm trust of [us]4700-we who know [him]3089-the king as a thing of no account . And because once , in a mood of remorse at [my]2779-i own presumption , [I]2779-i ascribed one trivial exploit — at the best a success of muscle and not brain — to [the King]3089-the king which was not [his]3089-the king , [you]126-wogan strip [him]3089-the king of all merit on the instant . "[2779-i] [He]2778-he saw that [her]2779-i face flushed . Here , at all events , [he]2778-he had hit the mark , and [he]2778-he cried out with a ringing confidence , — " [Your]2779-i stone is stone , not straw . "[2778-he] " Prove it [me]2779-i , "[2779-i] said [she]2779-i . " What do [you]2778-he know of [the Princess Caprara]164-maria vittoria at the end of it all ? " Within two weeks [I]126-wogan will convince [[your]2779-i Highness]3263-your highness , "[126-wogan] said [he]126-wogan , and for a good half - hour [he]126-wogan sauntered with [her]2779-i about [the garden]413-the garden before [he]126-wogan took [his]126-wogan leave . Oh , [I]142-gaydon know [my]142-gaydon [Whittington]111-whittington . And [I]142-gaydon know [you]142-gaydon , too , [Dick]169-dick . [I]142-gaydon do not blame [you]142-gaydon . "[126-wogan] " Therefore [you]142-gaydon will tell [me]126-wogan , "[126-wogan] cried [Wogan]126-wogan . "[142-gaydon] [Gaydon]142-gaydon stood quite unmoved , and with a remarkable sternness of expression . "[126-wogan] And [he]126-wogan recounted to [him]126-wogan the walk [he]126-wogan had taken and the conversation [he]126-wogan had held with [Clementina]116-clementina that morning . [Gaydon]142-gaydon listened with an unfeigned surprise . The story put [Wogan]126-wogan in quite a different light , and moreover it was told with so much sincerity of voice and so clear a simplicity of language , [Gaydon]142-gaydon could not doubt one syllable . " [I]142-gaydon am afraid , [[my]142-gaydon friend]3085-my friend , "[142-gaydon] said [he]142-gaydon , " [my]142-gaydon thoughts have done [you]3085-my friend some wrong — "[142-gaydon] " Leave [me]126-wogan out of them , "[126-wogan] cried [Wogan]126-wogan , impatiently . " [I]430-the cardinal will tell [you]109-wogan the truth of the matter , [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan . [The King]3089-the king saw [Mlle]204-mlle . Of [their]4781-their acquaintance [I]430-the cardinal need not speak . [The King]3089-the king just for one month became [an ardent youth]4783-an ardent youth . [He]3089-the king appealed to [the Pope]3095-the pope for [his]3095-the pope consent to marry [Mlle]204-mlle . [de Caprara]204-mlle , and [the Pope]3095-the pope consented . [The King]3089-the king was just sending off a message to bid [you]109-wogan cease [your]109-wogan search when [you]109-wogan came back with the news that [[her]204-mlle Highness]3138-her highness [the Princess Clementina]116-clementina had accepted [the King]3089-the king 's hand and would shortly set out for [Bologna]1-bologna . [Sir]3070-sir , [the King]3089-the king was in despair , though [he]3089-the king showed to [you]109-wogan a smiling , grateful face . [Mlle]204-mlle . [de Caprara]204-mlle went to [Rome]4-rome ; [the King]3089-the king stayed [here]3086-here awaiting [[his]3089-the king betrothed]4793-his betrothed . If [his]3089-the king heart leaped a little at the news , who shall blame [him]3089-the king ? Do [you]109-wogan remember how [you]109-wogan came privately one night to [[the King]3089-the king 's cabinet]4797-the king 's cabinet and found [me]430-the cardinal there in [[the King]3089-the king 's company]4799-the king 's company ? " Because [[her]204-mlle Highness]3138-her highness 's journey had been interrupted , because the marriage now seemed impossible ? But if [her]116-clementina Highness rejects the marriage , who suffers ? [Her]116-clementina Highness 's name is already widely praised for [her]116-clementina endurance , [her]116-clementina constancy . If , after all , at the last moment [she]116-clementina scornfully rejects that for which [she]116-clementina has so stoutly ventured , whose name , whose cause , will suffer most ? It will be one more misfortune , one more disaster , to add to the crushing weight under which [the King]3089-the king labours . There will be ignominy ; who will be dwarfed by it ? There will be laughter ; whom will it souse ? There will be scandal ; who will be splashed by it ? [The Princess]3107-the princess or [the King]3089-the king ? " How will [my]204-mlle story , though [I]204-mlle told it , help ? "[204-mlle] asked [Mlle . de Caprara]204-mlle . [Wogan]109-wogan had no doubts upon that score . The story of [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier and [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria had a strong parallel in [Clementina]116-clementina 's own history . Circumstance and duty held [them]2863-their apart , as it held apart [Clementina]116-clementina and [Wogan]109-wogan [himself]109-wogan .
