"[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , quietly , and [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria stared at [him]109-wogan . There was something [she]164-maria vittoria had not conjectured before . " Oh , [she]116-clementina does not love [him]3089-the king ! "[164-maria vittoria] [she]164-maria vittoria said in wonderment . [Her]164-maria vittoria wonderment swiftly changed to contempt . " [The fool]4855-the fool ! Let [her]116-clementina go on [her]116-clementina knees and pray for a modest heart . There 's [my]164-maria vittoria message to [her]116-clementina . Who is [she]116-clementina that [she]116-clementina should not love [him]3089-the king ? "[164-maria vittoria] But it nevertheless altered a trifle pleasurably [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria 's view of the position . It was pain to [her]164-maria vittoria to contemplate [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier 's marriage , a deep , gnawing , rancorous pain , but the pain was less , once [she]164-maria vittoria could believe [he]348-the chevalier was to marry [a woman who did not love [him]348-the chevalier]2868-a woman who did not love him . [She]164-maria vittoria despised [the woman]308-the woman for [her]308-the woman stupidity ; none the less , that was the wife [she]164-maria vittoria would choose , if [she]164-maria vittoria must needs choose another than [herself]164-maria vittoria . " [I]164-maria vittoria have a mind to see [this fool - woman of [yours]109-wogan]4866-this fool - woman of yours , "[164-maria vittoria] [she]164-maria vittoria said doubtfully . " Why does [she]164-maria vittoria not love [the King]3089-the king ? "[164-maria vittoria] [Wogan]109-wogan could have answered that [she]164-maria vittoria had never seen [him]109-wogan . [He]109-wogan thought silence , however , was the more expressive . The silence led [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria to conjecture . " Is there another picture at [her]164-maria vittoria heart ? "[164-maria vittoria] [she]164-maria vittoria asked , and again [Wogan]109-wogan was silent . " Whose , then ? [You]109-wogan will not tell [me]109-wogan . "[109-wogan] It might have been something in [Wogan]109-wogan 's attitude or face which revealed the truth to [her]164-maria vittoria ; it might have been [her]164-maria vittoria recollection of what [the King]3089-the king had said concerning [Wogan]109-wogan 's enthusiasm ; it might have been merely [[her]164-maria vittoria woman]2859-her woman 's instinct . But [she]164-maria vittoria started and took a step towards [Wogan]109-wogan . [Her]164-maria vittoria eyes certainly softened . " [I]164-maria vittoria will go with [you]109-wogan to [Bologna]1-bologna , "[164-maria vittoria] [she]164-maria vittoria said ; and that afternoon with the smallest equipment [she]164-maria vittoria started from [Rome]4-rome . [Wogan]109-wogan had ridden alone from [Bologna]1-bologna to [Rome]4-rome in four days ; [he]109-wogan had spent three days in [Rome]4-rome ; [he]109-wogan now took six days to return in company with [Mlle . de Caprara]204-mlle and [[her]204-mlle few servants]2356-her few servants . [He]109-wogan thus arrived in [Bologna]1-bologna on the eve of that day when [he]109-wogan was to act as [[the King]3089-the king 's proxy]2874-the king 's proxy in the marriage . It was about four o'clock in the afternoon when [the tiny cavalcade]2875-the tiny cavalcade clattered through [the Porta Castiglione]2876-the porta castiglione . [Wogan]109-wogan led the way to [the Pilgrim Inn]2614-the pilgrim inn , where [he]109-wogan left [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria , saying that [he]109-wogan would return at nightfall . [He]109-wogan then went on foot to [[O'Toole]158-o'toole 's lodging]2846-o'toole 's lodging . [O'Toole]158-o'toole , however , had no news for [him]109-wogan . " There has been [no mysterious visitor]4868-no mysterious visitor , "[158-o'toole] said [he]158-o'toole . " There will be one to - night , "[109-wogan] answered [Wogan]109-wogan . " [I]109-wogan shall need [you]158-o'toole . "[109-wogan] " [I]158-o'toole am ready , "[158-o'toole] said [O'Toole]158-o'toole . [The two friends]2879-the two friends walked back to [the Pilgrim Inn]2614-the pilgrim inn . [They]2879-the two friends were joined by [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria , and [they]2879-the two friends then proceeded to [the little house among the trees]2776-the little house among the trees . Outside the door in the garden wall [Wogan]109-wogan posted [O'Toole]158-o'toole . " Let [no one]356-no one pass , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan , " till [we]2879-the two friends return . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan knocked on the door , and after a little delay — for the night had fallen , and there was no longer [a porter]2882-a porter at the gate — a little hatch was opened , and [a servant]1509-a servant inquired [his]109-wogan business . " [I]109-wogan come with a message of the utmost importance , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . " [I]109-wogan beg [you]1509-a servant to inform [[her]2885-the real vittoria Highness]3138-her highness that [the Chevalier Wogan]167-wogan prays for two words with [her]2885-the real vittoria . "[109-wogan] The hatch was closed , and [the servant]753-the servant 's footsteps were heard to retreat . [Wogan]167-wogan 's anxieties had been increasing with every mile of that homeward journey . On [his]167-wogan ride to [Rome]4-rome [he]167-wogan had been sensible of but one obstacle,—the difficulty of persuading [the real Vittoria]2885-the real vittoria to return with [him]167-wogan . But once that had been removed , others sprang to view , and each hour enlarged [them]2886-them . There was but this one night , this one interview ! Upon the upshot of it depended whether [a woman]234-a woman , destined by nature for [a queen]3473-a queen , should set [her]234-a woman foot upon the throne - steps , whether a cause should suffer its worst of many eclipses , whether [Europe]7-europe should laugh or applaud . These five minutes while [he]167-wogan waited outside the door threw [him]167-wogan into a fever . " [You]204-mlle will be friendly , "[167-wogan] [he]167-wogan implored [Mlle]204-mlle . [de Caprara]204-mlle . " Oh , [you]204-mlle can not but be ! [She]2885-the real vittoria must marry [the King]3089-the king . [I]167-wogan plead for [him]3089-the king , not the least bit in [the world]245-the world for [her]2885-the real vittoria . For [his]3089-the king sake [she]2885-the real vittoria must complete the work [she]2885-the real vittoria has begun . [She]2885-the real vittoria is not obstinate ; [she]2885-the real vittoria has [her]2885-the real vittoria pride as [a woman]234-a woman should . [You]204-mlle will tell [her]2885-the real vittoria just the truth,—of [the King]3089-the king 's loyalty and [yours]204-mlle . [Hearts]208-hearts can not be commanded . Alas , mademoiselle , it is [a hard world]4875-a hard world at the end of it . It is mortised with the blood of broken hearts . But duty , mademoiselle , duty , a consciousness of rectitude,—these are very noble qualities . It will be a high consolation , mademoiselle , one of these days , when [the King]3089-the king sits upon [his]3089-the king throne in [England]19-england , to think that [your]204-mlle self - sacrifice had set [him]3089-the king [there]3363-there . "[167-wogan] And [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan hopped like [a bear on hot bricks]2889-a bear on hot bricks , twittering irreproachable sentiments until the garden door was opened . Beyond the door stretched [a level space of grass intersected by a gravel path]2890-a level space of grass intersected by a gravel path . Along [this path]2891-this path [the servant]753-the servant led [Wogan]109-wogan and [[his]109-wogan companion]649-his companion into [the house]3196-the house . There were lights in the windows on [the upper floor]2895-the upper floor , and a small lamp illuminated [the hall]295-the hall . But [the lower rooms]2897-the lower rooms were dark . [The servant]753-the servant mounted the stairs , and opening the door of [a little library]2899-a little library , announced [the Chevalier Wogan]167-wogan . [Wogan]167-wogan led [[his]167-wogan companion]649-his companion in by the hand . " [[Your]649-his companion Highness]3263-your highness , "[167-wogan] said [he]167-wogan , " [I]167-wogan have the honour to present to [you]649-his companion [the Princess Maria Vittoria Caprara]164-maria vittoria . "[167-wogan] [He]167-wogan left [the two women]2901-the two women standing opposite to and measuring [each other]259-each other silently ; [he]167-wogan closed the door and went down stairs into [the hall]295-the hall . A door in [the hall]295-the hall opened on to a small parlour , with windows giving on to [the garden]413-the garden . There once before [Lady Featherstone]134-lady featherstone and [Harry Whittington]111-whittington had spoken of [Wogan]167-wogan 's love for [the Princess Clementina]116-clementina and speculated upon its consequences . Now [Wogan]167-wogan sat there alone in the dark , listening to [the women]2906-the women 's voices overhead . [He]167-wogan had come to the end of [his]167-wogan efforts and could only wait . At all events , [the women]2906-the women were talking , that was something ; if [he]167-wogan could only hear [them]2906-the women weeping ! The sound of tears would have been very comforting to [Wogan]167-wogan at that moment , but [he]167-wogan only heard the low voices talking , talking . [He]167-wogan assured [himself]167-wogan over and over again that this meeting could not fail of its due result . That [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria had exacted some promise which held [[his]167-wogan King]326-his king in [Spain]18-spain [he]167-wogan was now aware . [She]164-maria vittoria would say what that promise was , the condition of [their]2909-their parting . [She]164-maria vittoria had come prepared to say it — and the thread of [Wogan]167-wogan 's reasonings was abruptly cut . It seemed to [him]167-wogan that [he]167-wogan heard something more than the night breeze through the trees,—a sound of feet upon [the gravel path]2910-the gravel path , a whispering of voices . The windows were closed , but not shuttered . [Wogan]167-wogan pressed [his]167-wogan eyes to the pane and looked out . The night was dark , and the sky overclouded . But [he]167-wogan had been sitting for some minutes in the darkness , and [his]167-wogan eyes were able to prove that [his]167-wogan ears had not deceived [him]167-wogan . For [he]167-wogan saw [the dim figures of [two men]415-two men standing on [the lawn]1109-the lawn before the window]2911-the dim figures of two men standing on the lawn before the window . [They]415-two men appeared to be looking at the lighted windows on [the upper floor]2895-the upper floor , then [one of [them]415-two men]417-one of them waved to [[his]417-one of them companion]649-his companion to stand still , and [himself]417-one of them walked towards the door . [Wogan]167-wogan noticed that [he]167-wogan made no attempt at secrecy ; [he]167-wogan walked with a firm tread , careless whether [he]167-wogan set [his]167-wogan foot on gravel or on grass . As [this man]1530-this man approached the door , [Wogan]167-wogan slipped into [the hall]295-the hall and opened it . But [he]167-wogan blocked the doorway , wondering whether [these men]2919-these men had climbed the wall or whether [O'Toole]158-o'toole had deserted [[his]158-o'toole post]2920-his post . [O'Toole]158-o'toole had not deserted [[his]158-o'toole post]2920-his post , but [he]158-o'toole had none the less admitted [these two men]1001-these two men . For [Wogan]167-wogan and [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria had barely been ten minutes within [the house]3196-the house when [O'Toole]158-o'toole heard the sound of horses ' hoofs in the entrance of [the alley]486-the alley . [They]1001-these two men stopped just within the entrance . [O'Toole]158-o'toole distinguished three horses , [he]158-o'toole saw [the three riders]2925-the three riders dismount ; and while one of [the three]1251-the three held the horses , [the other two]2927-the other two walked on foot towards the postern - door . [O'Toole]158-o'toole eased [his]158-o'toole sword in its scabbard . " [The little fellows]4879-the little fellows thought to catch [Charles Wogan]109-wogan napping , "[158-o'toole] [he]158-o'toole said to [himself]158-o'toole with a smile , and [he]158-o'toole let [them]1001-these two men come quite close to [him]158-o'toole . [He]158-o'toole was standing motionless in the embrasure of the door , nor did [he]158-o'toole move when [the two men]462-the two men stopped and whispered together , nor when [they]462-the two men advanced again , one behind the other . But [he]158-o'toole remarked that [they]462-the two men held [their]462-the two men cloaks to [their]462-the two men faces . At last [they]462-the two men came to a halt just in front of [O'Toole]158-o'toole . [The leader]1056-the leader produced a key . " [You]158-o'toole stand in [my]1056-the leader way , [[my]1056-the leader friend]3085-my friend , "[1056-the leader] said [he]1056-the leader , pleasantly , and [he]1056-the leader pushed by [O'Toole]158-o'toole to the lock of the door . [The man]365-the man came back , however , and though out of breath , spoke no less pleasantly than before . " [I]365-the man wish to enter , "[365-the man] said [he]365-the man . " [I]365-the man have important business . "[365-the man] [O'Toole]158-o'toole bowed with the utmost dignity . " Romanus civis sum , "[365-the man] said [he]365-the man . " Sum senator too . Dic Latinam linguam , amicus meus . "[158-o'toole] [O'Toole]158-o'toole drew a breath ; [he]158-o'toole could not but feel that [he]158-o'toole had acquitted [himself]158-o'toole with credit . [He]158-o'toole half began to regret that there was to be [a learned professor]4845-a learned professor to act as proxy on that famous day at [the Capitol]105-the capitol . [[His]158-o'toole antagonist]934-his antagonist drew back a little and spoke no longer pleasantly . " Here 's tomfoolery that would be as seasonable at a funeral , "[158-o'toole] said [he]158-o'toole , and [he]158-o'toole advanced again , still hiding [his]158-o'toole face . " [Sir]3070-sir , [you]3070-sir are blocking [my]158-o'toole way . [I]158-o'toole have authority to pass through that door in the wall . "[158-o'toole] " [Murus]209-murus ? ' "[348-the chevalier] " Ah . To [Peri]84-peri ! So [I]109-wogan thought , "[109-wogan] began [Wogan]109-wogan , and [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier whispered , — " Silence ! " [Whittington]111-whittington is not [the only one of [[Walpole]210-walpole 's men]4918-walpole 's men who has hoodwinked [us]4919-us the while [he]111-whittington filled [his]111-whittington pockets]4917-the only one of walpole 's men who has hoodwinked us the while he filled his pockets . [I]348-the chevalier brought [her]4892-a visitor all the way from [Rome]4-rome . "[348-the chevalier] " From [Rome]4-rome ? "[348-the chevalier] exclaimed [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier . " Yes ; "[348-the chevalier] and [Wogan]167-wogan flung open the door of [the library]2810-the library , and drawing [himself]167-wogan up announced in [his]167-wogan loudest voice , " [The King]3089-the king ! "[167-wogan] A loud cry came through the opening . It was not [Clementina]116-clementina 's voice which uttered it . [The Chevalier]348-the chevalier recognised the cry . [He]348-the chevalier stood for a moment or two looking at [Wogan]167-wogan . Then [he]348-the chevalier stepped over the threshold , and [Wogan]167-wogan closed the door behind [him]348-the chevalier . But as [he]167-wogan closed it [he]167-wogan heard [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria speak . [She]164-maria vittoria said , — " [[Your]167-wogan Majesty]3160-your majesty , a long while ago , when [you]167-wogan bade [me]164-maria vittoria farewell , [I]164-maria vittoria demanded of [you]167-wogan a promise , which [I]164-maria vittoria have but this moment explained to [the Princess]3107-the princess , who now deigns to call [me]164-maria vittoria [friend]4929-friend . [[Your]167-wogan Majesty]3160-your majesty has broken the promise . [I]164-maria vittoria had no right to demand it . [I]164-maria vittoria am very glad . "[164-maria vittoria] [Wogan]167-wogan went [downstairs]994-downstairs . [He]167-wogan could leave [the three of [them]2959-the three of them]2959-the three of them shut up in [that room]335-that room to come by a fitting understanding . Besides , there was other work for [him]167-wogan below,—work of a simple kind , to which [he]167-wogan had now for some weeks looked forward . [He]167-wogan crept down the stairs very stealthily . The hall door was still open . [He]167-wogan could see dimly the figure of [a man standing on the grass]2961-a man standing on the grass . When [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier came down into [the garden]413-the garden an hour afterwards , [a man]235-a man was still standing on the grass . [The man]365-the man advanced to [him]348-the chevalier . " Who is it ? "[348-the chevalier] asked [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier , drawing back . The voice which answered [him]365-the man was [Wogan]167-wogan 's . " And [Whittington]111-whittington ? "[167-wogan] " [He]111-whittington has gone , "[167-wogan] replied [Wogan]167-wogan . " [You]348-the chevalier have sent [him]111-whittington away ? "[167-wogan] " [I]348-the chevalier took so much upon [myself]348-the chevalier . "[348-the chevalier] [The Chevalier]348-the chevalier held out [his]348-the chevalier hand to [Wogan]167-wogan . " [I]348-the chevalier have good reason to thank [you]167-wogan , "[348-the chevalier] said [he]348-the chevalier , and before [he]348-the chevalier could say another word , a door shut above , and [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria came down the stairs towards [them]2968-them . [O'Toole]158-o'toole was still standing [sentry at the postern - door]2969-sentry at the postern - door , and [the three men]1088-the three men escorted [the Princess Caprara]164-maria vittoria to [the Pilgrim Inn]2614-the pilgrim inn . [She]164-maria vittoria had spoken no word during the walk , but as [she]164-maria vittoria turned in the doorway of [the inn]231-the inn , the light struck upon [her]164-maria vittoria face and showed that [her]164-maria vittoria eyes glistened . To [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier [she]164-maria vittoria said , " [I]164-maria vittoria wish [you]348-the chevalier , [[my]164-maria vittoria lord]3686-my lord , all happiness , and the boon of a great love . With all [my]164-maria vittoria heart [I]164-maria vittoria wish it ; "[164-maria vittoria] and as [he]348-the chevalier bowed over [her]164-maria vittoria hand , [she]164-maria vittoria looked across [his]348-the chevalier shoulder to [Wogan]167-wogan . " [I]164-maria vittoria will bid [you]167-wogan farewell to - morrow , "[164-maria vittoria] [she]164-maria vittoria said with a smile , and [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier explained [her]164-maria vittoria saying afterwards as [they]2975-they accompanied [him]348-the chevalier to [[his]348-the chevalier lodging]373-his lodging . " [Mlle . de Caprara]204-mlle will honour [us]2975-they with [her]204-mlle presence to - morrow . [You]167-wogan will still act as [[my]164-maria vittoria proxy]4932-my proxy , [Wogan]167-wogan . [I]164-maria vittoria am not yet returned from [Spain]18-spain . [I]164-maria vittoria wish no questions or talk about this evening 's doings . [[Your]167-wogan friend]4933-your friend will remember that ? "[164-maria vittoria] " [[My]167-wogan friend]3085-my friend , [sir]3070-sir , "[167-wogan] said [Wogan]167-wogan , " who was with [me]167-wogan at [Innspruck]17-innspruck , is [Captain Lucius O'Toole of [[Dillon]144-dillon 's regiment]3669-dillon 's regiment]4936-captain lucius o'toole of dillon 's regiment . "[167-wogan] " [Et senator]4938-et senator too , "[348-the chevalier] said [the Chevalier]348-the chevalier , with a laugh ; and [he]348-the chevalier added a friendly word or two which sent [O'Toole]158-o'toole back to [[his]158-o'toole lodging]373-his lodging in a high pleasure . [Wogan]167-wogan walked thither with [him]158-o'toole and held out [his]167-wogan hand at the door . " But [you]167-wogan will come up with [me]158-o'toole , "[158-o'toole] said [O'Toole]158-o'toole . " [We]4939-we will drink a glass together , for [God]126-wogan knows when [we]4939-we speak together again . [I]158-o'toole go back to [Schlestadt]31-schlestadt to - morrow . "[158-o'toole] " Ah , [you]167-wogan go back , "[126-wogan] said [Wogan]126-wogan ; and [he]126-wogan came in at the door and mounted the stairs . At [the first landing]2979-the first landing [he]126-wogan stopped . " Let [me]126-wogan rouse [Gaydon]142-gaydon . "[126-wogan] " [Gaydon]142-gaydon went three days ago . "[158-o'toole] " Ah ! And [Misset]143-misset is with [[his]142-gaydon wife]589-his wife . Here are [we]4939-we all once more scattered , and , as [you]167-wogan say , [God]126-wogan knows when [we]4939-we shall speak together again ; "[126-wogan] and [he]126-wogan went on to [the upper storey]2980-the upper storey . [O'Toole]158-o'toole remarked that [he]126-wogan dragged in [his]126-wogan walk and that [his]126-wogan voice had a strange , sad note of melancholy . " [[My]126-wogan friend]3085-my friend , "[126-wogan] said [he]126-wogan , " [you]3085-my friend have the black fit upon [you]3085-my friend ; [you]3085-my friend are plainly discouraged . Yet to - night sees the labour of many months brought to its due close ; "[126-wogan] and as [he]126-wogan lit the candles on [his]126-wogan chimney , [he]126-wogan was quite amazed by the white , tired face which the light showed to [him]126-wogan . [Wogan]126-wogan , indeed , harassed by misgivings , and worn with many vigils , presented a sufficiently woe - begone picture . The effect was heightened by the disorder of [his]126-wogan clothes , which were all daubed with clay in a manner quite surprising to [O'Toole]158-o'toole , who knew the ground to be dry underfoot . " True , "[126-wogan] answered [Wogan]126-wogan , " the work ends to - night . Months ago [I]126-wogan rode down [this street]4942-this street in the early morning , and with what high hopes ! The work ends to - night , and may [God]126-wogan forgive [me]126-wogan for [a meddlesome fellow]4943-a meddlesome fellow . Cup and ball 's a fine game , but it is ill playing it with [women]3284-women 's hearts ; "[126-wogan] and [he]126-wogan broke off suddenly . " [I]126-wogan 'll give [you]4945-you a toast , [Lucius]158-o'toole ! Here 's to [the Princess Clementina]116-clementina ! "[126-wogan] and draining [his]126-wogan glass [he]126-wogan stood for a while , lost in the recollecting of that flight from [Innspruck]17-innspruck ; [he]126-wogan was far away from [Bologna]1-bologna thundering down [the Brenner]62-the brenner through the night , with the sparks striking from the wheels of the berlin , and all about [him]126-wogan a glimmering , shapeless waste of snow . " To [the Princess]3107-the princess — no , to [the Queen [she]3107-the princess was born to be]4947-the queen she was born to be , "[158-o'toole] cried [O'Toole]158-o'toole , and [Wogan]126-wogan sprang at [him]158-o'toole . " [You]126-wogan saw that , "[126-wogan] [he]126-wogan exclaimed , [his]126-wogan eyes lighting , [his]126-wogan face transfigured in the intensity of this moment 's relief . " Aye,—to love a nation,—that is [her]3107-the princess high destiny . For [others]460-others , [a husband]4949-a husband , [a man]235-a man ; for [her]3107-the princess , [a nation]3553-a nation . And [you]126-wogan saw it ! It is evident , to be sure . Yet this or that thing [she]3107-the princess did , this or that word [she]3107-the princess spoke , assured [you]126-wogan , eh ? Tell [me]126-wogan what proved to [you]126-wogan here was [no mere woman]4952-no mere woman , but [a queen]3473-a queen ! "[126-wogan] The morning had dawned before [Wogan]126-wogan had had [his]126-wogan fill . [O'Toole]158-o'toole was very well content to see [[his]158-o'toole friend]1253-his friend 's face once more quivering like [a boy]251-a boy 's with pleasure , to hear [him]1253-his friend laugh , to watch the despondency vanish from [his]1253-his friend aspect . " There 's another piece of good news , "[126-wogan] [he]126-wogan said at the end , " which [I]126-wogan had almost forgotten to tell [you]126-wogan . [Jenny]161-jenny and [[the Princess]3107-the princess 's mother]3112-the princess 's mother are happily set free . It seems [Jenny]161-jenny swore from daybreak to daybreak , and [the Pope]3095-the pope used [[his]3095-the pope kindliest offices]4957-his kindliest offices , and for those two reasons [the Emperor]3102-the emperor was glad to let [them]4959-them go . But there 's a question [I]126-wogan would like to ask [you]126-wogan . One little matter puzzles [me]126-wogan . "[126-wogan] " Ask [your]126-wogan question , "[126-wogan] said [Wogan]126-wogan . " To - night through that door in the garden wall which [I]126-wogan guarded , there went in [yourself]126-wogan and a [lady,—the King]4960-lady,—the king and [a companion [he]4960-lady,—the king had with [him,—four people]4962-him,—four people]4961-a companion he had with him,—four people . Out of that door there came [yourself]126-wogan , [the lady]219-the lady , and [the King,—three people]4964-the king,—three people . "[126-wogan] " Ah , "[126-wogan] said [Wogan]126-wogan , as [he]126-wogan stood up with a strange smile upon [his]126-wogan lips , " [I]126-wogan have a deal of clay upon [my]126-wogan clothes . "[126-wogan] [O'Toole]158-o'toole nodded [his]126-wogan head wisely once or twice . " [I]126-wogan am answered , "[126-wogan] [he]126-wogan said . " Is it indeed so ? "[126-wogan] [He]126-wogan understood , however , nothing except that [the room]317-the room had suddenly grown cold . An account remains of the marriage ceremony , which took place the next morning in [[Cardinal Origo]122-cardinal origo 's house]2984-cardinal origo 's house . It was of the simplest kind and was witnessed by [few]2985-few . [Murray]212-murray , [Misset]143-misset and [[his]126-wogan wife]589-his wife , and [Maria Vittoria de Caprara]164-maria vittoria made the public part of the company ; [Wogan]126-wogan stood for [the King]3089-the king ; and [the Marquis of [Monti Boulorois]213-monti boulorois]2988-the marquis of monti boulorois for [James Sobieski]214-james , [[the bride]2989-the bride 's father]2990-the bride 's father . [Bride]2991-bride and [bridegroom]2992-bridegroom played [their]2993-their parts bravely and well , [one]3129-one must believe , for [the chronicler]2995-the chronicler speaks of [their]2993-their grace and modesty of bearing . [Clementina]116-clementina rose at five in the morning , dressed in a robe of white , tied a white ribbon about [her]116-clementina hair , and for [her]116-clementina only ornament fixed a white collar of pearls about [her]116-clementina neck . In this garb [she]116-clementina went at once to [the church of [San Domenico]106-san domenico]2996-the church of san domenico , where [she]116-clementina made [her]116-clementina confession , and from [the church]2281-the church to [the Cardinal 's Palace]2807-the cardinal 's palace . There [the Cardinal]430-the cardinal , with one [Maas]215-maas , [an English priest from [Rome]4-rome]3000-an english priest from rome , at [his]3000-an english priest from rome elbow , was already waiting for [her]116-clementina . [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan thereupon read the procuration , for which [he]109-wogan had ridden to [Rome]4-rome in haste so many months before , and pronounced the consent of [the King]3089-the king [[his]3089-the king master]221-his master to its terms . [Origo]122-cardinal origo asked [the Princess]3107-the princess whether [she]3107-the princess likewise consented , and the manner in which [she]3107-the princess spoke [her]3107-the princess one word , " Yes , "[3107-the princess] seems to have stirred [the historian]3004-the historian to pæans . It seems that all the virtues launched that one little word , and were clearly expressed in it . The graces , too , for once in a way went hand in hand with the virtues . Never was a " Yes "[3107-the princess] so sweetly spoken since [the earth]3142-the earth rose out of [the sea]3274-the sea . In a word , there was no ruffle of the great passion which [these two]1054-these two , [man]3319-man and [woman]3693-woman , had trodden beneath [their]1054-these two feet . [She]116-clementina did not hint of [Iphigenia]216-iphigenia ; [he]3010-he borrowed no plumes from [Don Quixote]131-don quixote . Nor need one fancy that [their]1054-these two contentment was all counterfeit . [They]1054-these two were neither of [them]1054-these two grumblers , and " fate "[1054-these two] and " destiny "[1054-these two] were words seldom upon [their]1054-these two lips . One incident , indeed , is related which [the chronicler]2995-the chronicler thought to be curious , though [he]2995-the chronicler did not comprehend it . [The Princess Clementina]116-clementina brought from [her]116-clementina confessional box a wisp of straw which clung to [her]116-clementina dress at the knee . Until [Wogan]109-wogan had placed [the King]3089-the king 's ring upon [her]116-clementina finger , [she]116-clementina did not apparently remark it ; but no sooner had that office been performed than [she]116-clementina stooped , and with a friendly smile at [[her]116-clementina makeshift bridegroom]3013-her makeshift bridegroom , [she]116-clementina plucked it from [her]116-clementina skirt and let it fall beneath [her]116-clementina foot . And that was all . No words passed between [them]1054-these two after the ceremony , for [[her]116-clementina Royal Highness]3014-her royal highness went straight back to [the little house in [the garden]413-the garden]4824-the little house in the garden , and [that same forenoon]3017-that same forenoon set out for [Rome]4-rome . [She]116-clementina was not [the only witness of the ceremony]3018-the only witness of the ceremony to take [that road]3019-that road that day . For some three hours later , to be precise , at half - past two , [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria stepped into [[her]164-maria vittoria coach]3020-her coach before [the Pilgrim Inn]2614-the pilgrim inn . [Wogan]109-wogan held the carriage door open for [her]164-maria vittoria . [He]109-wogan was still in the bravery of [his]109-wogan wedding clothes , and [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria looked [him]109-wogan over whimsically from the top of [his]109-wogan peruke to [his]109-wogan shoe - buckles . " [I]164-maria vittoria came to see [a fool - woman]4965-a fool - woman , "[164-maria vittoria] said [she]164-maria vittoria , " and [I]164-maria vittoria saw [a fool - man]4966-a fool - man . Well , well ! "[164-maria vittoria] and [she]164-maria vittoria suddenly lowered [her]164-maria vittoria voice to a passionate whisper . " Why , oh , why did [you]109-wogan not take [your]109-wogan fortunes in [your]109-wogan hands at [Peri]84-peri ? "[164-maria vittoria] [Wogan]109-wogan leaned forward to [her]164-maria vittoria . " Do [you]109-wogan know so much ? "[109-wogan] [She]164-maria vittoria answered [him]109-wogan quickly . " [I]164-maria vittoria will never forgive [you]109-wogan . Yes , [I]164-maria vittoria know . "[164-maria vittoria] [She]164-maria vittoria forced [her]164-maria vittoria lips into a smile . " [I]164-maria vittoria suppose [you]109-wogan are content . [You]109-wogan have [your]109-wogan black horse . "[164-maria vittoria] " [You]164-maria vittoria know of the horse , too , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan , colouring to the edge of [his]109-wogan peruke . " [You]164-maria vittoria know [I]109-wogan have no further use for it . "[109-wogan] " Say that again , and [I]164-maria vittoria will beg it of [you]109-wogan . "[164-maria vittoria] " Nay , it is [yours]164-maria vittoria , then . [I]164-maria vittoria will send [him]109-wogan after [you]109-wogan to [Rome]4-rome . "[164-maria vittoria] " Will [you]109-wogan ? "[164-maria vittoria] said [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria . " Why , then , [I]164-maria vittoria accept . There 's [my]164-maria vittoria hand ; "[164-maria vittoria] and [she]164-maria vittoria thrust it through the window to [him]109-wogan . " If ever [you]109-wogan come to [Rome]4-rome , [the Caprara Palace]98-the caprara palace stands where [it]98-the caprara palace did at [your]109-wogan last visit . [I]164-maria vittoria do not say [you]109-wogan will be welcome . No , [I]164-maria vittoria do not forgive [you]109-wogan , but [you]109-wogan may come . Having [your]109-wogan horse , [I]164-maria vittoria could hardly bar the door against [you]109-wogan . So [you]109-wogan may come . "[164-maria vittoria] [Wogan]109-wogan raised [her]164-maria vittoria hand to [his]109-wogan lips . " Aye , "[164-maria vittoria] said [she]164-maria vittoria , with a touch of bitterness , " kiss [my]164-maria vittoria hand . [You]109-wogan have had [your]109-wogan way . Here are [two people crossmated]4967-two people crossmated , and [two others not mated at all]4968-two others not mated at all . [You]109-wogan have made [four people]4969-four people entirely unhappy , and a kiss on the glove sets all right . "[164-maria vittoria] " Nay , not four , "[109-wogan] protested [Wogan]109-wogan . " [Your]109-wogan manners , "[164-maria vittoria] [she]164-maria vittoria continued remorselessly , ticking off the names upon [her]164-maria vittoria fingers , " will hinder [you]109-wogan from telling [me]164-maria vittoria to [my]164-maria vittoria face [the King]3089-the king is happy . And [the Princess]3107-the princess ? "[164-maria vittoria] " [She]3107-the princess was born to be [a queen]3473-a queen , "[109-wogan] replied [Wogan]109-wogan , stubbornly . " Happiness , mademoiselle ! It does not come by the striving after it . That 's the royal road to miss it . [You]109-wogan may build up [[your]109-wogan house of happiness]4973-your house of happiness with all [your]109-wogan care through years , and [you]109-wogan will find [you]109-wogan have only built [it]4973-your house of happiness up to draw down the blinds and hang out the hatchment above the door , for [the tenant]4974-the tenant to inhabit [it]4973-your house of happiness is dead . "[109-wogan] [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria listened very seriously till [he]109-wogan came to the end . Then [she]164-maria vittoria made a pouting grimace . " That is very fine , moral , and poetical . [[Your]109-wogan Princess]3700-your princess was born to be [a queen]3473-a queen . But what if [her]3107-the princess throne is set up only in [[your]109-wogan city of dreams]3282-your city of dreams ? Well , it is some consolation to know that [you]109-wogan are one of the four . "[164-maria vittoria] " Nay , [I]164-maria vittoria will make a shift not to plague [myself]164-maria vittoria upon the way [the world]245-the world treats [you]109-wogan . "[164-maria vittoria] " Ah , but because it treats [you]109-wogan well , "[164-maria vittoria] cried [she]164-maria vittoria . " There will be work for [you]109-wogan , hurryings to and fro , the opportunities of excelling , nights in the saddle , and perhaps again the quick red life of battlefields . It is well with [you]109-wogan , but what of [me]164-maria vittoria , [Mr. Wogan]109-wogan ? What of [me]164-maria vittoria ? "[164-maria vittoria] and [she]164-maria vittoria leaned back in [[her]164-maria vittoria carriage]250-her carriage and drove away . [Wogan]109-wogan had no answer to that despairing question . [He]109-wogan stood with [his]109-wogan head bared till [the carriage]287-the carriage passed round a corner and disappeared , but the voice rang for a long while in [his]109-wogan ears . And for a long while the dark eyes abrim with tears , and the tortured face , kept [him]109-wogan company at nights . [He]109-wogan walked slowly back to [[his]109-wogan lodging]373-his lodging , and mounting a horse rode out of [Bologna]1-bologna , and towards [the Apennines]107-the apennines . On one of [the lower slopes]3025-the lower slopes [he]109-wogan came upon [a villa just beyond a curve of the road]3026-a villa just beyond a curve of the road , and reined in [his]109-wogan horse . [The villa]526-the villa nestled on [the hillside below [him]109-wogan]3028-the hillside below him in [a terraced garden of oleander and magnolias]3029-a terraced garden of oleander and magnolias , very pretty to the eye . Cypress hedges enclosed [it]526-the villa ; the spring had made [it]526-the villa a bower of rose blossoms , and depths of shade out of whose green darkness glowed here and there a red statue like [a tutelary god]3030-a tutelary god . [Wogan]109-wogan dismounted and led [his]109-wogan horse down [the path]2537-the path to the door . [He]109-wogan inquired for [Lady Featherstone]134-lady featherstone , and was shown into [a room from the windows of which [he]109-wogan looked down on [Bologna]1-bologna]3032-a room from the windows of which he looked down on bologna , [that city of colonnades]3033-that city of colonnades . [Lady Featherstone]134-lady featherstone , however , had heard the tramp of [his]109-wogan horse ; [she]134-lady featherstone came running up from [the garden]413-the garden , and without waiting to hear any particulars of [[her]134-lady featherstone visitor]1651-her visitor , burst eagerly into [the room]317-the room . " Well ? "[134-lady featherstone] [she]134-lady featherstone said , and stopped and swayed upon the threshold . [Wogan]109-wogan turned from the window towards [her]134-lady featherstone . " [[Your]134-lady featherstone Ladyship]3098-your ladyship was wise , [I]109-wogan think , to leave [Bologna]1-bologna . [The little house in the trees]4980-the little house in the trees there had no such wide prospect as this . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan spoke rather to give [her]134-lady featherstone time than out of any sarcasm . [She]134-lady featherstone set a hand against the jamb of the door , and even so barely sustained [her]134-lady featherstone trifling weight . [Her]134-lady featherstone knees shook , [her]134-lady featherstone childlike face grew white as paper , a great terror glittered in [her]134-lady featherstone eyes . " [I]109-wogan am not [the visitor whom [you]134-lady featherstone expect]4981-the visitor whom you expect , "[109-wogan] continued [Wogan]109-wogan , " nor do [I]109-wogan bring the news which [you]134-lady featherstone would wish to hear ; "[109-wogan] and at that [she]134-lady featherstone raised a trembling hand . " [I]134-lady featherstone beg [you]109-wogan — a moment 's silence . Then [I]134-lady featherstone will hear [you]109-wogan , [Mr. Warner]130-mr. warner . "[134-lady featherstone] [She]134-lady featherstone made a sort of stumbling run and reached a couch . [Wogan]109-wogan shut the door and waited . [He]109-wogan was glad that [she]134-lady featherstone had used the name of [Warner]130-mr. warner . It recalled to [him]109-wogan that evening at [Ohlau]12-ohlau when [she]134-lady featherstone had stood behind the curtain with a stiletto in [her]134-lady featherstone hand , and the three last days of [his]109-wogan perilous ride to [Schlestadt]31-schlestadt . [He]109-wogan needed [his]109-wogan most vivid recollections to steel [his]109-wogan heart against [her]134-lady featherstone ; for [he]109-wogan was beginning to think it was [his]109-wogan weary lot to go up and down [the world]245-the world causing pain to [women]3284-women . After a while [she]134-lady featherstone said , " Now [your]109-wogan news ; "[134-lady featherstone] and [she]134-lady featherstone held [her]134-lady featherstone hand lightly to [her]134-lady featherstone heart to await the blow . " [The King]3089-the king married this morning [the Princess Clementina]116-clementina , "[109-wogan] said [Wogan]109-wogan . [Lady Featherstone]134-lady featherstone did not move [her]134-lady featherstone hand ; [she]134-lady featherstone still waited . It was just to hinder this marriage that [she]134-lady featherstone had come to [Italy]29-italy , but [her]134-lady featherstone failure was at this moment of no account . [She]134-lady featherstone heard of it with indifference ; it had no meaning to [her]134-lady featherstone . [She]134-lady featherstone waited . [Wogan]109-wogan 's mere presence at [the villa]526-the villa told [her]134-lady featherstone there was more to come . " [We]5007-we went to the bottom of [the garden]413-the garden where there is a little square of lawn hedged in with myrtle - trees . The night was very dark , so [we]5007-we stripped to [our]5007-we shirts . From the waist upwards [we]5007-we were visible to [each other]259-each other as a vague glimmer of white , and thus [we]5007-we fought , foot to foot , among the myrtle - trees . [We]5007-we could not see so much as [our]5007-we swords unless they clashed more than usually hard , and a spark struck from them . [We]5007-we fought by guesswork and feel , and in the end luck served [me]134-lady featherstone . " [He]109-wogan lived for perhaps five minutes . "[134-lady featherstone] " And [he]109-wogan ? "[134-lady featherstone] [she]134-lady featherstone interrupted,—"he died [there]3363-there . Well ? "[134-lady featherstone] [Lady Featherstone]134-lady featherstone rose to [her]134-lady featherstone feet . [She]134-lady featherstone spoke no word ; [she]134-lady featherstone uttered no cry ; [her]134-lady featherstone face was white and terrible . [She]134-lady featherstone stood rigid like one paralysed ; then [she]134-lady featherstone swayed round and fell in a swoon upon the floor . And as [she]134-lady featherstone fell , something bright slipped from [her]134-lady featherstone hand and dropped at [Wogan]109-wogan 's feet . [He]109-wogan picked it up . It was a stiletto . [He]109-wogan stood looking down at [the childish figure]3046-the childish figure with a queer compassionate smile upon [his]109-wogan face . " [She]134-lady featherstone could love , "[109-wogan] said [he]109-wogan ; " yes , [she]134-lady featherstone could love . "[109-wogan] [He]109-wogan walked out of [the house]3196-the house , led [his]109-wogan horse back onto [the road]228-the road and mounted it . The night was gathering ; there were purple shadows upon [the Apennines]107-the apennines . [Wogan]109-wogan rode away alone . [Sir Charles Wogan]217-sir charles wogan had opportunities enough to appreciate in later years the accuracy of [Maria Vittoria]164-maria vittoria 's prophecy . " Here are [two people cross - mated]5018-two people cross - mated , "[134-lady featherstone] said [she]134-lady featherstone , and events bore [her]134-lady featherstone out . The jealousies of [courtiers]3049-courtiers no doubt had [their]3049-courtiers share in the estrangement of [that unhappy couple]3050-that unhappy couple , but that was no consolation to [Wogan]109-wogan , who saw , within so short a time of that journey into [Italy]29-italy , [James]214-james separated from [the chosen woman]337-the chosen woman , and [the chosen woman]337-the chosen woman [herself]337-the chosen woman seeking the seclusion of [a convent]3053-a convent . As [his]109-wogan reward [he]109-wogan was made Governor of [La Mancha]108-la mancha in [Spain]18-spain , and no place could have been found with associations more suitable to [this Irishman who turned [his]3054-this irishman who turned his back upon his fortunes at peri back upon [his]3054-this irishman who turned his back upon his fortunes at peri fortunes at [Peri]84-peri]3054-this irishman who turned his back upon his fortunes at peri . At [La Mancha]108-la mancha [he]109-wogan lived for many years , writing a deal of Latin verse , and corresponding with [many distinguished men in [England]19-england]3055-many distinguished men in england upon matters of the intellect . Matters of the heart [he]109-wogan left alone , and meddled with no more . Nor did [any woman]3583-any woman ever ride on [his]109-wogan black horse into [[his]109-wogan city of dreams]2410-his city of dreams . [He]109-wogan lived and died [a bachelor]3058-a bachelor . The memory of that week when [he]109-wogan had rescued [[his]109-wogan Princess]2148-his princess and carried [her]2148-his princess through the snows was to the last too vivid in [his]109-wogan thoughts . The thunderous roll of [the carriage]287-the carriage down [the slopes]3061-the slopes , the sparks striking from the wheels , the sound of [Clementina]116-clementina 's voice singing softly in the darkness of [the carriage]287-the carriage , the walk under the stars to [Ala]63-ala , the coming of the dawn about [that lonely hut]3063-that lonely hut , high - placed amongst the pines . These recollections bore [him]109-wogan company through many a solitary evening . Somehow [the world]245-the world had gone awry . [Clementina]116-clementina , withdrawn into [[her]116-clementina convent]3065-her convent , was , after all , " wasted , "[116-clementina] as [he]109-wogan had sworn [she]116-clementina should not be . [James]214-james was fallen upon a deeper melancholy , and diminished hopes . [He]214-james [himself]214-james was [an exile alone in [[his]214-james white patio in [Spain]18-spain]3067-his white patio in spain]3066-an exile alone in his white patio in spain . [She]164-maria vittoria married five years later .
